English: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
Bahnar: Êsai kon drŏ-nglo Amôt đei Kră Yang tơ'bôh kơ sư gah teh đak Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem, lăm chăl Usia, Jôtham, Ahas păng Hesekia lu pơtao teh đak Juđa.

English: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth! For the LORD has spoken: “I have nourished and brought up children, And they have rebelled against Me
Bahnar: Ơ lu tăl plĕnh mơ̆ng bĕ! Ơ teh pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ, yua kơ Kră Yang pơma khan: “Inh wei rong lu kon hơ'lơ̆p Inh, dĭng truh kơ 'lŏ mă-lei lu sư plơ̆ blah Inh.

English: The ox knows its owner And the donkey its master’s crib; But Israel does not know, My people do not consider.”
Bahnar: Rơmo băt kơ tơ'ngla, aseh băt kơ bơng 'nhĕt tơ'ngla sư, mă-lei bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ băt, kon pơlei Inh ưh kơ hlôh ôh.”

English: Alas, sinful nation, A people laden with iniquity, A brood of evildoers, Children who are corrupters! They have forsaken the LORD, They have provoked to anger The Holy One of Israel, They have turned away backward.
Bahnar: Ô dêh char yoch kơnê̆ dêh, kon pơlei pơla pơm yoch kơnê̆ trăp dêh tơpă, Adrĕch adrung pơm kơnê̆ dêh, lu kon hơ'lơ̆p pơm kư̆ kă, lu sư achăng hŭt Kră Yang. Lu sư Pơjăm Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng tơpăt Isơrael, lu sư weh tơklah ataih bơih.

English: Why should you be stricken again? You will revolt more and more. The whole head is sick, And the whole heart faints.
Bahnar: Lơliơ lu iĕm wă kơ oei teh hơnơ̆ng? Yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm oei 'maih blah plơ̆ ling-lang? Rim kơ̆l lu iĕm đĭ rơka, jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm đĭ jĭ bơih.

English: From the sole of the foot even to the head, There is no soundness in it, But wounds and bruises and putrefying sores; They have not been closed or bound up, Or soothed with ointment.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơpang jơ̆ng truh tơ kơpal kơ̆l, ưh kơ đei 'bơ̆t yơ 'lơ̆ng. Tă kơ pơ'ngeh đêl teh păng rơka pham ro, tam mă ôp hăm pơ̆n hơmet păng tam mă pik đak pơgang rơmă ôliwơ mơ̆n.

English: Your country is desolate, Your cities are burned with fire; Strangers devour your land in your presence; And it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
Bahnar: Dêh char lu iĕm jing juơ, lu pơlei tih iĕm ŭnh sa đĭ, lu bơngai tơmoi tơgar iŏk teh choh iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm, teh lu iĕm jing juơ rơhiăng thoi lĕ bơngai tơmoi pơrăm tơgar iŏk bơih.

English: So the daughter of Zion is left as a booth in a vineyard, As a hut in a garden of cucumbers, As a besieged city.
Bahnar: Adruh Siôn ưh pă đei bu oei tơ noh, thoi đe tŭk lê̆ pơk mir hơmu, thoi pơk mir mơkai, thoi pơlei đe wang.

English: Unless the LORD of hosts Had left to us a very small remnant, We would have become like Sodom, We would have been made like Gomorrah.
Bahnar: Tơdah Kră Yang Tih Hloh ưh kơ lê̆ bơ̆n arih hơya tŏ sĕt, lei lu bơ̆n kư̆m răm lei-lăi thoi pơlei Sôđôm păng thoi pơlei Gômôrơ mơ̆n.

English: Hear the word of the LORD, You rulers of Sodom; Give ear to the law of our God, You people of Gomorrah
Bahnar: Ơ lu kră wei-lăng plei Sôđôm, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan. Ơ kon pơlei Gômôrơ, pơgling đon iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: “To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices to Me?” Says the LORD. “I have had enough of burnt offerings of rams And the fat of fed cattle. I do not delight in the blood of bulls, Or of lambs or goats.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hơdôm yơ tơmam mă iĕm soi sơmah hăm yua kiơ kơ Inh? Inh bơ̆l bơih dôm tơmam soi 'buh păng triu tơno hăm rơmă lu kon sem dơrong bek. Inh ưh kơ lăp đon ôh kơ pham rơmo tơno, triu kon păng bơbe tơno.

English: “When you come to appear before Me, Who has required this from your hand, To trample My courts?
Bahnar: Bu athei Lu iĕm năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, juă cham Inh.

English: Bring no more futile sacrifices; Incense is an abomination to Me. The New Moons, the Sabbaths, and the calling of assemblies— I cannot endure iniquity and the sacred meeting.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba ưh kơ yua kiơ kơ Inh dơ̆ng, Inh areh dêh tơmam 'bâu phu iĕm, năr khei 'nao, năr Sa'bat, lu năr iĕm akŭm sŏng sa tih. Inh ưh kơ lăp ôh tơdrong yoch tih iĕm lăm năr iĕm akŭm pơm giĕng tih.

English: Your New Moons and your appointed feasts My soul hates; They are a trouble to Me, I am weary of bearing them.
Bahnar: Inh areh dêh kơ lu 'năr khei 'nao, păng dôm tơdrong lu iĕm pơm giĕng, pơm trăp trĭn dêh kơ Inh. Inh pŭ iŏk gleh lap dêh.

English: When you spread out your hands, I will hide My eyes from you; Even though you make many prayers, I will not hear. Your hands are full of blood.
Bahnar: Na mưh kơplah iĕm yơ̆r ti krao khan, Inh đơ̆p măt ưh kơ wă lăng lu iĕm ôh. Mă khan iĕm krao khan lơ, Inh ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ôh. Ti lu iĕm 'bĕnh kơ pham.

English: “Wash yourselves, make yourselves clean; Put away the evil of your doings from before My eyes. Cease to do evil
Bahnar: Hum hơrao bĕ mă rơgoh! 'Bơ̆t anăp Inh lu iĕm athei hŭt lê̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆. 'Nĕ pă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dơ̆ng.

English: Learn to do good; Seek justice, Rebuke the oppressor; Defend the fatherless, Plead for the widow.
Bahnar: Pơhrăm iŏk bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, chă lu tơdrong tơpăt, tơiung lu bơngai đe pơjuă, dŏng tơgŭm lu bơngai mơti, pơma dŏng lu bơngai adro.

English: “Come now, and let us reason together,” Says the LORD, “Though your sins are like scarlet, They shall be as white as snow; Though they are red like crimson, They shall be as wool.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Dang ei lu bơ̆n năm bĕ wă kơ pơma pơđâu băl. Mă đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lu iĕm 'brê nhen thoi đak thêt gô jing kok thoi đak prĕl. Mă 'brê gơhieo gô jing kok thoi sŏk triu.

English: If you are willing and obedient, You shall eat the good of the land
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm wă păng chu yom Inh, Lei lu iĕm gô sa tơmam 'lơ̆ng hloh lăm teh âu.

English: But if you refuse and rebel, You shall be devoured by the sword”; For the mouth of the LORD has spoken.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ chu păng 'maih blơ̆ blĕch Inh, lei đao gưm gô pơrăm lu iĕm;” 'bơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơma bơih.

English: How the faithful city has become a harlot! It was full of justice; Righteousness lodged in it, But now murderers.
Bahnar: Ơ đêl Pơlei 'lơ̆ng tơnăp na jing pơlei pơm đi! Sơ̆ đêl pơlei tơpăt hơnơ̆ng; păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt oei lăm sư, mă-lei dang ei 'bĕnh kơ bơngai pơlôch đe!

English: Your silver has become dross, Your wine mixed with water.
Bahnar: Jên hu iĕm jing hla đuih, tơdrô hơmu iĕm đĭ lŭk hrâu hăm đak 'blăng.

English: Your princes are rebellious, And companions of thieves; Everyone loves bribes, And follows after rewards. They do not defend the fatherless, Nor does the cause of the widow come before them.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r iĕm tă kơ blơ̆ blĕch ngăl, pơm buăl hăm lu bơngai tơtông, rim 'nu lu sư tă kơ 'maih chă pơgâm sa tơmam, 'maih druh kiơ̆ mŭk tơmam đe ăn, ưh kơ dŏng tơgŭm lu bơngai mơti, pă 'maih lăng dŏng tơgŭm lu drŏ-kăn adro.

English: Therefore the Lord says, The LORD of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel, “Ah, I will rid Myself of My adversaries, And take vengeance on My enemies.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơih na Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Tơ'ngla Mơsêh Mơyang lu bơngai Isơrael khan: “Âu! Inh gô tuh tơdrong hil tơ lu bơngai blah Inh păng pơm 'mong kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ Inh!

English: I will turn My hand against you, And thoroughly purge away your dross, And take away all your alloy.
Bahnar: Inh gô yơ̆r ti pơm tơwih, inh gô pơgoh lê̆ 'bruih 'brăm đơ̆ng ih, păng iŏk hŭt lu rơ̆m rĕk ih.

English: I will restore your judges as at the first, And your counselors as at the beginning. Afterward you shall be called the city of righteousness, the faithful city.”
Bahnar: Inh gô tơiung ming lu 'bok sek tơlang noh thoi sơ̆ dơ̆ng, hăm lu bơngai pơđâu ih thoi blŭng-a na đe gô ang khan. Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng Tơpăt, Pơlei tơnăp 'lơ̆ng.

English: Zion shall be redeemed with justice, And her penitents with righteousness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô sek tơlang nhôn hăm tơdrong tơpăt, na huai iŏk lu bơngai lăm pơlei tơbral hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư.

English: The destruction of transgressors and of sinners shall be together, And those who forsake the LORD shall be consumed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai blơ̆ blĕch păng lu bơngai yoch lu sư gô lôch hiong lu đe bu mă achăng tŭk Kră Yang lu sư gô hiong răm.

English: For they shall be ashamed of the terebinth trees Which you have desired; And you shall be embarrassed because of the gardens Which you have chosen.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô mơlâu kơ lu 'long kôih mă iĕm kơkuh; lu iĕm gô hlơ̆l kơ pơgar 'long mă đêl lu iĕm rơih iŏk.

English: For you shall be as a terebinth whose leaf fades, And as a garden that has no water.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô nhen thoi 'long kôih hla sư jô kro, nhen thoi pơgar 'long ưh kơ đei đak.

English: The strong shall be as tinder, And the work of it as a spark; Both will burn together, And no one shall quench them.
Bahnar: Bơngai pran jing thoi kơđoh 'long kro, tơdrong jang sư thoi lĕ pla ŭnh, đĭ kơ bre sư ŭnh gô sa pơđĭ, ưh kơ đei bu kĕ pĭt.

English: The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Êsai kon 'bok Amôt, đei 'bôh gah dêh char Juđa păng Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now it shall come to pass in the latter days That the mountain of the LORD’s house Shall be established on the top of the mountains, And shall be exalted above the hills; And all nations shall flow to it.
Bahnar: Gô đei tơdrong truh lăm lu năr hơtuch kơnh: Kông hnam Kră Yang gô oei kơjăp tơ kơpal lu kơ̆l kông, kơjung hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu groi. Păng rim kơ teh đak gô luh leng năm tơ noh.

English: Many people shall come and say, “Come, and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, To the house of the God of Jacob; He will teach us His ways, And we shall walk in His paths.” For out of Zion shall go forth the law, And the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đei lơ khŭl bơngai gô truh tơ noh na khan: “Năm, bĕ lu bơ̆n tŏk tơ kông Kră Yang, tơ hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Jakôp. Sư gô bơtho bơ̆n trong Sư wă kơ lu bơ̆n yak kiơ̆ trong sư.” Khôi juăt gô đei đơ̆ng pơlei Siôn, nơ̆r Kră Yang gô đei đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: He shall judge between the nations, And rebuke many people; They shall beat their swords into plowshares, And their spears into pruning hooks; Nation shall not lift up sword against nation, Neither shall they learn war anymore.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô sek tơlang sơlam tŏk-bŏk kơ đĭ-đăng teh đak păng sek ăn kơ lơ adrĕch adrung bơngai, lu sư gô iŏk đao hơjơ̆m pơm pla 'nhik iŏk tơju hơlă lu sư pơm săng kô. Teh đak âu ưh pă đei tơblah păng teh đak to dơ̆ng bơih, ưh pă đei pơhrăm wă tơblah dơ̆ng.

English: O house of Jacob, come and let us walk In the light of the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch Jakôp, bĕ lu bơ̆n yak kiơ̆ lăm tơdrong hơdah Kră Yang.

English: For You have forsaken Your people, the house of Jacob, Because they are filled with eastern ways; They are soothsayers like the Philistines, And they are pleased with the children of foreigners.
Bahnar: Tơpă, Kră Yang đĭ achăng tŭk kon pơlei Kră Yang noh adrĕch Jakôp, yua kơ lu sư kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt teh đak gah hơlĕch, păng pơm pơjâu thoi lu bơngai Philistin, lu sư pơgơ̆p hăm lu bơngai tơmoi.

English: Their land is also full of silver and gold, And there is no end to their treasures; Their land is also full of horses, And there is no end to their chariots.
Bahnar: Dêh char lu sư đei hu maih, păng mŭk tơmam gĭt ưh pă băt dôm yơ, dêh noh đei aseh lơ păng đei gre aseh lơ pă gơh jô̆.

English: Their land is also full of idols; They worship the work of their own hands, That which their own fingers have made.
Bahnar: Dêh noh 'bĕnh-'bang kơ rup yang; lu sư kơkuh kơ rup yang đêl tơpang ti lu sư pơm kơdih. Đơ̆ng hơnglâu ti lu sư pơm.

English: People bow down, And each man humbles himself; Therefore do not forgive them.
Bahnar: Bơngai hmă gô mơlâu, bơngai mơng đe gô tơjur apinh Kră Yang 'nĕ kơ mơnat!

English: Enter into the rock, and hide in the dust, From the terror of the LORD And the glory of His majesty.
Bahnar: Iĕm mơ̆t bĕ lăm hơgơp tơmo, ôn bĕ akâu iĕm lăm teh, wă weh đơ̆ng anăp tơdrong đei krưp Kră Yang păng tơdrong ư-ang mơsêh mơyang Sư.

English: The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, The haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, And the LORD alone shall be exalted in that day.
Bahnar: Măt kon bơngai 'maih lăng pơrŏ gô mơlâu, tơdrong pơang kon bơngai gô tơhuŏng lê̆ tơ ala, lăm năr 'noh lăp minh 'nu Kră Yang đĕch bơ̆n ư-ang.

English: For the day of the LORD of hosts Shall come upon everything proud and lofty, Upon everything lifted up— And it shall be brought low
Bahnar: Đei minh năr Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơkă bơih, đei minh năr Sư gô pơm kơ bơngai pơang, păng lu bơngai pơrŏ akâu sư kơdih, đĭ-đăng lu sư Kră Yang gô tơhuŏng lê̆.

English: Upon all the cedars of Lebanon that are high and lifted up, And upon all the oaks of Bashan
Bahnar: Kŭm gô pơm kơ lu tơm 'long hơngo Liban pơrŏ pơang păng 'long kôih Basan.

English: Upon all the high mountains, And upon all the hills that are lifted up
Bahnar: Kŭm gô pơm kơ lu kông kơjung kơ lu groi kơjung.

English: Upon every high tower, And upon every fortified wall
Bahnar: Gô pơm kơ lu hnam thôt kơjung păng dur pơlei kơjăp.

English: Upon all the ships of Tarshish, And upon all the beautiful sloops.
Bahnar: Gô pơm kơ lu duk đe Tarsis păng dôm lu duk 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: The loftiness of man shall be bowed down, And the haughtiness of men shall be brought low; The LORD alone will be exalted in that day
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơang gô tơjur lê̆ tơ ala păng tơdrong kon bơngai pơrŏ kơdih akâu gô mơlâu, lăm năr 'noh kơnh pôm Kră Yang đĕch trŏ kơ bơ̆n ư-ang.

English: But the idols He shall utterly abolish.
Bahnar: Lu rup yang gô hiong đĭ.

English: They shall go into the holes of the rocks, And into the caves of the earth, From the terror of the LORD And the glory of His majesty, When He arises to shake the earth mightily.
Bahnar: Đe gô kơdâu ôn tơ lăm hơgơp tơmo, lăm trôm teh wă kơ weh đơ̆ng anăp tơdrong hli krưp Kră Yang păng tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư, kơplah năr Kră Yang wă iung pơm kơ teh âu tơdrŏ pơpơ̆.

English: In that day a man will cast away his idols of silver And his idols of gold, Which they made, each for himself to worship, To the moles and bats
Bahnar: Lăm 'năr 'nei kơnh đe gô klơ̆m ăn kơ kơne, klơ̆m ăn kơ hơmiĕt, lu rup yang păng maih, hu, mă đêl lu sư pơm wă kơkuh.

English: To go into the clefts of the rocks, And into the crags of the rugged rocks, From the terror of the LORD And the glory of His majesty, When He arises to shake the earth mightily.
Bahnar: Sư gô mơ̆t ôn tơ lăm trôm tơmo păng hơgơp tơmo, wă kơ weh đơ̆ng anăp tơdrong hli krưp păng tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Kră Yang. Kơplah Sư iung pơm kơ teh tơdrŏ pơpơ̆.

English: Sever yourselves from such a man, Whose breath is in his nostrils; For of what account is he?
Bahnar: 'Nĕ gơnang kơ kon bơngai; mă dui jơhngơ̆m hăm trôm muh, lu sư ưh kơ yua kiơ?

English: For behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, Takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah The stock and the store, The whole supply of bread and the whole supply of water
Bahnar: Âu, Kră Yang Kră Yang Tih Hloh, gô iŏk lê̆ tơdrong dŏng păng tơgŭm dôm tơmam kăl yua đơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem păng char Juđa, thoi kơ tơmam sa mă lu sư gơnang păng đak mă lu sư hơmĕng.

English: The mighty man and the man of war, The judge and the prophet, And the diviner and the elder
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk lê̆ lu bơngai pran kơtang, lu linh, lu kră sek tơlang, lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, lu pơjâu, lu bơngai kră.

English: The captain of fifty and the honorable man, The counselor and the skillful artisan, And the expert enchanter.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r pơđăm-jĭt 'nu linh, păng lu 'bok pơgơ̆r, lu 'bok gơh chă đon, lu bơngai gơh bơ̆jang hơgei păng lu pơjâu.

English: “I will give children to be their princes, And babes shall rule over them.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu nge pơm yŏng lu sư, lu hơ'lơ̆p gô pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: The people will be oppressed, Every one by another and every one by his neighbor; The child will be insolent toward the elder, And the base toward the honorable.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơjuă pơđep băl tơduă, rim 'nu tơblah băl, tơduă rông 'bôt tơblah băl, lu hơ'lơ̆p pơrăm lu kră. Lu bơngai răm-'băm pơm plơ̆ kơ lu bơngai mă đe ư-ang.

English: When a man takes hold of his brother In the house of his father, saying, “You have clothing; You be our ruler, And let these ruins be under your power,”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai gô rôp pơkơ̆ng minh 'nu 'nhŏng oh sư tơ lăm hnam 'bă sư na khan: “Ih đei ao tai, ih pơgơ̆r lu nhôn! Păng tơdrong răm rai 'nâu ih bơih pơgơ̆r.”

English: In that day he will protest, saying, “I cannot cure your ills, For in my house is neither food nor clothing; Do not make me a ruler of the people.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm năr noh, bơngai noh gô ôr khan, “inh ưh kơ trŏ bơngai gơh pơklaih ôh, lăm hnam inh ưh kơ đei tơmam sa, kư̆m ưh kơ đei ao tai, 'nĕ rôp inh pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei.”

English: For Jerusalem stumbled, And Judah is fallen, Because their tongue and their doings Are against the LORD, To provoke the eyes of His glory.
Bahnar: Pơlei Jêrusalem đĭ grê păng char Juđa đĭ hơlih; yua kơ nơ̆r pơma păng tơdrong jang lu sư blah Kră Yang, che bơle pơjăm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang trŏ kơ ư-ang.

English: The look on their countenance witnesses against them, And they declare their sin as Sodom; They do not hide it. Woe to their soul! For they have brought evil upon themselves.
Bahnar: Muh măt lu sư tơ'bôh pơdah blah plơ̆ kơdih akâu lu sư; lu sư pơdah tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih thoi pơlei Sôđôm, ưh kơ gơh ôn hlơp ôh, Răm-'băm dêh kơ bơhngol lu sư, yua kơ lu sư ba tơdrong răm kơdih akâu.

English: “Say to the righteous that it shall be well with them, For they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư; yua kơ lu sư gô đei sa plei đơ̆ng lu sư jang kơdih.

English: Woe to the wicked! It shall be ill with him, For the reward of his hands shall be given him.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, sư gô đei tơdrong pơmat-tat! Lu sư gô pŭ iŏk đêl ti lu sư pơm!

English: As for My people, children are their oppressors, And women rule over them. O My people! Those who lead you cause you to err, And destroy the way of your paths.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơla Inh, lu đe hơ'lơ̆p gô pơjuă pơđep lu sư. Drŏ-kăn gô pơgơ̆r lu sư. Ơ kon pơlei Inh! Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r chông iĕm jrok trong, pơm kơ iĕm wơ̆l kơ trong.

English: The LORD stands up to plead, And stands to judge the people.
Bahnar: Kră Yang iung pơma, Sư iung dơ̆ng sek tơlang kon pơlei.

English: The LORD will enter into judgment With the elders of His people And His princes: “For you have eaten up the vineyard; The plunder of the poor is in your houses.
Bahnar: Kră Yang sek tơlang lu bơngai kră păng lu kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Sư khan: “Lu iĕm luăn sa bơih pơgar hơmu. Tơtông iŏk tơmam lu bơngai dơnuh oei tơ lăm hnam lu iĕm.

English: What do you mean by crushing My people And grinding the faces of the poor?” Says the Lord GOD of hosts.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm tơchĕng liơ pơjuă pơđep kon pơlei Inh, juă gơhlơ̆r muh măt lu bơngai dơnuh hin?” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: Moreover the LORD says: “Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, And walk with outstretched necks And wanton eyes, Walking and mincing as they go, Making a jingling with their feet
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lu kon drŏ-kăn Siôn pơrŏ yak toh hơko, măt lu sư lăng cheng hơ'nhưp wă kơ đe hưch, lu sư yak nơnăm mơtuĭ mơtuă, mơgriu re kong jơ̆ng.

English: Therefore the Lord will strike with a scab The crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, And the LORD will uncover their secret parts.”
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang gô pơm kơ kon drŏ-kăn Siôn jĭ tơ'boch 'bĕnh kơpal kơ̆l lu sư, păng pơm kơ kơ̆l lu sư hok sŏk ưh kơ chăt.”

English: In that day the Lord will take away the finery: The jingling anklets, the scarves, and the crescents
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Kră Yang gô iŏk lê̆ lu tơmam lu sư pơguăng păng kong kiơng kong jơ̆ng, tơsi chơkep sŏk, che kơ̆t kơ̆l

English: The pendants, the bracelets, and the veils
Bahnar: maih đoh, kong maih 'bot tơ ti che klơ̆p kơ̆l.

English: The headdresses, the leg ornaments, and the headbands; The perfume boxes, the charms
Bahnar: Môk pơkao, rơbưn glang iĕ 'bot plei kĕnh, che trăk hơngiĕng, get đak pơgang 'bâu phu, pơgang rơhưch.

English: and the rings; The nose jewels
Bahnar: Tơkhiĕn 'bot, gŏp muh.

English: the festal apparel, and the mantles; The outer garments, the purses
Bahnar: Hơbĕn ao năr giĕng sŏng sa tih, ao lăm, ao tai 'nguaih, kơdŭng iĕ.

English: and the mirrors; The fine linen, the turbans, and the robes.
Bahnar: Kơmĭl lăng, ao, che klơ̆p kơ̆l păng che gom muh măt.

English: And so it shall be: Instead of a sweet smell there will be a stench; Instead of a sash, a rope; Instead of well-set hair, baldness; Instead of a rich robe, a girding of sackcloth; And branding instead of beauty.
Bahnar: Đak 'bâu ôm tơplih kơ đak pơgang 'bâu phu, tơlei kơnŭi pơm tơlei tơ̆n: Kơ̆l sŏk tơtuh tơplih kơ đei sŏk jing; bơnal 'bi pơ̆n akâu tơplih kơ ao tai brai se, tơdrong mơlâu tơplih tơdrong 'lơ̆ng.

English: Your men shall fall by the sword, And your mighty in the war.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơdăm ih gô pơ̆k kơ đao gưm, lu bơngai nuih kơtang ih gô lôch lăm tơdrong tơblah.

English: Her gates shall lament and mourn, And she being desolate shall sit on the ground.
Bahnar: Lu 'măng jang pơlei gô nhơ̆m hmoi, ơh sơ'ngon; thoi bơngai hơ-oei kơpal teh răm rai.

English: And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, “We will eat our own food and wear our own apparel; Only let us be called by your name, To take away our reproach.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh tơpơh 'nu drŏ-kăn gô rôp pơkơ̆ng minh 'nu drŏ-nglo păng pơma khan: “Lu nhôn sŏng sa tơmam nhôn kơdih. Păng hrŭk hơbĕn ao nhôn kơdih; apinh ăn kơ đe krao nhôn anăn Ih; sŭt lê̆ lu tơdrong mơlâu lu nhôn.”

English: In that day the Branch of the LORD shall be beautiful and glorious; And the fruit of the earth shall be excellent and appealing For those of Israel who have escaped.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh tơ'biĕng Kră Yang gô bluh 'lơ̆ng păng trŏ kơ ư-ang, plei đơ̆ng teh gô jing 'lơ̆ng chơt hiôk kơ lu bơngai Isơrael mă oei arih.

English: And it shall come to pass that he who is left in Zion and remains in Jerusalem will be called holy—everyone who is recorded among the living in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei arih lăm pơlei Siôn, lu bơngai oei oei arih lăm pơlei Jêrusalem gô krao lu sư bơngai rơgoh wă khan đĭ-đăng lu bơngai đei chih jô̆ oei arih lăm Jêrusalem.

English: When the Lord has washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and purged the blood of Jerusalem from her midst, by the spirit of judgment and by the spirit of burning
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ôp hơrao tơdrong pơm 'mê̆-'mach lu bơngai lăm Siôn, sek tơlang chhut rơgoh đĭ pham lăm pơlei Jêrusalem hăm Tơdrong Mơsêh Sư.

English: then the LORD will create above every dwelling place of Mount Zion, and above her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night. For over all the glory there will be a covering.
Bahnar: Tơ jơ̆p anih kơpal kông Siôn, tơ kơpal anih kon pơlei akŭm, Kră Yang pơm hơmơ̆l hăm 'nhui gom kơ 'năr păng pla ŭnh pơchrang hơdah kơmăng. Tơpă, thoi đei minh blah che gom jơ̆p-jang kơ tơdrong ư-ang.

English: And there will be a tabernacle for shade in the daytime from the heat, for a place of refuge, and for a shelter from storm and rain.
Bahnar: Sư gô jing thoi minh anih pơm yơ̆p kơ'nơp kơ'năr păng anih kơ'nơp năr 'mi kial hơbŭt.

English: Now let me sing to my Well-beloved A song of my Beloved regarding His vineyard: My Well-beloved has a vineyard On a very fruitful hill.
Bahnar: Inh gô hơri ăn kơ bơngai mă inh 'mêm, minh 'bai hơri gah pơgar hơmu sư, buăl mă inh 'mêm đei minh hlak pơgar hơmu tơ kơpal groi hơdrih 'lơ̆ng.

English: He dug it up and cleared out its stones, And planted it with the choicest vine. He built a tower in its midst, And also made a winepress in it; So He expected it to bring forth good grapes, But it brought forth wild grapes.
Bahnar: Sư choh teh preh dônh lê̆ tơmo đĭ, sư pơtăm rơih iŏk tơm hơmu bluh 'lơ̆ng, sư pơdơ̆ng minh pôm hnam thôt tŏk-bŏk pơgar păng sir minh pôm sơlŭng wă hmĕt iŏk đak hơmu sư. Sư hơmĕng hơmu sư đei plei 'lơ̆ng mă-lei tă kơ plei đĭ wir.

English: “And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah, Judge, please, between Me and My vineyard.
Bahnar: “Ơ kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng lu bơngai oei lăm char Juđa. Apinh sek tơlang bĕ kơ Inh păng pơgar hơmu Inh.

English: What more could have been done to My vineyard That I have not done in it? Why then, when I expected it to bring forth good grapes, Did it bring forth wild grapes?
Bahnar: Hăm đei tơdrong kiơ gơh pơm dơ̆ng kơ pơgar hơmu Inh. Mă Inh tam mă pơm ăn kiơ kơ sư? Kơplah Inh hơmĕng kơ đei plei 'lơ̆ng mă-lei tă tơ plei wir kơnê̆?

English: And now, please let Me tell you what I will do to My vineyard: I will take away its hedge, and it shall be burned; And break down its wall, and it shall be trampled down.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh roi kơ lu iĕm. Tơdrong Inh wă pơm kơ pơgar hơmu Inh. Inh gô yuih lê̆ dur war, na đe gô phĕ sa plei sư đĭ, Inh gô tơlơ̆ lê̆ dur noh na đe gô pơjuă pơrăm sư.

English: I will lay it waste; It shall not be pruned or dug, But there shall come up briers and thorns. I will also command the clouds That they rain no rain on it.”
Bahnar: Inh gô lê̆ sư Jing bri, ưh kơ đei hơleh dơng seh hơmet sư; na 'nhĕt jơla gô chăt krênh tơm sư. Inh gô khan kơ hơmơ̆l 'nĕ pă 'mi jruh tơ pơgar noh.

English: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel, And the men of Judah are His pleasant plant. He looked for justice, but behold, oppression; For righteousness, but behold, a cry for help.
Bahnar: Pơgar hơmu Kră Yang Tih Hloh noh jơ̆ adrĕch Isơrael, păng lu bơngai Juđa noh bơih tơm 'long pơtăm mă sư lăp đon. Hơmĕng wă kơ sư 'lơ̆ng tơpăt mă tă kơ pham lĕch sĕch huŏng, hơmĕng kơ sư tơpăt hơnơ̆ng mă tă đei tơdrong ôr krao.

English: Woe to those who join house to house; They add field to field, Till there is no place Where they may dwell alone in the midst of the land!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu iĕm bơngai mă pơm hnam thim hnam nai dơ̆ng, păng choh chŭn thim chŭn nai dơ̆ng, na jing pă đei teh 'bơ̆t yơ rơhơi dơ̆ng, păng lu iĕm jing oei adrô̆ lăm dêh char.”

English: In my hearing the LORD of hosts said, “Truly, many houses shall be desolate, Great and beautiful ones, without inhabitant.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan 'bơ̆t đon inh: “Sĭt tơpă gô đei lơ hnam gô lê̆ jing juơ, lu hnam tih kơjung păng 'lơ̆ng mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu oei lăm noh!

English: For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, And a homer of seed shall yield one ephah.”
Bahnar: Mơjĭt Hekta mir hơmu hmĕt iŏk đak sư lăp minh ge đĕch, mơjĭt kơđŏng pŭng adrĕch, kĕch iŏk lăp minh kơdŏng pŭng đĕch.”

English: Woe to those who rise early in the morning, That they may follow intoxicating drink; Who continue until night, till wine inflames them!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ bơngai bu mă đơ̆ng hrôih, drôih chơchă tơdrô, pơgŏk kơ tơdrô dĭng măng, dĭng tơdrô soh chhông lu sư!

English: The harp and the strings, The tambourine and flute, And wine are in their feasts; But they do not regard the work of the LORD, Nor consider the operation of His hands.
Bahnar: Lăm năr et sa lu sư reh brŏ, hlôm lillul teh hơgơ̆r hăm et tơdrô, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ tơchĕng tơdrong Kră Yang pơm; lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ 'bôh đêl dôm tơdrong đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang pơjing.

English: Therefore my people have gone into captivity, Because they have no knowledge; Their honorable men are famished, And their multitude dried up with thirst.
Bahnar: Yua ưh kơhlôh kơwao na kon pơlei pơla Inh jing pơm đĭch đe, lu bơngai yŏng mơng jing lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt, kon pơlei lu sư jing ol ăk yua kơ rơhing kơ đak.

English: Therefore Sheol has enlarged itself And opened its mouth beyond measure; Their glory and their multitude and their pomp, And he who is jubilant, shall descend into it.
Bahnar: Noh bơih na jing dêh hơtâu pơih 'măng sư rai să ha 'bơ̆r wă 'maih luăn sư ưh kơ pơdơh ôh, lu bơngai đe ư-ang păng kon pơlei pơla sư đĭ-đăng lu bơngai chơt hiôk oei lăm pơlei, tă kơ huŏng tơ lăm noh ngăl.

English: People shall be brought down, Each man shall be humbled, And the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hmă gô kŭp kơ̆l, kon bơngai gô tơjur, lu bơngai pơang gô lê̆ tơ ala.

English: But the LORD of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, And God who is holy shall be hallowed in righteousness.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, gô pôk hơtŏk tơ kơpal hloh hăm tơdrong sek tơlang tơpăt hơnơ̆ng, păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh gô pơdah Sư 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Then the lambs shall feed in their pasture, And in the waste places of the fat ones strangers shall eat.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu triu kon gô sa 'nhĕt, nhen thoi tơ tơmăn 'nhĕt sư kơdih, gah triu gô đei sa đêl đơ̆ng chŭn lu bơngai mơdrŏng lê̆ bri.

English: Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of vanity, And sin as if with a cart rope
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ bơngai bu đui tơdrong yoch hăm tơlei hơlĕnh; păng dui ba tơdrong yoch thoi tơlei dui gre.

English: That say, “Let Him make speed and hasten His work, That we may see it; And let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, That we may know it.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Apinh Ih jah pơm pơkeh tơdrong jang Ih, wă kơ lu nhôn 'bôh! Apinh tơdrong tơdă đơ̆ng Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael jah truh, jing keh. Wă kơ lu nhôn băt.”

English: Woe to those who call evil good, and good evil; Who put darkness for light, and light for darkness; Who put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ bơngai bu khan pơm kơnê̆ noh 'lơ̆ng, khan pơm 'lơ̆ng noh kơnê̆; khan măng mu noh hơdah, hơdah noh khan măng mu; tơmam tăng khan 'ngam, tơmam 'ngam khan tăng.

English: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes, And prudent in their own sight!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ bơngai bu lăng kơdih akâu sư khan hơgei, pôk kơdih akâu sư khan bơngai hlôh wao!

English: Woe to men mighty at drinking wine, Woe to men valiant for mixing intoxicating drink
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ bơngai bu khan nuih mưh et tơdrô, đei jơhngơ̆m pran hrâu đơ̆ng tơdrô.

English: Who justify the wicked for a bribe, And take away justice from the righteous man!
Bahnar: Lu sư achăng lê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ yua kơ đei iŏk pơgâm sa tơmam đe răt, sơngah ưh kơ pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kơ bơngai ưh kơ đei yoch.

English: Therefore, as the fire devours the stubble, And the flame consumes the chaff, So their root will be as rottenness, And their blossom will ascend like dust; Because they have rejected the law of the LORD of hosts, And despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lei na nhen thoi pla ŭnh sa tơm hơnong 'ba, thoi 'nhĕt kro mơ̆t lăm pla ŭnh. Na rơh lu sư kư̆m bŭk hĕch păng pơkao plei lu sư đông thoi 'mui teh; yua kơ lu sư sơngah tŭk lê̆ khôi juăt Kră Yang Tih Hloh păng pơjăm nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: Therefore the anger of the LORD is aroused against His people; He has stretched out His hand against them And stricken them, And the hills trembled. Their carcasses were as refuse in the midst of the streets. For all this His anger is not turned away, But His hand is stretched out still.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơih na Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ kon pơlei Sư; Kră Yang hiŏng ti teh lu sư, kông tơdrŏ, akâu bơngai lôch 'bĕnh-'bang kơ trong. Mă-lei tơdrong Kră Yang hil oei ưh kơ ngach oei hiŏng ti hil kơ lu sư 'mơ̆i.

English: He will lift up a banner to the nations from afar, And will whistle to them from the end of the earth; Surely they shall come with speed, swiftly.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Sư pơdơ̆ng hla-kơ ăn kơ lu bơngai oei tơ dêh ataih, păng hơhôch krao lu sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang tôch kơ teh đak, na lu sư hăt hot wă kơ jah truh tĕnh.

English: No one will be weary or stumble among them, No one will slumber or sleep; Nor will the belt on their loins be loosed, Nor the strap of their sandals be broken
Bahnar: Lăm lu sư ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bơngai bu gleh lap, kơtơih pơ̆k, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu tep kơkôi păng tep blêk; ưh kơ đei bơngai bu tơlei tơ̆n sư tơyaih dah tơlei chơkhŏ sư kơtĕch.

English: Whose arrows are sharp, And all their bows bent; Their horses’ hooves will seem like flint, And their wheels like a whirlwind.
Bahnar: 'Brơ̆m hră lu sư suĕng dêh, hră lu sư hơ'năk lê̆ bơih, kơchôp aseh lu sư thoi tơmo tơneh. Jơ̆ng gre thoi phŭt huơ̆r.

English: Their roaring will be like a lion, They will roar like young lions; Yes, they will roar And lay hold of the prey; They will carry it away safely, And no one will deliver.
Bahnar: Lu sư ôr jơwa thoi dăm-brang akăn, gơhuh nhen dăm-brang mơlôh, lu sư grĕnh chă rôp sa sem bri păng hor ba, ưh kơ đei bu kĕ dŏng pơklaih ôh.

English: In that day they will roar against them Like the roaring of the sea. And if one looks to the land, Behold, darkness and sorrow; And the light is darkened by the clouds.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh lu sư ôr thoi jơwa đak dơsĭ poh-yă, tơdah đe tơmang lăng tơ teh noh măng mu păng răm rai ngăl, mă lu tơdrong hơdah hơmơ̆l găm klơ̆p lê̆ đĭ.

English: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His robe filled the temple.
Bahnar: Sơnăm pơtao Usia lôch, inh 'bôh Kră Yang tơoei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao kơjung hloh kơ đĭ-đăng păng pơyom ao tai sư 'bĕnh kơ lăm hnam akŭm.

English: Above it stood seraphim; each one had six wings: with two he covered his face, with two he covered his feet, and with two he flew.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal Kră Yang; đei lu Seraphim rim Sêraphim đei tơdrâu hlak pơnăr, 'bar pah pơnăr sư pĕng muh măt, 'bar pah pơnăr pĕng jơ̆ng păng 'bar pah pơnăr dơ̆ng yua wă păr.

English: And one cried to another and said: “Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of hosts; The whole earth is full of His glory!”
Bahnar: Lu Sêraphim ôr krao tơduă lu sư khan: “'Lơ̆ng rơgoh dêh, 'lơ̆ng rơgoh dêh, 'lơ̆ng rơgoh dêh Kră Yang Tih Hloh; jơ̆p kơ teh đak 'bĕnh-'bang kơ tơdrong ư-ang Sư!”

English: And the posts of the door were shaken by the voice of him who cried out, and the house was filled with smoke.
Bahnar: Yua kơ re jơwa ôr noh na đĭ-đăng lu jrăng 'măng tơdrŏ păng hnam akŭm 'bĕnh kơ 'nhui.

English: So I said: “Woe is me, for I am undone! Because I am a man of unclean lips, And I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; For my eyes have seen the King, The LORD of hosts.”
Bahnar: Inh ôr khan: “Răm-'băm dêh kơ inh! Inh đĭ răm bơih! Yua kơ inh jơ̆ minh 'nu bơngai đei 'bơ̆r kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, oei hơdai hăm kon pơlei đei 'bơ̆r kơnê̆ 'mê̆ mach, yua kơ măt inh lăng 'bôh bơih pơtao, noh bơih Kră Yang Tih Hloh!”

English: Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a live coal which he had taken with the tongs from the altar.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei minh pôm lăm lu Sêraphim păr năm tơ inh, ti sư chĕp ngar ŭnh ngŭr kep iŏk đơ̆ng anih chơnang soi hăm mam kep.

English: And he touched my mouth with it, and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; Your iniquity is taken away, And your sin purged.”
Bahnar: Sêraphim kep ngar noh 'bơm tơ 'bơ̆r inh, na khan: “Lăng âu tơmam âu hơtŭt 'bơm hơkŭng ih bơih, tơdrong kơnê̆ ih tŭk lê̆ bơih, tơdrong yoch ih mơnat ăn bơih.”

English: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: “Whom shall I send, And who will go for Us?” Then I said, “Here am I! Send me.”
Bahnar: Păng inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô wơh bu năm? Bu gô năm kơ lu bơ̆n?” Inh tơl: “Đei inh tơ âu, apinh ih wơh inh năm.”

English: And He said, “Go, and tell this people: ‘Keep on hearing, but do not understand; Keep on seeing, but do not perceive.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Năm bĕ! Khan kơ kon pơlei 'nâu: ‘Mơ̆ng, mă-lei ưh kơ hlôh kiơ: Lăng 'bôh mă-lei ưh kơ băt kiơ.’

English: “Make the heart of this people dull, And their ears heavy, And shut their eyes; Lest they see with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And understand with their heart, And return and be healed.”
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ kơ kon pơlei 'nâu jơhngơ̆m lu sư arăng, đon tơngơl, măt lu sư bơbôl, Hli kơ măt lu sư gơh 'bôh đon lu sư kơtơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m lu sư hlôh kơnh lu sư wơ̆t brŏk păng gơh klaih.”

English: Then I said, “Lord, how long?” And He answered: “Until the cities are laid waste and without inhabitant, The houses are without a man, The land is utterly desolate
Bahnar: Na inh jet: “Ơ Kră Yang dĭng truh tơ layơ?” Na Kră Yang tơl: “Gô dĭng lu pơlei noh jing juơ, ưh kơ đei kon pơlei oei lăm noh, hnam ưh kơ đei bơngai oei, teh mir đĭ răm jing bri đĭ

English: The LORD has removed men far away, And the forsaken places are many in the midst of the land.
Bahnar: dĭng truh tơ Kră Yang puh lê̆ kon pơlei năm tơ ataih păng lăm dêh noh jing juơ tơtŭng.

English: But yet a tenth will be in it, And will return and be for consuming, As a terebinth tree or as an oak, Whose stump remains when it is cut down. So the holy seed shall be its stump.”
Bahnar: Mă khan minh lăm mơjĭt 'nu kon pơlei oei đei tơ noh, lu sư đe kư̆m gô pơrăm đĭ, thoi đe kăl 'long hơngo, 'long kôih, sư kư̆m oei đei tơm, na gô đei adrĕch rơgoh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt thoi tơm lăm teh đak noh.

English: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin king of Syria and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to make war against it, but could not prevail against it.
Bahnar: Lăm chăl Ahas kon Jôtham, sâu Usia pơtao char Juđa, đei Rêsin, pơtao dêh char Siri păng Pêka kon Rômalia pơtao Isơrael, tŏk blah pơlei Jêrusalem mă-lei ưh kơ kĕ.

English: And it was told to the house of David, saying, “Syria’s forces are deployed in Ephraim.” So his heart and the heart of his people were moved as the trees of the woods are moved with the wind.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai năm roi ăn kơ hnam Đawit khan: “Siri pơgơ̆p hăm Êphraim.” Na kơplah noh Ahas păng kon pơlei Juđa hli tơrơ hyĭng hyơ̆ng dang lĕ kial tơthu 'long lăm bri.

English: Then the LORD said to Isaiah, “Go out now to meet Ahaz, you and Shear-Jashub your son, at the end of the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the highway to the Fuller’s Field
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Êsai: “Ih hăm kon drŏ-nglo ih Sêar Jasup năm sơng bĕ Ahas 'bơ̆t tôch kơ hơbong đak ro mơ̆t tơ Dơnâu Kơpơ̆ng, trong năm tơ dơnih đak bơngai tong brai.

English: and say to him: ‘Take heed, and be quiet; do not fear or be fainthearted for these two stubs of smoking firebrands, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and the son of Remaliah.
Bahnar: Na khan kơ sư: ‘Ih kơchăng oei mă hơđơ̆ng bĕ, 'nĕ kơ hli, 'nĕ kơ rơdu ôh, yua kơ đei 'bar tŏ 'long ŭnh sa lĕch 'nhui noh wă khan tơdrong hil blĕk lĕch đơ̆ng Rêsin, Siri păng kon drŏ-nglo Rêmalia.

English: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have plotted evil against you, saying
Bahnar: Kơlih yua kơ Siri hăm Êphraim păng kon drŏ-nglo Rêmalia chă đon wă pơrăm ih lu sư khan

English: “Let us go up against Judah and trouble it, and let us make a gap in its wall for ourselves, and set a king over them, the son of Tabel”
Bahnar: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm tŏk blah char Juđa, pơm kơ sư hli tơrơ blah iŏk char noh asong băl bơ̆n, pôk kon drŏ-nglo Tabel pơm pơtao lu sư tơ noh.”

English: thus says the Lord GOD: “It shall not stand, Nor shall it come to pass.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Tơdrong noh ưh kơ jing, ưh kơ đei truh ôh!”

English: For the head of Syria is Damascus, And the head of Damascus is Rezin. Within sixty-five years Ephraim will be broken, So that it will not be a people.
Bahnar: Yua kơ kơ̆l char Siri jơ pơlei Đamas, kơ̆l pơlei Đamas jơ̆ Rêsin lăm tơdrâu-jĭt pơđăm sơnăm Êphraim gô răm đĭ ưh pă jing kon pơlei pơla dơ̆ng.

English: The head of Ephraim is Samaria, And the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If you will not believe, Surely you shall not be established.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Kơ̆l kơ char Êphraim jơ̆ pơlei Samari, kơ̆l kơ pơlei Samari jơ̆ kon drŏ-nglo Rêmalia. Tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ lui ngeh lei iĕm dơ̆ng ưh kơjăp ôh.”

English: Moreover the LORD spoke again to Ahaz, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Ahas

English: “Ask a sign for yourself from the LORD your God; ask it either in the depth or in the height above.”
Bahnar: “Apinh bĕ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, tơ'bôh kơ ih tơdra, tơ anih jrŭ dơnâu ŭnh sŭng dah tơ kơpal plei 'lơ̆ng tơ plĕnh ti.”

English: But Ahaz said, “I will not ask, nor will I test the LORD!”
Bahnar: Ahas tơl khan: “Inh ưh kơ apinh, inh kư̆m ưh kơ pơlong lăng Kră Yang.”

English: Then he said, “Hear now, O house of David! Is it a small thing for you to weary men, but will you weary my God also?
Bahnar: Na Êsai khan: “Ơ hnam Đawit mơ̆ng bĕ! Lu iĕm khan pơm pơơh kơ đe noh jơ̆ tơdrong iĕ đĕch, na lu iĕm kư̆m 'maih pơm kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh ơh dơ̆ng mơ̆n hă?

English: Therefore the Lord Himself will give you a sign: Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a Son, and shall call His name Immanuel.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh bơih Kră Yang gô tơ'bôh kơ lu iĕm tơdra: Minh 'nu adruh gô anăp tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, đe anăn kon sư noh Êmanuel.

English: Curds and honey He shall eat, that He may know to refuse the evil and choose the good.
Bahnar: Hơ'lơ̆p ei gô sa đak toh krăl păng đak sut, dĭng truh sư băt hŭt tơdrong kơnê̆ păng rơih iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng.

English: For before the Child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land that you dread will be forsaken by both her kings.
Bahnar: Na hơdrol kơ hơ'lơ̆p ei băt tŭk tơdrong kơnê̆ păng rơih iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, teh đak 'bar 'nu pơtao mă ih hli noh gô jing juơ.

English: The LORD will bring the king of Assyria upon you and your people and your father’s house—days that have not come since the day that Ephraim departed from Judah.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn tơdrong truh kơ ih, kon pơlei ih păng hnam 'bă ih, đơ̆ng năr mă Êphraim tơklah đơ̆ng Juđa kư̆m tam mă đei 'bôh thoi noh wă khan sư gô chông ba pơtao Asiri truh.”

English: And it shall come to pass in that day That the LORD will whistle for the fly That is in the farthest part of the rivers of Egypt, And for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Kră Yang gô hơhôch krao lu roi đơ̆ng tu đak glung Êyiptơ păng krao sut đơ̆ng dêh Asiri.

English: They will come, and all of them will rest In the desolate valleys and in the clefts of the rocks, And on all thorns and in all pastures.
Bahnar: Sut păng roi gô truh kôp tơ lăm chhom kông, tơ lăm trôm tơmo, tơ tơm 'long jơla, tơ đak dơnâu.

English: In the same day the Lord will shave with a hired razor, With those from beyond the River, with the king of Assyria, The head and the hair of the legs, And will also remove the beard.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Kră Yang gô yua săng kôih mưng đơ̆ng pah to krong, noh wă khan pơtao Asiri na hơkôih đĭ sŏk kơ̆l, sŏk sop jơ̆ng păng sŏk kang lu iĕm dơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: It shall be in that day That a man will keep alive a young cow and two sheep
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh rim 'nu gô rong minh pôm rơmo adruh păng 'bar tŏ triu đĕch.

English: So it shall be, from the abundance of milk they give, That he will eat curds; For curds and honey everyone will eat who is left in the land.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư đei đak toh jrah jrai na sư gô sa đak toh krăl, yua kơ lu bơngai oei oei lăm dêh noh sư 'me akâu sư păng đak toh krăl hăm đak sut.

English: It shall happen in that day, That wherever there could be a thousand vines Worth a thousand shekels of silver, It will be for briers and thorns.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, tơ anih đêl đei rơbâu tơnơm 'long hơmu. Kăp sư dang tơ rơbâu sêikơl jên gô chăt 'long jơla păng 'nhĕt jơla ngăl

English: With arrows and bows men will come there, Because all the land will become briers and thorns.
Bahnar: Đe gô chĕp ba hră hăm 'brơ̆m truh tơ noh yua kơ jơ̆p dêh noh 'bĕnh kơ 'long jơla 'nhĕt jơla ngăl.

English: And to any hill which could be dug with the hoe, You will not go there for fear of briers and thorns; But it will become a range for oxen And a place for sheep to roam.
Bahnar: Kŭm ưh kơ đei bơngai bu năm tơ đêl anih sư choh jang noh dơ̆ng yua kơ hli kơ lu 'long jơla 'nhĕt jơla hro 'bĕnh-'bang, mă-lei gô ăn kơ rơmo sa păng triu pơjuă anih noh.

English: Moreover the LORD said to me, “Take a large scroll, and write on it with a man’s pen concerning Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: “Iŏk bĕ minh hlak gơ'bang să păng chih tơ noh hăm chư hmă kon bơngai gơh băt: Maher-Salal-Hasbas.

English: And I will take for Myself faithful witnesses to record, Uriah the priest and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.”
Bahnar: Inh rơih kơ Inh lu bơngai pơm kơdranh tơnăp sĭt, noh Uria 'bok soi păng Sachari kon drŏ-nglo Jêbêrêkia.”

English: Then I went to the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son. Then the LORD said to me, “Call his name Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh năm oei tơ hnam drŏ-kăn bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, sư anăp păng tơpŭ kon drŏ-nglo, na Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Ih anăn sư noh Maher-Salal-Hasbas.

English: for before the child shall have knowledge to cry ‘My father’ and ‘My mother,’ the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria will be taken away before the king of Assyria.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ adrol kơ kon nge noh gơh pơma krao, 'Bă ơi! Mĕ ơi! Đe gô iŏk lê̆ mŭk tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng pơlei Đamas păng tơmam tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng Samari năm ba 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Asiri.

English: The LORD also spoke to me again, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ inh

English: “Inasmuch as these people refused The waters of Shiloah that flow softly, And rejoice in Rezin and in Remaliah’s son
Bahnar: “Yua kơ kon pơlei âu sơngah kơ krong đak Silôa ro 'lơ̆ng rơnang, mă-lei hiôk kơ Rêsin hăm kon drŏ-nglo Rêmalia.

English: Now therefore, behold, the Lord brings up over them The waters of the River, strong and mighty— The king of Assyria and all his glory; He will go up over all his channels And go over all his banks.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na âu, Kră Yang ăn đak lơ̆p krong ro jăng păng đak tih ro truh tơ lu sư, noh wă khan pơtao Asiri păng đĭ-đăng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư. Đak gô ro blai đĭ-đăng lu hơbong păng lơ̆p đĭ-đăng lu bơnơ̆.

English: He will pass through Judah, He will overflow and pass over, He will reach up to the neck; And the stretching out of his wings Will fill the breadth of Your land, O Immanuel.
Bahnar: Ro blai mơ̆t tơ char Juđa, dĭng lơ̆p truh tơ hơko. Ơ Êmanuel! Pơnăr Sư gô bơyar jơ̆p kơ dêh ih.”

English: “Be shattered, O you peoples, and be broken in pieces! Give ear, all you from far countries. Gird yourselves, but be broken in pieces; Gird yourselves, but be broken in pieces.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Asiri ôr krao bĕ, ơh sơ'ngon bĕ! Ơ đĭ-đăng lu dêh ataih, pơđêng đon iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ! Gơhret bĕ tơlei tơ̆n mă-lei hli dêh.

English: Take counsel together, but it will come to nothing; Speak the word, but it will not stand, For God is with us.”
Bahnar: Pơđâu chă đon bĕ tơduă iĕm, mă-lei ưh kơ yĕng jing, tơtĕch bĕ tơdrong iĕm chă đon mă-lei gô ưh kơ kĕ tơdơ̆ng kơjăp ôh, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai hăm lu nhôn.

English: For the LORD spoke thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang yua ti pran kơtang Sư pơma hăm inh păng bơtho tơbăt khan kơ inh 'nĕ rok kiơ̆ trong lu kon pơlei 'nâu.

English: “Do not say, ‘A conspiracy,’ Concerning all that this people call a conspiracy, Nor be afraid of their threats, nor be troubled.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “'Nĕ kơ pơma 'bơm wă blah, dôm lu tơdrong kon pơlei âu pơma 'bơm blah plơ̆. 'Nĕ kơ hli tơdrong lu sư hli păng 'nĕ kơ tơrơ ôh.

English: The LORD of hosts, Him you shall hallow; Let Him be your fear, And let Him be your dread.
Bahnar: Pôk pơư pơang bĕ Kră Yang Tih Hloh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, Kră Yang mă lu iĕm athei hli Sư bơih Kră Yang trŏ kơ iĕm hli yom.

English: He will be as a sanctuary, But a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense To both the houses of Israel, As a trap and a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sư gô jing anih kơ'nơp kơjăp Mă Sư kư̆m thoi tơmo pơm kơ đe kơtơih pơ̆k păng tơmo tih pơm kơ Isơrael păng Juđa huŏng păng thoi hơđong hơnhuăl đăk kơ kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem mơ̆n.

English: And many among them shall stumble; They shall fall and be broken, Be snared and taken.”
Bahnar: Đei lơ lăm lu sư gô kơtơih pơ̆k. Lu sư gô pơ̆k huŏng păng, pơchah pơchek, gô hrơ̆p hơnhuăl păng đe gô rôp.

English: Bind up the testimony, Seal the law among my disciples.
Bahnar: Chô̆ kơjăp bĕ nơ̆r tơbăt âu păng pơklep mă kơjăp tơdrong juăt lăm lu đĭch đam Inh.

English: And I will wait on the LORD, Who hides His face from the house of Jacob; And I will hope in Him.
Bahnar: Inh gô gơnang kơ Kră Yang păng chang gô Sư, jơ̆ Kră Yang mă ôn muh măt Sư đơ̆ng adrĕch Jakôp.

English: Here am I and the children whom the LORD has given me! We are for signs and wonders in Israel From the LORD of hosts, Who dwells in Mount Zion.
Bahnar: Âu, inh hăm lu kon mă Kră Yang Sư ăn bơih kơ inh noh tơdra wă pơsĭt lăm Isơrael đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Tơ'ngla oei kơpal kông Siôn.

English: And when they say to you, “Seek those who are mediums and wizards, who whisper and mutter,” should not a people seek their God? Should they seek the dead on behalf of the living?
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bu khan kơ iĕm Năm apinh jet bĕ lu pơjâu pơma hăm lu bơngai lôch, lu pơma bơlăm thoi sem păng pơma ưh kơ rơđah ôh khan bĕ kơ lu sư: Ưh kơ trŏ ôh hă kon pơlei năm apinh jet Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kơdih? Wă tơgŭm ăn kơ bơngai arih, liơ năm apinh jet bơngai lôch?

English: To the law and to the testimony! If they do not speak according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ khôi juăt păng nơ̆r tơbăt âu! Tơdah kon pơlei ưh kơ pơma thoi noh lei lu sư ưh kơ đei tơdrong hơdah ôh.

English: They will pass through it hard-pressed and hungry; and it shall happen, when they are hungry, that they will be enraged and curse their king and their God, and look upward.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô thông huang jơ̆p kơ lăm dêh char, pơmat-tat, đei pơngot rơwĕt, dah đei pơngot lu sư gô hil mĭl ngơk muh măt tơ kơpal hiap pơtao păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kơdih.

English: Then they will look to the earth, and see trouble and darkness, gloom of anguish; and they will be driven into darkness.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh kŭp kơ̆l lăng tơ teh 'bôh tơdrong pơmat-tat măng mu, 'bôh tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon tơhuŏng lê̆ lu sư kơdih tơ anih măng mu gueo.

Mă-lei ưh pă đei măng mu bơih kơ lu bơngai ơh sơ'ngon pơmat-tat, lăm chăl sơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơjur lê̆ bơih teh đak Neptali păng Sebulun; mă-lei lăm năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơnh Sư gô pơm ư-ang kơ tơring trong cheng đak dơsĭ, tơring pah to krong Jôrđăn, lăm dêh Galilê 'măn kơ lu bơngai tơmoi.

English: Nevertheless the gloom will not be upon her who is distressed, As when at first He lightly esteemed The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, And afterward more heavily oppressed her, By the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, In Galilee of the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei năm lăm măng mu 'bôh bơih tơdrong hơdah tih; păng tơdrong hơdah pơchrang bơih kơ lu bơngai oei lăm dêh măng mu gueo.

English: The people who walked in darkness Have seen a great light; Those who dwelt in the land of the shadow of death, Upon them a light has shined.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ kon pơlei âu chek lar rai lơ păng pơthim ăn kơ lu sư chơt hiôk. Rim 'nu chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, thoi đe chơt hiôk kơ bơyan yuă 'ba, thoi lu bơngai jreo hiôk klah song băl tơmam đơ̆ng blah tơgar iŏk.

English: You have multiplied the nation And increased its joy; They rejoice before You According to the joy of harvest, As men rejoice when they divide the spoil.
Bahnar: Thoi lăm chăl Midian, Ih gơ̆ lê̆ bơih 'long ăt đêl lu sư tôi trăp, kư̆m gơ̆ lê̆ 'long hơnong đơ̆ng hơngiĕng lu sư păng 'long jra đêl đe pơjuă pơđep lu sư.

English: For You have broken the yoke of his burden And the staff of his shoulder, The rod of his oppressor, As in the day of Midian.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng chơkhŏ đêl lu bơngai 'bot năm tơblah, hăm ao mam đêl pham klep gô soh rŭk tơ ŭnh pơđĭ.

English: For every warrior’s sandal from the noisy battle, And garments rolled in blood, Will be used for burning and fuel of fire.
Bahnar: Đei tơpŭ ăn kơ lu bơ̆n minh 'nu kon nge, ăn kơ bơ̆n minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, tơdrong pơgơ̆r tơ kơpal hơngiĕng Sư, đe gô krao Sư Kră Yang pơlung tơgŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Mơsêh Mơyang, 'Bă Arih Ling-Lang Kră Yang kon Pơtao Hiôk-Hian.

English: For unto us a Child is born, Unto us a Son is given; And the government will be upon His shoulder. And His name will be called Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Sư pơgơ̆r rai tŏk păng hiôk-hian đei hơnơ̆ng ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch, tơ anih tang-dŏ pơtao Đawit păng dêh char pơtao pơgơ̆r noh kơjăp pran, hăm tơdrong sek tơlang trŏ păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đơ̆ng dang ei truh tơ ning-mônh ưh kơ đei layơ tôch, jơhngơ̆m hưch hanh Kră Yang Tih Hloh sĭt gô pơm tơdrong noh!

English: Of the increase of His government and peace There will be no end, Upon the throne of David and over His kingdom, To order it and establish it with judgment and justice From that time forward, even forever. The zeal of the LORD of hosts will perform this.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang hơtă hil kơ Jakôp păng nơ̆r noh tuh ăn kơ Isơrael.

English: The Lord sent a word against Jacob, And it has fallen on Israel.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei gô băt tơdrong noh, lu đe Êphraim hăm lu kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Samari, lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m pơang, nuih pơma khan

English: All the people will know— Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria— Who say in pride and arrogance of heart
Bahnar: “Gŏch đêl man hơlih đĭ bơih mă-lei lu bơ̆n gô man ming hăm tơmo đe blah, 'long hơra đe kăl lê̆ bơih, mă-lei lu bơ̆n gô tơplih ming hăm 'long hơngo.”

English: “The bricks have fallen down, But we will rebuild with hewn stones; The sycamores are cut down, But we will replace them with cedars.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang gô hơtŏk lu ayăt đơ̆ng Rêsin iung blah lu sư păng gô pơdrŭt lu ayăt kơ lu sư.

English: Therefore the LORD shall set up The adversaries of Rezin against him, And spur his enemies on
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Siri, tơ anăp, kon pơlei Philistin gah rŏng ha 'bơ̆r gô luăn sa Isơrael, mă đơ̆ng lei ră, tơdrong Kră Yang hil ưh kơ ngach ôh păng ti Kră Yang oei yơ̆r tơ kơpal pơm kơ lu sư.

English: The Syrians before and the Philistines behind; And they shall devour Israel with an open mouth. For all this His anger is not turned away, But His hand is stretched out still.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei ưh kơ wih brŏk ôh tơ tơ'ngla mă teh pơjĭ lu sư, kư̆m ưh kơ chơchă Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: For the people do not turn to Him who strikes them, Nor do they seek the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lăp minh năr đĕch, Kră Yang gô chơ̆ng lê̆ đơ̆ng Isơrael chơ̆ng kơ̆l păng kiĕng đĭ-đăng 'long gao hăm 'nhĕt gơlăr.

English: Therefore the LORD will cut off head and tail from Israel, Palm branch and bulrush in one day.
Bahnar: Kơ̆l noh jơ̆ lu 'bok kơdră păng lu bơngai đe pơyom, kiĕng noh jơ̆ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol bơtho tơdrong hơlĕnh.

English: The elder and honorable, he is the head; The prophet who teaches lies, he is the tail.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r pơm kơ kon pơlei âu năm jrok trong bơih păng lu bơngai sư chông puh kơ sư hơlĕnh.

English: For the leaders of this people cause them to err, And those who are led by them are destroyed.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh Kră Yang ưh kơ lăp đon kơ lu tơdăm păng ưh pă mơnat ôh kơ lu bơngai adro po, kon mơti mơtuei lu sư, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ pơyom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơm kơnê̆, 'bơ̆r lu sư pơma kơnê̆ kơtul bơlŭk, mă khan thoi noh ră Kră Yang oei hil pơma kơ lu sư, ti Kră Yang oei yơ̆r tơ kơpal wă pơm kơ lu sư 'mơ̆i!

English: Therefore the Lord will have no joy in their young men, Nor have mercy on their fatherless and widows; For everyone is a hypocrite and an evildoer, And every mouth speaks folly. For all this His anger is not turned away, But His hand is stretched out still.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư khơ̆ng thoi ŭnh sa 'nhĕt jơla hăm jơ'bôt jơla 'nhui sư kơdŭk hyôi tŏk kơjung.

English: For wickedness burns as the fire; It shall devour the briers and thorns, And kindle in the thickets of the forest; They shall mount up like rising smoke.
Bahnar: Ŭnh sa teh lu sư, yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh hil, kon pơlei jing thoi tơmam ăn kơ ŭnh sa, ưh kơ đei bu 'mêm mơnat kơ 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih.

English: Through the wrath of the LORD of hosts The land is burned up, And the people shall be as fuel for the fire; No man shall spare his brother.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơgar iŏk sa gah 'ma mă-lei oei pơngot, lu sư iŏk sa gah 'ngiĕo mă-lei ưh kơ phĭ, đĭ-đăng lu sư sa kon sâu kơdih.

English: And he shall snatch on the right hand And be hungry; He shall devour on the left hand And not be satisfied; Every man shall eat the flesh of his own arm.
Bahnar: Manase blah Êphraim, Êphraim blah Manase păng 'bar pah măr sư tơblah hăm Juđa; Mă đơ̆ng thoi noh ră, Kră Yang oei mĭl hil kơ lu sư 'mơ̆i, ti Kră Yang oei yơ̆r tơ kơpal wă pơm kơ lu sư.

English: “Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees, Who write misfortune, Which they have prescribed
Bahnar: Răm-'băm tơpă kơ lu bơngai pơm khôi juăt glăi păng lu bơngai chih khôi juăt pơjuă pơđep

English: To rob the needy of justice, And to take what is right from the poor of My people, That widows may be their prey, And that they may rob the fatherless.
Bahnar: Hơngah kơ pơm tơdrong tơpăt lu bơngai hoh kơ đei păng ưh kơ pơm tơdrong trŏ kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin lăm kon pơlei pơla Inh. Tơgar iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng lu drŏ-kăn adro, hơđuh iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng lu kon mơti.

English: What will you do in the day of punishment, And in the desolation which will come from afar? To whom will you flee for help? And where will you leave your glory?
Bahnar: Lăm năr sek tơlang, Kơplah đei tơdrong kơnê̆ truh đơ̆ng ataih lu iĕm gô pơm kiơ? Lu iĕm kơdâu tơ bu mă lu iĕm wă gơnang dŏng tơgŭm? Lu iĕm wă 'măn mŭk tơmam iĕm tơ yơ?

English: Without Me they shall bow down among the prisoners, And they shall fall among the slain.” For all this His anger is not turned away, But His hand is stretched out still.
Bahnar: Ưh pă đei kiơ oei oei. Lăp kŭp kơ̆l drap lăm lu bơngai bơnă păng pơ̆k hơdai hăm lu bơngai lôch đĕch. Mă-lei ră, Kră Yang oei hil mĭl kơ lu sư 'mơ̆i, ti Kră Yang oei yơ̆r tơ kơpal wă pơm kơ lu sư.

English: “Woe to Assyria, the rod of My anger And the staff in whose hand is My indignation.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm tơpă kơ dêh char Asiri, sư thoi sơnguĕt tơdrong Inh hil mĭl, 'long jra mă lu sư chĕp 'bơ̆t ti noh tơdrong Inh hil mĭl.

English: I will send him against an ungodly nation, And against the people of My wrath I will give him charge, To seize the spoil, to take the prey, And to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
Bahnar: Inh wơh sư năm pơm kơ lu adrĕch adrung mă ưh kơ chu lui kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Inh athei sư blah kon pơlei mă tơblĕk Inh, wă plah tơgar iŏk tơmam, păng pơjuă lu sư thoi rơpŭk rok trong.

English: Yet he does not mean so, Nor does his heart think so; But it is in his heart to destroy, And cut off not a few nations.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ wă thoi noh. Lăm jơhngơ̆m sư ưh kơ tơchĕng thoi noh ôh sư wă 'maih pơrăm tơhiong lê̆ lơ dêh char.

English: For he says, ‘Are not my princes altogether kings?
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Lu kră pơgơ̆r lu bơ̆n ưh kơ trŏ pơtao ngăl hă?

English: Is not Calno like Carchemish? Is not Hamath like Arpad? Is not Samaria like Damascus?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ pơlei Kalnô kư̆m thoi pơlei Karchêmis, pơlei Hamat kư̆m thoi pơlei Arpat, pơlei Samari kư̆m thoi pơlei Đamas?

English: As my hand has found the kingdoms of the idols, Whose carved images excelled those of Jerusalem and Samaria
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi ti inh đei tơgar iŏk bơih dêh char pơtao đei lu rup yang. Rup yang lu sư hloh kơ rup yang lăm pơlei Jêrusalem păng pơlei Samari.

English: As I have done to Samaria and her idols, Shall I not do also to Jerusalem and her idols?’ ”
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ wă pơrăm rup yang pơlei Jêrusalem hă? Thoi inh đei pơm bơih kơ pơlei Samari hăm rup yang sư?”

English: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Lord has performed all His work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, that He will say, “I will punish the fruit of the arrogant heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his haughty looks.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei mưh Kră Yang pơkeh tơdrong jang Sư kơ kông Siôn păng pơlei Jêrusalem, Sư gô phak pơtao Asiri, yua kơ jơhngơ̆m sư pơang păng măt sư lăng pơrŏ.

English: For he says: “By the strength of my hand I have done it, And by my wisdom, for I am prudent; Also I have removed the boundaries of the people, And have robbed their treasuries; So I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư khan: “Inh đei pơm bơih tơdrong 'nâu đơ̆ng ti pran kơtang inh. Đơ̆ng tơdrong inh gơh hơgei hlôh wao. Inh đei rĭ tơplih bơih hơdral teh đak lu kon pơlei; Blah iŏk lu tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng anih lu sư mong. Thoi bơngai nuih kơtang, inh đei tơhuŏng bơih lu pơtao đơ̆ng tang-dŏ lu sư.

English: My hand has found like a nest the riches of the people, And as one gathers eggs that are left, I have gathered all the earth; And there was no one who moved his wing, Nor opened his mouth with even a peep.”
Bahnar: Ti inh đei iŏk bơih mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng kon pơlei thoi iŏk tơpu sem. Thoi đe dônh kơtăp iĕr đơ̆ng yŏng sư lê̆. Inh dônh pơpôi bơih đĭ teh đak. Ưh kơ đei bu tơtuh pơnăr păr, dah ha 'bơ̆r krao ôr.”

English: Shall the ax boast itself against him who chops with it? Or shall the saw exalt itself against him who saws with it? As if a rod could wield itself against those who lift it up, Or as if a staff could lift up, as if it were not wood!
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ sung tưk sư kơdih hloh kơ tơ'ngla chĕp sư? Dah hơnuă pơrŏ ot plơ̆ kơ bơngai chĕp sư? Dah thoi sơnguĕt hiŏng bơngai chĕp sư? Dah thoi 'long jra tưk ti bơngai chĕp Sư.

English: Therefore the Lord, the Lord of hosts, Will send leanness among his fat ones; And under his glory He will kindle a burning Like the burning of a fire.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh, gô tơjur ăn tơdrong jĭ iôr hiang kơ lu linh pran kơtang sư. Đơ̆ng tơdrong pơang sư, ŭnh gô sa nhen thoi pla ŭnh sa.

English: So the Light of Israel will be for a fire, And his Holy One for a flame; It will burn and devour His thorns and his briers in one day.
Bahnar: Tơdrong hơdah bơngai Isơrael gô jing ŭnh, Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh sư gô thoi pla ŭnh; Sư gô sa pơgoh lu jơla hăm jơ'bôt 'long jơla lăm minh năr.

English: And it will consume the glory of his forest and of his fruitful field, Both soul and body; And they will be as when a sick man wastes away.
Bahnar: Ŭnh gô sa đĭ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ 'long kơdrơ̆ng lăm bri păng chŭn mir teh mơ̆r bơhngol hăm akâu jăn hloi. Thoi bơngai jĭ wă lôch.

English: Then the rest of the trees of his forest Will be so few in number That a child may write them.
Bahnar: Lu 'long oei lăm bri kơdrơ̆ng pă tŏ sĕt, dĭng mah minh 'nu hơ'lơ̆p kĕ chih jô̆.

English: And it shall come to pass in that day That the remnant of Israel, And such as have escaped of the house of Jacob, Will never again depend on him who defeated them, But will depend on the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, dôm lu bơngai Isơrael mă oei oei. Dôm lu bơngai lăm adrĕch Jakôp oei klaih, gô ưh pă gơnang kơ bơngai mă pơrăm lu sư. Mă-lei gô gơnang sĭt kơ Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: The remnant will return, the remnant of Jacob, To the Mighty God.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai mă oei arih gô wih brŏk. Dôm lu bơngai adrĕch Jakôp noh gô wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Mơsêh Mơyang.

English: For though your people, O Israel, be as the sand of the sea, A remnant of them will return; The destruction decreed shall overflow with righteousness.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael, mă khan adrĕch adrung iĕm lơ thoi chuơh cheng đak dơsĭ, lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch gô wih brŏk. Đei pơkă bơih wă pơrăm hăm tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng.

English: For the Lord GOD of hosts Will make a determined end In the midst of all the land.
Bahnar: Yua kơ, Kră Yang Tih Hloh đei pơkă gô pơm tơdrong pơrăm jơ̆p kơpal teh lu Sư.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD of hosts: “O My people, who dwell in Zion, do not be afraid of the Assyrian. He shall strike you with a rod and lift up his staff against you, in the manner of Egypt.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Ơ kon pơlei pơla Inh oei lăm Siôn, 'nĕ kơ hli kơ lu bơngai Asiri, mă khan lu sư iŏk sơnguĕt teh iĕm păng yơ̆r 'long jra wă pơjuă pơđep kơ lu iĕm thoi bơngai Êyiptơ pơm sơ̆.

English: For yet a very little while and the indignation will cease, as will My anger in their destruction.”
Bahnar: Ưh pă đunh bơih tơdrong Inh hil kơ iĕm gô đĭ na. Tơdrong Inh mĭl gô plơ̆ tơwih pơrăm lu sư.”

English: And the LORD of hosts will stir up a scourge for him like the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb; as His rod was on the sea, so will He lift it up in the manner of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô chĕp sơnguĕt teh lu sư. Thoi Sư đei pơm kơ kon pơlei Midian 'bơ̆t tơmo Ôrep; păng Sư kư̆m yơ̆r 'long jra tơ kơpal đak dơsĭ, thoi Sư đei pơm tơ Êyiptơ sơ̆.

English: It shall come to pass in that day That his burden will be taken away from your shoulder, And his yoke from your neck, And the yoke will be destroyed because of the anointing oil.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh tơdrong iĕm pŭ trăp gô plôh đơ̆ng hơngiĕng iĕm. 'Long ăt gô yaih lê̆ đơ̆ng hơko iĕm. 'Long ăt gô tơgơ̆. Yua kơ iĕm tih bek prah bơih.

English: He has come to Aiath, He has passed Migron; At Michmash he has attended to his equipment.
Bahnar: Sư blah truh tơ pơlei Ayat. Sư rok pơlei Migrôn. Sư mong 'măn lê̆ tơmam sư lăm pơlei Mikmas.

English: They have gone along the ridge, They have taken up lodging at Geba. Ramah is afraid, Gibeah of Saul has fled.
Bahnar: Lu sư rok trong kuĕt kuĕl sơlam kông, lu sư 'bĭch 'bơ̆t pơlei Gêba; kon pơlei Rama hli tơrơ, kon pơlei Gibêah kơdâu ôn đĭ noh pơlei Sôl sơ̆.

English: Lift up your voice, O daughter of Gallim! Cause it to be heard as far as Laish— O poor Anathoth!
Bahnar: Ôr mă re bĕ, Ơ kon pơlei Galim! Mơ̆ng bĕ ơ pơlei Laisa păng mơnat dêh kơ kon pơlei Anathôt!

English: Madmenah has fled, The inhabitants of Gebim seek refuge.
Bahnar: Kon Pơlei Matmêna kơdâu ôn. Lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei Gêbim kơdâu chă anih ôn kơ'nơp.

English: As yet he will remain at Nob that day; He will shake his fist at the mount of the daughter of Zion, The hill of Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu bơih lu sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t pơlei Nôp, Sư hiŏng ti Sư blah hăm lu kon pơlei Siôn, tơ kông groi pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Behold, the Lord, The LORD of hosts, Will lop off the bough with terror; Those of high stature will be hewn down, And the haughty will be humbled.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Kră Yang Tih Hloh, gô yua tơdrong mơsêh pran kơtang krưp Sư chre dơng 'long. Lu tơm 'long tih kơjung gô kăl tơpăk đĭ; 'long kơjung gô păk tơ ala teh.

English: He will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, And Lebanon will fall by the Mighty One.
Bahnar: Sư gô kăl lu 'long rơ̆m rĕk lăm bri kơdrơ̆ng hăm sung. Char Liban hăm lu 'long tih kơjung gô păk 'bơ̆t anăp Tơ'ngla Mơsêh Mơyang.

English: There shall come forth a Rod from the stem of Jesse, And a Branch shall grow out of his roots.
Bahnar: Đei minh pôm tơ'biĕng gô chăt đơ̆ng tơm Jese, đei minh pôm dơng chăt đơ̆ng rơh sư gô đei plei.

English: The Spirit of the LORD shall rest upon Him, The Spirit of wisdom and understanding, The Spirit of counsel and might, The Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang gô oei kơpal Sư, Yang Bơhngol ăn kơ sư đei đon gơh hơgei păng mơsêh mơyang, Yang Bơhngol ăn kơ sư hlôh băt păng hli yom kơ Kră Yang.

English: His delight is in the fear of the LORD, And He shall not judge by the sight of His eyes, Nor decide by the hearing of His ears
Bahnar: Sư hiôk chơt lăm tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang, Sư ưh kơ sek tơlang kiơ̆ kơ măt 'bôh, kư̆m ưh kơ sek kiơ̆ đon Sư kơtơ̆ng.

English: But with righteousness He shall judge the poor, And decide with equity for the meek of the earth; He shall strike the earth with the rod of His mouth, And with the breath of His lips He shall slay the wicked.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sư gô sek tơlang tơpăt kơ lu bơngai dơnuh, păng sek ăn kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat kơpal teh âu. Sư gô teh teh đak hăm 'long jra đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư pơma păng hơyuh kial đơ̆ng hơkŭng Sư na pơlôch lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Righteousness shall be the belt of His loins, And faithfulness the belt of His waist.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt noh thoi tơlei tơ̆n Sư, tơdrong tơnăp sĭt noh thoi tơlei tơ̆n tơ kơiĕng Sư.

English: “The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, The leopard shall lie down with the young goat, The calf and the young lion and the fatling together; And a little child shall lead them.
Bahnar: Na lu kŏ-so gô oei hơdai hăm kon triu, djrang 'bĭch hơdai hăm kon bơbe, kon rơmo, dăm-brang sem dơrong bek 'lơ̆ng kư̆m ngôi hơdai, minh 'nu 'lơ̆p gô dui wei lu sư.

English: The cow and the bear shall graze; Their young ones shall lie down together; And the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
Bahnar: Rơmo akăn gô sa hơdai hăm chơgơu, kon lu sư gô drum hơdai, dăm-brang gô sa hơnong 'ba thoi rơmo.

English: The nursing child shall play by the cobra’s hole, And the weaned child shall put his hand in the viper’s den.
Bahnar: Lu hơ'lơ̆p oei mŏm gô pơm ngôi 'bơ̆t anih 'bih dong oei, lu hơ'lơ̆p ưh pă mŏm bơih gô 'bot ngôi trôm 'bih mă choh lôch.

English: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all My holy mountain, For the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the LORD As the waters cover the sea.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơm kơnê̆ păng pơrăm băl ôh, jơ̆p kơ anih lăm kông 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, yua kơ jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak 'bĕnh blai tơdrong hlôh băt kơ Kră Yang bơih, thoi đak ro 'bĕnh dơsĭ.

English: “And in that day there shall be a Root of Jesse, Who shall stand as a banner to the people; For the Gentiles shall seek Him, And His resting place shall be glorious.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh, rơh Jese iung pơm thoi hla-kơ ăn kơ rim adrĕch adrung kon bơngai. Rim teh đak gô năm chă Sư, anih Sư pơdơh gô đei rang mơnhal.

English: It shall come to pass in that day That the Lord shall set His hand again the second time To recover the remnant of His people who are left, From Assyria and Egypt, From Pathros and Cush, From Elam and Shinar, From Hamath and the islands of the sea.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh, Kră Yang gô yơ̆r ti Sư pă minh 'măng dơ̆ng wă huai iŏk kon pơlei Sư mă oei đei đơ̆ng lăm teh đak Asiri, Êyiptơ, Patrôs, Êthiôpi, Êlam, Sinar, Hamat păng đơ̆ng lu bŏl đak dơsĭ.

English: He will set up a banner for the nations, And will assemble the outcasts of Israel, And gather together the dispersed of Judah From the four corners of the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơdơ̆ng hla-kơ ăn kơ rim teh đak akŭm iŏk lu bơngai Isơrael mă đêl đe puh tơweh; pơpôi iŏk lu bơngai Juđa đêl lu sư tơklah tơklang đơ̆ng puăn pah mum teh đak.

English: Also the envy of Ephraim shall depart, And the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, And Judah shall not harass Ephraim.
Bahnar: Êphraim ưh pă hil klai dơ̆ng bơih, lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ Juđa đe gô tơhiong đĭ, Êphraim ưh pă areh kơ Juđa dơ̆ng, Juđa ưh pă pơm kơnê̆ kơ Êphraim dơ̆ng bơih.

English: But they shall fly down upon the shoulder of the Philistines toward the west; Together they shall plunder the people of the East; They shall lay their hand on Edom and Moab; And the people of Ammon shall obey them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư gô jur năm pơm kơ Philistin tơ gah bơmơ̆t, lu sư wang plah tơgar iŏk pơlei teh đak gah hơlĕch, lu sư yơ̆r ti pơm kơ Eđôm păng Môap, Ammôn gô chu kơ lu sư.

English: The LORD will utterly destroy the tongue of the Sea of Egypt; With His mighty wind He will shake His fist over the River, And strike it in the seven streams, And make men cross over dry-shod.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm kơ đak dơsĭ Êyiptơ hrơ̆ đĭ; Kră Yang yơ̆r ti sư kơpal đak krong Ơphrat hăm kial tŏ, Sư blah song krong noh jing tơpơh chơnglah, wă kơ đe yak năm lăm krong noh jơ̆ng ưh kơ hơiuh ôh.

English: There will be a highway for the remnant of His people Who will be left from Assyria, As it was for Israel In the day that he came up from the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Gô đei minh pôm trong tih ăn kơ kon pơlei Kră Yang mă oei đei đơ̆ng dêh Asiri yak năm, kư̆m thoi đei bơih trong tih ăn kơ lu đe Isơrael yak năm, năr mă lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ noh.

English: And in that day you will say: “O LORD, I will praise You; Though You were angry with me, Your anger is turned away, and You comfort me.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh ih gô khan: “Ơ Kră Yang inh bơnê kơ Ih. Mă khan Ih hil mĭl kơ inh ră, mă-lei tơdrong Ih hil mĭl ưh pă đei bơih păng Ih pơlung inh bơih.

English: Behold, God is my salvation, I will trust and not be afraid; ‘For YAH, the LORD, is my strength and song; He also has become my salvation.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng pơklaih inh, Inh gô gơnang kơ Ih păng ưh kơ hli tơrơ ôh. Kră Yang boih tơdrong inh hơri bơnê, Sư bơih dŏng pơklaih inh.”

English: Therefore with joy you will draw water From the wells of salvation.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk năm chhŏ iŏk đak đơ̆ng tu tơdrong dŏng pơklaih.

English: And in that day you will say: “Praise the LORD, call upon His name; Declare His deeds among the peoples, Make mention that His name is exalted.
Bahnar: Păng lăm năr noh kơnh lu iĕm gô khan: “Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang; krao khan bĕ kơ Anăn Sư, năm ră roi bĕ dôm tơdrong jang Sư kơ rim adrĕch adrung bơngai, roi bĕ Anăn Kră Yang Sư bơih mă bơ̆n athei ư-ang.

English: Sing to the LORD, For He has done excellent things; This is known in all the earth.
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư đei pơm bơih dôm tơdrong jang gĭt kăl ư-ang, na roi pơdah bĕ kơ jơ̆p lăm teh đak băt.

English: Cry out and shout, O inhabitant of Zion, For great is the Holy One of Israel in your midst!”
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Siôn ôr hơri mă re bĕ! Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael jơ̆ tih hloh tŏk-bŏk lăm lu iĕm.”

English: The burden against Babylon which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol gah dêh char Babilôn mă Êsai kon Amôt 'bôh.

English: “Lift up a banner on the high mountain, Raise your voice to them; Wave your hand, that they may enter the gates of the nobles.
Bahnar: Pơdơ̆ng bĕ hla-kơ tơ kơpal wĕch kông mơ-mlưch! Ôr krao lu sư bĕ, kơkuơch lu sư bĕ, ba lu sư năm mơ̆t tơ 'măng jang lu bơngai yŏng mơng!

English: I have commanded My sanctified ones; I have also called My mighty ones for My anger— Those who rejoice in My exaltation.”
Bahnar: Inh tơtă ăn bơih kơ lu bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh; Inh krao bơih lu bơngai nuih kơtang Inh wă pơm pơtruh tơdrong Inh hil mĭl, lu Sư chhôk hal pơm tơdrong Inh wă.

English: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, Like that of many people! A tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together! The LORD of hosts musters The army for battle.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ, đei nơ̆r ơ-ôs ơ-as tơ kơpal lu kông noh, thoi đei nơ̆r kon pơlei lơlap! Mơ̆ng bĕ, đei ôr krao re đơ̆ng lu dêh char, thoi lu dêh char akŭm băl! Kră Yang Tih Hloh akŭm lu linh Sư wă năm tơblah.

English: They come from a far country, From the end of heaven— The LORD and His weapons of indignation, To destroy the whole land.
Bahnar: Lu sư truh đơ̆ng dêh char ataih, đơ̆ng tôch kơ plĕnh teh. Kră Yang păng lu tơmam tơblah, Sư yua lăm tơdrong Sư hil mĭl wă pơrăm đĭ teh âu.

English: Wail, for the day of the LORD is at hand! It will come as destruction from the Almighty.
Bahnar: Nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ lu iĕm! Yua kơ năr Kră Yang truh jê̆ bơih, tơdrong noh gô truh, thoi tơdrong pơrăm tih đơ̆ng Tơ'ngla Mơsêh Mơyang.

English: Therefore all hands will be limp, Every man’s heart will melt
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh bơih na jơ̆ng ti đĭ rơdu, jơhngơ̆m rim 'nu kon bơngai đĭ hơwơ̆l hơwang.

English: And they will be afraid. Pangs and sorrows will take hold of them; They will be in pain as a woman in childbirth; They will be amazed at one another; Their faces will be like flames.
Bahnar: Lu sư hli tơrơ, đei tơdrong hang nuih ơh sơ'ngon gô truh tơ lu sư, lu sư đei tơdrong jĭ truh tơ lu sư thoi drŏ-kăn jĭ anăp wă tơpŭ, lu sư hli tơrơ na lu sư pơglăn băl tơduă lu sư muh măt lu sư nhen thoi pla ŭnh.

English: Behold, the day of the LORD comes, Cruel, with both wrath and fierce anger, To lay the land desolate; And He will destroy its sinners from it.
Bahnar: 'Nâu năr Kră Yang truh bơih, năr kơnê̆ krưp đei tơdrong hil mĭl kơtang, wă pơrăm teh âu jing juơ păng pơlôch lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm noh.

English: For the stars of heaven and their constellations Will not give their light; The sun will be darkened in its going forth, And the moon will not cause its light to shine.
Bahnar: Lu sơnglŏng păng khŭl sơnglŏng rang tơ kơpal plĕnh ti ưh pă pơchrang hơdah dơ̆ng bơih. Măt 'năr lĕch ră mă kư̆m oei măng mu, măt khei kư̆m ưh pă pơchrang hơdah dơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: “I will punish the world for its evil, And the wicked for their iniquity; I will halt the arrogance of the proud, And will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.
Bahnar: Inh gô phak teh đak âu yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư, phak lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư, Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ lu bơngai pơang, tơjur lê̆ tơ ala tơdrong pơang kơdih akâu lu bơngai pơm chư̆ kơnê̆.

English: I will make a mortal more rare than fine gold, A man more than the golden wedge of Ophir.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ kon bơngai khăi hloh kơ maih se; Inh gô pơm kơ kon bơngai khăi 'băi hloh kơ maih rơgoh đơ̆ng dêh Ôphir.

English: Therefore I will shake the heavens, And the earth will move out of her place, In the wrath of the LORD of hosts And in the day of His fierce anger.
Bahnar: Na Inh gô pơm kơ plĕnh pơpơ̆ teh tơdrŏ đơ̆ng anih sư, yua kơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh hil mĭl lăm năr Sư hil iung tơtŏ thoi ŭnh.

English: It shall be as the hunted gazelle, And as a sheep that no man takes up; Every man will turn to his own people, And everyone will flee to his own land.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh rim 'nu nhen thoi kơtŏng đe druh prah, thoi khŭl triu ưh kơ đei bơngai wei, lu sư gô brŏk tơ kon pơlei sư kơdih, gô kơdâu klĕnh brŏk tơ dêh sư kơdih.

English: Everyone who is found will be thrust through, And everyone who is captured will fall by the sword.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đe tơ'bơ̆p đe gô rôp 'bet sư, Bơngai bu đe đei rôp gô pơlôch hăm đao.

English: Their children also will be dashed to pieces before their eyes; Their houses will be plundered And their wives ravished.
Bahnar: Lu kon hơ'lơ̆p sư đe gô rôp teh pơhĕch 'bơ̆t tơm măt lu sư, hnam lu sư đe tơgar iŏk, akăn lu sư đe tơrôp pơgô̆.

English: “Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, Who will not regard silver; And as for gold, they will not delight in it.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtrŭt bơngai Mêdơ pơm kơ lu sư, lu bơngai noh sư ưh kơ gĭt kơ hu kư̆m ưh kơ wă kơ maih ôh.

English: Also their bows will dash the young men to pieces, And they will have no pity on the fruit of the womb; Their eye will not spare children.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơlôch lu adruh tơdăm hăm hră; ưh kơ mơnat ôh kơ lu nge oei lăm klak, măt lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ 'blŏk mơnat kơ lu đe hơ'lơ̆p.

English: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, The beauty of the Chaldeans’ pride, Will be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
Bahnar: Babilôn jơ̆ pơlei đe ư-ang rim kơ teh đak, pơlei mă lu bơngai Kalđê ang pơyom kơ sư, Sư jing thoi pơlei Siđôm păng pơlei Gômôrơ, sư gô mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơrăm lê̆.

English: It will never be inhabited, Nor will it be settled from generation to generation; Nor will the Arabian pitch tents there, Nor will the shepherds make their sheepfolds there.
Bahnar: Pơlei noh ưh kơ đei bơngai bu oei dơ̆ng, đơ̆ng chăl nai truh tơ chăl ninh. Lu bơngai Arâp ưh pă pơdơ̆ng hnam khăn 'bĭch tơ noh, lu bơngai wei triu kư̆m ưh pă chĭt triu lu sư tơ noh dơ̆ng.

English: But wild beasts of the desert will lie there, And their houses will be full of owls; Ostriches will dwell there, And wild goats will caper there.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sem bri gô truh 'bĭch tơ noh păng hnam lăm pơlei noh 'bĕnh-'bang kơ sem bơrơ̆m grơ̆-ă gô oei lăm noh, anih bơbe bri pơplŏng hal tơ noh.

English: The hyenas will howl in their citadels, And jackals in their pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come, And her days will not be prolonged.”
