Bahnar: Kŏ-so gô kuăl lăm pơlei kơjăp, kŏ bri gô kơlu lăm anih pơtao 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Khei sơnăm sư truh jê̆ bơih, măng năr sư ưh pă đunh dơ̆ng bơih.

English: For the LORD will have mercy on Jacob, and will still choose Israel, and settle them in their own land. The strangers will be joined with them, and they will cling to the house of Jacob.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô mơnat kơ Jakôp, păng oei wă rơih iŏk đe Isơrael minh wơ̆t dơ̆ng, Kră Yang gô krao tơbrŏk lu sư dơ̆ng, oei lăm teh đak lu sư kơdih, lu bơngai tơmoi teh đak nai gô oei hơdai lu sư păng pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm adrĕch Jakôp.

English: Then people will take them and bring them to their place, and the house of Israel will possess them for servants and maids in the land of the LORD; they will take them captive whose captives they were, and rule over their oppressors.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei teh đak tơmoi gô năm ba lu đe Isơrael brŏk tơ dêh lu sư kơdih; adrĕch Isơrael gô iŏk lu sư, pơm đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn lăm teh đak Kră Yang. Lu sư gô rôp lu bơngai đêl rôp lu sư pơm bơnă, păng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai mă đêl pơgŏ pơđep lu sư.

English: It shall come to pass in the day the LORD gives you rest from your sorrow, and from your fear and the hard bondage in which you were made to serve
Bahnar: Truh năr Kră Yang ăn kơ iĕm pơdơh pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon hli tơrơ păng đơ̆ng tơdrong jang gleh trăp mă đêl đe rôp pơgŏ iĕm

English: that you will take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say: “How the oppressor has ceased, The golden city ceased!
Bahnar: Na iĕm gô yua nơ̆r pơma 'nâu wă pơjăm pơtao Babilôn: Lơliơ mă lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep hiong đĭ, bơngai mă hil areh pă 'bôh dơ̆ng bơih.

English: The LORD has broken the staff of the wicked, The scepter of the rulers
Bahnar: Kră Yang gơ̆ lê̆ bơih 'long băl lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, păng gơ̆ lê̆ 'long jra lu pơtao pơgơ̆r.

English: He who struck the people in wrath with a continual stroke, He who ruled the nations in anger, Is persecuted and no one hinders.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă oei lăm tơdrong hil mĭl teh pơlôch bơih kon pơlei ưh kơ pơdơh ôh. Lăm tơdrong hil mĭl pơgơ̆r bơih teh đak, pơm kơnê̆ ling-lang.

English: The whole earth is at rest and quiet; They break forth into singing.
Bahnar: Jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak oei pơdơh hiôk-hian, lu sư hơri chơt hiôk.

English: Indeed the cypress trees rejoice over you, And the cedars of Lebanon, Saying, ‘Since you were cut down, No woodsman has come up against us.’
Bahnar: 'Long hơngo hla iĕ, 'long hơngo lăm dêh Liban kư̆m hiôk yua păng khan: “Đơ̆ng năr kăl ih păk noh, ưh kơ đei bu năm kăl nhôn dơ̆ng.”

English: “Hell from beneath is excited about you, To meet you at your coming; It stirs up the dead for you, All the chief ones of the earth; It has raised up from their thrones All the kings of the nations.
Bahnar: Tơ dêh atâu sŭng tơdrŏ wă tơ'bơ̆p ih kơplah ih truh tơ noh, lu bơhngol bơngai lôch băl noh jơ̆ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak lu sư hơđơ̆r wă tơ'bơ̆p ih, lu pơtao rim kơ teh đak iung đơ̆ng tang-dŏ pơtao sư.

English: They all shall speak and say to you: ‘Have you also become as weak as we? Have you become like us?
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư gô khan kơ ih: “Ih dai rơdu thoi lu nhôn mơ̆n; ih dai lei-lăi thoi lu nhôn mơ̆n.

English: Your pomp is brought down to Sheol, And the sound of your stringed instruments; The maggot is spread under you, And worms cover you.’
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơrŏ ih păng re brŏ ih reh gô jur tơ dêh atâu, hrai gô pơm hơdŭ ih lơ̆k 'bĭch, gô pơm khăn ih su!

English: “How you are fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! How you are cut down to the ground, You who weakened the nations!
Bahnar: Ơ sơnglŏng wŏng-tar, kon drŏ-nglo pơgê hrôih, lơliơ mă ih đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti huŏng tơ ala teh âu! Ơ lu bơngai chă pơrăm lu teh đak, liơ mă đe tơhuŏng lê̆ ih tơ ala teh âu!

English: For you have said in your heart: ‘I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will also sit on the mount of the congregation On the farthest sides of the north
Bahnar: Mă ih tơchĕng lăm to khan: “Inh gô tŏk tơ kơpal plĕnh, inh gô hơtŏk tang-dŏ pơtao inh tơ kơpal hloh kơ lu hơnglŏng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, inh gô tŏk hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao tơ kơpal kông anih lu yang akŭm, tôch tơ gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds, I will be like the Most High.’
Bahnar: Inh gô tŏk tơ kơpal lu hơmơ̆l, inh gô pơm kơ inh thoi Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, To the lowest depths of the Pit.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đe gô tơjur ih tơ Dêh atâu sŭng, huŏng tơ anih tôch kơ jrŭ.

English: “Those who see you will gaze at you, And consider you, saying: ‘Is this the man who made the earth tremble, Who shook kingdoms
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'bôh ih gô lăng pơglăn tơ ih ưh kơ tơtĕp măt, lăng tơdrong truh kơ ih hlĭch na khan: “Hăm trŏ kơ bơngai âu pơm kơ teh tơdrŏ, pơm kơ lu dêh char hli tơtơ̆?

English: Who made the world as a wilderness And destroyed its cities, Who did not open the house of his prisoners?’
Bahnar: Pơm kơ lu dêh char jing teh glă, pơrăm lê̆ lu plei tih, păng ưh kơ tơlĕch lu bơngai pơm bơnă brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih?”

English: “All the kings of the nations, All of them, sleep in glory, Everyone in his own house
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng pơtao rim teh đak. 'Bĭch lăm bơsat ư-ang lu sư.

English: But you are cast out of your grave Like an abominable branch, Like the garment of those who are slain, Thrust through with a sword, Who go down to the stones of the pit, Like a corpse trodden underfoot.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đe klơ̆m lê̆ ih tơ 'nguaih kơ bơsat ih, thoi dơng 'long bŭk đơ̆ng đe chre tŭk lê̆ đơ̆ng tơm, akâu ih klơ̆p 'bĕnh kơ bơngai lôch, đe 'bet hăm đao gưm đe tơlơ̆ lăm sơlŭng tơmo jrŭ, thoi akâu bơngai lôch đe juă gơhlơ̆r tơ ala jơ̆ng!

English: You will not be joined with them in burial, Because you have destroyed your land And slain your people. The brood of evildoers shall never be named.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ gơh 'bŭ hơdai lăm bơsat hăm lu pơtao, yua kơ ih pơrăm teh đak ih păng pơlôch kon pơlei ih, adrĕch adrung ih bơngai kơnê̆ đe gô ưh pă đei tơ'blŏk dơ̆ng

English: Prepare slaughter for his children Because of the iniquity of their fathers, Lest they rise up and possess the land, And fill the face of the world with cities.”
Bahnar: Hơmet bĕ tơdrong pơlôch kon sâu lu sư yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu yă 'bok lu sư, 'Nĕ ăn kơ lu sư iung iŏk teh đak, pơjing plei tih kơjăp jơ̆p kơ teh đak dơ̆ng!

English: “For I will rise up against them,” says the LORD of hosts, “And cut off from Babylon the name and remnant, And offspring and posterity,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô iung pơm tơwih kơ lu sư, Inh gô pơrăm sŭt lê̆ anăn pơlei Babilôn păng lu kon pơlei oei oei đei lăm noh, hăm đĭ lu kon sâu lu sư dơ̆ng mơ̆n.” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I will also make it a possession for the porcupine, And marshes of muddy water; I will sweep it with the broom of destruction,” says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: “Inh gô pơm kơ teh đak lu sư jing anih lu jơma oei, jing đak dơnâu 'nhĕt, Inh gô pơlôch pơrăm păng hơpuih pơgoh lê̆ sư.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: The LORD of hosts has sworn, saying, “Surely, as I have thought, so it shall come to pass, And as I have purposed, so it shall stand
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơma pơkăm khan: “Tơpă tơdrong Inh pơkă lê̆ bơih sĭt sư gô đei truh, tơdrong Inh tơchĕng lê̆ bơih sư gô jing.

English: That I will break the Assyrian in My land, And on My mountains tread him underfoot. Then his yoke shall be removed from them, And his burden removed from their shoulders.
Bahnar: Inh gô blah pơrăm bơngai Asiri lăm teh đak Inh, gô pơjuă bơhlơ̆r sư tơ kơpal kông Inh, 'long ăt sư gô plôh gơ̆ lê̆ đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei Inh, hơnong trăp sư gô hơ'nglơh lê̆ đơ̆ng hơngiĕng lu sư.”

English: This is the purpose that is purposed against the whole earth, And this is the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.
Bahnar: Noh bơih tơdrong Inh tơchĕng rĕng lê̆ bơih wă pơm kơ jơ̆p-jang teh đak, 'nâu ti Inh yơ̆r kơpal wă pơm kơ teh đak.

English: For the LORD of hosts has purposed, And who will annul it? His hand is stretched out, And who will turn it back?”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơkă bơih na bu gơh sŭt lê̆? Ti Kră Yang yơ̆r bơih na bu gơh gơ̆t lê̆?

English: This is the burden which came in the year that King Ahaz died.
Bahnar: Sơnăm pơtao Ahas lôch đei nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol thoi âu

English: “Do not rejoice, all you of Philistia, Because the rod that struck you is broken; For out of the serpent’s roots will come forth a viper, And its offspring will be a fiery flying serpent.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Philistin, iĕm 'nĕ kơ chhôk 'nă ôh yua kơ sơnguĕt teh iĕm tơgơ̆ bơih, Đơ̆ng tơm rơh adrĕch 'bih gô jing đei 'bih hơkăm, plei đơ̆ng 'bih hơkăm gô jing 'bih ŭnh gơh păr.

English: The firstborn of the poor will feed, And the needy will lie down in safety; I will kill your roots with famine, And it will slay your remnant.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'nei kơnh lu bơngai dơnuh gô đei tơmam sa, bơngai kơ'bah hoh kơđei gô phĭ hiôk, mă-lei Inh gô pơm kơ yă 'bok tơm rơh adrĕch adrung ih lôch kơ pơngot, păng lu bơngai oei arih Inh gô pơlôch.

English: Wail, O gate! Cry, O city! All you of Philistia are dissolved; For smoke will come from the north, And no one will be alone in his appointed times.”
Bahnar: Ơ 'măng jang nhơ̆m ơh bĕ, ơ pơlei tih ôr tơngưih bĕ, ơ pơlei Philistin đĭ-đăng iĕm gô pơchah răm, yua kơ đei 'nhui ŭnh tih đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m truh, ưh kơ đei bu gơh weh đơ̆ng anih lu khŭl linh sư.

English: What will they answer the messengers of the nation? That the LORD has founded Zion, And the poor of His people shall take refuge in it.
Bahnar: Wă tơl tơwih liơ kơ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r đơ̆ng minh pôm teh đak? Tơl tơwih khan: “Kră Yang pơjing kơjăp bơih Siôn păng lu kon pơlei Sư mă ơh sơ'ngon pơmat-tat gô kơ'nơp lăm noh.”

English: The burden against Moab. Because in the night Ar of Moab is laid waste And destroyed, Because in the night Kir of Moab is laid waste And destroyed
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol gah Môap, ô, pơlei tih Ar lăm char Môap pơchah răm lăm minh măng. Lăm minh măng pơlei Kir lăm char Môap pơchah pơchek đĭ!

English: He has gone up to the temple and Dibon, To the high places to weep. Moab will wail over Nebo and over Medeba; On all their heads will be baldness, And every beard cut off.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Dibôn tŏk tơ groi; lu sư năm tŏk tơ anih kơjung kơkuh kơ yang wă hmoi; kon pơlei Môap nhơ̆m hmoi ơh yua kơ kông Nêbô păng pơlei Mêdêba, lu sư yuă sŏk 'ngôch ngăl, sŏk kang lu sư hơkôih đĭ.

English: In their streets they will clothe themselves with sackcloth; On the tops of their houses And in their streets Everyone will wail, weeping bitterly.
Bahnar: Lu sư su 'bi sơ'ngon jơ̆p kơ trong tih lăm pơlei, lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam păng tơ anih hơdrŭm, lu sư hmoi ơh lĕch đak măt.

English: Heshbon and Elealeh will cry out, Their voice shall be heard as far as Jahaz; Therefore the armed soldiers of Moab will cry out; His life will be burdensome to him.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Hesbôn păng kon plei Êlêaleh, nơ̆r lu sư krao ôr re dêh mah kơtơ̆ng truh tơ pơlei Jahas. Na lu linh dêh char Môap nhơ̆m ơh, lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư pơpơ̆.

English: “My heart will cry out for Moab; His fugitives shall flee to Zoar, Like a three-year-old heifer. For by the Ascent of Luhith They will go up with weeping; For in the way of Horonaim They will raise up a cry of destruction
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh hmoi ơh kơ Môap. Lu kon pơlei sư kơdâu ôn tơ pơlei Soar păng truh tơ pơlei Êglat Sêlisia, lu sư tŏk năm tơ pơlei Luhit, nhơ̆m rah yak rah rok trong pơlei Hôrônaim, lu sư hmoi ơh sơ'ngon yua kơ tơdrong đe pơrăm đĭ.

English: For the waters of Nimrim will be desolate, For the green grass has withered away; The grass fails, there is nothing green.
Bahnar: Krong Nimrim hrơ̆ đĭ, 'nhĕt đĭ kro krĕnh. 'Nhĕt 'lơ̆p hơdrih pă đei, ưh pă đei 'nhĕt dah 'long hơdrih ayơ dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore the abundance they have gained, And what they have laid up, They will carry away to the Brook of the Willows.
Bahnar: Noh bơih mŭk tơmam mă lu sư đei păng lu tơmam gĭt mă lu sư tah mong, lu sư chĕp ba tŏk pah to thŭng thong đak 'long prai.

English: For the cry has gone all around the borders of Moab, Its wailing to Eglaim And its wailing to Beer Elim.
Bahnar: Jơwa re lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi, kơtơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ hơdral dêh Môap, nơ̆r lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi kơtơ̆ng truh tơ pơlei Êglaim, păng tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon oei truh tơ pơlei Bêr Êlim.

English: For the waters of Dimon will be full of blood; Because I will bring more upon Dimon, Lions upon him who escapes from Moab, And on the remnant of the land.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ đak glung tơ pơlei Dibôn 'bĕnh kơ pham, mă-lei Inh gô pơthim ăn tơdrong pơmat-tat truh kơ pơlei Dibôn, Minh pôm dăm-brang sa lu bơngai Môap mă oei arih păng lu bơngai mă oei đei lăm dêh sư.

English: Send the lamb to the ruler of the land, From Sela to the wilderness, To the mount of the daughter of Zion.
Bahnar: Ba ăn bĕ triu kon thuê̆ kơ bơngai pơgơ̆r teh đak 'nâu, đơ̆ng pơlei Sêla rok char glă, truh tơ kông kon pơlei Siôn.

English: For it shall be as a wandering bird thrown out of the nest; So shall be the daughters of Moab at the fords of the Arnon.
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-kăn Môap tơ tơnŏk đak krong Arnôn gô đông nhen thoi sem păr tơklah tơklang, păng nhen thoi hơnar sem đe yuih lê̆ tơpu.

English: “Take counsel, execute judgment; Make your shadow like the night in the middle of the day; Hide the outcasts, Do not betray him who escapes.
Bahnar: “Ih chă đon bĕ, pơm bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng, pơm kơ yơ̆p ngôi ih nhen thoi kơmăng. Ôn bĕ lu bơngai oei klaih, 'nĕ pơdrâu lu bơngai chă kơdâu ôn!

English: Let My outcasts dwell with you, O Moab; Be a shelter to them from the face of the spoiler. For the extortioner is at an end, Devastation ceases, The oppressors are consumed out of the land.
Bahnar: Lê̆ lu bơngai Môap mă đe puh tơweh oei hơdai ih. Ăn kơ lu sư chă ôn kơ'nơp đơ̆ng đe wă pơrăm lu sư. Lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep gô pă đei, tơdrong pơrăm gô tôch đĭ. Lu bơngai chă plah tơgar iŏk gô hiong đĭ đơ̆ng teh âu.”

English: In mercy the throne will be established; And One will sit on it in truth, in the tabernacle of David, Judging and seeking justice and hastening righteousness.”
Bahnar: Na gô đei pơtao pơgơ̆r hăm tơdrong 'mêm mơnat, đơ̆ng adrĕch Đawit gô đei minh 'nu 'bok tŏk pơgơ̆r tơpăt, sư gô sek tơlang, chă tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng păng pơm hloi tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: We have heard of the pride of Moab— He is very proud— Of his haughtiness and his pride and his wrath; But his lies shall not be so.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n đei kơtơ̆ng bơih gah tơdrong lu bơngai Môap pơang, sư pơrŏ pơang dêh, pơma pôk kơdih mă-lei, tơdrong pơang sư jing tơdrong kơ đei.

English: Therefore Moab shall wail for Moab; Everyone shall wail. For the foundations of Kir Hareseth you shall mourn; Surely they are stricken.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh bơih lu bơngai Môap gô nhơ̆m hmoi; đĭ-đăng lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi kơ Môap, nhơ̆m bĕ, tơtok ơh sơ'ngon bĕ, kơ 'bĕng plei hơmu pơlei Kir Harêsat!

English: For the fields of Heshbon languish, And the vine of Sibmah; The lords of the nations have broken down its choice plants, Which have reached to Jazer And wandered through the wilderness. Her branches are stretched out, They are gone over the sea.
Bahnar: Chŭn Hesbôn păng 'long hơmu pơlei Sipma đĭ jô kro. Đơ̆ng hơdrol sơ̆ sư chă kơjung mah truh tơ pơlei Jaser, păng truh tơ char glă; tơ'biĕng sư chăt sôr tơ 'nguaih, lĕch truh tơ đak dơsĭ. Na dang ei pơtao lu teh đak choh chre lê̆ boih lu dơng 'lơ̆ng.

English: Therefore I will bewail the vine of Sibmah, With the weeping of Jazer; I will drench you with my tears, O Heshbon and Elealeh; For battle cries have fallen Over your summer fruits and your harvest.
Bahnar: Na inh nhơ̆m ơh kư̆m thoi pơlei Jaser nhơ̆m ơh kơ 'long hơmu pơlei Sipma. Ơ pơlei Hesbôn păng plei Êlêaleh, inh gô ruh kơpal iĕm hăm đak măt, yua kơ bơyan iĕm phĕ plei đei nơ̆r jreo hiôk, păng bơyan yuă iĕm pă đei bơih.

English: Gladness is taken away, And joy from the plentiful field; In the vineyards there will be no singing, Nor will there be shouting; No treaders will tread out wine in the presses; I have made their shouting cease.
Bahnar: Tơdrong chơt hơiă 'nă hal tơ lăm mir hlă hla chŭn bluh 'lơ̆ng noh pă đei bơih, tơ lăm pơgar hơmu ưh pă đei bu hơri dah jreo chơt hiôk boih lu bơngai pơjuă plei hơmu wă pơm sik kư̆m ưh pă đei dơ̆ng, Inh pơm kơ tơdrong jreo chơt hiôk noh pơdơh hreh.

English: Therefore my heart shall resound like a harp for Moab, And my inner being for Kir Heres.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh hmoi kơ Môap thoi brŏ reh sơ'ngon, jơhngơ̆m inh ơh kơ pơlei Kirhêres kư̆m lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: And it shall come to pass, When it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, That he will come to his sanctuary to pray; But he will not prevail.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh mă khan lu đe Môap năm tŏk tơ anih kơjung kơkuh kơ yang pih pang lap đĕch, mă đơ̆ng lu sư mơ̆t tơ anih chơnang soi wă krao khan kư̆m tơdrong kơ đei.

English: This is the word which the LORD has spoken concerning Moab since that time.
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang khan boih kơ lu Môap sơ̆.

English: But now the LORD has spoken, saying, “Within three years, as the years of a hired man, the glory of Moab will be despised with all that great multitude, and the remnant will be very small and feeble.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei Kră Yang khan: “Lăm pêng sơnăm, thoi lĕ kơ sơnăm đe jang apah đĕch na tơdrong ư-ang lu đe Môap mă hăm lơ khŭl kon pơlei lu sư ră đe gô pơjăm pơjuă păng lu bơngai oei đei pă tŏ sĕt đĕch, ưh kơ jing kiơ bơih.”

English: The burden against Damascus. “Behold, Damascus will cease from being a city, And it will be a ruinous heap.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Khan lê̆ adrol kơ pơlei Đamas: “Mơ̆ng bĕ Pơlei Đamas, ưh pă jô̆ jing pơlei tih dơ̆ng, mă-lei gô jing tơmam pơchah rơ̆m rĕk.

English: The cities of Aroer are forsaken; They will be for flocks Which lie down, and no one will make them afraid.
Bahnar: Lu pơlei Arôe đĭ jing juơ rơhiăng jing anih ăn kơ lu triu drum pơdơh, ưh pă đei hli kơ kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: The fortress also will cease from Ephraim, The kingdom from Damascus, And the remnant of Syria; They will be as the glory of the children of Israel,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Kơđông kơjăp Êphraim ưh pă đei dơ̆ng bơih, pơlei tih Đamas ưh pă đei tơdrong pơgơ̆r dơ̆ng, lu kon plei mă oei đei đơ̆ng dêh char Siri kư̆m gô lei-lăi nhen thoi tơdrong ư-ang lu đe Isơrael.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “In that day it shall come to pass That the glory of Jacob will wane, And the fatness of his flesh grow lean.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh tơdrong ư-ang đe Jakôp hach hiong bơih, akâu akar bek gô jing hơkĕ hơkong.

English: It shall be as when the harvester gathers the grain, And reaps the heads with his arm; It shall be as he who gathers heads of grain In the Valley of Rephaim.
Bahnar: Sư thoi bơngai yuă 'ba, akŭm pơpôi đêl sư yuă yua ti sư yuă iŏk hơie 'ba kư̆m thoi đe chă dônh 'ba hơlŭng lăm thŭng Rêphaim.

English: Yet gleaning grapes will be left in it, Like the shaking of an olive tree, Two or three olives at the top of the uppermost bough, Four or five in its most fruitful branches,” Says the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m oei đei 'ba hiơt tơ noh. Thoi kơ đe gơgŭ tơm plei 'long ôliwơ, plei sư kư̆m oei đei 'bar pêng tŏ tơ kơnhŏng wĕch ti, dah mă kư̆m oei puăn pơđăm tŏ plei tơ dơng sư. Kră Yang đe Isơrael khan.

English: In that day a man will look to his Maker, And his eyes will have respect for the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, kon bơngai gô tơchĕng 'blŏk gơnang kơ Tơ'ngla mă Pơjing sư, păng măt lu sư wơ̆t lăng tơ Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh đe Isơrael.

English: He will not look to the altars, The work of his hands; He will not respect what his fingers have made, Nor the wooden images nor the incense altars.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô ưh pă lăng tơ chơnang soi mă đêl ti lu sư pơm, păng kư̆m ưh pă lăng dơ̆ng ti lu sư pơjing kơdih, mă rup yang Arsêrim, păng chơnang soi lu sư soh 'long 'bâu phu.

English: In that day his strong cities will be as a forsaken bough And an uppermost branch, Which they left because of the children of Israel; And there will be desolation.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh lu pơlei tih kơjăp Isơrael gô jing anih đe lê̆ juơ tơ lăm bri roh dah tơ kơpal kông, kư̆m thoi lu anih đĭ jing juơ 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe Isơrael. Đĭ-đăng jing anih juơ rơhiăng.

English: Because you have forgotten the God of your salvation, And have not been mindful of the Rock of your stronghold, Therefore you will plant pleasant plants And set out foreign seedlings
Bahnar: Ih hiơt bơih kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih ih; ih ưh kơ 'blŏk bơih hơgơp tơmo Tih mă ih kơ'nơp. Mă đơ̆ng ih pơtăm 'long arih 'lơ̆ng, ih pơtăm adrĕch 'long hơmu plơ̆ng đơ̆ng nai.

English: In the day you will make your plant to grow, And in the morning you will make your seed to flourish; But the harvest will be a heap of ruins In the day of grief and desperate sorrow.
Bahnar: Mă khan ih pơtăm, ih wei jing 'lơ̆ng ră, kiơ̆ pơgê pơm kơ sư arih đei pơkao kiơ̆ pơgê. Mă-lei lăm năr pơmat-tat jĭ jăn ưh kơ gơh klaih mă đei phĕ plei ưh kơđei yua kiơ ôh!

English: Woe to the multitude of many people Who make a noise like the roar of the seas, And to the rushing of nations That make a rushing like the rushing of mighty waters!
Bahnar: Ô lu kon pơlei dêh char lơlap, ôr krao thoi jơwa đak dơsĭ poh-yă, ô lu adrĕch adrung kon bơngai ôr krao thoi jơwa đak poh-yă tih!

English: The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters; But God will rebuke them and they will flee far away, And be chased like the chaff of the mountains before the wind, Like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch adrung kon bơngai ôr krao jơwa sư năm tơblah dang đak poh-yă, mă-lei Kră Yang gô chrih hil kơ lu sư na lu sư gô kơdâu ataih, puh tơweh lê̆ lu sư thoi kial tơthu hơkam 'ba kơpal kông, thoi 'mui teh năr kial hơbŭt.

English: Then behold, at eventide, trouble! And before the morning, he is no more. This is the portion of those who plunder us, And the lot of those who rob us.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơsơ̆ đei tơdrong hli tơrơ; adrol kơ pơgê hrôih truh ưh pă 'bôh lu sư dơ̆ng, 'nâu minh tơdrong tuh ăn kơ lu bơngai blah tơgar iŏk mŭk tơmam dêh char bơ̆n, noh jơ̆ tơdrong truh kơ lu bơngai tơtông tơgar tơmam đơ̆ng lu bơ̆n.

English: Woe to the land shadowed with buzzing wings, Which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia
Bahnar: Răm-'băm tơpă kơ teh đak đei re jơwa thoi tơtuh pơnăr noh jơ̆ teh đak pah to lu krong lăm char Kus.

English: Which sends ambassadors by sea, Even in vessels of reed on the waters, saying, “Go, swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth of skin, To a people terrible from their beginning onward, A nation powerful and treading down, Whose land the rivers divide.”
Bahnar: Ih wơh lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r tŏk đak dơsĭ, hao thŏng-nan pik hăm chai đông kơpal đak! Ơ lu bơngai năm pơtruh nơ̆r hơbĕch hơbal, năm tơ teh đak lu bơngai kơjung akar rơmuăn. Tơ kon pơlei mă jê̆ mă ataih hli ngăl; minh pôm teh đak đei bơngai pran kơtang, chă tơgar pơjuă pơđep lu sư pơma nơ̆r phara krưp. Dêh char đei lơ chơnglah krong klah asong teh đak sư.

English: All inhabitants of the world and dwellers on the earth: When he lifts up a banner on the mountains, you see it; And when he blows a trumpet, you hear it.
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla lăm teh đak oei kơpal teh kơplah đe pơdơ̆ng hla-kơ kơpal kông iĕm gô lăng 'bôh mưh đe hlôm tơgiĕp iĕm gô kơtơ̆ng.

English: For so the LORD said to me, “I will take My rest, And I will look from My dwelling place Like clear heat in sunshine, Like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan bơih kơ inh thoi âu: “Inh gô oei hreh păng Inh gô răp lăng đơ̆ng anih Inh oei, thoi drang tŏ pơchrang hơdah đơ̆ng măt 'năr, thoi hơiuh đak ngom năr tŏ bơyan yuă.”

English: For before the harvest, when the bud is perfect And the sour grape is ripening in the flower, He will both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks And take away and cut down the branches.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ bơyan yuă, kơplah pơkao đĭ wă plei. Păng pơkao hơmu đĭ plei wă jê̆ đum, na Kră Yang gô iŏk săng kô kăt lê̆ lu tơ'biĕng păng lu dơng bluh hla dêh.

English: They will be left together for the mountain birds of prey And for the beasts of the earth; The birds of prey will summer on them, And all the beasts of the earth will winter on them.
Bahnar: Đe gô tŭk lê̆ lu sư ăn kơ sem păr tơ lăm kông sa, păng ăn kơ sem bri tơ ala teh sa, lu sem păr gô sa lu sư lăm bơyan phang păng lu sem bri brah gô sa lăm bơyan tơngiĕt.

English: In that time a present will be brought to the LORD of hosts From a people tall and smooth of skin, And from a people terrible from their beginning onward, A nation powerful and treading down, Whose land the rivers divide— To the place of the name of the LORD of hosts, To Mount Zion.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah noh, lu adrĕch adrung bơngai kơjung akâu akar rơmuăn, jơ̆ lu adrĕch adrung krưp dêh, kon pơlei mă jê̆ mă ataih hli ngăl, minh pôm teh đak đei bơngai pran kơtang chă tơgar pơjuă pơđep, teh đak đei lơ chơnglah krong klah asong teh đak sư, adrĕch adrung noh bơih gô chĕp ba tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lăm anih 'măn kơ anăn Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei, jơ̆ kông Siôn.

English: The burden against Egypt. Behold, the LORD rides on a swift cloud, And will come into Egypt; The idols of Egypt will totter at His presence, And the heart of Egypt will melt in its midst.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol gah dêh đe Êyiptơ. Kră Yang jur hăm hơmơ̆l tĕnh truh tơ dêh Êyiptơ, lu rup yang dêh char đe Êyiptơ tơtơ̆ đĭ 'bơ̆t anăp Sư, jơhngơ̆m đe Êyiptơ hiong hach đĭ.

English: “I will set Egyptians against Egyptians; Everyone will fight against his brother, And everyone against his neighbor, City against city, kingdom against kingdom.
Bahnar: “Inh gô pơm kơ bơngai Êyiptơ tơblah băl tơduă bơngai Êyiptơ, 'nhŏng oh tơblah băl tơduă 'nhŏng oh, rông 'bôt tơblah băl tơduă rông 'bôt, pơlei tih tơblah băl tơduă pơlei tih, teh đak âu tơblah hăm teh đak noh.

English: The spirit of Egypt will fail in its midst; I will destroy their counsel, And they will consult the idols and the charmers, The mediums and the sorcerers.
Bahnar: Lu đe Êyiptơ gô rơdu, inh gô pơrăm lê̆ tơdrong tơdă lu sư hơmet wă pơm, lu sư gô krao chă lu rup yang, lu pơjâu, lu pơjâu pơma dơnuh hăm bơhngol bơngai lôch, lu pơjâu tơwir.

English: And the Egyptians I will give Into the hand of a cruel master, And a fierce king will rule over them,” Says the Lord, the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Inh gô jao kon pơlei Êyiptơ lăm ti lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kơnê̆ dêh păng ăn kơ minh 'nu pơtao chư̆ kơnê̆ gô pơgơ̆r lu sư. Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: The waters will fail from the sea, And the river will be wasted and dried up.
Bahnar: Đak dơsĭ gô hrơ̆, đak krong gô hrĕng kro.

English: The rivers will turn foul; The brooks of defense will be emptied and dried up; The reeds and rushes will wither.
Bahnar: Lu glung iĕ jing 'bâu ôm thong đak lăm char Êyiptơ gô hrơ̆ hrĕng kro. 'Nhĕt trang cheng krong lôch ôm đĭ.

English: The papyrus reeds by the River, by the mouth of the River, And everything sown by the River, Will wither, be driven away, and be no more.
Bahnar: 'Nhĕt chăt jih đak krong Nil, tơ tu krong păng chŭn ba lu sư cheng krong jô kro đĭ, kial bơbơ̆t pă đei kiơ dơ̆ng.

English: The fishermen also will mourn; All those will lament who cast hooks into the River, And they will languish who spread nets on the waters.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai chă ka gô tơtok, lu bơngai chă wah tơ krong Nil nhơ̆m ôr păng lu bơngai traih jal dăng hơnhuăl gô ơh klai đĭ.

English: Moreover those who work in fine flax And those who weave fine fabric will be ashamed
Bahnar: Lu đe dui brai se păng lu đe tanh che kok gô ưh pă hơmĕng.

English: And its foundations will be broken. All who make wages will be troubled of soul.
Bahnar: Lu pơm yŏng thoi jrăng tơm lăm dêh Êyiptơ đe gô pơrăm păng lu bơngai jang mưng gô jĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Surely the princes of Zoan are fools; Pharaoh’s wise counselors give foolish counsel. How do you say to Pharaoh, “I am the son of the wise, The son of ancient kings?”
Bahnar: Lu kră pơlei Sôan ngăl kơtul, lu bơngai hơgei oei jang hăm Pharaôn lu sư chă đon kơhlôh kơwao, liơ iĕm gơh khan kơ Pharaôn khan: “Inh jơ̆ minh lăm lu bơngai hơgei, kon sâu lu đe pơtao adrol sơ̆?”

English: Where are they? Where are your wise men? Let them tell you now, And let them know what the LORD of hosts has purposed against Egypt.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơgei iĕm tơ yơ? Athei lu sư roi kơ ih băt Kră Yang Tih Hloh hơmet lê̆ bơih wă pơm kiơ kơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: The princes of Zoan have become fools; The princes of Noph are deceived; They have also deluded Egypt, Those who are the mainstay of its tribes.
Bahnar: Lu kră pơlei Sôan kơtul ngăl, lu kră pơlei Nôp huŏng lăm tơdrong đe hơlĕnh, lu bơngai pơm kră lăm tơring đơ̆ng adrĕch pha pơm kơ đe Êyiptơ jrok trong.

English: The LORD has mingled a perverse spirit in her midst; And they have caused Egypt to err in all her work, As a drunken man staggers in his vomit.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tuh ăn tơdrong tơchĕng hơwơ̆l kơ bơngai Êyiptơ, lu sư gô wơ̆l jrok lăm tôm tơdrong jang, thoi bơngai suai hăk rah năm rah tơ 'ma tơ 'ngiĕo kơ hăk sư.

English: Neither will there be any work for Egypt, Which the head or tail, Palm branch or bulrush, may do.
Bahnar: Đe pă đei gơh pơm kiơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ, mă khan kơ̆l dah kiĕng. Dơng gao dah gơlar.

English: In that day Egypt will be like women, and will be afraid and fear because of the waving of the hand of the LORD of hosts, which He waves over it.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh, bơngai Êyiptơ gô nhen thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn, hli tơrơ kơ ti Kră Yang Tih Hloh wă pơrăm lu sư.

English: And the land of Judah will be a terror to Egypt; everyone who makes mention of it will be afraid in himself, because of the counsel of the LORD of hosts which He has determined against it.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei kơnh teh đak Juđa jing minh tơdrong pơm ăn kơ Êyiptơ hli krưp mưh đe roi kơ Juđa rim 'nu hli ngăl, yua gah tơdrong tơdă Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơkă bơih wă pơm kơ char lu sư.

English: In that day five cities in the land of Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear by the LORD of hosts; one will be called the City of Destruction.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, tơ dêh Êyiptơ, đei pơđăm tŏ pơlei pơma nơ̆r Kanaan păng pơkăm pơkă hăm anăn Kră Yang Tih Hloh, lăm lu pơlei noh đei minh pôm pơlei đe krao pơlei pơlôch pơrăm.

English: In that day there will be an altar to the LORD in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to the LORD at its border.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh gô đei minh pôm chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ. Păng đei minh pôm jrăng man 'blŏk kơ Kră Yang tơ jih hơdral teh đak noh.

English: And it will be for a sign and for a witness to the LORD of hosts in the land of Egypt; for they will cry to the LORD because of the oppressors, and He will send them a Savior and a Mighty One, and He will deliver them.
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ tơdra kơnăl păng tơbăt kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ, lu Sư gô krao chă Kră Yang, kơplah lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư, Kră Yang gô wơh minh 'nu 'bok dŏng pơklaih wă dŏng tơgŭm păng pơklaih lu sư.

English: Then the LORD will be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know the LORD in that day, and will make sacrifice and offering; yes, they will make a vow to the LORD and perform it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn kơ bơngai Êyiptơ băt kơ Sư, lăm năr noh lu bơngai Êyiptơ gô băt kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, lu sư gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ Kră Yang, lu sư pơkă pơkăm hăm Kră Yang păng pơm keh tơdrong lu sư pơkă noh.

English: And the LORD will strike Egypt, He will strike and heal it; they will return to the LORD, and He will be entreated by them and heal them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô teh bơtho dêh char Êyiptơ đơ̆ng noh hơmet pơklaih lu sư dơ̆ng, lu sư gô wih tơ Kră Yang, Kră Yang gô mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư krao khan păng ming pơklaih ăn.

English: In that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian will come into Egypt and the Egyptian into Assyria, and the Egyptians will serve with the Assyrians.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh gô đei minh pôm trong glung tih đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ truh tơ dêh Asiri, lu bơngai Asiri gô năm tơ dêh Êyiptơ, lu bơngai Êyiptơ gô năm tơ dêh Asiri, lu bơngai Êyiptơ păng bơngai Asiri wang hơdai kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: In that day Israel will be one of three with Egypt and Assyria—a blessing in the midst of the land
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh, dêh Isơrael gô pơgơ̆p hơdai hăm bơngai dêh Êyiptơ păng Asiri jing teh đak mă pêng. Pêng tŏ teh đak 'nâu pơm tơm tơdrong pŭn hiôk lăm teh đak.

English: whom the LORD of hosts shall bless, saying, “Blessed is Egypt My people, and Assyria the work of My hands, and Israel My inheritance.”
Bahnar: Pêng tŏ teh đak Kră Yang Tih Hloh sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư, khan: “Pŭn hiôk kơ Êyiptơ kon pơlei Inh, Asiri tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti Inh, Isơrael jơ̆ mŭk tơmam Inh.”

English: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm Sargôn pơtao dêh Asiri wơh Tartan năm tơ pơlei Asdôt, blah păng iŏk pơlei noh.

English: at the same time the LORD spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, “Go, and remove the sackcloth from your body, and take your sandals off your feet.” And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Kră Yang, khan kơ Êsai kon drŏ-nglo Amôt: “Năm bĕ, plôh lê̆ ao 'bi ih păng plôh lê̆ chơkhŏ đơ̆ng jơ̆ng ih.” Êsai pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r noh, năm akâu hoh păng yak jơ̆ng hoh.

English: Then the LORD said, “Just as My servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and a wonder against Egypt and Ethiopia
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Thoi đĭch đam Inh Êsai năm akâu hoh păng yak jơ̆ng hoh lăm pêng sơnăm wă pơm tơdra tơ'bôh wă blah teh đak Êyiptơ păng Kus.

English: so shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians as prisoners and the Ethiopians as captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh mơ̆n pơtao Asiri gô chông ba kon pơlei Êyiptơ păng Kus pơm bơnă đơ̆ng hơ'lơ̆p truh tơ kră năm akâu hoh păng yak jơ̆ng hoh pơdah pơtâu hoh thoi noh wă kơ teh đak Êyiptơ mơlâu.

English: Then they shall be afraid and ashamed of Ethiopia their expectation and Egypt their glory.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai gơnang kơ teh đak Kus păng hơmĕng kơ teh đak Êyiptơ gô hli păng mơlâu.

English: And the inhabitant of this territory will say in that day, ‘Surely such is our expectation, wherever we flee for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria; and how shall we escape?’ ”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh lu bơngai oei jê̆ đak dơsĭ gô khan to, lu adrĕch adrung mă bơ̆n gơnang păng kơdâu tơkan wă kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih đơ̆ng pơtao dêh Asiri, na lu sư đĭ jing thoi noh bơih! Lei liơ bơ̆n gơh klaih?

English: The burden against the Wilderness of the Sea. As whirlwinds in the South pass through, So it comes from the desert, from a terrible land.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol kơ char glă oei rok cheng đak dơsĭ. Thoi kial hơbŭt pơrăm char gah gơal. Sư lĕch đơ̆ng char glă đơ̆ng teh đak hli krưp.

English: A distressing vision is declared to me; The treacherous dealer deals treacherously, And the plunderer plunders. Go up, O Elam! Besiege, O Media! All its sighing I have made to cease.
Bahnar: Đei tơ'bôh kơ inh tơdrong hli krưp dêh. Lu bơngai chă tơgar oei chă tơgar, lu bơngai pơrăm, oei chă pơrăm, ơ bơngai Êlam tŏk bĕ, ơ bơngai Mêđi! Wang bĕ, Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ dôm nơ̆r ôr ơh sư.

English: Therefore my loins are filled with pain; Pangs have taken hold of me, like the pangs of a woman in labor. I was distressed when I heard it; I was dismayed when I saw it.
Bahnar: Na kơdŭ inh jĭ dêh, inh jĭ tuĕnh nhen thoi drŏ-kăn tơpŭ, lăp inh kơtơ̆ng inh pơ̆k lăp inh 'bôh inh hli tơrơ.

English: My heart wavered, fearfulness frightened me; The night for which I longed He turned into fear for me.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh hơwơ̆l hơwang, pơm kơ inh hli tơrơ dêh, hơdah pơgê hrôih mă inh 'maih wă đĭ tơplih jing tơdrong inh hli tơtơ̆ kơ.

English: Prepare the table, Set a watchman in the tower, Eat and drink. Arise, you princes, Anoint the shield!
Bahnar: Đe hơmet gơ'bang sa et, đe lơ̆k che, đe sa păng et. Ơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r iung bĕ tuh đak rơmă kơ khêl iĕm.

English: For thus has the Lord said to me: “Go, set a watchman, Let him declare what he sees.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ăn bơngai gak bĕ sư 'bôh tơdrong kiơ athei sư roi.

English: And he saw a chariot with a pair of horsemen, A chariot of donkeys, and a chariot of camels, And he listened earnestly with great care.
Bahnar: Mưh 'bôh lu linh hao gre aseh năm hơgrop 'bar 'bar, hao aseh iĕ, aseh lăk-đa, na sư athei kơchăng mơ̆ng mă nhen.”

English: Then he cried, “A lion, my Lord! I stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime; I have sat at my post every night.
Bahnar: Bơngai gak ôr re na khan: “Ơ yŏng, inh dơ̆ng lăm hnam gak prăt năr păng dơ̆ng gak tơ anih gak prăt măng.

English: And look, here comes a chariot of men with a pair of horsemen!” Then he answered and said, “Babylon is fallen, is fallen! And all the carved images of her gods He has broken to the ground.”
Bahnar: To lu linh hao gre aseh lu sư năm hơgrop 'bar 'bar, sư tơl khan: ‘Pơlei Babilôn pơchah răm bơih! Dôm lu rup yang sư pơchah hĕch đĭ tơ teh bơih!’ ”

English: Oh, my threshing and the grain of my floor! That which I have heard from the LORD of hosts, The God of Israel, I have declared to you.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei inh, mă đe pơjuă pơđep, tơdrong mă inh đei kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, na inh roi ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong noh.

English: The burden against Dumah. He calls to me out of Seir, “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Khan lê̆ adrol gah plei Đuma. Đei bơngai krao inh đơ̆ng kông Sêir khan: “Ơ bơngai gak, măng oei đunh ưh? Ơ bơngai gak măng oei đunh ưh?”

English: The watchman said, “The morning comes, and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire; Return! Come back!”
Bahnar: Bơngai gak tơl khan: “Pơgê truh bơih kơmăng kư̆m truh mơ̆n. Mưh ih wă jet; jet bĕ, kơnh wơ̆t tơ âu dơ̆ng hŏ.”

English: The burden against Arabia. In the forest in Arabia you will lodge, O you traveling companies of Dedanites.
Bahnar: Khan lê̆ adrol gah char Arâp Ơ lu khŭl Đêdan bơngai chă mơdro, lu iĕm gô tep lăm bri Arabi

English: O inhabitants of the land of Tema, Bring water to him who is thirsty; With their bread they met him who fled.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Têma chĕp ba đak ăn kơ lu đe rơhing. Năm sơng bĕ lu bơngai kơdâu đơ̆ng tơdrong truh; ăn 'bĕng por kơ lu sư sa.

English: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, From the bent bow, and from the distress of war.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơdâu đơ̆ng đao gưm, đơ̆ng đao đe toh đơ̆ng hơnglop, đơ̆ng hră đe hơ'năk bơih, kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng tơdrong tơblah wang.

English: For thus the LORD has said to me: “Within a year, according to the year of a hired man, all the glory of Kedar will fail
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Lăm minh sơnăm dơ̆ng, jô̆ thoi sơnăm đe jang apah, dôm tơdrong ư-ang dêh char Kêdar gô hiong.

English: and the remainder of the number of archers, the mighty men of the people of Kedar, will be diminished; for the LORD God of Israel has spoken it.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pran kơtang chĕp hră, lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo dêh char Kêdar oei pă tŏ sĕt đĕch.” Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael đei khan bơih thoi noh.

English: The burden against the Valley of Vision. What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol gah thŭng tơdrong tơ'bôh. Lu iĕm đei tơdrong kiơ mă đĭ-đăng lu iĕm tŏk hao bơbŭng hnam thoi noh?

English: You who are full of noise, A tumultuous city, a joyous city? Your slain men are not slain with the sword, Nor dead in battle.
Bahnar: Ơ pơlei ôr tơkĕch, ơ-ôs ơ-as, pơlei mă chơt hiôk, pơm kư̆ kă lu khŭl iĕm lôch ưh trŏ kơ lôch yua kơ đao gưm kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ lôch yua kơ tơblah.

English: All your rulers have fled together; They are captured by the archers. All who are found in you are bound together; They have fled from afar.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kră pơgơ̆r lu iĕm lu sư wang kơdâu chă ôn, đe rôp chô̆ lu sư, ưh kơ đei yua hră ôh. Đe rôp đĭ bơih lu kon pơlei iĕm, mă đe đei chă 'bôh, mă khan lu sư kơdâu ataih bơih ră.

English: Therefore I said, “Look away from me, I will weep bitterly; Do not labor to comfort me Because of the plundering of the daughter of my people.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh khan: “Iĕm 'nĕ lăng tơ inh, lê̆ inh nhơ̆m ơh ol, 'nĕ chă pơlung inh yua kơ tơdrong pơrăm lu kon pơlei inh!

English: For it is a day of trouble and treading down and perplexity By the Lord GOD of hosts In the Valley of Vision— Breaking down the walls And of crying to the mountain.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơkă bơih, gô đei minh năr tơdrong rŭng răng, pơjuă pơđep iung blah lăm anih thŭng tơdrong tơ'bôh, lu dur pơlei pơchah hơlih, nơ̆r krao ôr dŏng jơwa truh tơ kông.

English: Elam bore the quiver With chariots of men and horsemen, And Kir uncovered the shield.
Bahnar: Lu đe Êlam tơ̆n jŏ 'brơ̆m hră, năm kiơ̆ đei gre aseh hăm lu linh hao aseh, lu bơngai Kir chĕp khêl.

English: It shall come to pass that your choicest valleys Shall be full of chariots, And the horsemen shall set themselves in array at the gate.
Bahnar: Rim anih thŭng ih 'lơ̆ng hloh đĭ-đăng noh tă 'bĕnh-'bang kơ gre aseh, păng lu linh hao aseh pơrĕng bơih wă tơblah tơ 'măng jang pơlei.

English: He removed the protection of Judah. You looked in that day to the armor of the House of the Forest
Bahnar: Sư iŏk lê̆ bơih tơmam bơwei dêh char Juđa, păng lăm năr noh iĕm gơnang kơ tơmam wă tơblah đơ̆ng hnam mong lăm bri.

English: You also saw the damage to the city of David, That it was great; And you gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'bôh lơ trong hơđang pơchah lăm pơlei Đawit; na iĕm mong đak đơ̆ng dơnâu gah ala.

English: You numbered the houses of Jerusalem, And the houses you broke down To fortify the wall.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm jô̆ hnam lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, teh pơchah lu hnam noh, wă hơmet ming dur pơlei kơjăp.

English: You also made a reservoir between the two walls For the water of the old pool. But you did not look to its Maker, Nor did you have respect for Him who fashioned it long ago.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơm sơlŭng dơnâu plah sơlam dur pơlei wă mong iŏk đak đơ̆ng đak dơnâu so. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ gơnang ôh kơ Tơ'ngla pơm tơdrong noh, iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ lăng ôh tơ Tơ'ngla hơmet lê̆ wă pơm tơdrong noh đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: And in that day the Lord GOD of hosts Called for weeping and for mourning, For baldness and for girding with sackcloth.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh krao lu iĕm athei nhơ̆m hmoi, ơh sơ'ngon, hơkôih sŏk, hrŭk ao 'bi.

English: But instead, joy and gladness, Slaying oxen and killing sheep, Eating meat and drinking wine: “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăng to lăm lu iĕm đei tơdrong chơt hiôk kư̆ kă 'bet sa rơmo, 'buh sa triu, sa 'nhĕm, et tơdrô: “Et sa bĕ yua kơ dơning bơ̆n gô lôch!”

English: Then it was revealed in my hearing by the LORD of hosts, “Surely for this iniquity there will be no atonement for you, Even to your death,” says the Lord GOD of hosts.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh roi tơbăt lăm đon inh: “Tơdrong yoch 'nâu ưh kơ gơh mơnat ăn ôh dĭng truh năr lu iĕm lôch.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the Lord GOD of hosts: “Go, proceed to this steward, To Shebna, who is over the house, and say
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Ih năm bĕ truh tơ noh, Sepna bơngai bơ̆jang wei-lăng hnam pơtao păng khan kơ sư

English: ‘What have you here, and whom have you here, That you have hewn a sepulcher here, As he who hews himself a sepulcher on high, Who carves a tomb for himself in a rock?
Bahnar: Ih oei tơ âu pơm kiơ? Bu ăn kơ ih oei tơ âu? Mă ih mah sir anih pơm bơsat kơ ih tơ âu? Ih sir bŏk kơ ih minh anih tơ kơpal, sir bŏk anih ih lăm tơmo.

English: Indeed, the LORD will throw you away violently, O mighty man, And will surely seize you.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, ơ bơngai pran kơtang Kră Yang gô klơ̆m lê̆ ih kơtang mơ̆n. Sư gô rôp ih kơjăp.

English: He will surely turn violently and toss you like a ball Into a large country; There you shall die, and there your glorious chariots Shall be the shame of your master’s house.
Bahnar: Sư gô lôm ih, lôm kơjăp thoi 'bŏng-lŏng klơ̆m ih tơ dêh char să rơhơi ih gô lôch tơ noh, anih mă lu gre aseh ih, ih jơ̆ bơngai pơm kơ hnam tơ'ngla ih mơlâu.

English: So I will drive you out of your office, And from your position he will pull you down.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơlĕch lê̆ ih, gô puh tơweh lê̆ ih đơ̆ng anih ih jang.

English: ‘Then it shall be in that day, That I will call My servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Inh gô krao đam Inh Êliakim kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia.

English: I will clothe him with your robe And strengthen him with your belt; I will commit your responsibility into his hand. He shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem And to the house of Judah.
Bahnar: Iŏk ao ih pơhrŭk ăn kơ sư, tơ̆n ăn kơ sư tơlei tơ̆n ih, iŏk tơdrong pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng ih pơjao ăn lăm ti sư, sư gô pơm 'bă kơ kon pơlei oei lăm Jêrusalem păng bơngai Juđa.

English: The key of the house of David I will lay on his shoulder; So he shall open, and no one shall shut; And he shall shut, and no one shall open.
Bahnar: Inh gô dan khuă hnam Đawit kơpal hơngiĕng sư, mưh sư pơih ưh kơ đei bu gơh tang, mưh sư tang ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơih.

English: I will fasten him as a peg in a secure place, And he will become a glorious throne to his father’s house.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơ̆ng sư thoi đe pơ̆ng kơđĭnh 'bơ̆t anih kơjăp păng sư gô jing minh 'nu đe ư-ang ăn kơ hnam 'bă sư.

English: ‘They will hang on him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the posterity, all vessels of small quantity, from the cups to all the pitchers.
Bahnar: Đe gô hơtol kơpal sư dôm tơdrong ư-ang hnam 'bă sư, đơ̆ng kon hơ'lơ̆p, adrĕch adrung păng đĭ-đăng tơmam yua tih iĕ đơ̆ng pơnhan kơthao truh tơ ge gŏ.

English: In that day,’ says the LORD of hosts, ‘the peg that is fastened in the secure place will be removed and be cut down and fall, and the burden that was on it will be cut off; for the LORD has spoken.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Lăm năr noh, kơđĭnh đêl pơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anih kơjăp gô tơtoh, đe gô lê̆ sư, sư gô huŏng, tơmam trăp hơtol kơpal sư gô koh kơtĕch lê̆. Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: The burden against Tyre. Wail, you ships of Tarshish! For it is laid waste, So that there is no house, no harbor; From the land of Cyprus it is revealed to them.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol kơ pơlei Tir, ơ duk Tarsis nhơ̆m ơh bĕ, yua kơ pơlei Tir pơchah răm đĭ bơih, dĭng mah hnam oei, anih duk pơdơh kư̆m đĭ pă đei, Đơ̆ng dêh Kitim đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r roi 'nâu.

English: Be still, you inhabitants of the coastland, You merchants of Sidon, Whom those who cross the sea have filled.
Bahnar: Oei hreh bĕ kon pơlei oei tơter đak dơsĭ, ơ lu bơngai mơdro pơlei Siđôn anih mă lơ bơngai năm trong đak dơsĭ pơm kơ iĕm.

English: And on great waters the grain of Shihor, The harvest of the River, is her revenue; And she is a marketplace for the nations.
Bahnar: Mơdrŏng chơ phe 'ba đơ̆ng Sihôr, kĕch yuă đei đơ̆ng krong Nil, chơ rok trong đak dơsĭ tih, noh jơ̆ tơm đei lơi yua, sư noh bơih anih mơdro mơchan kơ rim teh đak.

English: Be ashamed, O Sidon; For the sea has spoken, The strength of the sea, saying, “I do not labor, nor bring forth children; Neither do I rear young men, Nor bring up virgins.”
Bahnar: Ơ Siđôn mơlâu bĕ! Yua kơ đak dơsĭ khan bơih anih kơjăp mă lu iĕm gơnang lăm đak dơsĭ đei pơma bơih: “Inh tam đei anăp kư̆m tam đei layơ tơpŭ; kư̆m tam đei rong kon tơdăm dah kon adruh.”

English: When the report reaches Egypt, They also will be in agony at the report of Tyre.
Bahnar: Kơplah tơdrong âu kơtơ̆ng truh tơ char Êyiptơ, đe gô ơh dêh yua kơ đei kơtơ̆ng tơdrong đe roi gah pơlei Tir.

English: Cross over to Tarshish; Wail, you inhabitants of the coastland!
Bahnar: Kơdâu năm tơ Tarsis bĕ, ơ kon pơlei oei jê̆ đak dơsĭ nhơ̆m hmoi bĕ!

English: Is this your joyous city, Whose antiquity is from ancient days, Whose feet carried her far off to dwell?
Bahnar: Âu hăm trŏ kơ pơlei iĕm chơt hiôk ưh? Pơlei đei bơih đơ̆ng chăl Kră sơ̆, mă đêl jơ̆ng sư yak năm tơ anih ataih chă anih wă oei pơm pơlei jang sa.

English: Who has taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning city, Whose merchants are princes, Whose traders are the honorable of the earth?
Bahnar: Na bu pơkă tơdrong âu wă pơm kơ pơlei Tir, jơ̆ pơlei asong ăn bơih lu tơmam thoi môk pơtao, lu bơngai mơdro mơchan sư noh lu bơngai yŏng mơng thoi kon pơtao, lu tơ'ngla tĕch mơdro jơ̆ lu bơngai đe pơyom lăm teh đak.

English: The LORD of hosts has purposed it, To bring to dishonor the pride of all glory, To bring into contempt all the honorable of the earth.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh bơih pơkă pơm tơdrong âu, tơjur tơdrong pơang kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ păng pơm kơ lu bơngai đe pơyom lăm teh đak âu mơlâu.

English: Overflow through your land like the River, O daughter of Tarshish; There is no more strength.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Tarsis, năm bĕ jơ̆p kơ anih teh ih tih thoi kơ krong Nil! Ưh pă đei anih kơ duk ih bơih.

English: He stretched out His hand over the sea, He shook the kingdoms; The LORD has given a commandment against Canaan To destroy its strongholds.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yơ̆r ti sư kơpal đak dơsĭ, pơm kơ rim teh đak tơdrŏ, Sư pơm boih kơ Kanaan wă pơrăm lu kơđông kơjăp sư.

English: And He said, “You will rejoice no more, O you oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon. Arise, cross over to Cyprus; There also you will have no rest.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Ơ kon adruh 'nao iung pơlei Siđôn mă đe tơrôp bơih, ih ưh pă đei chơt hiôk dơ̆ng bơih, iung bĕ ih yak năm tơ dêh Kitim, tơ noh ih kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơdơh hiôk ôh!

English: Behold, the land of the Chaldeans, This people which was not; Assyria founded it for wild beasts of the desert. They set up its towers, They raised up its palaces, And brought it to ruin.
Bahnar: Ih lăng dêh char lu bơngai Kalđê, ưh kơ đei kon pơlei noh dơ̆ng bơih, bơngai Asiri pơm kơ anih noh jing anih sem bri, sư pơm hnam thôt, wang tăp dăr, blah iŏk pơgoh, teng lê̆ anih hnam pơtao sư pơchah pơchek jing juơ.

English: Wail, you ships of Tarshish! For your strength is laid waste.
Bahnar: Ơ lu duk Tarsis, nhơ̆m ơh bĕ! Kơđông lu iĕm pơchah răm đĭ bơih.

English: Now it shall come to pass in that day that Tyre will be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king. At the end of seventy years it will happen to Tyre as in the song of the harlot
Bahnar: Kơplah noh kơnh pơlei Tir đe gô hiơt kơ sư lăm tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm, dang minh chăl arih pơtao. Klaih hlôi kơ tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm bơih, pơlei Tir gô nhen thoi 'bai bơngai drŏ-kăn đi hơri.

English: “Take a harp, go about the city, You forgotten harlot; Make sweet melody, sing many songs, That you may be remembered.”
Bahnar: “Ơ drŏ-kăn đi mă đe hiơt bơih, chĕp bĕ brŏ ih, chă juang jơ̆p lăm pơlei reh mă hiôk, hơri bĕ mă lơ, wă kơ đe 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ ih.”

English: And it shall be, at the end of seventy years, that the LORD will deal with Tyre. She will return to her hire, and commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.
Bahnar: Kơtĕch tơpơh-jĭt sơnăm bơih, Kră Yang gô năm tơmang pơlei Tir, pơlei sư gô pơm thoi đêl dơ̆ng, sư gô mơdro mơchan hăm rim dêh char lăm teh đak âu.

English: Her gain and her pay will be set apart for the LORD; it will not be treasured nor laid up, for her gain will be for those who dwell before the LORD, to eat sufficiently, and for fine clothing.
Bahnar: Mă-lei mŭk tơmam sư đei lơi yua noh gô klah 'măn kơ Kră Yang, sư ưh kơ đei mong dah tah 'măn ôn lê̆ ôh, yua kơ tơmam đei lơi noh gô yua lăm tơmam sa, ao hrŭk 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai oei 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Behold, the LORD makes the earth empty and makes it waste, Distorts its surface And scatters abroad its inhabitants.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang gô pơrăm teh, pơm kơ teh jing juơ rơhiăng, sư gô blơ̆ pơrăm lê̆ teh đak păng pơm kơ kon pơlei tơklah tơklang.

English: And it shall be: As with the people, so with the priest; As with the servant, so with his master; As with the maid, so with her mistress; As with the buyer, so with the seller; As with the lender, so with the borrower; As with the creditor, so with the debtor.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi kư̆m thoi kon pơlei, yŏng tơ'ngla jing thoi đam sư, yă yŏng tơ'ngla kư̆m thoi đam drŏ-kăn sư, bơngai tĕch kư̆m thoi bơngai răt, bơngai ăn mưng kư̆m thoi bơngai iŏk mưng, bơngai đe hre kư̆m thoi bơngai oei hre.

English: The land shall be entirely emptied and utterly plundered, For the LORD has spoken this word.
Bahnar: Teh đak âu gô pơrăm đĭ ưh pă đei kiơ đe gô plah tơgar iŏk đĭ, yua kơ Kră Yang đei khan bơih nơ̆r 'nâu.

English: The earth mourns and fades away, The world languishes and fades away; The haughty people of the earth languish.
Bahnar: Teh đak kro krĕnh păng jô hŏnh, dêh char âu ơh sơ'ngon păng jô hŏnh, lu bơngai đe ư-ang dêh đĭ rơdu rơmơ̆n.

English: The earth is also defiled under its inhabitants, Because they have transgressed the laws, Changed the ordinance, Broken the everlasting covenant.
Bahnar: Teh đak âu jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆ mach, đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơm yoch. Ưh kơ kiơ̆ khôi juăt, pơm yoch hăm nơ̆r tơtă, pơm glăi hăm tơdrong pơgơ̆p ling-lang.

English: Therefore the curse has devoured the earth, And those who dwell in it are desolate. Therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, And few men are left.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na tơdrong hiap luăn sa teh đak. Lu kon pơlei oei kơpal teh âu, đei pơmat-tat yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih. Yua kơ noh kon bơngai oei kơpal teh ŭnh sa bơih. Păng pă tŏ sĕt đĕch bơngai oei đei.

English: The new wine fails, the vine languishes, All the merry-hearted sigh.
Bahnar: Sik hơmu 'nao đĭ hrơ̆, tơm hơmu đĭ jô kro, lu bơngai juăt đei jơhngơ̆m chơt đĭ tơtok tơtăm.

English: The mirth of the tambourine ceases, The noise of the jubilant ends, The joy of the harp ceases.
Bahnar: Re hơgơ̆r iĕ chơt hiôk ưh pă đei dơ̆ng, jreo 'nă hal ưh pă đei bơih, jơwa đe reh brŏ chơt hiôk kư̆m đĭ tôch.

English: They shall not drink wine with a song; Strong drink is bitter to those who drink it.
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m ưh pă đei et sik hơri rah dơ̆ng; lu bơngai hơmui kơ sik et sik đĭ tăng.

English: The city of confusion is broken down; Every house is shut up, so that none may go in.
Bahnar: Pơlei đei tơdrong truh pơchah đĭ bơih, rim hnam tang chơkăl lê̆ 'măng, ưh kơ đei bu gơh mơ̆t.

English: There is a cry for wine in the streets, All joy is darkened, The mirth of the land is gone.
Bahnar: Đe ôr tơ rok trong lăm pơlei yua kơ tơdrô ưh pă đei; tơdrong chơt đĭ pă đei. Tơdrong 'nă hal lăm teh đak đĭ hiong!

English: In the city desolation is left, And the gate is stricken with destruction.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei kơkot rơhiăng, 'măng jang pơchah đĭ bơih.

English: When it shall be thus in the midst of the land among the people, It shall be like the shaking of an olive tree, Like the gleaning of grapes when the vintage is done.
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung kon bơngai oei kơpal teh âu gô đei thoi noh. Nhen thoi tơm 'long ôliwơ đĭ hơlŭng đơ̆ng đe gơgŭ păng thoi đe chă mok plei hơmu đơ̆ng rŏng kơ bơyan đe phĕ plei.

English: They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing; For the majesty of the LORD They shall cry aloud from the sea.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô jreo 'nă hal đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ gah bơmơ̆t, lu sư ư-ang tơdrong hơbŏ rŏ Kră Yang.

English: Therefore glorify the LORD in the dawning light, The name of the LORD God of Israel in the coastlands of the sea.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ư-ang bĕ kơ Kră Yang ơ lu bơngai oei lăm teh đak gah hơlĕch, ư-ang bĕ kơ anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael ơ lu bơngai oei lăm lu bŏl đak dơsĭ.

English: From the ends of the earth we have heard songs: “Glory to the righteous!” But I said, “I am ruined, ruined! Woe to me! The treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously, Indeed, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.”
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng bơih đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak hơri: “Ư-ang kơ Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.” Mă-lei inh khan: “Inh hiong bơih! Inh hiong răm-'băm dêh kơ inh! Lu bơngai blơ̆ blĕch hơlĕnh pơdăr, lu bơngai blơ̆ blĕch hơlĕnh pơdăr rai dêh.

English: Fear and the pit and the snare Are upon you, O inhabitant of the earth.
Bahnar: Ơ kon bơngai oei lăm teh đak, tơdrong hli tơrơ, sơlŭng jrŭ păng poh-'năk hơnhuăl oei răp gô iĕm.

English: And it shall be That he who flees from the noise of the fear Shall fall into the pit, And he who comes up from the midst of the pit Shall be caught in the snare; For the windows from on high are open, And the foundations of the earth are shaken.
Bahnar: Bơngai ayơ kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng tơdrong hli tơrơ gô huŏng lăm sơlŭng; tŏk hlôi đơ̆ng sơlŭng gô hrơ̆p hơnhuăl, lu 'măng-'mŏk tơ kơpal plĕnh pơih lê̆ bơih, lu hơnă tơ ala teh pơpơ̆ đĭ.

English: The earth is violently broken, The earth is split open, The earth is shaken exceedingly.
Bahnar: Plei teh pơchah hĕch hoch đĭ, teh đĭ hơđang phơ̆t, teh đĭ pơpơ̆ dêh.

English: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, And shall totter like a hut; Its transgression shall be heavy upon it, And it will fall, and not rise again.
Bahnar: Plei teh tơdrŏ 'ma 'ngiĕo nhen bơngai suai, yĕng yŏng thoi pơk gia, tơdrong yoch sư trăp dêh, sư gô pơ̆k huŏng ưh kơ kĕ iung dơ̆ng.

English: It shall come to pass in that day That the LORD will punish on high the host of exalted ones, And on the earth the kings of the earth.
Bahnar: Năr noh kơnh Kră Yang gô phak lu linh jang kơnê̆ tơ kơpal plĕnh ti păng phak lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kơnê̆ lăm teh âu.

English: They will be gathered together, As prisoners are gathered in the pit, And will be shut up in the prison; After many days they will be punished.
Bahnar: Đe akŭm lu sư lăm sơlŭng păng chĭt lu sư nhen bơnă lăm hnam phak, đunh năr đe gô phak pơmat lu sư.

English: Then the moon will be disgraced And the sun ashamed; For the LORD of hosts will reign On Mount Zion and in Jerusalem And before His elders, gloriously.
Bahnar: Măt khei gô ưh pă hơđơ̆ng, măt 'năr gô kơdơ̆, Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô pơgơ̆r kơpal kông Siôn, tơ pơlei Jêrusalem păng tơdrong ư-ang rang mơnhal sư gô pơdah 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe kră.

English: O LORD, You are my God. I will exalt You, I will praise Your name, For You have done wonderful things; Your counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh! Inh ư-ang kơ Ih, inh bơnê pôk pơư kơ anăn Ih, Ih đei pơm boih tơdrong hlĭch, tơdrong Ih pơkă lê̆ đơ̆ng sơ̆, hăm tơdrong tơpăt sĭt.

English: For You have made a city a ruin, A fortified city a ruin, A palace of foreigners to be a city no more; It will never be rebuilt.
Bahnar: Ih pơm bơih kơ lơ pơlei jing anih pôi teh rơ̆m rĕk, pơlei tih kơjăp jing pơchah hĕch. Pơlei hnam kơjăp lu yŏng pơtao lu bơngai tơmoi ưh pă jing pơlei dơ̆ng bơih, ưh pă đei layơ wă gơh man tơiung ming dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore the strong people will glorify You; The city of the terrible nations will fear You.
Bahnar: Noh bơih na lu kon pơlei đơ̆ng dêh char pran kơtang gô ư-ang kơ Ih, pơlei tih lu adrĕch adrung bơngai pơm kơnê̆ krưp gô hli yom kơ Ih.

English: For You have been a strength to the poor, A strength to the needy in his distress, A refuge from the storm, A shade from the heat; For the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.
Bahnar: Ih boih Kră Yang jing anih kơjăp lu bơngai dơnuh gơnang. Pơlei hơđơ̆ng ăn kơ lu bơngai hoh kơđei kơplah năr pơmat-tat, pơm anih kơ'nơp năr kial hơbŭt, pơm yơ̆p wă huay kơ tŏ, kơplah lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ khĕnh lu sư lĕch thoi hơyuh kial hơbŭt tơthu bah tơ dur pơlei.

English: You will reduce the noise of aliens, As heat in a dry place; As heat in the shadow of a cloud, The song of the terrible ones will be diminished.
Bahnar: Thoi tŏ lăm char glă, Ih chĭt lê̆ nơ̆r ôr jơwa lu bơngai tơmoi. Ih găn lê̆ hreh nơ̆r hơri 'nă hal lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, nhen thoi hơyuh tŏ hiong kơ yơ̆p hơmơ̆l.

English: And in this mountain The LORD of hosts will make for all people A feast of choice pieces, A feast of wines on the lees, Of fat things full of marrow, Of well-refined wines on the lees.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal kông âu Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô hơmet ăn kơ rim adrĕch adrung, tơmam et sa tih. Hăm tơdrô hơmu 'lơ̆ng hloh, tơmam sa 'nhĕm rơmă bek đei 'ngăl, tơdrô hơmu 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: And He will destroy on this mountain The surface of the covering cast over all people, And the veil that is spread over all nations.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal kông âu, Sư gô pơrăm lê̆ che pĕng măt đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla păng che pĕng măt đĭ-đăng teh đak.

English: He will swallow up death forever, And the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from all faces; The rebuke of His people He will take away from all the earth; For the LORD has spoken.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơtôch lê̆ bơih tơdrong lôch hiong ling-lang, Kră Yang gô sŭt lê̆ đak măt đơ̆ng muh măt rim 'nu, păng iŏk lê̆ tơdrong mơlâu đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla Sư đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak. Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: And it will be said in that day: “Behold, this is our God; We have waited for Him, and He will save us. This is the LORD; We have waited for Him; We will be glad and rejoice in His salvation.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh, đe gô khan: “Âu bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, mă lu bơ̆n đei chang gô Sư dŏng pơklaih bơ̆n. 'Nâu bơih Kră Yang mă lu bơ̆n chang gô Sư. Bĕ lu bơ̆n 'nă hal chơt hiôk kơ tơdrong Sư dŏng pơklaih!”

English: For on this mountain the hand of the LORD will rest, And Moab shall be trampled down under Him, As straw is trampled down for the refuse heap.
Bahnar: Ti Kră Yang gô dan kơpal kông âu. Mă-lei teh đak Môap đe gô pơjuă pơđep tơ anih lu sư, thoi đe pơjuă hơnong lăm anih pơm 'mê̆.

English: And He will spread out His hands in their midst As a swimmer reaches out to swim, And He will bring down their pride Together with the trickery of their hands.
Bahnar: Mă lu sư gô pơdăng ti lu sư lăm noh, thoi bơngai glơi đak pơdăng ti sư wă glơi, mă-lei Kră Yang gô tơhuŏng lê̆ tơdrong pơang lu sư, Mă ti lu sư yơ̆r hơwơi ră.

English: The fortress of the high fort of your walls He will bring down, lay low, And bring to the ground, down to the dust.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơrăm lê̆ dur man kơjung kơjăp noh, hơlih đĭ tơ ala, bơlih tơhuŏng lê̆ tơ teh, lăm 'mui teh.

English: In that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: “We have a strong city; God will appoint salvation for walls and bulwarks.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh tơ dêh Juđa, đe gô hơri 'bai âu: Lu bơ̆n đei pơlei tih kơjăp! Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Sư pơm thoi dur pơlei kơjăp.

English: Open the gates, That the righteous nation which keeps the truth may enter in.
Bahnar: Pơih bĕ lu 'măng jang. Ăn kơ dêh char tơpăt đei đon lui tơpă mơ̆t tơ noh

English: You will keep him in perfect peace, Whose mind is stayed on You, Because he trusts in You.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon gơnang đĭ tơdrong sư tơchĕng. Kră Yang gô ăn kơ sư hiôk-hian lăm tôm tơdrong. Yua kơ sư gơnang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Trust in the LORD forever, For in YAH, the LORD, is everlasting strength.
Bahnar: Lui gơnang bĕ kơ Kră Yang ling-lang; Kră Yang jing hơgơp tơmo kơjăp ling-lang.

English: For He brings down those who dwell on high, The lofty city; He lays it low, He lays it low to the ground, He brings it down to the dust.
Bahnar: Sư tơjur lê̆ lu bơngai oei tơ kơpal, teh pơchah lê̆ bơih pơlei tih kơjăp, tơjur lê̆ lu bơngai pơang truh tơ teh, huŏng lăm 'mui teh.

English: The foot shall tread it down— The feet of the poor And the steps of the needy.”
Bahnar: Pơjuă lê̆ tơ ala jơ̆ng, lăm jơ̆ng yak lu bơngai pơmat-tat, tơpang jơ̆ng lu bơngai dơnuh hin yak.

English: The way of the just is uprightness; O Most Upright, You weigh the path of the just.
Bahnar: Trong lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt jơ̆ tơpăt, ơ Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng tơpăt, Ih pơm ăn trong kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt dơhnă hiôk.

English: Yes, in the way of Your judgments, O LORD, we have waited for You; The desire of our soul is for Your name And for the remembrance of You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, mă Ih sek tơlang kơ nhôn lu nhôn oei chang gô lăm trong Ih sek tơlang tơpăt, bơhngol lu nhôn hơpơi kơ anăn Ih păng 'blŏk hơdơ̆r.

English: With my soul I have desired You in the night, Yes, by my spirit within me I will seek You early; For when Your judgments are in the earth, The inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
Bahnar: Kơmăng bơhngol inh rơhing kơ Ih, pơgê lăm jơhngơ̆m inh hơpơi wă chă Ih dêh, mưh Ih sek tơlang tơ ala teh, kon bơngai oei lăm teh đak gô băt tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Let grace be shown to the wicked, Yet he will not learn righteousness; In the land of uprightness he will deal unjustly, And will not behold the majesty of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ pơm mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang mơnat ăn ră, kư̆m ưh kơ wă hŏk iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu sư oei pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ lăm teh đak 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, păng ưh kơ 'bôh ôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ tih-tin Kră Yang.

English: LORD, when Your hand is lifted up, they will not see. But they will see and be ashamed For their envy of people; Yes, the fire of Your enemies shall devour them.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang ti Ih yơ̆r bơih, mă-lei lu sư oei ưh kơ 'bôh, lê̆ lu sư 'bôh gô mơlâu năr Ih pơm tơ'bôh 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ kon pơlei Ih. Tơpă ŭnh mă 'măn kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ Ih gô sa lu sư.

English: LORD, You will establish peace for us, For You have also done all our works in us.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih gô pơjing tơdrong hiôk-hian ăn kơ lu nhôn. Dôm tơdrong lu nhôn pơm noh jơ̆ Ih pơm ăn kơ nhôn bơih!

English: O LORD our God, masters besides You Have had dominion over us; But by You only we make mention of Your name.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, 'nguaih kơ Ih kư̆m đei lu yŏng nai pơgơ̆r lu nhôn, Mă-lei lu nhôn gơnang kơ minh anăn Ih đĕch.

English: They are dead, they will not live; They are deceased, they will not rise. Therefore You have punished and destroyed them, And made all their memory to perish.
Bahnar: Lu sư lôch bơih ưh kơ gơh iung arih dơ̆ng, đĭ jing atâu bơih ưh kơ gơh iung dơ̆ng. Tơpă Ih phak păng pơlôch lu sư boih. Tơdrong đe 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ lu sư ih kư̆m sŭt lê̆ đĭ.

English: You have increased the nation, O LORD, You have increased the nation; You are glorified; You have expanded all the borders of the land.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih đei ăn kon bơngai dêh char âu rai lơ, Ih thim ăn kon bơngai dêh char âu rai lơ, Ih bơih đei tơdrong ư-ang, ih pơih ăn kơ hơdral teh đak nhôn rai să.

English: LORD, in trouble they have visited You, They poured out a prayer when Your chastening was upon them.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, lu sư chă Ih kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat, lu sư krao khan apinh Ih mơmơnh kơplah Ih đei phak bơtho lu sư.

English: As a woman with child Is in pain and cries out in her pangs, When she draws near the time of her delivery, So have we been in Your sight, O LORD.
Bahnar: Nhen thoi drŏ-kăn ôr kơ jĭ anăp sư wă jê̆ tơpŭ. Ơ Kră Yang, lu nhôn oei tơ anăp Ih nhen thoi noh.

English: We have been with child, we have been in pain; We have, as it were, brought forth wind; We have not accomplished any deliverance in the earth, Nor have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn đei anăp bơih, lu nhôn kư̆m oei jĭ anăp, lu nhôn tơpŭ ră nhen tơpŭ kơ kial đĕch. Lu nhôn ưh kơ ba ăn tơdrong dŏng pơklaih lăm teh đak, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh tơpŭ pơjing ăn kon bơngai lăm teh đak âu.

English: Your dead shall live; Together with my dead body they shall arise. Awake and sing, you who dwell in dust; For your dew is like the dew of herbs, And the earth shall cast out the dead.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lôch lăm Ih gô iung arih, akâu akar lôch bơih lu sư gô iung dơ̆ng. Ơ lu bơngai lăm 'mui teh iung bĕ, hiôk chơt hơri bĕ. Đak ngom Ih nhen đak ngom pơgê hrôih, teh gô tơpŭ tơlĕch lu bơngai đơ̆ng lôch bơih.

English: Come, my people, enter your chambers, And shut your doors behind you; Hide yourself, as it were, for a little moment, Until the indignation is past.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla Inh mơ̆t bĕ tơ anih ih păng tang bĕ 'măng gah rŏng ih, ôn bĕ akâu iĕm hơya tŏ sĕt năr, Dĭng truh kơ layơ tơdrong Kră Yang hil hlôi đĭ.

English: For behold, the LORD comes out of His place To punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity; The earth will also disclose her blood, And will no more cover her slain.
Bahnar: Lăng to, Kră Yang lĕch đơ̆ng anih Sư jur wă phak kon bơngai oei kơpal teh âu, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư. Kơplah noh kơnh teh gô pơdah tơ'bôh pham đêl lu đe pơlôch păng ưh kơ gơh ôn dơ̆ng lu bơngai đêl đe pơlôch.

English: In that day the LORD with His severe sword, great and strong, Will punish Leviathan the fleeing serpent, Leviathan that twisted serpent; And He will slay the reptile that is in the sea.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, Kră Yang gô yua đao gưm arăng, Tih păng pran kơtang wă phak: Lêwiathan jơ̆ 'bih hơbĕch hơbal, phak Lêwiathan jơ̆ 'bih đŏng đĕo păng Sư gô pơlôch kơ-nang-grai lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: In that day sing to her, “A vineyard of red wine!
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh “hơri bĕ kơ pơgar hơmu đei sik hơmu 'lơ̆ng.

English: I, the LORD, keep it, I water it every moment; Lest any hurt it, I keep it night and day.
Bahnar: Inh bơih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla wei-lăng sư, gô ruh đak kơ sư ling-lang, păng inh wei-lăng sư măng năr kơnh hli kơ đe pơrăm sư.

English: Fury is not in Me. Who would set briers and thorns Against Me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ hil ôh mă-lei tơdah sư đei jơla bơmrôm păng lu jơla hro 'bơ̆t anăp Inh. Inh gô blah lu sư, Inh gô soh lu sư lăm ŭnh hơdai.

English: Or let him take hold of My strength, That he may make peace with Me; And he shall make peace with Me.”
Bahnar: Dah lu sư gơnang kơ Inh bơwei, ngôi hiôk-hian hăm Inh” tơpă pơm hiôk-hian hăm Inh.”

English: Those who come He shall cause to take root in Jacob; Israel shall blossom and bud, And fill the face of the world with fruit.
Bahnar: Lăm Chăl đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp kơnh đe Jakôp sư gô chăt rơh, Isơrael gô bluh tơ'biĕng păng pơkao, gô đei plei 'bĕnh jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: Has He struck Israel as He struck those who struck him? Or has He been slain according to the slaughter of those who were slain by Him?
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm teh lu sư thoi Kră Yang đei teh bơih lu bơngai teh lu sư ưh? Đah hăm pơlôch lu sư, thoi bơngai mă pơlôch lu sư ưh?

English: In measure, by sending it away, You contended with it. He removes it by His rough wind In the day of the east wind.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh lăm tơdrong Ih phak lu sư dă 'biơ̆ na puh lu sư năm tơ nai, Ih yua kial tih pơpuh lê̆ lu sư tơ ataih, thoi lăm năr đei kial bah đơ̆ng hơlĕch.

English: Therefore by this the iniquity of Jacob will be covered; And this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: When he makes all the stones of the altar Like chalkstones that are beaten to dust, Wooden images and incense altars shall not stand.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, đơ̆ng tơdrong âu na tơdrong yoch Jakôp gơh mơnat ăn; păng 'nâu jơ̆ lĕch đơ̆ng tơdrong sŭt lê̆ tơdrong yoch sư, layơ sư teh lê̆ tơmo chơnang soi pơchah hĕch nhen tơmo chŭr, ưh pă đei rup yang Asêrim păng chơnang soh 'long 'bâu phu kơ yang nai dơ̆ng.

English: Yet the fortified city will be desolate, The habitation forsaken and left like a wilderness; There the calf will feed, and there it will lie down And consume its branches.
Bahnar: Pơlei tih kơjăp đĭ jing juơ bơih, anih đêl pơlei đĭ jing juơ, đĭ hiong hiơt 'biao nhen thoi teh char glă, tơ noh kon rơmo sa 'nhĕt; lu sư 'bĭch păng sa lu dơng 'long tơ noh.

English: When its boughs are withered, they will be broken off; The women come and set them on fire. For it is a people of no understanding; Therefore He who made them will not have mercy on them, And He who formed them will show them no favor.
Bahnar: Mưh lu dơng sư kro păng tơgơ̆ hơlŭng, lu drŏ-kăn dônh chĕp ba pơm hơpaih. Kon pơlei âu ưh kơ hlôh ôh, na Tơ'ngla mă pơjing lu sư ưh kơ 'blŏk mơnat, Tơ'ngla man pơjing lu sư ưh kơ tơ'bôh ăn tơdrong hiôk kơ lu sư.

English: And it shall come to pass in that day That the LORD will thresh, From the channel of the River to the Brook of Egypt; And you will be gathered one by one, O you children of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh Kră Yang preh ba đơ̆ng đak Krong Ơphrat truh tơ glung đak Êyiptơ, ơ kon pơlei Isơrael đe gô chă dônh iĕm minh 'nu, minh 'nu.

English: So it shall be in that day: The great trumpet will be blown; They will come, who are about to perish in the land of Assyria, And they who are outcasts in the land of Egypt, And shall worship the LORD in the holy mount at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh đe gô hlôm tơgiĕp re tih: Kơplah noh lu bơngai wơ̆l jrok lăm dêh Asiri păng lu bơngai pơm đĭch đam đơ̆ng Êyiptơ, gô brŏk kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ kơpal kông rơgoh 'lơ̆ng tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, Whose glorious beauty is a fading flower Which is at the head of the verdant valleys, To those who are overcome with wine!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh hơgăl pơkao lu bơngai suai tơdrô lăm dêh Êphraim pơang răm-'băm dêh kơ pơkao 'bônh kơ jô hŏnh; lu bơngai suai tơdrô ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ pơlei noh oei tơ kơ̆l groi thŭng teh mơ̆r!

English: Behold, the Lord has a mighty and strong one, Like a tempest of hail and a destroying storm, Like a flood of mighty waters overflowing, Who will bring them down to the earth with His hand.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Kră Yang đei minh 'nu bơngai pran kơtang. Nhen thoi kial hơbŭt 'mi prĕl, nhen kial bah pơrăm, nhen đak tih blai kơ thong. Sư gô klơ̆m tơhuŏng lê̆ sư tơ teh.

English: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, Will be trampled underfoot
Bahnar: Hơgăl pơkao pơang lu bơngai suai tơdrô lăm char Êphraim đe gô pơjuă tơ ala jơ̆ng.

English: And the glorious beauty is a fading flower Which is at the head of the verdant valley, Like the first fruit before the summer, Which an observer sees; He eats it up while it is still in his hand.
Bahnar: Pơkao 'lơ̆ng 'bônh kơ jô hŏnh, Tơdrong ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư oei tơ kơ̆l groi anih thŭng teh mơ̆r, kư̆m gô nhen thoi plei hơra đum adrol kơ bơyan phang, đe 'bôh plei sư, ti đe phĕ sa hloi.

English: In that day the LORD of hosts will be For a crown of glory and a diadem of beauty To the remnant of His people
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh kơnh Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô jing thoi hơgăl pơkao rang mơnhal, păng hơgăl pơkao 'lơ̆ng rŏ kơ lu kon pơlei Sư mă oei oei.

English: For a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, And for strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.
Bahnar: Sư bơih ăn kơ lu bơngai sek tơlang đei yŏng tơpăt păng ăn jơhngơ̆m nuih pran kơ lu bơngai wă blah tơweh lu ayăt đơ̆ng 'măng jang.

English: But they also have erred through wine, And through intoxicating drink are out of the way; The priest and the prophet have erred through intoxicating drink, They are swallowed up by wine, They are out of the way through intoxicating drink; They err in vision, they stumble in judgment.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu đe noh kư̆m wing măt yua kơ sik hơmu pơm. Nơnăm 'ma 'ngiĕo yua kơ suai kơ tơdrô 'lơ̆ng! 'Bok soi păng 'bok khan lê̆ adrol wing măt yua kơ suai kơ tơdrô 'lơ̆ng, tơdrô pơrăm đĭ đon tơchĕng lu sư, tơdrô pơm kơ lu sư yak năm we-wo 'ma 'ngiĕo oei mơngưt mơngat kơplah lu sư đei tơdrong tơ'bôh. Lu sư glăi lăm tơdrong sek tơlang.

English: For all tables are full of vomit and filth; No place is clean.
Bahnar: Lu sư hăk 'bĕnh kơ gơ'bang sŏng sa, ưh kơ đei 'bơ̆t ayơ rơgoh!

English: “Whom will he teach knowledge? And whom will he make to understand the message? Those just weaned from milk? Those just drawn from the breasts?
Bahnar: “Na sư gô bơtho tơdrong gơh hơgei ăn kơ bu, sư gô tơblang kơ bu nơ̆r sư pơma? Hăm trŏ bơtho ăn kơ lu nge 'nao lê̆ mŏm, 'nao achăng đơ̆ng toh hă?

English: For precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept, Line upon line, line upon line, Here a little, there a little.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: Pơm păng pơm bĕ, pơm păng pơm dơ̆ng, tơdrong juăt 'nâu tơdrong juăt noh. Tŏ sĕt tơ âu, tŏ sĕt tơ to!

English: For with stammering lips and another tongue He will speak to this people
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang gô yua 'bơ̆r lu bơngai 'nguaih pơma păng nơ̆r hlĭch pơma kơ lu kon pơlei pơla âu.

English: To whom He said, “This is the rest with which You may cause the weary to rest,” And, “This is the refreshing”; Yet they would not hear.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơma khan kơ lu sư: “'Nâu anih pơdơh, ăn bĕ kơ lu bơngai lap gleh pơdơh, 'nâu anih pơdơh hiôk-hian, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng.

English: But the word of the LORD was to them, “Precept upon precept, precept upon precept, Line upon line, line upon line, Here a little, there a little,” That they might go and fall backward, and be broken And snared and caught.
Bahnar: Na nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma kơ lu sư: Pơm păng pơm bĕ, pơm păng pơm dơ̆ng, tơdrong juăt 'nâu tơdrong juăt noh Tŏ sĕt tơ âu, tŏ sĕt tơ to, wă lu sư yak truh pơ̆k hraih đang, păng jĭ rơka, 'leh hơđong păng đe rôp ba!

English: Therefore hear the word of the LORD, you scornful men, Who rule this people who are in Jerusalem
Bahnar: Na mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan. Ơ lu bơngai juăt kơ pơjăm đe, lu bơngai pơgơ̆r kon pơlei âu lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Because you have said, “We have made a covenant with death, And with Sheol we are in agreement. When the overflowing scourge passes through, It will not come to us, For we have made lies our refuge, And under falsehood we have hidden ourselves.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơma pơrŏ khan: “Lu nhôn pơgơ̆p bơih hăm tơdrong lôch, păng pơgơ̆p hăm dêh atâu, Tơdah tơdrong anat anot gô truh, ưh kơ 'bơm lu nhôn ôh. Lu nhôn yua tơdrong pơma hơlĕnh pơm anih nhôn kơ'nơp. Păng pơma bơkuĕch hơlĕnh wă kơdâu ôn.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I lay in Zion a stone for a foundation, A tried stone, a precious cornerstone, a sure foundation; Whoever believes will not act hastily.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Inh dan tơ Siôn minh pôm tơmo tih, minh pôm tơmo đe pơlong lăng bơih, jơ̆ tơmo mum hnam gĭt kăl dêh, pơm hơnă jrăng kơjăp, bu lui gơnang jơhngơ̆m sư gô huay kơ hli ôh.

English: Also I will make justice the measuring line, And righteousness the plummet; The hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, And the waters will overflow the hiding place.
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng pơm tơlei pơtŏ, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt pơm 'long hơgăt, 'mi prĕl gô pơrăm lê̆ anih pơma hơlĕnh lu iĕm ôn kơ'nơp, đak gô lơ̆p lê̆ iĕm lu sư wă kơdâu klĕnh.

English: Your covenant with death will be annulled, And your agreement with Sheol will not stand; When the overflowing scourge passes through, Then you will be trampled down by it.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh tơdrong pơgơ̆p lu iĕm hăm tơdrong lôch gô ưh pă đei, tơdrong lu iĕm pơgơ̆p hăm dêh atâu gô ưh pă đei, tơdah tơdrong anat anot truh 'bĕnh-'bang sư pơrăm lu iĕm, lu iĕm răm đĭ.

English: As often as it goes out it will take you; For morning by morning it will pass over, And by day and by night; It will be a terror just to understand the report.”
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t tơdrong anat anot truh, sư gô rôp ba lu iĕm tơ nai, sư gô truh, rim pơgê hrôih, kơ'năr kư̆m thoi kơmăng. Lu iĕm gô hli tơrơ dêh dah hlôh băt kơ nơ̆r bơtho noh.

English: For the bed is too short to stretch out on, And the covering so narrow that one cannot wrap himself in it.
Bahnar: Thoi giơng kơđeh dêh 'bĭch yon ưh kơmah, thoi khăn iĕ dêh su ưh kơtăp.

English: For the LORD will rise up as at Mount Perazim, He will be angry as in the Valley of Gibeon— That He may do His work, His awesome work, And bring to pass His act, His unusual act.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô iung pơm thoi Sư pơm tơ kông Parêsim, Sư gô hil thoi tơ thŭng Gibeôn, wă pơm tơdrong jang Sư, jơ̆ tơdrong jang hơnat păng pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp.

English: Now therefore, do not be mockers, Lest your bonds be made strong; For I have heard from the Lord GOD of hosts, A destruction determined even upon the whole earth.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na iĕm 'nĕ pă pơjăm, kơnh hli kơ glang chô̆ iĕm gơhret rai kơjăp, inh kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơkă wă pơrăm đĭ dêh char 'nâu.

English: Give ear and hear my voice, Listen and hear my speech.
Bahnar: Pơđêng đon, mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh bĕ, kơchăng, mơ̆ng nơ̆r inh bĕ!
