English: Does the plowman keep plowing all day to sow? Does he keep turning his soil and breaking the clods?
Bahnar: Bơngai choh chŭn, wă rei adrĕch 'ba hăm trŏ hrăn choh hơnơ̆ng hloi? Hăm trŏ choh pơjuă hĕch bơih na hrăn nŏng kơ 'bơ?

English: When he has leveled its surface, Does he not sow the black cummin And scatter the cummin, Plant the wheat in rows, The barley in the appointed place, And the spelt in its place?
Bahnar: Tơdah choh hơmet dơnă 'lơ̆ng bơih, hăm trŏ kơ sư săi adrĕch găr hla ngo tơ âu, na rei adrĕch ba rơngâu tơ to? Hăm trŏ kơ sư pơtăm 'ba mi kiơ̆ trong rơuơ păng pơtăm 'ba tơ'bâu tơ anih sư păng 'ba nai tơ lăm mir sư dah kiơ?

English: For He instructs him in right judgment, His God teaches him.
Bahnar: Noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơtho kơ sư păng pơhrăm ăn kơ sư pơm trŏ.

English: For the black cummin is not threshed with a threshing sledge, Nor is a cartwheel rolled over the cummin; But the black cummin is beaten out with a stick, And the cummin with a rod.
Bahnar: Đe ưh kơ yua mut wă teh pơhĕch găr hla ngo, kư̆m ưh kơ yua tang-wang gre aseh pơjuă găr rơngâu noh. Mă-lei đe preh găr hla ngo noh hăm 'long, păng rơngâu hăm 'long mơ̆n.

English: Bread flour must be ground; Therefore he does not thresh it forever, Break it with his cartwheel, Or crush it with his horsemen.
Bahnar: Đe peh 'ba mi pơm 'bĕng, 'ba mi noh đe rŏl mă-lei đe ưh kơ preh sư hơnơ̆ng ôh, mă đơ̆ng tang-wang gre aseh dah jơ̆ng aseh juă găr sư, mă-lei găr sư ưh kơ hĕch ôh.

English: This also comes from the LORD of hosts, Who is wonderful in counsel and excellent in guidance.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh kư̆m lĕch đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh, tơdrong tơchĕng Sư hlĭch chrơp dêh tơdrong gơh hơgei Sư 'lơ̆ng tih tơpă.

English: “Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt! Add year to year; Let feasts come around.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ pơlei Ariêl, pơlei Ariêl jơ̆ pơlei Đawit pơm anih sư oei, sơnăm âu truh kơ sơnăm nai thim dơ̆ng. Ăn kơ tơdrong iĕm akŭm tih đei dăr wơwĭr hơnơ̆ng.

English: Yet I will distress Ariel; There shall be heaviness and sorrow, And it shall be to Me as Ariel.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ pơlei Ariêl pơmat-tat; gô đei nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon, hăm Inh pơlei Ariêl gô nhen thoi chơnang soi pơyơ̆r.

English: I will encamp against you all around, I will lay siege against you with a mound, And I will raise siegeworks against you.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm anih wang tăp dăr kơ ih, pơjing kơđông wang ih, pơm anih blah ih.

English: You shall be brought down, You shall speak out of the ground; Your speech shall be low, out of the dust; Your voice shall be like a medium’s, out of the ground; And your speech shall whisper out of the dust.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơjur lê̆ ih tơ ala, ih gô pơma đơ̆ng ala teh sŭng, nơ̆r ih pơma thơ-thâm lĕch đơ̆ng lăm 'mui teh, thoi nơ̆r hơtâu nơ̆r ih pơma klĕch đơ̆ng lăm teh re thoi nơ̆r pơma sôm mơrôm

English: “Moreover the multitude of your foes Shall be like fine dust, And the multitude of the terrible ones Like chaff that passes away; Yes, it shall be in an instant, suddenly.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu đe ayăt kơ ih lơlap nhen 'bruih 'mui teh rơpŭk, lu đe pơm kơnê̆ dêh gô nhen hơkam 'ba kial bơbơ̆t, tơdrong noh gô truh ngei ngei ưh kơ tam băt ôh.

English: You will be punished by the LORD of hosts With thunder and earthquake and great noise, With storm and tempest And the flame of devouring fire.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô yua grơ̆m glaih, teh pơpơ̆, jơwa re, păng pla ŭnh soh phak lu sư.

English: The multitude of all the nations who fight against Ariel, Even all who fight against her and her fortress, And distress her, Shall be as a dream of a night vision.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng teh đak lơlap lơlang bơngai năm blah pơlei Ariêl, đĭ-đăng năm wang blah pơlei kơjăp sư pơm kơ sư ơh sơ'ngon nhen apo, nhen tơdrong tơ'bôh kơplah kơmăng.

English: It shall even be as when a hungry man dreams, And look—he eats; But he awakes, and his soul is still empty; Or as when a thirsty man dreams, And look—he drinks; But he awakes, and indeed he is faint, And his soul still craves: So the multitude of all the nations shall be, Who fight against Mount Zion.”
Bahnar: Nhen thoi bơngai pơngot tep apo 'bôh sŏng sa, 'brĕng hơđơ̆r mă oei pơngot đĕch, nhen bơngai rơhing kơ đak tep apo nhă đak, 'brĕng iung mơn oei kro hơlŏng păng oei rơhing đĕch, đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung kon bơngai rim kơ teh đak blah kông Siôn kư̆m thoi noh.

English: Pause and wonder! Blind yourselves and be blind! They are drunk, but not with wine; They stagger, but not with intoxicating drink.
Bahnar: Kơdrăt bĕ, hli tơrơ bĕ, măt iĕm tol păng pă 'bôh! Suai bĕ, mă-lei ưh kơ suai đơ̆ng tơdrô hơmu, nơnăm we-wo 'ma 'ngiĕo ưh kơ sĭ đơ̆ng huch tơdrô 'lơ̆ng ôh.

English: For the LORD has poured out on you The spirit of deep sleep, And has closed your eyes, namely, the prophets; And He has covered your heads, namely, the seers.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơm bơih kơ lu iĕm tep blêk, chĭt lê̆ măt lu iĕm, jơ̆ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, Kră Yang gom kơ̆l lu iĕm bơngai mă đei tơdrong tơ'bôh.

English: The whole vision has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one who is literate, saying, “Read this, please.” And he says, “I cannot, for it is sealed.”
Bahnar: Noh jing tôm tơdrong tơ'bôh kơ iĕm 'nâu, nhen thoi nơ̆r pơma lăm sơ̆p hla bơar mă đe chĭt đơ̆p lê̆ bơih. Tơdah ăn kơ bơngai gơh đŏk na khan: “Apinh ih đŏk lăng hla bơar âu!” Na sư gô tơl tơwih: “Inh ưh kơ gơh kơ đŏk yua kơ sơ̆p hla bơar âu đe chĭt đơ̆p lê̆ bơih.”

English: Then the book is delivered to one who is illiterate, saying, “Read this, please.” And he says, “I am not literate.”
Bahnar: Dah mă ih ăn kơ bơngai ưh kơ gơh đŏk na khan: “Apinh ih đŏk sơ̆p hla bơar âu,” Na sư tơl khan: “Inh ưh kơ băt kơ đŏk.”

English: Therefore the Lord said: “Inasmuch as these people draw near with their mouths And honor Me with their lips, But have removed their hearts far from Me, And their fear toward Me is taught by the commandment of men
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Kon pơlei âu năm jê̆ Inh hăm 'bơ̆r lu sư đĕch; kơkuh kơ Inh hăm hơkŭng, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m lu sư ataih đơ̆ng Inh. Tơdrong lu sư hli yom kơ Inh jơ̆ kiơ̆ tơdrong tơtă kon bơngai đĕch păng đơ̆ng kon bơngai bơtho ăn.

English: Therefore, behold, I will again do a marvelous work Among this people, A marvelous work and a wonder; For the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, And the understanding of their prudent men shall be hidden.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh Inh gô pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp kơ kon pơlei âu, đơ̆ng tơdrong hlĭch âu truh tơdrong hlĭch nai. Tơdrong hlôh băt lu bơngai hlôh băt ưh pă yua kiơ, tơdrong hơgei lu bơngai hơgei gô hiong tôch.

English: Woe to those who seek deep to hide their counsel far from the LORD, And their works are in the dark; They say, “Who sees us?” and, “Who knows us?”
Bahnar: Răm dêh kơ lu bơngai ôn kơ Kră Yang tơdrong lu sư pơđâu, tơdrong jang lu sư pơm oei lăm măng mu păng lu sư khan: Bu 'bôh bơ̆n? Bu băt kơ bơ̆n?

English: Surely you have things turned around! Shall the potter be esteemed as the clay; For shall the thing made say of him who made it, “He did not make me”? Or shall the thing formed say of him who formed it, “He has no understanding”?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm plơ̆ plĕch dêh, liơ iĕm lăng bơngai man, nhen thoi teh lơ̆n sư man? Tơmam sư man hăm gơh pơma kơ tơ'ngla man sư khan: Ih ưh kơ man inh ôh, dah khan kơ bơngai man. “Ih ưh kơ hlôh ôh.”

English: Is it not yet a very little while Till Lebanon shall be turned into a fruitful field, And the fruitful field be esteemed as a forest?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ Pă 'biơ̆ kơ âu Liban gô jing chŭn mir teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng, păng chŭn teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng noh gô jing thoi bri brah?

English: In that day the deaf shall hear the words of the book, And the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh lu bơngai klĭk gô kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar; măt lu bơngai tol đơ̆ng lăm măng mu gô lăng 'bôh.

English: The humble also shall increase their joy in the LORD, And the poor among men shall rejoice In the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai răm-'băm gô thim tơdrong chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang, lu bơngai dơnuh hin gô 'nă hal lăm Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đe Isơrael.

English: For the terrible one is brought to nothing, The scornful one is consumed, And all who watch for iniquity are cut off
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ gô lôch đĭ, lu bơngai che bơle pơjăm đe gô lôch hiong đĭ, lu bơngai răp pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ gô kăl tơpăk đĭ.

English: Who make a man an offender by a word, And lay a snare for him who reproves in the gate, And turn aside the just by empty words.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai chă yua 'bơ̆r pơma sơlam hơlĕnh pơm kơ đe yoch, chă pơma sơlam hơlĕnh kơ lu kră sek tơlang. Chă roi pơma sơlam hơlĕnh kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt mă ưh kơ đei yoch gô lôch đĭ.

English: Therefore thus says the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: “Jacob shall not now be ashamed, Nor shall his face now grow pale
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang, tơ'ngla huai iŏk Abraham đei pơma kơ adrĕch adrung Jakôp thoi âu: “Muh măt lu sư huay pă găm goi păng huay pă mơlâu dơ̆ng

English: But when he sees his children, The work of My hands, in his midst, They will hallow My name, And hallow the Holy One of Jacob, And fear the God of Israel.
Bahnar: Mưh lu sư 'bôh lu kon hơ'lơ̆p sư, jơ̆ tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti Inh pơm kơ lu sư, lu sư gô pôk pơyom kơ anăn Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh băt pơyom kơ Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Jakôp, păng gô hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael.

English: These also who erred in spirit will come to understanding, And those who complained will learn doctrine.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai đei đon tơchĕng wơ̆l glăi gô jing gơh hlôh, păng lu bơngai juăt kơ tơtok sư gô pơhrăm iŏk tơdrong đe bơtho.”

English: “Woe to the rebellious children,” says the LORD, “Who take counsel, but not of Me, And who devise plans, but not of My Spirit, That they may add sin to sin
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p arăng kơ̆l 'maih chă đon mă ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong Inh wă, pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă ưh kơ đơ̆ng Yang bơhngol 'lơ̆ng Inh, thim tơdrong yoch rai dêh dơ̆ng.

English: Who walk to go down to Egypt, And have not asked My advice, To strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, And to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh tam mă apinh Inh, mă đĭ jur năm bơih tơ dêh char Êyiptơ, wă gơnang kơ Pharaôn bơwei dŏng lu sư, păng kơ'nơp lăm yơ̆p Êyiptơ!

English: Therefore the strength of Pharaoh Shall be your shame, And trust in the shadow of Egypt Shall be your humiliation.
Bahnar: Thoi noh tơdrong Pharaôn dŏng bơwei gô pơm kơ lu iĕm mơlâu, anih ôn kơ'nơp lăm yơ̆p Êyiptơ gô jing tơdrong đe pơjăm lu iĕm.

English: For his princes were at Zoan, And his ambassadors came to Hanes.
Bahnar: Mă khan lu bơngai pơgơ̆r sư truh bơih tơ pơlei Sôan, lu bơngai tơplih măt char lu sư truh tơ pơlei Hanês.

English: They were all ashamed of a people who could not benefit them, Or be help or benefit, But a shame and also a reproach.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư gô mơlâu yua kơ minh adrĕch adrung, ưh kơ đei yua kiơ kơ lu sư, ưh kơ đei tơgŭm kư̆m ưh kơ đei lơi yua mă-lei pơm kơ lu sư mơlâu păng đe pơjăm.

English: The burden against the beasts of the South. Through a land of trouble and anguish, From which came the lioness and lion, The viper and fiery flying serpent, They will carry their riches on the backs of young donkeys, And their treasures on the humps of camels, To a people who shall not profit
Bahnar: Nơ̆r khan lê̆ adrol gah lu sem bri brah tơ Negeu. Lăm dêh anat anot pơmat-tat, dêh char lu dăm-brang tơno, dăm-brang akăn, 'bih bôm, 'bih ŭnh păr. Lu sư chơ mŭk tơmam lu sư tơ kơpal aseh iĕ, chơ tơmam gĭt tơ kơdŭ aseh lăk-đa, wă ăn tơ minh adrĕch adrung mă ưh kơ đei yua kiơ kơ lu sư.

English: For the Egyptians shall help in vain and to no purpose. Therefore I have called her Rahab-Hem-Shebeth.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lu bơngai Êyiptơ tơgŭm jơ̆ tơdrong ưh kơ yua, na Inh anăn sư Rahap, wă khan bơngai oei minh 'bôt ưh kơ pơm kiơ.

English: Now go, write it before them on a tablet, And note it on a scroll, That it may be for time to come, Forever and ever
Bahnar: Năm bĕ dang ei chih ăn kơ lu sư nơ̆r âu tơ gơ'bang, chih tơmơ̆t nơ̆r noh tơ lăm sơnôm hla bơar, wă roi tơbăt kơ chăl đơ̆ng rŏng ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: That this is a rebellious people, Lying children, Children who will not hear the law of the LORD
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung âu jơ̆ adrĕch adrung blơ̆ blĕch, kon hơlĕnh, kon adrĕch ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho khan.

English: Who say to the seers, “Do not see,” And to the prophets, “Do not prophesy to us right things; Speak to us smooth things, prophesy deceits.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ lu bơngai đei tơdrong tơ'bôh: “'Nĕ pă 'bôh;” khan kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol: “'Nĕ pă khan lê̆ adrol kơ lu nhôn gah tơdrong sĭt. Pơma roi bĕ kơ lu nhôn tơdrong nhôn lăp đon chơt, roi bĕ kơ lu nhôn tơdrong 'bôh ưh kơ đei tơpă.

English: Get out of the way, Turn aside from the path, Cause the Holy One of Israel To cease from before us.”
Bahnar: Weh bĕ trong nai, tơklah bĕ đơ̆ng trong noh lê̆ pă roi gah Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh đe Isơrael, weh bĕ đơ̆ng muh măt lu nhôn.”

English: Therefore thus says the Holy One of Israel: “Because you despise this word, And trust in oppression and perversity, And rely on them
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh đe Isơrael pơma khan: “Yua kơ lu iĕm sơngah achăng lê̆ nơ̆r âu, gơnang kơ tơdrong pơjuă pơđep, gơnang kơ tơdrong đŏng đĕo.

English: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you Like a breach ready to fall, A bulge in a high wall, Whose breaking comes suddenly, in an instant.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong yoch lu iĕm nhen thoi dur kơjung đĭ hơđang pơchah wă jê̆ păk păng gô hơlih răm hĕch hoch, ưh kơ tam băt.

English: And He shall break it like the breaking of the potter’s vessel, Which is broken in pieces; He shall not spare. So there shall not be found among its fragments A shard to take fire from the hearth, Or to take water from the cistern.”
Bahnar: Sư gô pơchah hĕch nhen thoi bô̆i teh ưh pă 'mêm, lu kơcheh sư pơchah mah pă gơh dônh, yua wă tŏng ngar ŭnh đơ̆ng tơnuh, dah mă chhŏng iŏk đak đơ̆ng sơlŭng.”

English: For thus says the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel: “In returning and rest you shall be saved; In quietness and confidence shall be your strength.” But you would not
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh đe Isơrael khan: “Lu iĕm gơh klaih đơ̆ng lu iĕm wơ̆t brŏk dơ̆ng păng pơdơh lăm Inh. Lu iĕm gô đei jơhngơ̆m pran, yua kơ lu iĕm oei hơđơ̆ng păng gơnang kơ Inh. Mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă kơ thoi noh.

English: And you said, “No, for we will flee on horses”— Therefore you shall flee! And, “We will ride on swift horses”— Therefore those who pursue you shall be swift!
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: ‘Ưh, lu nhôn gô hao aseh chă kơdâu klĕnh’ trŏ bơih na lu iĕm gô kơdâu klĕnh. ‘Lu iĕm khan lu nhôn hao aseh kơdâu hrĕnh,’ na lu bơngai druh iĕm kư̆m gô kơdâu hrĕnh mơ̆n!

English: One thousand shall flee at the threat of one, At the threat of five you shall flee, Till you are left as a pole on top of a mountain And as a banner on a hill.
Bahnar: Minh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai kơdâu ôn Minh 'nu bơngai ayăt tơhli, pơđăm 'nu bơngai ayăt tơhli đĭ dang lu iĕm kơdâu ôn, Dĭng truh oei pă minh 'bar 'nu nhen thoi minh pôm jrăng kơ kơpal kơ̆l kông, nhen thoi hla-kơ hơtol kơpal groi.

English: Therefore the LORD will wait, that He may be gracious to you; And therefore He will be exalted, that He may have mercy on you. For the LORD is a God of justice; Blessed are all those who wait for Him.
Bahnar: Mă tơpă, Kră Yang oei gô wă pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu iĕm, Tơpă Sư gô 'mêm mơnat kơ lu iĕm. Kră Yang jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Pŭn hiôk dêh kơ bơngai bu oei chang gô Sư!

English: For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem; You shall weep no more. He will be very gracious to you at the sound of your cry; When He hears it, He will answer you.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla oei lăm Siôn, lu bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, lu iĕm huay pă nhơ̆m hmoi dơ̆ng bơih. Mưh iĕm krao, sĭt Sư gô mơnat. Mưh kơtơ̆ng lu iĕm krao, Sư gô tơl hloi.

English: And though the Lord gives you The bread of adversity and the water of affliction, Yet your teachers will not be moved into a corner anymore, But your eyes shall see your teachers.
Bahnar: Mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn kơ lu iĕm pơmat-tat păng ơh sơ'ngon thoi por sŏng đak nhă ră, mă-lei Tơ'ngla pơhrăm lu iĕm Sư ưh pă gơh ôn akâu sư hlơp bơih, măt lu iĕm gô 'bôh Tơ'ngla pơhrăm lu iĕm.

English: Your ears shall hear a word behind you, saying, “This is the way, walk in it,” Whenever you turn to the right hand Or whenever you turn to the left.
Bahnar: Mă lu iĕm weh gah 'ma dah gah 'ngiĕo, đon lu iĕm gô kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng rŏng lu iĕm khan: “Âu jơ̆ trong mă lu iĕm athei rok kiơ̆!”

English: You will also defile the covering of your images of silver, And the ornament of your molded images of gold. You will throw them away as an unclean thing; You will say to them, “Get away!”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô tŭk hŭt lê̆ rup iĕm traih lom hăm hu păng rup man bah hăm maih, na lu iĕm klơ̆m lê̆ sư tơ ataih thoi tơmam 'mê̆-'mach. Păng khan: “Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng anih âu!”

English: Then He will give the rain for your seed With which you sow the ground, And bread of the increase of the earth; It will be fat and plentiful. In that day your cattle will feed In large pastures.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô ăn 'mi jur tơ adrĕch iĕm rei tơ mir chŭn, tơmam sŏng sa 'lơ̆ng đei đơ̆ng mir chŭn păng mah rơkah rơkai, lăm năr noh sem dơrong iĕm gô sa 'nhĕt 'lơ̆p bluh đơ̆ng tơmăn glă.

English: Likewise the oxen and the young donkeys that work the ground Will eat cured fodder, Which has been winnowed with the shovel and fan.
Bahnar: Rơmo păng aseh iĕ choh chŭn, gô sa hơnong 'ba 'lơ̆ng mă đơ̆ng đe sơ̆k tơraih hăm chơkrơ, gơ'bênh bơih.

English: There will be on every high mountain And on every high hill Rivers and streams of waters, In the day of the great slaughter, When the towers fall.
Bahnar: Truh kơ năr 'bet pơlôch băl tih, kơplah noh lu kơđông tih kơjăp pơchah, tơ rim kông kơjung rim groi gô đei lu glung đak ro.

English: Moreover the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun, And the light of the sun will be sevenfold, As the light of seven days, In the day that the LORD binds up the bruise of His people And heals the stroke of their wound.
Bahnar: Măt khei gô hơdah rang nhen hơdah măt 'năr păng tơdrong hơdah măt 'năr gô hơdah hloh tơpơh wơ̆t, thoi tơdrong hơdah kơ tơpơh năr, lăm năr Kră Yang ming rơka jĭ kon pơlei Sư păng ming hơmet pơklaih đêl rơka Sư teh.

English: Behold, the name of the LORD comes from afar, Burning with His anger, And His burden is heavy; His lips are full of indignation, And His tongue like a devouring fire.
Bahnar: To Anăn Kră Yang truh đơ̆ng ataih, tơdrong sư hil khơ̆ng thoi ŭnh 'nhui ŭnh bluh găm suek puăn pah, hơkŭng Sư 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong hil, hơpiĕt Sư thoi kơ ŭnh dơhlông sa.

English: His breath is like an overflowing stream, Which reaches up to the neck, To sift the nations with the sieve of futility; And there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people, Causing them to err.
Bahnar: Hơyuh Sư dui jơhngơ̆m thoi glung lơ̆p blai truh tơ ako, Sư wă um pơliĕng rim teh đak hăm tơdrong pơrăm păng sư yua dam pơhơ̆p tơ kon pơlei păng ba lu sư năm trong jrok.

English: You shall have a song As in the night when a holy festival is kept, And gladness of heart as when one goes with a flute, To come into the mountain of the LORD, To the Mighty One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô hơri thoi lăm măng iĕm pơm giĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk thoi bơngai hlôm 'lal tŏk tơ kông Kră Yang, truh tơ Tơmo Tih đe Isơrael.

English: The LORD will cause His glorious voice to be heard, And show the descent of His arm, With the indignation of His anger And the flame of a devouring fire, With scattering, tempest, and hailstones.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơm ăn kơ đe kơtơ̆ng jơwa nơ̆r rŏ krưp Sư, Sư gô tơ'bôh kơ đe kơkŏng ti Sư tơjur, lăm tơdrong Sư hil mĭl, thoi kơ ŭnh dơhlông sa, thoi kial hơbŭt, thoi 'mi prĕl.

English: For through the voice of the LORD Assyria will be beaten down, As He strikes with the rod.
Bahnar: Asiri gô kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang na hli tơtơ̆, Sư gô teh Asiri hăm sơnguĕt.

English: And in every place where the staff of punishment passes, Which the LORD lays on him, It will be with tambourines and harps; And in battles of brandishing He will fight with it.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t mưh Kră Yang iŏk sơnguĕt wă teh lu sư, na đe gô kơtơ̆ng re hơgơ̆r iĕ, re brŏ. Kră Yang gô yơ̆r ti blah lu sư.

English: For Tophet was established of old, Yes, for the king it is prepared. He has made it deep and large; Its pyre is fire with much wood; The breath of the LORD, like a stream of brimstone, Kindles it.
Bahnar: Tôphêt đei hơmet lê̆ đơ̆ng sơ̆ bơih anih wă soh. Sĭt tơpă đei hơmet bơih ăn kơ pơtao, Hơlŭng ŭnh jrŭ păng să, đei ŭnh păng 'long ŭnh lơ, hơyuh dui jơhngơ̆m Kră Yang thoi glung tơmo ŭnh sa khơ̆ng.

English: Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help, And rely on horses, Who trust in chariots because they are many, And in horsemen because they are very strong, But who do not look to the Holy One of Israel, Nor seek the LORD!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu đe năm jur tơ Êyiptơ wă chă apinh tơdrong dŏng tơgŭm, gơnang kơ lu aseh, lu gre aseh, yua kơ lu sư lơ; gơnang kơ lu linh hao gre aseh yua kơ lu sư pran, Mă-lei ưh pă lăng gơnang kơ Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh đe Isơrael, păng ưh kơ chă Kră Yang dŏng Tơgŭm.

English: Yet He also is wise and will bring disaster, And will not call back His words, But will arise against the house of evildoers, And against the help of those who work iniquity.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang gơh hơgei! Sư bơih Tơ'ngla ăn tơdrong pơrăm truh. Kră Yang nơ̆r Sư pơma ưh kơ tơplih. Sư gô iung blah lu adrĕch adrung bơngai pơm kơnê̆, păng blah lu bơngai tơgŭm lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.

English: Now the Egyptians are men, and not God; And their horses are flesh, and not spirit. When the LORD stretches out His hand, Both he who helps will fall, And he who is helped will fall down; They all will perish together.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Êyiptơ jơ̆ kon bơngai hmă đĕch, ưh kơ trŏ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, lu aseh sư jơ̆ sĕch akar đĕch, ưh kơ trŏ kơ yang ôh, mưh Kră Yang yơ̆r ti Sư wă pơm, bơngai tơgŭm đe gô kơtơih, bơngai mă đe tơgŭm gô pơ̆k, 'bar 'nu măr sư gô lôch hiong hơdai.

English: For thus the LORD has spoken to me: “As a lion roars, And a young lion over his prey (When a multitude of shepherds is summoned against him, He will not be afraid of their voice Nor be disturbed by their noise), So the LORD of hosts will come down To fight for Mount Zion and for its hill.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei khan bơih kơ inh thoi âu: “Nhen thoi dăm-brang grĕnh, dah nhen thoi dăm-brang mơlôh arum chă rôp tơmam sa, mă đơ̆ng lu bơngai wei triu minh khŭl lơ ră wă blah sư, sư ưh kơ tơrơ ôh kơ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai wei triu ôr tơkĕch, sư kư̆m ưh kơ hli kơ jơwa jreo lu đe noh, kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, Kră Yang Tih Hloh, gô jur wă tơblah tơ kơpal Kông Siôn păng tơ kơpal lu groi.

English: Like birds flying about, So will the LORD of hosts defend Jerusalem. Defending, He will also deliver it; Passing over, He will preserve it.”
Bahnar: Nhen thoi sem păr tơ kơpal bơwei kon sư thoi yơ, kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n Kră Yang Tih Hloh gô bơwei Jêrusalem, Sư gô wei-lăng păng dŏng pơklaih, Sư gô găn lê̆ păng pơklaih lu sư.”

English: Return to Him against whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei pơla Isơrael, wơ̆t brŏk bĕ tơ Tơ'ngla mă đêl iĕm pơm kơnê̆ plơ̆ Sư lơ dêh.

English: For in that day every man shall throw away his idols of silver and his idols of gold—sin, which your own hands have made for yourselves.
Bahnar: Lăm năr ei kơnh, mă bu bu kư̆m klơ̆m tŭk lê̆ rup yang lu sư man hăm hu, hăm maih, jơ̆ tơmam đêl ti lu iĕm pơm kơdih noh boih mă lu iĕm băt iĕm pơm noh yoch.

English: “Then Assyria shall fall by a sword not of man, And a sword not of mankind shall devour him. But he shall flee from the sword, And his young men shall become forced labor.
Bahnar: “Asiri gô pơ̆k răm kơ đao gưm, ưh kơ trŏ kơ đao kon bơngai ôh kư̆m ưh kơ đao gưm đơ̆ng bơngai bu wă pơlôch sư. Lu sư gô kơdâu ôn đơ̆ng đao gưm noh păng lu kon tơdăm lu sư gô jing đĭch jang pơmat.

English: He shall cross over to his stronghold for fear, And his princes shall be afraid of the banner,” Says the LORD, Whose fire is in Zion And whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Tơmo mă sư gơnang gô hiong đĭ, yua kơ tơdrong hli tơrơ, lu yŏng linh gô hli tơrơ, kơdâu achăng tŭk lăp lu sư 'bôh.” Tơ'ngla Kră Yang thoi ŭnh tơ kông Siôn, ŭnh bơmur tơ Jêrusalem. Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Behold, a king will reign in righteousness, And princes will rule with justice.
Bahnar: 'Nâu gô đei minh 'nu pơtao pơgơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu kră pơgơ̆r gô wei-lăng tơpăt hơnơ̆ng.

English: A man will be as a hiding place from the wind, And a cover from the tempest, As rivers of water in a dry place, As the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu bơngai nhen thoi anih kơ'nơp kơ kial, thoi anih pĕng kơ hơbŭt, nhen glung đak ro lăm anih hrĕng kro, nhen thoi yơ̆p tơmo tih lăm teh đak kro krĕnh.

English: The eyes of those who see will not be dim, And the ears of those who hear will listen.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh măt lu bơngai lăng gô 'bôh ưh pă bơbôl, đon lu bơngai kơtơ̆ng gô pơgling mơ̆ng.

English: Also the heart of the rash will understand knowledge, And the tongue of the stammerers will be ready to speak plainly.
Bahnar: Kơ̆l 'ngok lu bơngai hăt hot gô băt păng hlôh wao, hơpiĕt lu bơngai pơma hơrăk gô gơh pơma rơđah.

English: The foolish person will no longer be called generous, Nor the miser said to be bountiful
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơhlôh kơwao đe ưh pă krao sư bơngai đe pơyom, đe kư̆m ưh kơ pơyom mơ̆n bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr.

English: For the foolish person will speak foolishness, And his heart will work iniquity: To practice ungodliness, To utter error against the LORD, To keep the hungry unsatisfied, And he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai kơwao sư pơma lu nơ̆r kơtul kơwao; jơhngơ̆m đon sư pơm tơdrong yoch, 'maih pơm lu tơdrong kơnê̆, pơma tơdrong glăi gah Kră Yang, pơm kơ bơngai pơngot klak hoh, ưh kơ ăn đak nhă kơ lu bơngai rơhing.

English: Also the schemes of the schemer are evil; He devises wicked plans To destroy the poor with lying words, Even when the needy speaks justice.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr yua tơdrong kơnê̆; pơđâu pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, wă pơrăm lu bơngai dơnuh hăm nơ̆r pơma hơlĕnh Mă khan lu bơngai dơnuh hoh roi khan trŏ.

English: But a generous man devises generous things, And by generosity he shall stand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng sư chă đon 'lơ̆ng, sư ling-lang jang hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng sư.

English: Rise up, you women who are at ease, Hear my voice; You complacent daughters, Give ear to my speech.
Bahnar: Ơ lu drŏ-kăn hiôk-hian iung bĕ mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh! Ơ lu drŏ-kăn mă huay kơ tơtăm, pơđêng đon lu iĕm mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh!

English: In a year and some days You will be troubled, you complacent women; For the vintage will fail, The gathering will not come.
Bahnar: Lăm minh sơnăm dơ̆ng, lu iĕm jơ̆ bơngai mă ưh kơ tơtăm, gô hli tơtơ̆ păng rŭng răng yua kơ bơyan phĕ plei hơmu iĕm ưh pă đei, păng bơyan phĕ plei nai ưh pă đei dơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: Tremble, you women who are at ease; Be troubled, you complacent ones; Strip yourselves, make yourselves bare, And gird sackcloth on your waists.
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-kăn oei hiôk-hian, tơtơ̆ bĕ, ơ lu kon drŏ-kăn ưh kơ tơtăm hli bĕ Plôh bĕ ao lu iĕm, lê̆ akâu hoh tơ̆n bĕ 'bi tơ kơiĕng lu iĕm.

English: People shall mourn upon their breasts For the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
Bahnar: Tŭr bĕ kơtơh nhơ̆m hmoi, yua kơ chŭn mir 'lơ̆ng, 'long hơmu đei plei trem pă đei boih

English: On the land of my people will come up thorns and briers, Yes, on all the happy homes in the joyous city
Bahnar: 'Long jơla hro chăt lăm teh mir kon pơlei pơla Inh, nhơ̆m hmoi kơ rim hnam chơt hiôk, kơ pơlei tih hơdrŭm ơ-ôs ơ-as.

English: Because the palaces will be forsaken, The bustling city will be deserted. The forts and towers will become lairs forever, A joy of wild donkeys, a pasture of flocks
Bahnar: Đe gô lê̆ hnam pơtao kơkot rơhiăng, pơlei tih gô jing juơ, kông groi păng hnam thôt đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp gô păk răm truh tơ ning-mônh jing anih lu aseh bri păng tơmăn 'nhĕt kơ lu kon sem brem.

English: Until the Spirit is poured upon us from on high, And the wilderness becomes a fruitful field, And the fruitful field is counted as a forest.
Bahnar: Dĭng truh kơ Yang bơhngol đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh jur tơ lu bơ̆n, char glă gô jing chŭn mir teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng, chŭn mir teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng noh chăt jing dang lĕ kơ bri brah.

English: Then justice will dwell in the wilderness, And righteousness remain in the fruitful field.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh tơ rim anih oei tơ char glă, oei tơ chŭn teh mơ̆r 'lơ̆ng đĭ-đăng bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: The work of righteousness will be peace, And the effect of righteousness, quietness and assurance forever.
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô jing tơdrong hiôk-hian, plei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt gô đei hiôk hơđơ̆ng ling-lang.

English: My people will dwell in a peaceful habitation, In secure dwellings, and in quiet resting places
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh gô pơdơh oei lăm anih hiôk-hian, lăm hnam hiôk hơđơ̆ng, lăm anih pơdơh rơnŭk rơnua.

English: Though hail comes down on the forest, And the city is brought low in humiliation.
Bahnar: Mă đơ̆ng 'mi prĕl jruh lăm bri brah păng pơlei tih gô pơchah răm.

English: Blessed are you who sow beside all waters, Who send out freely the feet of the ox and the donkey.
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ lu iĕm rei adrĕch jê̆ tơter đak, achăng rơmo aseh chă sa mơ̆ng kơ wă.

English: Woe to you who plunder, though you have not been plundered; And you who deal treacherously, though they have not dealt treacherously with you! When you cease plundering, You will be plundered; When you make an end of dealing treacherously, They will deal treacherously with you.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ ih, ơ bơngai pơrăm đe, đe ưh tam mă đei pơrăm ih, ơ bơngai blơ̆ blĕch đe, đe ưh tam đei blơ̆ ih! Kơplah mă ih pơdơh pơrăm đe, đe gô pơrăm ih dơ̆ng. Kơplah ih ưh pă blơ̆ blĕch đe gô blơ̆ ih.

English: O LORD, be gracious to us; We have waited for You. Be their arm every morning, Our salvation also in the time of trouble.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang mơnat bĕ kơ lu nhôn! Lu nhôn oei chang gô Ih, Apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn đei jơhngơ̆m pran rim năr rim pơgê, apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn đơ̆ng lăm tơdrong pơmat-tat!

English: At the noise of the tumult the people shall flee; When You lift Yourself up, the nations shall be scattered
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng re jơwa nơ̆r Ih thoi grơ̆m, lu kon pơlei kơdâu ôn đĭ; mưh Ih iung blah lu teh đak tơklah tơklang.

English: And Your plunder shall be gathered Like the gathering of the caterpillar; As the running to and fro of locusts, He shall run upon them.
Bahnar: Mŭk tơmam lu iĕm đe gô pơdŭ iŏk nhen thoi lep 'ba, pơdŭ sa, đe gô bruh iŏk tơmam iĕm thoi lu lep 'ba bruh sa.

English: The LORD is exalted, for He dwells on high; He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơyom hloh, yua kơ Sư oei tơ anih kơpal ti, Sư pơm ăn kơ Siôn 'bĕnh blai kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng trŏ hơnơ̆ng.

English: Wisdom and knowledge will be the stability of your times, And the strength of salvation; The fear of the LORD is His treasure.
Bahnar: Sư bơih gô pơm kơjăp lăm chăl lu iĕm, Sư boih tơdrong dŏng pơklaih, tơdrong hlôh wao, tơdrong gơh hơgei 'bĕnh blai, tơdrong hli yom kơ Kră Yang jơ̆ tơmam gĭt iĕm.

English: Surely their valiant ones shall cry outside, The ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai pran kơtang oei krao ôr tơ rok trong, lu bơngai đe wơh chă tơdrong hiôk-hian nhơ̆m ơh ol.

English: The highways lie waste, The traveling man ceases. He has broken the covenant, He has despised the cities, He regards no man.
Bahnar: Trong glung kơkot rơhiăng, ưh pă đei bơngai bu brŏk năm dơ̆ng. Tơdrong pơgơ̆p đĭ pă đei, pơlei tih đe pơjăm pơjuă bơih, kon bơngai đe ưh pơyom kơ bu bơih.

English: The earth mourns and languishes, Lebanon is shamed and shriveled; Sharon is like a wilderness, And Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
Bahnar: Teh đak nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon đĭ jing juơ. Liban kơdơ̆ mơlâu păng jô hŏnh, dêh char Sarôn nhen thoi char glă Araba, dêh char Basan păng kông Karmel hla sư hơlŭng ruh đĭ.

English: “Now I will rise,” says the LORD; “Now I will be exalted, Now I will lift Myself up.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Dang ei Inh gô iung, dang ei Inh gô pôk hơtŏk, dang ei Inh gô đei tơdrong ư-ang.

English: You shall conceive chaff, You shall bring forth stubble; Your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô đei anăp hơkam 'ba, gô tơpŭ lĕch hơnong, hơyuh dui jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm jing ŭnh soh iĕm kơdih.

English: And the people shall be like the burnings of lime; Like thorns cut up they shall be burned in the fire.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei gô nhen thoi chŭr tơmo ŭnh sa, nhen jơla đe chong soh lăm ŭnh.”

English: Hear, you who are afar off, what I have done; And you who are near, acknowledge My might.”
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai oei tơ ataih mơ̆ng bĕ, tơdrong Inh pơm bơih; păng lu iĕm bơngai mă ei jê̆, hlôh băt bĕ kơ tơdrong mơsêh Inh.

English: The sinners in Zion are afraid; Fearfulness has seized the hypocrites: “Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? Who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm yoch lăm pơlei Siôn hli tơrơ, bơngai ưh chu kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang hli tơtơ̆ đĭ bơih. “Bu lăm lu bơ̆n gơh oei lăm ŭnh kơdơ̆r? Bu lăm lu bơ̆n gơh oei lăm pla ŭnh sa khơ̆ng ling-lang?”

English: He who walks righteously and speaks uprightly, He who despises the gain of oppressions, Who gestures with his hands, refusing bribes, Who stops his ears from hearing of bloodshed, And shuts his eyes from seeing evil
Bahnar: Lu bơngai arih kiơ̆ trong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, pơma tơpăt, areh kơ tơdrong pơjuă sa tơmam đe. Hơpuih ti sư ưh kơ chro iŏk tơmam kơnê̆ đe apah, đon sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng tơdrong pơlôch băl, măt sư ưh kơ wă lăng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: He will dwell on high; His place of defense will be the fortress of rocks; Bread will be given him, His water will be sure.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh sư gô oei tơ lăm anih kơjung Sư gô kơ'nơp tơ lăm kông tơmo kơjăp tơmam sa sư rơkah rơkai, đak nhă sư mah ling-lang.

English: Your eyes will see the King in His beauty; They will see the land that is very far off.
Bahnar: Măt ih gô 'bôh pơtao lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư păng ih gô lăng 'bôh teh đak pơih rai să.

English: Your heart will meditate on terror: “Where is the scribe? Where is he who weighs? Where is he who counts the towers?”
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m ih gô tơchĕng kơ tơdrong hli krưp dêh: “Lu đe chă dăr oei tơ yơ bơih? Lu bơngai iŏk tơmam thuê̆ tơ yơ bơih? Lu bơngai chă jô̆ hnam gak tơ yơ bơih?”

English: You will not see a fierce people, A people of obscure speech, beyond perception, Of a stammering tongue that you cannot understand.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh pă 'bôh dơ̆ng lu kon pơlei pơang tơdrong kơnê̆, noh jơ̆ lu bơngai pơma nơ̆r sôm mơrôm anat kơ hlôh, lu kon pơlei pơma nơ̆r tơmoi ih mơ̆ng ưh kơ hlôh ôh.

English: Look upon Zion, the city of our appointed feasts; Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet home, A tabernacle that will not be taken down; Not one of its stakes will ever be removed, Nor will any of its cords be broken.
Bahnar: Lăng bĕ tơ Siôn jơ̆ pơlei tih lu bơ̆n pơm giĕng tih. Măt ih gô 'bôh pơlei Jêrusalem, jơ̆ anih hiôk hơđơ̆ng, jơ̆ anih oei ưh kơ đei layơ pôk tơplih tơ nai dơ̆ng, lu 'long pơ̆ng, ưh kơ đei layơ toh lê̆ ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơlei minh dăng ayơ kơtĕch mơ̆n!

English: But there the majestic LORD will be for us A place of broad rivers and streams, In which no galley with oars will sail, Nor majestic ships pass by
Bahnar: Tơ noh Kră Yang mơsêh gô oei hơdai bơ̆n lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ Sư, đei Krong să tơ noh thŏng-nan ayăt ưh kơ gơh năm, kư̆m ưh kơ đei duk tih ayăt gơh chă năm brih găn mơ̆n.

English: (For the LORD is our Judge, The LORD is our Lawgiver, The LORD is our King; He will save us)
Bahnar: Tơpă, Kră Yang bơih Tơ'ngla sek tơlang lu bơ̆n, Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing ăn kơ lu bơ̆n khôi juăt, Sư bơih Kră Yang pơtao lu bơ̆n, sư bơih Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu bơ̆n!

English: Your tackle is loosed, They could not strengthen their mast, They could not spread the sail. Then the prey of great plunder is divided; The lame take the prey.
Bahnar: Tơlei lu ayăt chô̆ lu iĕm tơlang lê̆ bơih, ưh pă chô̆ tơ jrăng păng ưh pă dăng che duk noh dơ̆ng. Kơplah noh đe gô klah asong băl lơ lu tơmam đêl blah tơgar iŏk, mă lu bơngai jopo kư̆m gô đei iŏk tơmam đêl blah tơgar noh mơ̆n.

English: And the inhabitant will not say, “I am sick”; The people who dwell in it will be forgiven their iniquity.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pơla gô ưh pă đei pơma bơih khan: “Inh jĭ bơlŏ” Lu kon pơlei oei tơ noh gô đei tơdrong mơnat ăn kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: Come near, you nations, to hear; And heed, you people! Let the earth hear, and all that is in it, The world and all things that come forth from it.
Bahnar: Ơ lu dêh char năm mă jê̆ mơ̆ng bĕ, ơ kon pơlei pơla pơđêng đon iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ! Ơ teh đak păng lu tơmam 'bĕnh-'bang kơpal teh ơ dêh char păng lu tơmam lĕch đơ̆ng lăm noh mơ̆ng bĕ.

English: For the indignation of the LORD is against all nations, And His fury against all their armies; He has utterly destroyed them, He has given them over to the slaughter.
Bahnar: Yua Kră Yang hil mĭl wă pơrăm đĭ-đăng dêh char; Kră Yang hil kơ đĭ-đăng linh lu sư, gô ăn kơ lu sư lôch hiong păng pơjao lê̆ kơ đe pơlôch.

English: Also their slain shall be thrown out; Their stench shall rise from their corpses, And the mountains shall be melted with their blood.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai đe pơlôch, đe gô klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ lu sư. 'Bâu ôm atâu bơngai lôch jơ̆p-jang, rim kơ kông 'bĕnh-'bang kơ pham.

English: All the host of heaven shall be dissolved, And the heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll; All their host shall fall down As the leaf falls from the vine, And as fruit falling from a fig tree.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu măt khei sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh gô hach lek, plĕnh gô tơlôm nhen đe lôm sơnôm hla bơar. Đĭ-đăng lu măt khei sơnglŏng sư gô hiong đĭ, nhen thoi hla hơmu hơlŭng, nhen thoi plei hơra hơlŭng huŏng đơ̆ng tơm sư.

English: “For My sword shall be bathed in heaven; Indeed it shall come down on Edom, And on the people of My curse, for judgment.
Bahnar: Mưh đao gưm Inh huch suai bơih tơ kơpal plĕnh. Na 'nâu sư gô jur tơ Eđôm, jur tơ kon pơlei mă Inh đei sek wă pơrăm lu sư.

English: The sword of the LORD is filled with blood, It is made overflowing with fatness, With the blood of lambs and goats, With the fat of the kidneys of rams. For the LORD has a sacrifice in Bozrah, And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
Bahnar: Đao gưm Kră Yang 'bĕnh kơ pham păng rơmă, thoi pham triu păng bơbe. Hăm rơmă đơ̆ng boh-lăn triu tơno. Yua kơ Kră Yang đei tơdrong soi sơmah tơ pơlei Bôsra, tơdrong pơlôch tih dêh tơ dêh char Eđôm.

English: The wild oxen shall come down with them, And the young bulls with the mighty bulls; Their land shall be soaked with blood, And their dust saturated with fatness.”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei thoi rơmo bri tơno gô wang pơ̆k hơdai lu sư; đĭ lu rơmo bri dăm păng lu rơmo tơno pran kơtang. Teh đak lu sư 'bĕnh kơ pham. 'Mui teh hơiuh rơbơ̆r yua kơ rơmă.

English: For it is the day of the LORD’s vengeance, The year of recompense for the cause of Zion.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang đei minh năr wă pơm 'mong. Đei sơnăm Sư wă pơm tơwih yua kơ pơlei Siôn.

English: Its streams shall be turned into pitch, And its dust into brimstone; Its land shall become burning pitch.
Bahnar: Lu thong đak Eđôm gô jing chai tơmo arăng 'mui teh sư jing tơmo ŭnh, teh sư gô jing chai tơmo ŭnh sa hơnơ̆ng.

English: It shall not be quenched night or day; Its smoke shall ascend forever. From generation to generation it shall lie waste; No one shall pass through it forever and ever.
Bahnar: Măng năr ưh kơ đei layơ păt, 'nhui ŭnh bluh hơnơ̆ng. Teh gô jing juơ đơ̆ng chăl âu truh tơ chăl nai, ling-lang hlŏng hloi ưh pă đei bu oei dah chă găn brih rok trong noh.

English: But the pelican and the porcupine shall possess it, Also the owl and the raven shall dwell in it. And He shall stretch out over it The line of confusion and the stones of emptiness.
Bahnar: Sem bơrơ̆m păng jơma oei tơ anih noh, sem bơrơ̆m, sem ak gô oei tơ noh. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô dăng hăm tơlei tơdrong pơrăm lu sư păng pơtŏ hăm 'long thưk tơdrong tơhiong lu Sư.

English: They shall call its nobles to the kingdom, But none shall be there, and all its princes shall be nothing.
Bahnar: Dêh char Êđôm noh ưh pă đei krao dêh char pơtao dơ̆ng bơih. Đĭ-đăng lu kră pơgơ̆r lu sư gô lôch hiong đĭ.

English: And thorns shall come up in its palaces, Nettles and brambles in its fortresses; It shall be a habitation of jackals, A courtyard for ostriches.
Bahnar: Lu 'long jơla gô chăt lăm anih pơtao, 'long jơla chăt hro 'bĕnh lăm kơđông kơjăp noh jing anih lu kŏ bri păng anih pơdơh lu sem grơ̆-ă.

English: The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the jackals, And the wild goat shall bleat to its companion; Also the night creature shall rest there, And find for herself a place of rest.
Bahnar: Sem bri păng lu kŏ bri tơ'bơ̆p băl tơ noh. Bơbe bri tơno tơ krao băl, lu sem bơrơ̆m chă sa kơmăng pơdơh tơ noh păng pơm anih pơdơh hiôk.

English: There the arrow snake shall make her nest and lay eggs And hatch, and gather them under her shadow; There also shall the hawks be gathered, Every one with her mate.
Bahnar: Sem bơrơ̆m gô pơm tơpu kơtăp tơ noh, 'nơ̆m cheh kon păng krôm lu kon sư tơ lăm pơnăr. Tơ noh lu, grơ̆ akŭm băl, tơmông păng akăn.

English: “Search from the book of the LORD, and read: Not one of these shall fail; Not one shall lack her mate. For My mouth has commanded it, and His Spirit has gathered them.
Bahnar: Chă lăng bĕ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Kră Yang păng đŏk: Lăm lu kon sem 'nâu ưh kơ đei minh pôm sem ayơ mă ưh kơ đei, kư̆m ưh kơ đei minh pôm sem ayơ mă ưh kơ tôm hơgrop, yua kơ đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă bơih păng Yang Bơhngol Sư đei akŭm bơih lu sư.

English: He has cast the lot for them, And His hand has divided it among them with a measuring line. They shall possess it forever; From generation to generation they shall dwell in it.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang hlang lăng bơih ăn kơ lu sư, Ti Kră Yang dăng tơlei klah asong ăn teh âu. Lu sư gô oei tơ noh ling-lang păng oei tơ noh đơ̆ng chăl âu truh chăl nai khŏm khŏm.

English: The wilderness and the wasteland shall be glad for them, And the desert shall rejoice and blossom as the rose
Bahnar: Char glă păng teh phang-ang hrĕng kro gô chơt hiôk. Anih bri brah gô 'nă hal, păng đei bluh pơkao thoi pơkao gôh.

English: It shall blossom abundantly and rejoice, Even with joy and singing. The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it, The excellence of Carmel and Sharon. They shall see the glory of the LORD, The excellency of our God.
Bahnar: Sư đei bluh pơkao lơ, păng 'nă hal hơri chơt hiôk. Tơdrong ư-ang Liban, hăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ kông Karmel păng thŭng dơnă Sarôn, gô ăn kơ lu Sư. Lu sư gô 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: Strengthen the weak hands, And make firm the feeble knees.
Bahnar: Pơm ăn bĕ lu ti rơdu mă jăng, pơm ăn kơ lu kŭl-tăng rơdu mă kơjăp!

English: Say to those who are fearful-hearted, “Be strong, do not fear! Behold, your God will come with vengeance, With the recompense of God; He will come and save you.”
Bahnar: Akhan bĕ kơ lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m hli tơtăm; “Chơ̆n jơhngơ̆m 'nĕ pă hli dơ̆ng! To, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm gô truh wă pơm 'mong păng pơrăm Sư gô truh dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm!”

English: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, And the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai măt tol gô 'bôh, lu bơngai klĭk klot gô kơtơ̆ng.

English: Then the lame shall leap like a deer, And the tongue of the dumb sing. For waters shall burst forth in the wilderness, And streams in the desert.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai jopo gô pơplŏng nhen juei. Hơpiĕt lu bơngai kơmlo gô gơh hơri chơt hiôk. Gô đei đak ro tơ char glă, păng lu glung đak gô ro lăm bri brah.

English: The parched ground shall become a pool, And the thirsty land springs of water; In the habitation of jackals, where each lay, There shall be grass with reeds and rushes.
Bahnar: Teh chuơh tŏ gô jing dơnâu, teh hrĕng kro gô đei tu đak mơlĕch lơ. Anih đêl kŏ bri oei gô jing đei 'nhĕt gơlăr păng trang.

English: A highway shall be there, and a road, And it shall be called the Highway of Holiness. The unclean shall not pass over it, But it shall be for others. Whoever walks the road, although a fool, Shall not go astray.
Bahnar: Tơ noh gô đei minh pôm trong glung tih. Minh pôm trong đe krao trong 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh. Bơngai 'mê̆-'mach ưh kơ gơh năm trong noh. Mă-lei 'măn lu bơngai kiơ̆ Kră Yang năm trong noh. Mă khan đơ̆ng kơ hlôh kơwao kư̆m huay kơ jrok.

English: No lion shall be there, Nor shall any ravenous beast go up on it; It shall not be found there. But the redeemed shall walk there
Bahnar: Tơ trong noh ưh kơ đei dăm-brang, ưh kơ đei minh pôm sem bri ayơ mă krưp năm rok trong noh; ưh kơ đei bu 'bôh sư tơ noh. Mă-lei lu bơngai mă huai iŏk bơih gô yak năm trong noh.

English: And the ransomed of the LORD shall return, And come to Zion with singing, With everlasting joy on their heads. They shall obtain joy and gladness, And sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă Kră Yang huai iŏk bơih gô brŏk. Năm mơ̆t tơ pơlei Siôn hăm tơdrong hơri chơt hiôk. Tơdrong hơri chơt hiôk ling-lang gô oei lăm kơ̆l lu sư. Lu sư gô đei tơdrong chơt hiôk, 'nă hal, na tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon chhŭr nuih gô hiong đĭ.

English: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah and took them.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm măt mơjĭt-puăn chăl pơtao Hesekia pơgơ̆r, Senakêrip pơtao dêh char Asiri, năm blah lu pơlei kơjăp lăm dêh char Juđa păng iŏk đĭ.

English: Then the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh with a great army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. And he stood by the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the highway to the Fuller’s Field.
Bahnar: Pơtao dêh char Asiri wơh 'bok yŏng anăn sư Rapsaka hăm lu linh sư lơ, đơ̆ng pơlei Lakis truh tơ Jêrusalem wă kơ pơtao Hesekia yơ̆r ti kiơ̆ Sư, Rapsaka dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t hơbong đak ro mơ̆t tơ Dơnâu kơpơ̆ng, trong năm tơ dơnih đak lu bơngai tong brai.

English: And Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came out to him.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Êliakim, kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia pơm 'bok wei-lăng hnam pơtao, Sepna bơngai chih hla bơar păng Jôa kon drŏ-nglo Asap kiơ̆ chih tơdrong truh boih, năm tơ'bơ̆p sư.

English: Then the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: “What confidence is this in which you trust?
Bahnar: Rapsaka khan kơ lu sư: “Akhan bĕ kơ pơtao Hesekia, pơtao tih, pơtao char Asiri thoi âu: Lĕch đơ̆ng yơ, mă lu iĕm gơnang noh?

English: I say you speak of having plans and power for war; but they are mere words. Now in whom do you trust, that you rebel against me?
Bahnar: Ih, tơchĕng wă tơblah hăm inh hăm nơ̆r pơma 'bơ̆r hoh đĕch hă? Ih gơnang kơ bu mă pơ̆n tơblah hăm inh.

English: Look! You are trusting in the staff of this broken reed, Egypt, on which if a man leans, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him.
Bahnar: 'Nâu ih gơnang kơ dêh char Êyiptơ, noh thoi 'long jra gơlăr đĭ tơgơ̆ bơih bu mă gơnang kơ sư, sư gô trŏ 'bet ti bơngai noh hlôh. Pharaôn, pơtao Êyiptơ đe bu mă gơnang kơ sư kư̆m gô thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: “But if you say to me, ‘We trust in the LORD our God,’ is it not He whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and said to Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar’?” ’
Bahnar: Păng tơdah ih khan kơ inh, “Lu nhôn gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, “Hăm trŏ ưh kơ pơtao Hesekia yuih hŭt lê̆ bơih lu anih tơ kơpal păng chơnang soi Sư, na khan kơ lu đe Juđa păng pơlei Jêrusalem: “Lu iĕm athei kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi âu dah kiơ?”

English: Now therefore, I urge you, give a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses—if you are able on your part to put riders on them!
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm athei pơma pơkăm bĕ hăm yŏng tơ'ngla inh, pơtao char Asiri. Tơdah ih chă đei tôm lu linh hao aseh, lei inh gô ăn kơ ih 'bar-rơbâu tŏ aseh.

English: How then will you repel one captain of the least of my master’s servants, and put your trust in Egypt for chariots and horsemen?
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ gơh puh tơweh lê̆ minh 'nu yŏng linh iĕ hloh lăm lu yŏng tơ'ngla inh, mă khan ih gơnang kơ dêh Êyiptơ wă kơ đei gre aseh păng lu linh kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ.

English: Have I now come up without the LORD against this land to destroy it? The LORD said to me, ‘Go up against this land, and destroy it.’ ”
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng, ưh kơ trŏ đơ̆ng Kră Yang athei inh tŏk blah dêh âu păng wă pơlôch pơrăm sư hă? Kră Yang 'mơ̆i athei inh năm blah dêh âu păng athei pơrăm pơlôch đĭ sư.”

English: Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it; and do not speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people who are on the wall.”
Bahnar: Êliakim hăm Sepna păng Jôa khan kơ Rapsaka: “Apinh ih pơma hăm đĭch đam ih âu hăm nơ̆r Aram, yua kơ lu nhôn hlôh nơ̆r noh. Ih 'nĕ pơma nơ̆r Juđa hăm lu nhôn kơnh kon pơlei pơla oei tơ kơpal dur pơlei âu hlôh.”

English: But the Rabshakeh said, “Has my master sent me to your master and to you to speak these words, and not to the men who sit on the wall, who will eat and drink their own waste with you?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Rapsaka tơl: “Yŏng inh, wơh inh roi dôm nơ̆r noh, hăm trŏ roi ăn kơ yŏng iĕm hăm lu iĕm đĕch? Ưh kơ trŏ ôh hă kư̆m roi ăn kơ lu bơngai oei tơ kơpal dur pơlei, lu bơngai mă wă jê̆ lôch hơdai hăm lu iĕm, sa ĭch kơdih, nhă đak hơyô kơdih?”

English: Then the Rabshakeh stood and called out with a loud voice in Hebrew, and said, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Rapsaka iung pơma rơ̆n hăm nơ̆r Juđa khan: “Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng pơtao tih mơng, jơ̆ pơtao dêh char Asiri.

English: Thus says the king: ‘Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you
Bahnar: Pơtao khan thoi âu: 'Nĕ ăn pơtao Hesekia hơlĕnh lu iĕm yua kơ sư ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm ôh.

English: nor let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, “The LORD will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.” ’
Bahnar: Kŭm 'nĕ ăn pơtao Hesekia pơdrŭt lu iĕm gơnang kơ Kră Yang na khan: ‘Kră Yang gô dŏng pơklaih lu bơ̆n ngei păng pơlei âu gô ưh kơ đei jao ăn lăm ti pơtao Asiri ôh!

English: Do not listen to Hezekiah; for thus says the king of Assyria: ‘Make peace with me by a present and come out to me; and every one of you eat from his own vine and every one from his own fig tree, and every one of you drink the waters of his own cistern
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă mơ̆ng pơtao Hesekia, 'nâu nơ̆r pơtao Asiri pơma khan: Pơm hiôk hăm inh păng yơ̆r ti kơ inh bĕ, na lu iĕm mă bu bu kư̆m gô đei sa plei hơra, plei hơmu iĕm kơdih păng nhă đak sơlŭng iĕm kơdih

English: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
Bahnar: Dĭng truh tơ layơ, inh truh chông ba lu iĕm mơ̆t tơ dêh char, nhen dêh lu iĕm kơdih, noh jơ̆ dêh char đei 'ba, tơ'bâu păng sik hơmu 'nao, 'ba mi păng plei hơmu.

English: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, “The LORD will deliver us.” Has any one of the gods of the nations delivered its land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
Bahnar: Kơchăng bĕ, kơnh hli kơ pơtao Hesekia pơhlŭ pơlung lu iĕm khan: ‘Kră Yang gô dŏng pơklaih lu bơ̆n hăm đei ưh yang lu teh đak đe nai, gơh dŏng pơklaih teh đak lu sư đơ̆ng ti pơtao Asiri?

English: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Indeed, have they delivered Samaria from my hand?
Bahnar: Tơ yơ yang pơlei Hamat păng yang pơlei Arpat? Tơ yơ yang pơlei Sepharwaim? Lu yang noh tam đei dŏng pơklaih pơlei Samari klaih đơ̆ng ti inh ưh?

English: Who among all the gods of these lands have delivered their countries from my hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem from my hand?’ ”
Bahnar: Lăm lu yang dêh char noh tam đei yang ayơ dŏng pơklaih bơih dêh char sư klaih đơ̆ng ti inh ưh? Na liơ Kră Yang gơh dŏng pơklaih Jêrusalem đơ̆ng ti inh lĕ?

English: But they held their peace and answered him not a word; for the king’s commandment was, “Do not answer him.”
Bahnar: Lu sư oei hreh đĕch, ưh kơ đei tơl tơwih minh nơ̆r, yua kơ pơtao Hesekia đei pơkă khan: Lu iĕm 'nĕ tơl tơwih.”

English: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of the Rabshakeh.
Bahnar: Êliakim kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia, 'bok wei-lăng hnam pơtao, hăm Sepna bơngai chih hla bơar, Jôa kon drŏ-nglo Asap bơngai răp chih tơdrong đei truh, hek ao lu sư kơdih, wơ̆t brŏk roi kơ pơtao Hesekia dôm nơ̆r đêl Rapsaka pơma.

English: And so it was, when King Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, pơtao Hesekia hek hloi ao sư kơdih, hrŭk 'bi năm mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam akŭm kơkuh Kră Yang.

English: Then he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
Bahnar: Pơtao wơh Êliakim 'bok wei-lăng hnam pơtao, Sepna bơngai chih hla bơar păng lu kră lăm lu khŭl 'bok soi hơdai wang hrŭk asu 'bi, năm tơ Êsai 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kon drŏ-nglo Amôt.

English: And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day is a day of trouble and rebuke and blasphemy; for the children have come to birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth.
Bahnar: Lu sư roi kơ Êsai khan: “Pơtao Hesekia pơma thoi âu: Năr âu jơ̆ năr sơ'ngon truh, 'năr đei chrih păng 'năr mơlâu, thoi drŏ-kăn anăp truh bơih năr tơpŭ kơ kon nge mă-lei ưh kơ kĕ đei jơhngơ̆m wă tơpŭ.

English: It may be that the LORD your God will hear the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to reproach the living God, and will rebuke the words which the LORD your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.’ ”
Bahnar: Rŏ lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih gô kơtơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r Rapsaka pơma, bơngai đơ̆ng pơtao Asiri wơh sư năm tơ âu wă pơma pơjăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang păng Kră Yang gô phak sư kiơ̆ thoi dôm nơ̆r mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtơ̆ng bơih, noh bơih ih krao khan bĕ kơ lu bơngai mă oei oei tơ âu!”

English: So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
Bahnar: Lu đam kơiĕng Hesekia năm truh tơ Êsai

English: And Isaiah said to them, “Thus you shall say to your master, ‘Thus says the LORD: “Do not be afraid of the words which you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.
Bahnar: Êsai khan: “Roi bĕ kơ yŏng lu iĕm, Kră Yang đei khan thoi âu: ‘'Nĕ kơ hli ôh kơ dôm nơ̆r mă lu iĕm đei kơtơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r đơ̆ng lu đam pơtao Asiri, pơma blông kơ Inh.

English: Surely I will send a spirit upon him, and he shall hear a rumor and return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.” ’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh gô ăn lăm đon sư, kơtơ̆ng tơdrong, đe roi na wih tơ dêh sư kơdih, tơ noh Inh gô pơm kơ sư lôch kơ đao gưm.

English: Then the Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he heard that he had departed from Lachish.
Bahnar: Kơplah Rapsaka kơtơ̆ng yŏng sư pơtao Asiri hlôi weh bơih đơ̆ng pơlei Lakis, na sư wơ̆t brŏk păng 'bôh pơtao Asiri oei blah pơlei Lipna.

English: And the king heard concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, “He has come out to make war with you.” So when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Asiri kơtơ̆ng roi tơdrong Tirhaka pơtao dêh char Kus khan: Sư chĕp ba linh wă tơblah hăm ih. Lăp kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, na sư wơh lu bơngai năm roi khan kơ pơtao Hesekia păng pơkă khan

English: “Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying: ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, “Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm roi bĕ kơ Hesekia pơtao Juđa khan: 'Nĕ ăn ôh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă ih gơnang hơlĕnh kơ ih, khan: Pơlei Jêrusalem gô ưh kơ đei jao lăm ti pơtao dêh Asiri.

English: Look! You have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands by utterly destroying them; and shall you be delivered?
Bahnar: 'Nâu ih đei kơtơ̆ng bơih lu tơdrong pơtao dêh char Asiri pơm kơ lu dêh char, lu dêh char noh lôch răm đĭ bơih, na bĭ ih gơh klaih mơ̆n hă?

English: Have the gods of the nations delivered those whom my fathers have destroyed, Gozan and Haran and Rezeph, and the people of Eden who were in Telassar?
Bahnar: Lu yang, lu teh đak mă 'bok yă inh đei pơrăm lê̆ đĭ bơih, lu yang char Gôsan, pơlei Haran, Rêsep păng lu kon pơlei Êđen oei tơ pơlei Têl Asar hăm gơh pơklaih lu sư ưh?

English: Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?’ ”
Bahnar: Pơtao pơlei Hamat, pơtao pơlei Arpat, pơtao pơlei Sepharwaim, pơtao pơlei Hêna păng pơtao pơlei Iwa tơ yơ?

English: And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it; and Hezekiah went up to the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.
Bahnar: Hesekia đei iŏk kơthơ đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai năm roi păng đŏk lăng, Na sư năm tơ hnam Kră Yang, pơih kơthơ noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: Then Hezekiah prayed to the LORD, saying
Bahnar: Pơtao Hesekia krao apinh Kră Yang khan

English: “O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, the One who dwells between the cherubim, You are God, You alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael, Tơ'ngla hơ-oei tŏk-bŏk chêrubim, lăp minh Ih đĕch jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă pơgơ̆r rim teh đak; Ih bơih pơjing plĕnh păng teh.

English: Incline Your ear, O LORD, and hear; open Your eyes, O LORD, and see; and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which he has sent to reproach the living God.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih pơgling đon mơ̆ng bĕ! Ơ Kră Yang apinh Ih pơih măt lăng bĕ! Apinh ih mơ̆ng bĕ dôm nơ̆r Senakêrip gơih wă pơma blông 'bơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang!

English: Truly, LORD, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations and their lands
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, tơpă, lu pơtao Asiri đei pơrăm bơih đĭ-đăng bơngai păng pơrăm teh lu sư

English: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were not gods, but the work of men’s hands—wood and stone. Therefore they destroyed them.
Bahnar: Klơ̆m lê̆ rup yang lăm ŭnh. Noh ưh kơ yang tơpă ôh, noh đơ̆ng ti kon bơngai pơm păng 'long păng tơmo, na lu sư gơh pơrăm lu yang noh.

English: Now therefore, O LORD our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You are the LORD, You alone.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, dang ei apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn đơ̆ng ti Senakêrip, wă kơ rim teh đak băt kơ minh Ih đĕch Kră Yang!

English: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says the LORD God of Israel, ‘Because you have prayed to Me against Sennacherib king of Assyria
Bahnar: Êsai kon drŏ-nglo Amôt wơh bơngai năm pơtruh nơ̆r kơ pơtao Hesekia: Kră Yang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan thoi âu: Yua kơ ih đei krao khan apinh Inh wă pơm kơ Senakêrip, pơtao Asiri

English: this is the word which the LORD has spoken concerning him: “The virgin, the daughter of Zion, Has despised you, laughed you to scorn; The daughter of Jerusalem Has shaken her head behind your back!
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan gah sư: Lu adruh hle pơlei Siôn Sư pơdê ih, pơjăm ih, kon drŏ-kăn pơlei Jêrusalem tơtreh kơ̆l gah rŏng ih!

English: “Whom have you reproached and blasphemed? Against whom have you raised your voice, And lifted up your eyes on high? Against the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Ih pơjăm 'bơm bu? Ih đei pơma ôr wă blah bu păng ngơk lăng muh măt pơang? Pơ̆n blah Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: By your servants you have reproached the Lord, And said, ‘By the multitude of my chariots I have come up to the height of the mountains, To the limits of Lebanon; I will cut down its tall cedars And its choice cypress trees; I will enter its farthest height, To its fruitful forest.
Bahnar: Ih đei yua lu đam ih wă pơjăm Kră Yang, ih khan: Inh yua lu gre aseh lơ tŏk tơ kơpal kơ̆l kông, tơ anih kơjung ataih dêh lăm char Liban, inh kăl lu 'long hơngo mă kơjung dêh, 'long hơngo hla iĕ mă 'lơ̆ng hloh, inh năm truh bơih tơ kơ̆l kông kơjung hloh, lăm bri kơdrơ̆ng rơ̆m hloh.

English: I have dug and drunk water, And with the soles of my feet I have dried up All the brooks of defense.’
Bahnar: Inh đei sir bơih sơlŭng đak lăm dêh char tơmoi păng nhă đak noh; yua jơ̆ng inh pơm kơ lu glung dêh char Êyiptơ hrơ̆.’

English: “Did you not hear long ago How I made it, From ancient times that I formed it? Now I have brought it to pass, That you should be For crushing fortified cities into heaps of ruins.
Bahnar: Ih ưh tam kơtơ̆ng ôh hă, Inh wă pơm tơdrong noh đơ̆ng sơ̆ đunh bơih? Inh đei pơkă bơih đơ̆ng chăl sơ̆ dang ei Inh ăn tơdrong noh truh jing, noh wă kơ ih pơrăm lu pơlei tih kơjăp pơm kơ lu pơlei tih jing anih pơchah hĕch hoch đĭ.

English: Therefore their inhabitants had little power; They were dismayed and confounded; They were as the grass of the field And the green herb, As the grass on the housetops And grain blighted before it is grown.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei, lăm pơlei noh đĭ hơwơ̆l hơwang rơdu bơih, hli tơrơ mơlâu, jing thoi 'nhĕt bri păng thoi 'nhĕt 'lơ̆p. Thoi 'nhĕt chăt kơpal bơbŭng hnam, tam mă bluh tơmơ̆ng đĭ jô kro.

English: “But I know your dwelling place, Your going out and your coming in, And your rage against Me.
Bahnar: Inh băt kơ ih, kơplah ih hơ-oei, kơplah ih năm kơplah ih truh, kơplah ih iung hil wă blah Inh.

English: Because your rage against Me and your tumult Have come up to My ears, Therefore I will put My hook in your nose And My bridle in your lips, And I will turn you back By the way which you came.” ’
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong ih hil iung wă blah Inh, nơ̆r ih pơma tơan kơnê̆ kơtơ̆ng truh tơ đon Inh bơih, na Inh iŏk gŏp tôt lăm muh ih păng iŏk dam pơhơ̆p 'bơ̆r ih, pơm kơ ih brŏk kiơ̆ đêl trong ih năm.

English: “This shall be a sign to you: You shall eat this year such as grows of itself, And the second year what springs from the same; Also in the third year sow and reap, Plant vineyards and eat the fruit of them.
Bahnar: Ơ Hesekia tơdrong âu jơ̆ tơdra wă kơ ih kơnăl: Sơnăm 'nâu ih gô đei sa plei chăt bluh kơdih đơ̆ng lăm mir chŭn, sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng ih oei sŏng sa phe 'ba chăt kơdih mơ̆n, truh sơnăm mă pêng, ih athei rei păng yuă, ih pơtăm bĕ 'long hơmu păng sa plei sư.

English: And the remnant who have escaped of the house of Judah Shall again take root downward, And bear fruit upward.
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch adrung Juđa bơngai oei arih gô Sôr rơh tơ ala păng gô đei plei tơ kơpal.

English: For out of Jerusalem shall go a remnant, And those who escape from Mount Zion. The zeal of the LORD of hosts will do this.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei mă oei arih gô lĕch đơ̆ng Jêrusalem păng đơ̆ng kông Siôn lu bơngai noh gô oei tơ jơ̆p kơ dêh char jơhngơ̆m Kră Yang Tih Hloh wă pơm ngei tơdrong noh.

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD concerning the king of Assyria: ‘He shall not come into this city, Nor shoot an arrow there, Nor come before it with shield, Nor build a siege mound against it.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang khan gah pơtao Asiri thoi âu: “Sư gô ưh kơ mơ̆t ôh lăm pơlei tih âu, ưh kơ đei prah minh găr 'brơ̆m hră, tơ noh ưh kơ đei chĕp khêl kư̆m ưh kơ pơm anih kơjăp tăp dăr kơ pơlei wă tơblah hăm sư.

English: By the way that he came, By the same shall he return; And he shall not come into this city,’ Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư gô wơ̆t brŏk kiơ̆ trong đêl sư năm, sư ưh kơ mơ̆t tơ pơlei âu ôh, Kră Yang khan.

English: ‘For I will defend this city, to save it For My own sake and for My servant David’s sake.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô dŏng tơgŭm pơlei tih âu păng dŏng pơklaih sư, yua kơ Inh khan boih păng yua kơ Inh pơkă boih hăm Đawit đĭch đam Inh.

English: Then the angel of the LORD went out, and killed in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when people arose early in the morning, there were the corpses—all dead.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang năm mơ̆t tơ lăm kơđông lu linh Asiri păng pơlôch minh-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu, pơgê hrôih năr đơ̆ng rŏng đe hơđơ̆r iung 'bôh bơngai lôch hnơ̆k hnăk.

English: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and went away, returned home, and remained at Nineveh.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Senakêrip pơtao Asiri wih brŏk oei tơ pơlei Niniwe.

English: Now it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Then Esarhaddon his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Minh năr noh sư oei kơkuh lăm hnam yang sư Nisrŏk, na kon drŏ-nglo sư Adrammelek păng Sarêsar iŏk đao 'bet pơlôch sư, đang kơ noh bre sư kơdâu ôn tơ dêh Ararat, kon drŏ-nglo sư Êsarhađôn pơgơ̆r tơplih sư.

English: In those days Hezekiah was sick and near death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, went to him and said to him, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Set your house in order, for you shall die and not live.’ ”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Hesekia jĭ dêh wă jê̆ lôch; Êsai 'bok khan lê̆ adrol kon drŏ-nglo Amôt năm mơ̆t roi kơ pơtao păng khan: “Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Hơmet bĕ dôm tơdrong jang ih lăm hnam ih, yua kơ ih wă lôch, ưh pă arih bơih.”

English: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the LORD
Bahnar: Pơtao Hesekia tơwih muh măt sư tơ tơnăr hnam, krao khan kơ Kră Yang

English: and said, “Remember now, O LORD, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a loyal heart, and have done what is good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
Bahnar: “Ơ Kră Yang apinh ih 'blŏk kơ inh, tơdrong inh arih tơnăp đĭ jơhngơ̆m kiơ̆ ih păng pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t anăp Ih” đơ̆ng noh pơtao Hesekia nhơ̆m ôr.

English: And the word of the LORD came to Isaiah, saying
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang khan kơ Êsai

English: “Go and tell Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the LORD, the God of David your father: “I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears; surely I will add to your days fifteen years.
Bahnar: “Ih năm khan dơ̆ng kơ Hesekia: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Đawit 'bok ih khan thoi âu: Inh kơtơ̆ng bơih nơ̆r ih krao khan, Inh 'bôh bơih đak măt ih lĕch, Inh gô asong ăn kơ ih arih thim pă mơjĭt-pơđăm sơnăm dơ̆ng.

English: I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.” ’
Bahnar: Inh gô dŏng pơklaih ih păng pơlei âu đơ̆ng ti pơtao Asiri păng Inh gô bơwei pơlei âu.

English: And this is the sign to you from the LORD, that the LORD will do this thing which He has spoken
Bahnar: Âu jơ̆ tơdra đơ̆ng Kră Yang wă pơsĭt kơ ih; Kră Yang gô pơm pơkeh nơ̆r đêl sư pơkă bơih

English: “Behold, I will bring the shadow on the sundial, which has gone down with the sun on the sundial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward.” So the sun returned ten degrees on the dial by which it had gone down.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ ngôi măt 'năr pơchrang kơpal kơnao kung, gô kơdŭn tơ rŏng mơjĭt kơnao, ngôi mă măt 'năr pơchrang tơ kơpal kơnao kung Ahas” thoi noh ngôi mă đơ̆ng măt 'năr pơchrang kơdŭn tơ rŏng dơ̆ng mơjĭt juă, mă đêl măt 'năr đĭ năm hlôi bơih.

English: This is the writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick and had recovered from his sickness
Bahnar: Âu jơ̆ nơ̆r Hesekia pơtao Juđa chih kơplah sư klaih đơ̆ng jĭ.

English: I said, “In the prime of my life I shall go to the gates of Sheol; I am deprived of the remainder of my years.”
Bahnar: Inh khan “'Nao minh puăt chăl arih inh. Na inh năm 'măng jang dêh atâu boih, dôm lu khei sơnăm inh oei arih pă đei boih.

English: I said, “I shall not see YAH, The LORD in the land of the living; I shall observe man no more among the inhabitants of the world.
Bahnar: Inh khan: “Inh gô ưh pă 'bôh bơih Kră Yang, Kră Yang mă oei tơ teh lu bơngai arih, inh ưh pă 'bôh bơih kon bơngai oei arih dah oei hơdai hăm kon bơngai lăm teh đak âu.

English: My life span is gone, Taken from me like a shepherd’s tent; I have cut off my life like a weaver. He cuts me off from the loom; From day until night You make an end of me.
Bahnar: Hnam inh đe yuih, pôk lê̆ ataih đơ̆ng inh, thoi đe pôk anih bơsŭn lu bơngai wei triu, inh lôm chăl arih inh nhen bơngai tanh brai. Kră Yang kăt lê̆ inh đơ̆ng hơtơ̆ng wai, Kră Yang pơtôch lê̆ tơdrong arih inh đơ̆ng kơ năr truh kơmăng!

English: I have considered until morning— Like a lion, So He breaks all my bones; From day until night You make an end of me.
Bahnar: Inh ôr tơngưih truh pơgê, nhen thoi dăm-brang Sư teh pơchah tơgơ̆ đĭ kơting inh, Kră Yang gô pơtôch lê̆ tơdrong arih inh kơ năr păng kơmăng!

English: Like a crane or a swallow, so I chattered; I mourned like a dove; My eyes fail from looking upward. O LORD, I am oppressed; Undertake for me!
Bahnar: Inh ôr nhen sem kơdŏng, sem pleng, inh tơngưih nhen sem kơtơp si; măt inh lăng tơ kơpal đĭ rơgah. Ơ Kră Yang inh ơh sơ'ngon dêh, apinh ih dŏng iŏk inh bĕ!”

English: “What shall I say? He has both spoken to me, And He Himself has done it. I shall walk carefully all my years In the bitterness of my soul.
Bahnar: Inh wă pơma kiơ dơ̆ng? Kră Yang pơma hăm inh bơih, na Sư kư̆m gô pơm keh boih tơdrong noh. Đĭ chăl inh arih, inh gô arih sa pơyom, yua kơ lăm jơhngơ̆m chhŭr nuih.

English: O Lord, by these things men live; And in all these things is the life of my spirit; So You will restore me and make me live.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, kon bơngai arih yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong ih 'nâu. Bơhngol inh arih kư̆m yua kơ tơdrong noh! Ih pơklaih inh, ăn kơ inh arih.

English: Indeed it was for my own peace That I had great bitterness; But You have lovingly delivered my soul from the pit of corruption, For You have cast all my sins behind Your back.
Bahnar: Âu yua kơ đei tơdrong lơi yua kơ inh, na inh đei tơdrong chhŭr nuih lơ. Kră Yang 'mêm kơ inh rôp bơhngol inh kơjăp, wă kơ inh huay kơ huŏng lăm sơlŭng lôch răm; Kră Yang klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ bơih dôm tơdrong yoch inh tơ rŏng Ih.

English: For Sheol cannot thank You, Death cannot praise You; Those who go down to the pit cannot hope for Your truth.
Bahnar: Tơ dêh atâu ưh kơ gơh bơnê kơ Ih păng tơdrong lôch ưh kơ gơh ư-ang kơ Ih ôh, lu bơngai jur lăm sơlŭng jrŭ ưh kơ đei tơdrong chang hơmĕng kơ tơdrong tơpăt đơ̆ng Ih dơ̆ng.

English: The living, the living man, he shall praise You, As I do this day; The father shall make known Your truth to the children.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai arih, lu bơngai arih đĕch ư-ang kơ Ih. Thoi inh đei pơm năr âu. Lu bơngai pơm 'bă gô bơtho ăn kơ kon hơ'lơ̆p sư băt tơdrong tơpăt Ih.

English: “The LORD was ready to save me; Therefore we will sing my songs with stringed instruments All the days of our life, in the house of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang bơih Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih inh. Đĭ chăl arih nhôn gô reh brŏ păng hơri lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: Now Isaiah had said, “Let them take a lump of figs, and apply it as a poultice on the boil, and he shall recover.”
Bahnar: Êsai đei khan: “Iŏk bĕ minh pôm plei hơra dan 'bơ̆t pơtôch ih, na ih gơh klaih.”

English: And Hezekiah had said, “What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Hesekia tơl khan: “Đei tơdra kiơ ăn kơ inh băt inh gô tŏk tơ hnam Kră Yang?”

English: At that time Merodach-Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he heard that he had been sick and had recovered.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Mêrôđak Balađan, kon Balađan, pơtao Babilôn wơh bơngai năm ba hla kơthơ păng tơmam pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Hesekia, yua kơtơ̆ng ang sư jĭ dêh păng klaih bơih.

English: And Hezekiah was pleased with them, and showed them the house of his treasures—the silver and gold, the spices and precious ointment, and all his armory—all that was found among his treasures. There was nothing in his house or in all his dominion that Hezekiah did not show them.
Bahnar: Hesekia hiôk sơng iŏk lu sư, na sư ăn năm lăng lăm hnam pơtao, anih lê̆ tơmam gĭt thoi kơ: Hu, maih, pơgang 'bâu phu, đak plei ôliwơ gĭt hăm năm lăng anih 'măn lu tơmam tơblah păng dôm lu tơmam gĭt lăm anih hnam sư, mă tơmam kiơ kiơ lăm anih pơtao păng lăm jơ̆p kơ dêh char pơtao sư, ưh kơ đei minh pôm tơmam yă kiơ mă Hesekia ưh kơ ăn kơ lu bơngai tang măt ăn kơ dêh char Babilôn lăng.

English: Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah, and said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” So Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far country, from Babylon.”
Bahnar: Êsai bơngai khan lê̆ adrol năm tơ pơtao Hesekia păng jet sư: “Lu bơngai noh pơma yă kiơ hăm ih? Păng lu sư đơ̆ng yơ năm ngôi tơ ih?” Hesekia tơl khan: “Lu sư đơ̆ng dêh ataih truh tơ âu, đơ̆ng dêh char Babilôn.”

English: And he said, “What have they seen in your house?” So Hezekiah answered, “They have seen all that is in my house; there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.”
Bahnar: Êsai jet: “Lu sư lăng kiơ lăm hnam pơtao?” Hesekia tơl khan: “Lu sư lăng đĭ dôm lu tơmam lăm anih hnam pơtao inh, ưh kơ đei anih tơmam gĭt kiơ lăm anih mă inh ưh kơ tơ'bôh ăn kơ lu sư lăng.”

English: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the LORD of hosts
Bahnar: Êsai khan kơ Hesekia: “Apinh ih mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan

English: ‘Behold, the days are coming when all that is in your house, and what your fathers have accumulated until this day, shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left,’ says the LORD.
Bahnar: Âu, năr gô truh, dôm tơmam lăm anih hnam pơtao ih, dôm tơmam mă 'bok ih 'măn lê̆ lăm hnam đơ̆ng sơ̆ truh năr 'nâu, gô chĕp ba pơđĭ tơ dêh char Babilôn, ưh pă đei lê̆ minh pôm tơmam kiơ dơ̆ng, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: ‘And they shall take away some of your sons who will descend from you, whom you will beget; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”
Bahnar: Lu kon sâu drŏ-nglo ih, lĕch đơ̆ng ih pơjing đei lu mơ'nah đe gô rôp pơm linh krĕo lăm hnam pơtao Babilôn.”

English: So Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the LORD which you have spoken is good!” For he said, “At least there will be peace and truth in my days.”
Bahnar: Hesekia tơl nơ̆r Êsai khan: “Nơ̆r Kră Yang mă ih 'nao roi kơ inh noh 'lơ̆ng tơpă. Yua kơ lăm năr inh oei arih inh tơchĕng gô đei hiôk-hian rơnŭk rơnua.”

English: “Comfort, yes, comfort My people!” Says your God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm khan: Pơlung bĕ, pơlung bĕ kon pơlei Inh.

English: “Speak comfort to Jerusalem, and cry out to her, That her warfare is ended, That her iniquity is pardoned; For she has received from the LORD’s hand Double for all her sins.”
Bahnar: Pơma bĕ kơ pơlei Jêrusalem mă hiôk păng roi khan tơdrong lu sư pơm đĭch tôch đĭ bơih, tơdrong yoch lu sư mơnat ăn bơih, lu sư chu iŏk bơih đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang mơnat 'bar wơ̆t hloh kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: The voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Prepare the way of the LORD; Make straight in the desert A highway for our God.
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r krao: “Pơih bĕ trong lăm bri glă ăn kơ Kră Yang; hơmet bĕ trong mă tơpăt lăm teh glă ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n.

English: Every valley shall be exalted And every mountain and hill brought low; The crooked places shall be made straight And the rough places smooth
Bahnar: Rim anih thŭng thong gô tŏk kơjung, Rim kông, rim groi gô tơjur tơ kơđeh, lu anih hơlôk hơlak gô pơm dơnă, lu anih kông krang, gô jing dơnă 'lơ̆ng.

English: The glory of the LORD shall be revealed, And all flesh shall see it together; For the mouth of the LORD has spoken.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang gô pơdah păng đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô lăng 'bôh; yua kơ 'bơ̆r Kră Yang pơma bơih thoi noh.

English: The voice said, “Cry out!” And he said, “What shall I cry?” “All flesh is grass, And all its loveliness is like the flower of the field.
Bahnar: Đei nơ̆r khan: “Krao ôr bĕ!” Inh jet: “Inh gô krao lơliơ?” “Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai nhen thoi 'nhĕt. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng sư nhen thoi pơkao tơ bri brah.

English: The grass withers, the flower fades, Because the breath of the LORD blows upon it; Surely the people are grass.
Bahnar: 'Nhĕt kro, pơkao hơlŭng, mưh hơyuh Kră Yang tơthu. Tơpă kon bơngai thoi 'nhĕt 'nhot đĕch

English: The grass withers, the flower fades, But the word of our God stands forever.”
Bahnar: 'Nhĕt kro, pơkao hơlŭng: Mă-lei nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n oei kơjăp ling-lang!”

English: O Zion, You who bring good tidings, Get up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, You who bring good tidings, Lift up your voice with strength, Lift it up, be not afraid; Say to the cities of Judah, “Behold your God!”
Bahnar: Ơ Siôn lu iĕm bơngai mă ră roi tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng, tŏk bĕ tơ kơpal kông kơjung! Ơ Jêrusalem lu iĕm bơngai mă tơbăt tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng ôr mă re đĭ jơhngơ̆m bĕ! Ôr mă re! 'Nĕ kơ hli! Khan bĕ kơ lu pơlei tih Juđa: “'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm!”

English: Behold, the Lord GOD shall come with a strong hand, And His arm shall rule for Him; Behold, His reward is with Him, And His work before Him.
Bahnar: To Kră Yang jur hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang, păng Sư pơgơ̆r hăm ti pran kơtang Sư To, lu bơngai mă Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih gô năm hơdai Sư.

English: He will feed His flock like a shepherd; He will gather the lambs with His arm, And carry them in His bosom, And gently lead those who are with young.
Bahnar: Sư gô wei rong khŭl triu Sư nhen thoi bơngai wei triu, akŭm lu triu kon lăm ti Sư, păng kơ'mĭn kuăr sư tơ kơtơh, chông hơdar hơdêh lu triu yŏng đei kon iĕ.

English: Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, Measured heaven with a span And calculated the dust of the earth in a measure? Weighed the mountains in scales And the hills in a balance?
Bahnar: Bu yua bơih tơpang sư na kŏng đak dơsĭ, yua hơđa ti sư pơtŏ lu plĕnh ti? Bu Yua hnŏng na kŏng bơih 'mui teh? Bu yua bơih 'long kŏng na kŏng kông? Bu yua bơih tơlei tơpăt na pơtŏ kông groi?

English: Who has directed the Spirit of the LORD, Or as His counselor has taught Him?
Bahnar: Bu băt Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơchĕng liơ. Bu gơh bơtho pơhrăm pơđâu kơ Sư?

English: With whom did He take counsel, and who instructed Him, And taught Him in the path of justice? Who taught Him knowledge, And showed Him the way of understanding?
Bahnar: Sư hăm đei pơđâu hăm bu wă kơ hơdah bu đei bơtho Sư tơdrong tơpăt? Bu gô bơtho Sư tơdrong hlôh băt? Bu gô bơtho tơ'bôh ăn kơ Sư trong gơh hơgei?

English: Behold, the nations are as a drop in a bucket, And are counted as the small dust on the scales; Look, He lifts up the isles as a very little thing.
Bahnar: Tơpă đĭ-đăng kon bơngai nhen thoi minh tơdjoh đak lăm kơthao păng lăng nhen thoi 'bruih iĕ huŏng kơpal 'long kŏng, Sư gô chĕp đĭ bŏl lăm đak dơsĭ nhen thoi minh găr 'bruih iĕ.

English: And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, Nor its beasts sufficient for a burnt offering.
Bahnar: 'Long lăm Liban wă tơkuh lăm chơnang soi ưh kơmah, păng lu sem brem kư̆m ưh kơ mah wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: All nations before Him are as nothing, And they are counted by Him less than nothing and worthless.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dêh char 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang dang lĕ hoh-hoy, Sư lăng lu noh dang lĕ tam mă đei, păng ưh kơ đei kiơ.

English: To whom then will you liken God? Or what likeness will you compare to Him?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm hăm gơh pơting Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bu? Iĕm iŏk hơbŏ kiơ wă pơtih hăm Sư?
