English: The workman molds an image, The goldsmith overspreads it with gold, And the silversmith casts silver chains.
Bahnar: Minh pôm rup man mă kon bơngai tuh pơm hling hu lom maih, păng tuh pơm lu tơlei rơbưn hăm hu hă?

English: Whoever is too impoverished for such a contribution Chooses a tree that will not rot; He seeks for himself a skillful workman To prepare a carved image that will not totter.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai dơnuh wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi. Sư rơih chă 'long mă ưh kơ bŭk, păng chă bơngai gơh traih hơgei. Traih pơm minh pôm rup kơjăp huay kơ păk tơkơ̆l.

English: Have you not known? Have you not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Have you not understood from the foundations of the earth?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ băt hă? Lu iĕm ưh tam kơtơ̆ng hă? Đe ưh tam mă bơtho khan ăn kơ iĕm đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ dah kiơ? Lu iĕm ưh tam hlôh hă đơ̆ng năr pơjing hơnă teh âu.

English: It is He who sits above the circle of the earth, And its inhabitants are like grasshoppers, Who stretches out the heavens like a curtain, And spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.
Bahnar: Sư bơih oei kơpal gơwang teh đak âu; lu kon bơngai oei kơpal teh âu nhen thoi lep đĕch. Sư bơlang plĕnh nhen bơlang che; Sư dăng che noh thoi đe wă pơm bơsŭn oei.

English: He brings the princes to nothing; He makes the judges of the earth useless.
Bahnar: Sư bơih pơm kơ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r jing tơdrong kơ đei păng lu Kră pơgơ̆r tơ kơpal teh âu jing ưh kơ đei yua.

English: Scarcely shall they be planted, Scarcely shall they be sown, Scarcely shall their stock take root in the earth, When He will also blow on them, And they will wither, And the whirlwind will take them away like stubble.
Bahnar: Lu sư thoi 'nao pơtăm, 'nao rei, 'long 'nao chăt rơh lăm teh, Kră Yang tơthu na sư jô kro; kial phŭt huơ̆r bơbơ̆t đĭ lu sư thoi hơkam 'ba.

English: “To whom then will you liken Me, Or to whom shall I be equal?” says the Holy One.
Bahnar: Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh khan: “Lu iĕm wă pơting Inh hăm bu?” Bu hơtŏ hăm Inh?

English: Lift up your eyes on high, And see who has created these things, Who brings out their host by number; He calls them all by name, By the greatness of His might And the strength of His power; Not one is missing.
Bahnar: Ngơk bĕ măt tơ kơpal plĕnh, na lăng bu pơjing bơih lu tơmam âu? Bu Tơ'ngla ba lu sơnglŏng đei dôm noh păng krao anăn rim kơ lu noh, yua kơ Sư pran tih dêh păng Sư mơsêh mơyang. Ưh kơ đei hơnglŏng kiơ ưh kơ đei.

English: Why do you say, O Jacob, And speak, O Israel: “My way is hidden from the LORD, And my just claim is passed over by my God”?
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch Jakôp lơliơ iĕm khan: Ơ bơngai Isơrael lơliơ iĕm pơma tơtok: “Trong inh đĭ ôn pĕng lê̆ bơih đơ̆ng Kră Yang; 'Bok Kei-Dei inh ưh pă gan lăng inh bơih?

English: Have you not known? Have you not heard? The everlasting God, the LORD, The Creator of the ends of the earth, Neither faints nor is weary. His understanding is unsearchable.
Bahnar: Lơliơ iĕm ưh kơ băt hă? Ưh tam kơtơ̆ng hă? Kră Yang arih ling-lang Sư bơih, Tơ'ngla pơjing plĕnh teh, ưh kơ gleh lap ôh; păng tơdrong hlôh băt Sư ưh kơ đei bu gơh hlôh.

English: He gives power to the weak, And to those who have no might He increases strength.
Bahnar: Sư ăn jơhngơ̆m pran kơ lu bơngai gleh lap, thim ăn jơhngơ̆m pran kơ lu bơngai rơdu.

English: Even the youths shall faint and be weary, And the young men shall utterly fall
Bahnar: Mă lu bơngai 'nao iung kư̆m gleh lap lu tơdăm kư̆m gô kơtơih pơ̆k.

English: But those who wait on the LORD Shall renew their strength; They shall mount up with wings like eagles, They shall run and not be weary, They shall walk and not faint.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bu chang gô Kră Yang sư gô đei jơhngơ̆m pran 'nao, sư gô păr kơjung thoi sem klang; kơdâu mă ưh kơ băt kơ lap, nơnăm mă ưh kơ gleh.

English: “Keep silence before Me, O coastlands, And let the people renew their strength! Let them come near, then let them speak; Let us come near together for judgment.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bŏl đak dơsĭ oei hreh bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, wă kơ lu teh đak iŏk jơhngơ̆m pran 'nao lê̆ lu sư năm jê̆ Inh na pơma: Bĕ lu bơ̆n akŭm hơdai wă sek tơlang!

English: “Who raised up one from the east? Who in righteousness called him to His feet? Who gave the nations before him, And made him rule over kings? Who gave them as the dust to his sword, As driven stubble to his bow?
Bahnar: Bu râu tơiung bơngai đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch? Kră Yang Krao sư năm bơ̆jang lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Kră Yang jao đĭ teh đak ăn kơ sư, pơjuă lu pơtao tơ ala jơ̆ng sư, sư pơm kơ lu pơtao nhen 'bruih teh hăm đao gưm sư, jao lu pơtao hră sư pơm kơ lu sư thoi hơkam 'ba kial bơbơ̆t pơđông đĭ.

English: Who pursued them, and passed safely By the way that he had not gone with his feet?
Bahnar: Sư druh lu sư ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ̆ 'bơm Sư, Na Sư rok trong mă jơ̆ng sư ưh tam mă biơh rok.

English: Who has performed and done it, Calling the generations from the beginning? ‘I, the LORD, am the first; And with the last I am He.’ ”
Bahnar: Bu đei pơm bơih tơdrong âu? Bu krao iŏk jơhnơr kon bơngai đơ̆ng blŭng-a? Noh Inh bơih Kră Yang blŭng-a, mă kư̆m oei dang ei truh kơ tôch. Inh bơih Kră Yang noh.

English: The coastlands saw it and feared, The ends of the earth were afraid; They drew near and came.
Bahnar: Lu bŏl đak dơsĭ 'bôh păng hli tơrơ, tôch kơ teh đak tơtơ̆ đĭ. Lu sư năm păng năm jê̆.

English: Everyone helped his neighbor, And said to his brother, “Be of good courage!”
Bahnar: Rim 'nu tơgŭm băl, păng khan kơ 'nhŏng oh sư: Mă nuih bĕ!

English: So the craftsman encouraged the goldsmith; He who smooths with the hammer inspired him who strikes the anvil, Saying, “It is ready for the soldering”; Then he fastened it with pegs, That it might not totter.
Bahnar: Bơngai traih 'long pơtrŭt bơngai hling maih, bơngai tơtang hăm mut pơtrŭt lu bơngai hơjơ̆m, khan kơ bơngai hang: “Noh 'lơ̆ng bơih” đơ̆ng noh Sư iŏk kơđĭnh pơ̆ng wă kơ rup 'long noh huay kơ păk.

English: “But you, Israel, are My servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, The descendants of Abraham My friend.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm, ơ bơngai Isơrael, đĭch đam Inh, păng iĕm ơ adrĕch Jakôp bơngai mă Inh đei rơih iŏk bơih, adrĕch adrung Abraham buăl Inh.

English: You whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, And called from its farthest regions, And said to you, ‘You are My servant, I have chosen you and have not cast you away
Bahnar: Inh iŏk iĕm đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh đak, krao iŏk iĕm đơ̆ng puăn pah mum teh; Inh khan kơ iĕm: Iĕm bơih đam Inh, Inh rơih iŏk iĕm bơih, ưh kơ đei layơ achăng lê̆ ih.

English: Fear not, for I am with you; Be not dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you, Yes, I will help you, I will uphold you with My righteous right hand.’
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hli yua kơ Inh oei hơdai iĕm, 'nĕ tơrơ dêh, yua kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm! Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm pran; tơpă inh tơgŭm iĕm, Inh gô wei-lăng iĕm hăm ti gah 'ma 'Lơ̆ng Tơpăt Inh.

English: “Behold, all those who were incensed against you Shall be ashamed and disgraced; They shall be as nothing, And those who strive with you shall perish.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai mă hil kơ iĕm, lu sư gô mơlâu păng hlơ̆l. Lu bơngai iung blah iĕm lu sư gô răm păng lôch hiong.

English: You shall seek them and not find them— Those who contended with you. Those who war against you Shall be as nothing, As a nonexistent thing.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô chă lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh. Lu bơngai tơblah plơ̆ hăm iĕm gô lôch răm đĭ thoi ưh kơ đei.

English: For I, the LORD your God, will hold your right hand, Saying to you, ‘Fear not, I will help you.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm: Tơ'ngla rôp ti 'ma lu iĕm, păng khan kơ lu iĕm, 'nĕ kơ hli ôh Inh gô tơgŭm lu iĕm

English: “Fear not, you worm Jacob, You men of Israel! I will help you,” says the LORD And your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch Jakôp thoi hơdrông, ơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael, 'nĕ kơ hli kơ kiơ, Inh gô tơgŭm iĕm, Kră Yang pơma thoi noh, Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng tơpăt đe Isơrael păng Tơ'ngla huai iŏk lu iĕm.

English: “Behold, I will make you into a new threshing sledge with sharp teeth; You shall thresh the mountains and beat them small, And make the hills like chaff.
Bahnar: Âu, inh gô pơm kơ lu iĕm nhen thoi minh pôm tơmam preh 'ba 'nao hơnĕnh sư lơ păng han dêh, lu iĕm gô preh lu kông pơhĕch lê̆ lu Sư, lu groi jing thoi hơkam 'ba.

English: You shall winnow them, the wind shall carry them away, And the whirlwind shall scatter them; You shall rejoice in the LORD, And glory in the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô um sư na gô tơthu pơđông lu sư, phŭt gô huơ̆r lu sư tơklah hiong đĭ, mă-lei gah lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang gô ư-ang kơ Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: “The poor and needy seek water, but there is none, Their tongues fail for thirst. I, the LORD, will hear them; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai dơnuh păng lu bơngai kơ'bah tơmam chơchă đak. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei, hơpiĕt đĭ kro yua kơ rơhing dêh, Inh bơih Kră Yang gô tơl nơ̆r lu sư, Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael ưh kơ achăng tŭk lu sư ôh.

English: I will open rivers in desolate heights, And fountains in the midst of the valleys; I will make the wilderness a pool of water, And the dry land springs of water.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ đak krong lĕch ro tơ kông groi mơ-mlưch păng tu đak glung gô ro 'bĕnh lăm thŭng, inh gô pơm kơ teh char glă jing dơnâu đak. Teh hrĕng kro gô jing đak mơlĕch.

English: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar and the acacia tree, The myrtle and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the cypress tree and the pine And the box tree together
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtăm tơ anih bri char glă, lu hơngo, 'long keo, 'long pơgang păng 'long ôliwơ. Inh gô pơtăm 'long hơngo hla iĕ, hơngo hmă, 'long krăk hơdai tơ lăm char glă.

English: That they may see and know, And consider and understand together, That the hand of the LORD has done this, And the Holy One of Israel has created it.
Bahnar: Wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai 'bôh păng băt, wă kơ tơchĕng hơdai hlôh khan, noh đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang pơm tơdrong 'nâu, păng Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael pơjing tơdrong noh.

English: “Present your case,” says the LORD. “Bring forth your strong reasons,” says the King of Jacob.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Pơdah bĕ tơdrong lu iĕm, wă khan” Pơtao đe Jakôp khan: “Pơdah pơsĭt bĕ tơdrong lu iĕm khan trŏ.”

English: “Let them bring forth and show us what will happen; Let them show the former things, what they were, That we may consider them, And know the latter end of them; Or declare to us things to come.
Bahnar: Lê̆ lu rup Yang roi dơ̆ng bĕ! Roi bĕ kơ lu nhôn tơdrong kiơ gô truh! Ră roi bĕ tơdrong blŭng-a sơ̆ sư đei lơliơ wă kơ nhôn lăng lăng păng hlôh kơ tơdrong tuch-luch sư thoi yơ, Athei roi kơ lu nhôn băt dôm tơdrong, kiơ gô truh ning-mônh.

English: Show the things that are to come hereafter, That we may know that you are gods; Yes, do good or do evil, That we may be dismayed and see it together.
Bahnar: Roi bĕ kơ lu nhôn dôm tơdrong gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơnh, wă kơ lu nhôn băt kơ lu iĕm jơ̆ lu yang, pơm tơ'bôh bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng dah tơdrong kơnê̆ wă kơ lu nhôn chhưu jơhngơ̆m păng lăng 'bôh hlĭch hlăch.

English: Indeed you are nothing, And your work is nothing; He who chooses you is an abomination.
Bahnar: Âu, lu iĕm ưh kơ rơ-a kiơ, tơdrong jang iĕm pơm kư̆m ưh kơ yua kiơ, bơngai mă rơih lu iĕm jơ̆ bơngai trŏ kơ areh krưp dêh tơpă.

English: “I have raised up one from the north, And he shall come; From the rising of the sun he shall call on My name; And he shall come against princes as though mortar, As the potter treads clay.
Bahnar: Inh tơiung minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m păng sư năm bơih; Minh 'nu đơ̆ng gah 'năr lĕch sư krao apinh hăm Anăn Inh Sư pơjuă kơpal lu 'bok pơgơ̆r nhen pơjuă teh hlŭt, nhen thoi bơngai man gŏ pơjuă teh lơ̆n.

English: Who has declared from the beginning, that we may know? And former times, that we may say, ‘He is righteous’? Surely there is no one who shows, Surely there is no one who declares, Surely there is no one who hears your words.
Bahnar: Bu roi pơdah bơih tơdrong noh đơ̆ng blŭng-a wă kơ lu bơ̆n băt? Bu đei roi bơih đơ̆ng adrol sơ̆, wă kơ lu bơ̆n khan: “Sư trŏ bơih!” Ưh kơ đei bu ră roi ôh, ưh kơ đei bu năm khan ôh, ưh kơ đei bu kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng lu iĕm ôh.

English: The first time I said to Zion, ‘Look, there they are!’ And I will give to Jerusalem one who brings good tidings.
Bahnar: Inh bơih mă adrol hloh roi kơ Siôn khan: “Lăng, lu sư âu!” Inh gô wơh minh 'nu rup Yang năm roi tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng tơ plei Jêrusalem.

English: For I looked, and there was no man; I looked among them, but there was no counselor, Who, when I asked of them, could answer a word.
Bahnar: Inh chă lăng, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu, lăm lu rup Yang kư̆m ưh kơ đei Yang kiơ gơh chă đon, wă kơ mưh Inh jet sư gơh tơl tơwih kơ Inh minh nơ̆r.

English: Indeed they are all worthless; Their works are nothing; Their molded images are wind and confusion.
Bahnar: Tơpă đĭ-đăng lu sư jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei, tơdrong jang lu sư jing pă yua, rup lu sư man, dang kial 'biao pă đei.

English: “Behold! My Servant whom I uphold, My Elect One in whom My soul delights! I have put My Spirit upon Him; He will bring forth justice to the Gentiles.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơih đam Inh bơngai mă Inh dŏng tơgŭm, bơngai mă Inh rơih iŏk, bơngai mă Inh lăp đon. Inh gô dan yang Bơhngol Inh lăm sư, sư gô ba ăn tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng kơ lu teh đak.

English: He will not cry out, nor raise His voice, Nor cause His voice to be heard in the street.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ ôr pơret, kư̆m ưh kơ pơma re, ưh kơ ăn kơ đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r sư tơ rok trong pơlei.

English: A bruised reed He will not break, And smoking flax He will not quench; He will bring forth justice for truth.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gơ̆ lê̆ 'long gơlăr wă tơgơ̆ bơih păng ưh kơ pĭt lê̆ ŭnh oei khơ̆ng kơplah brai wă jê̆ tôch. Sư gô ba tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng hăm tơdrong sĭt.

English: He will not fail nor be discouraged, Till He has established justice in the earth; And the coastlands shall wait for His law.”
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gleh lap, ưh kơ bơ̆l hăl ôh, dĭng truh kơ pơjing tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng tơ teh đak âu, lu bŏl đak dơsĭ chang gô hơmĕng kơ khôi juăt sư.

English: Thus says God the LORD, Who created the heavens and stretched them out, Who spread forth the earth and that which comes from it, Who gives breath to the people on it, And spirit to those who walk on it
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing lu plĕnh păng bơlang plĕnh, Sư Tơ'ngla lơ̆k bơlang bơih teh hăm dôm tơmam lĕch đơ̆ng noh. Tơ'ngla ăn kial dui jơhngơ̆m kơ kon bơngai păng ăn tơdrong arih lu bơngai yak năm kơpal teh. 'Nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ đam Sư.

English: “I, the LORD, have called You in righteousness, And will hold Your hand; I will keep You and give You as a covenant to the people, As a light to the Gentiles
Bahnar: Inh Kră Yang krao ih wă tơ'bôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Inh, Inh gô rôp kơjăp ti ih păng wei-lăng ih, Inh gô jao ăn kơ ih pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh hăm kon pơlei ih tơm tơdrong hơdah ăn kơ lu teh đak.

English: To open blind eyes, To bring out prisoners from the prison, Those who sit in darkness from the prison house.
Bahnar: Wă pơih ăn măt lu bơngai tol, tơlĕch lu bơngai đe chĭt lăm hnam phak păng đơ̆ng anih măng mu.

English: I am the LORD, that is My name; And My glory I will not give to another, Nor My praise to carved images.
Bahnar: “Inh bơih Kră Yang, Noh jơ̆ Anăn Inh. Inh ưh kơ asong tơdrong ư-ang 'lơ̆ng rŏ Inh kơ minh 'nu bu nai, kư̆m ưh kơ ăn tơdrong pơư bơnê Inh kơ lu rup man!”

English: Behold, the former things have come to pass, And new things I declare; Before they spring forth I tell you of them.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong adrol đei truh 'blep trŏ bơih, dang ei Inh roi ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'nao dơ̆ng; adrol kơ Sư wă truh, Inh roi ăn kơ iĕm băt adrol.

English: Sing to the LORD a new song, And His praise from the ends of the earth, You who go down to the sea, and all that is in it, You coastlands and you inhabitants of them!
Bahnar: Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'bai hơri 'nao. Hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Sư đơ̆ng anih tôch kơ teh đak. Ơ Lu bơngai năm tơ đak dơsĭ, hăm lu sem brem arih lăm noh, ơ lu bŏl đak dơsĭ păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei lăm noh.

English: Let the wilderness and its cities lift up their voice, The villages that Kedar inhabits. Let the inhabitants of Sela sing, Let them shout from the top of the mountains.
Bahnar: Ơ lu char glă hăm lu pơlei tih jreo tơkĕch bĕ, lu kon pơlei Kêdar oei kư̆m hiôk thoi noh mơ̆n; ơ kon pơlei Sêla hơri bĕ, krao ôr chơt hiôk bĕ dơ̆ng kơpal kông ti!

English: Let them give glory to the LORD, And declare His praise in the coastlands.
Bahnar: Pơyơ̆r bĕ tơdrong ư-ang kơ Kră Yang păng roi tơdrong bơnê kơ Kră Yang tơ lăm jơ̆p-jang bŏl dơsĭ.

English: The LORD shall go forth like a mighty man; He shall stir up His zeal like a man of war. He shall cry out, yes, shout aloud; He shall prevail against His enemies.
Bahnar: Kră Yang năm tơ anăp thoi minh 'nu bơngai pran kơtang, Sư pơtrŭt jơhngơ̆m hưch hal nhen thoi linh tơblah, Sư ôr pơret re, Sư nuih tơblah hăm ayăt jei Sư.

English: “I have held My peace a long time, I have been still and restrained Myself. Now I will cry like a woman in labor, I will pant and gasp at once.
Bahnar: “Inh oei hreh đunh bơih, Inh ngăn hrĕng ĕnh kơdih akâu. Mă-lei dang ei inh tơngưih re, dui jơhngơ̆m gleh nhen drŏ-kăn tơpŭ.

English: I will lay waste the mountains and hills, And dry up all their vegetation; I will make the rivers coastlands, And I will dry up the pools.
Bahnar: Inh wă pơrăm lê̆ kông groi Inh pơm kơ lu 'nhĕt 'long jô kro, Inh gô pơm kơ glung krong jing teh hrĕng đak dơnâu gô hrơ̆.

English: I will bring the blind by a way they did not know; I will lead them in paths they have not known. I will make darkness light before them, And crooked places straight. These things I will do for them, And not forsake them.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông lu bơngai măt tol rok trong lu sư ưh kơ biơh năm, dui lu sư rok trong iĕ mă lu sư ưh tam juăt; inh gô tơplih măng mu jing hơdah 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, Inh gô pơm kơ teh jrŭ đơng jing dơnă. Tơpă inh gô pơm lu tơdrong noh păng ưh kơ achăng tŭk lu sư ôh.

English: They shall be turned back, They shall be greatly ashamed, Who trust in carved images, Who say to the molded images, ‘You are our gods.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai gơnang kơ rup yang lu sư traih lu bơngai khan kơ lu rup lu sư man: Lu iĕm bơih yang lu nhôn, tă kơ gô kơdŭn tơ rŏng păng mơlâu.

English: “Hear, you deaf; And look, you blind, that you may see.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai klĭk, mơ̆ng bĕ, ơ lu bơngai măt tol lar măt iĕm lăng bĕ

English: Who is blind but My servant, Or deaf as My messenger whom I send? Who is blind as he who is perfect, And blind as the LORD’s servant?
Bahnar: Bu măt tol, thoi đam Inh? Bu klĭk nhen bơngai mă Inh wơh năm bơih? Bu măt tol nhen bơngai jao Sư đĭ kơ Inh? Bu măt tol nhen đam Kră Yang?

English: Seeing many things, but you do not observe; Opening the ears, but he does not hear.”
Bahnar: Iĕm 'bôh ră lơ tơdrong mă ưh kơ wă lăng hơlen, iĕm đei ră hla đon mă ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng.

English: The LORD is well pleased for His righteousness’ sake; He will exalt the law and make it honorable.
Bahnar: Kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư kơdih Kră Yang lăp đon, Sư gô pơm kơ khôi juăt Sư hơdah păng ư-ang.

English: But this is a people robbed and plundered; All of them are snared in holes, And they are hidden in prison houses; They are for prey, and no one delivers; For plunder, and no one says, “Restore!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei Sư đe tơtông, đe tơgar iŏk, Đĭ-đăng lu sư huŏng lăm sơlŭng păng đe chĭt ôn lăm sơlŭng jrŭ, lu sư jing tơmam đe tơtông iŏk. Mă ưh kơ đei bu dŏng pơklaih lu sư, mă ưh kơ đei bu khan: “Pơdrâu kơ Inh wă!”

English: Who among you will give ear to this? Who will listen and hear for the time to come?
Bahnar: Bu lăm lu iĕm gô pơđêng đon mơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu, bu kơchăm mơ̆ng đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp?

English: Who gave Jacob for plunder, and Israel to the robbers? Was it not the LORD, He against whom we have sinned? For they would not walk in His ways, Nor were they obedient to His law.
Bahnar: Bu jao lê̆ Jakôp ăn đe plah iŏk, păng lê̆ lu bơngai Isơrael ăn kơ đe tơtông? Ưh kơ trŏ Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă lu bơ̆n pơm yoch hăm Sư hă? Lu sư ưh kơ wă yak kiơ̆ trong Kră Yang păng ưh kơ wei răk khôi juăt Sư?

English: Therefore He has poured on him the fury of His anger And the strength of battle; It has set him on fire all around, Yet he did not know; And it burned him, Yet he did not take it to heart.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang tuh tơdrong Sư hil, tơdrong tơblah wang tih dêh tơ lu sư, thoi ŭnh sa jum dăr mă lu sư ưh kơ hlôh, ŭnh sa lu sư mă-lei kư̆m ưh kơ bơngơ̆t.

English: But now, thus says the LORD, who created you, O Jacob, And He who formed you, O Israel: “Fear not, for I have redeemed you; I have called you by your name; You are Mine.
Bahnar: Dang ei Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Ơ Jakôp Sư Tơ'ngla pơjing iĕm, ơ Isơrael! Sư bơih Tơ'ngla pơjing iĕm, 'nĕ kơ hli yua kơ Inh huai iŏk iĕm bơih. Inh bơih krao iĕm hăm anăn iĕm păng iĕm gah Inh.

English: When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; And through the rivers, they shall not overflow you. When you walk through the fire, you shall not be burned, Nor shall the flame scorch you.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm tŏk kơ đak, inh gô oei hơdai iĕm, tơdah iĕm glơi tŏk kơ đak glung, iĕm huay kơ glơ̆k ôh, tơdah iĕm yak lăm ŭnh iĕm huay kơ pơtŏk, pla ŭnh ưh kơ sa iĕm.

English: For I am the LORD your God, The Holy One of Israel, your Savior; I gave Egypt for your ransom, Ethiopia and Seba in your place.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Isơrael, Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih iĕm. Inh ăn bơih dêh char Êyiptơ jing tơmam huai iŏk iĕm. Char Kus păng Sêba pơm tơmam huai tơplih kơ iĕm.

English: Since you were precious in My sight, You have been honored, And I have loved you; Therefore I will give men for you, And people for your life.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm bơih gĭt dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Inh; trŏ kơ Inh 'mêm kơeng, na Inh ăn đei bơngai wă tơplih iŏk iĕm păng ăn đĭ-đăng kon pơlei tơplih kơ tơdrong arih iĕm.

English: Fear not, for I am with you; I will bring your descendants from the east, And gather you from the west
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli ôh, yua kơ Inh oei hơdai iĕm. Inh gô chông adrĕch adrung iĕm đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch păng akŭm lu iĕm đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t.

English: I will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’ And to the south, ‘Do not keep them back!’ Bring My sons from afar, And My daughters from the ends of the earth
Bahnar: Inh gô khan kơ gah yă-nơ̆m: ‘Achăng lu sư bĕ’ păng khan kơ gah gơal: ‘Lê̆ pă rôp pơkơ̆ng lu sư.’ Chông ba bĕ lu kon drŏ-nglo Inh brŏk đơ̆ng dêh ataih, chông ba lu kon drŏ-kăn Inh brŏk đơ̆ng tôch kơ teh.

English: Everyone who is called by My name, Whom I have created for My glory; I have formed him, yes, I have made him.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă Inh krao hăm anăn Inh, Inh bơih pơjing lu sư, wă ư-ang kơ Inh, tơpă Inh bơih pơjing lu sư.

English: Bring out the blind people who have eyes, And the deaf who have ears.
Bahnar: Chông ba bĕ kon pơlei noh, kon pơlei đei ră măt mă-lei tol. Đei ră đon mă-lei klĭk!

English: Let all the nations be gathered together, And let the people be assembled. Who among them can declare this, And show us former things? Let them bring out their witnesses, that they may be justified; Or let them hear and say, “It is truth.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dêh char akŭm băl bĕ, rim lu adrĕch adrung kon bơngai akŭm hơdai bĕ! Lăm lu sư bu gơh roi hơdrol tơdrong âu păng roi pơdah ăn kơ lu bơ̆n băt dôm tơdrong truh đơ̆ng adrol sơ̆? Lu sư athei chông ba bơngai roi pơm kơdranh tơpăt wă kơ đe băt kơ lu sư tơpăt păng ăn kơ đe kơtơ̆ng na khan: Noh jơ̆ sĭt tơpă!

English: “You are My witnesses,” says the LORD, “And My servant whom I have chosen, That you may know and believe Me, And understand that I am He. Before Me there was no God formed, Nor shall there be after Me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lu iĕm bơih bơngai pơm kơdranh gah Inh, đĭch đam Inh mă đei rơih iŏk bơih, wă kơ lu iĕm băt păng lui kơ Inh, păng hlôh kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang iĕm noh! Ưh kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei ayơ mă pơjing đei adrol kơ Inh păng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Inh kư̆m ưh kơ đei.

English: I, even I, am the LORD, And besides Me there is no savior.
Bahnar: Inh âu bơih Kră Yang, 'nguaih kơ inh, ưh kơ đei 'bok dŏng pơklaih nai ôh.

English: I have declared and saved, I have proclaimed, And there was no foreign god among you; Therefore you are My witnesses,” Says the LORD, “that I am God.
Bahnar: Inh, Tơ'ngla roi tơbăt bơih, Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih păng bơtho tơ'bôh, ưh kơ đei yang ayơ mă hlĭch tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm.” Kră Yang khan: “Lu iĕm bơih bơngai pơm kơdranh gah Inh, Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei!

English: Indeed before the day was, I am He; And there is no one who can deliver out of My hand; I work, and who will reverse it?”
Bahnar: Tơpă, adrol kơ đơ̆ng đei khei năr sơ̆, Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ đei bu gơh iŏk tơgar đơ̆ng ti Inh. Mưh Inh pơm, ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơgăn Inh.

English: Thus says the LORD, your Redeemer, The Holy One of Israel: “For your sake I will send to Babylon, And bring them all down as fugitives— The Chaldeans, who rejoice in their ships.
Bahnar: Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla huai iŏk lu iĕm, Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh đe Isơrael khan thoi âu: “Yua kơ lu iĕm, Inh wơh đe năm truh tơ pơlei Babilôn, pơm kơ lu sư kơdâu đĭ wă khan lu bơngai Kalđê, kơdâu ôn jur tơ lu thŏng-nan nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: I am the LORD, your Holy One, The Creator of Israel, your King.”
Bahnar: Inh bơih Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh lu iĕm, Tơ'ngla pơjing Isơrael, Inh bơih Pơtao iĕm.”

English: Thus says the LORD, who makes a way in the sea And a path through the mighty waters
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Sư boih Tơ'ngla pơih bơih trong lăm đak dơsĭ, păng pơm trong rok đak ro jăng.

English: Who brings forth the chariot and horse, The army and the power (They shall lie down together, they shall not rise; They are extinguished, they are quenched like a wick)
Bahnar: Pơm ăn kơ lu gre aseh, lu linh pran kơtang akŭm băl, đĭ-đăng lu sư pơ̆k tơ noh, ưh kơ kĕ kơ iung dơ̆ng, lu sư lôch đĭ, nhen đe pĭt ŭnh kơđeng.

English: “Do not remember the former things, Nor consider the things of old.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă 'blŏk dơ̆ng kơ tơdrong adrol ki sơ̆, păng lê̆ pă tơchĕng kơ tơdrong chăl so sơ̆ bơih.

English: Behold, I will do a new thing, Now it shall spring forth; Shall you not know it? I will even make a road in the wilderness And rivers in the desert.
Bahnar: Âu, Inh oei pơm minh tơdrong 'nao, dang ei sư oei wă lĕch tơ'bôh lu iĕm ưh kơ 'bôh ôh hă? Tơpă, Inh gô pơih minh pôm trong lăm bri brah păng gô pơm lu glung đei đak ro lăm char glă.

English: The beast of the field will honor Me, The jackals and the ostriches, Because I give waters in the wilderness And rivers in the desert, To give drink to My people, My chosen.
Bahnar: Lu sem bri, kŏ bri păng sem diydui gô kơkuh ư-ang kơ Inh. Yua kơ Inh ăn đak ro lăm char glă, păng pơm lu tu glung đak tơ char glă, wă kơ kon pơlei mă inh rơih iŏk bơih lu sư đei đak nhă.

English: This people I have formed for Myself; They shall declare My praise.
Bahnar: Inh pơjing bơih lu kon pơlei âu, ăn kơ Inh, lu sư gô ră roi bơnê kơ inh.

English: “But you have not called upon Me, O Jacob; And you have been weary of Me, O Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, ơ Jakôp, iĕm ưh kơ krao apinh Inh! Ơ Isơrael iĕm đĭ bơ̆l kơ Inh bơih!

English: You have not brought Me the sheep for your burnt offerings, Nor have you honored Me with your sacrifices. I have not caused you to serve with grain offerings, Nor wearied you with incense.
Bahnar: Iĕm ưh pă pơyơ̆r kon triu pơm tơmam soi 'buh kơ Inh bơih, kư̆m ưh pă soi sơmah pơyom kơ Inh. Inh ưh kơ đei pơm kơ iĕm pŭ trăp pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba kơ Inh păng kư̆m ưh kơ pơm kơ iĕm ưh kơ hiôk yua kơ tơmam pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu mơ̆n.

English: You have bought Me no sweet cane with money, Nor have you satisfied Me with the fat of your sacrifices; But you have burdened Me with your sins, You have wearied Me with your iniquities.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ đei iŏk jên răt kơ Inh 'long 'bâu phu ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơm kơ Inh hrăp lăp đon đơ̆ng rơmă tơmam soi sơmah. Mă-lei tă kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm dơ̆ng pơm kơ Inh pŭ trăp păng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm pơm kơ Inh ơh klai.

English: “I, even I, am He who blots out your transgressions for My own sake; And I will not remember your sins.
Bahnar: Noh, Inh kơdih 'mơ̆i sŭt lê̆ tơdrong iĕm pơm yoch păng Inh ưh pă 'blŏk dơ̆ng tơdrong yoch iĕm.

English: Put Me in remembrance; Let us contend together; State your case, that you may be acquitted.
Bahnar: Tơ'blŏk dơ̆ng bĕ kơ Inh, bĕ bơ̆n pơma tơgar băl kơ trŏ. Roi pơdah tơdrong trŏ iĕm bĕ, wă tơ'bôh khan lu iĕm trŏ 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: Your first father sinned, And your mediators have transgressed against Me.
Bahnar: 'Bok tơm lu iĕm sơ̆ pơm yoch bơih, bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r lăm lu iĕm pơm glăi blah Inh bơih.

English: Therefore I will profane the princes of the sanctuary; I will give Jacob to the curse, And Israel to reproaches.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh na Inh gô pơm kơ lu 'bok soi tơm iĕm oei lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh gô mơlâu, Inh gô ăn kơ đe pơrăm Jakôp păng pơjăm lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: “Yet hear now, O Jacob My servant, And Israel whom I have chosen.
Bahnar: “Dang ei mơ̆ng bĕ, ơ Jakôp đam Inh, ơ Isơrael mă Inh rơih iŏk bơih.

English: Thus says the LORD who made you And formed you from the womb, who will help you: ‘Fear not, O Jacob My servant; And you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Inh Tơ'ngla pơjing lu iĕm, man lu iĕm oei đơ̆ng lăm klak mĕ, păng gô tơgŭm lu iĕm: Ơ Jakôp đam Inh păng Jêsurun mă Inh rơih iŏk bơih 'nĕ kơ hli.

English: For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, And floods on the dry ground; I will pour My Spirit on your descendants, And My blessing on your offspring
Bahnar: Inh gô tuh ăn đak tơ tơring char rơhing. Ăn đak glung ro tơ anih hrĕng kro, Inh gô tuh Yang Bơhngol Inh tơ adrĕch adrung lu iĕm, Inh gô ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu kon sâu iĕm.

English: They will spring up among the grass Like willows by the watercourses.’
Bahnar: Lu sư gô bluh chăt lăm 'nhĕt, nhen thoi tơm 'long hla prai chăt cheng đak glung

English: One will say, ‘I am the LORD’s’; Another will call himself by the name of Jacob; Another will write with his hand, ‘The LORD’s,’ And name himself by the name of Israel.
Bahnar: Bơngai âu sư gô khan, inh gah Kră Yang, bơngai nai dơ̆ng sư krao anăn sư hăm anăn Jakôp. Bơngai plơ̆ng dơ̆ng sư chih tơ ti sư khan: Inh gah Kră Yang păng chih anăn Isơrael tơ ti Sư.

English: “Thus says the LORD, the King of Israel, And his Redeemer, the LORD of hosts: ‘I am the First and I am the Last; Besides Me there is no God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơgơ̆r plĕnh teh, Pơtao păng 'Bok huai iŏk Isơrael, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi âu: “Inh blŭng-a păng tuch-luch, 'nguaih kơ Inh ưh kơ đei Yang nai dơ̆ng ôh.

English: And who can proclaim as I do? Then let him declare it and set it in order for Me, Since I appointed the ancient people. And the things that are coming and shall come, Let them show these to them.
Bahnar: Bu lei-lăi thoi Inh? Ăn kơ sư roi tơdrong noh, păng pơdah tơdrong noh kơ Inh đĭ tơdrong truh đơ̆ng năr Inh pơjing adrĕch adrung kon bơngai sơ̆, lê̆ lu sư roi bĕ tơdrong noh kơ lu bơ̆n đei tơdrong kiơ truh dang ei păng đei tơdrong kiơ truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơnh.

English: Do not fear, nor be afraid; Have I not told you from that time, and declared it? You are My witnesses. Is there a God besides Me? Indeed there is no other Rock; I know not one.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli 'nĕ kơ tơtơ̆ ôh, hăm trŏ kơ đơ̆ng sơ̆ Inh roi tơbăt kơ iĕm bơih. Lu iĕm pơm kơdranh gah Inh. 'Nguaih kơ Inh hăm đei Yang nai dơ̆ng ưh? Tơpă ưh kơ đei Tơmo tih nai dơ̆ng ôh, Inh băt ưh kơ đei bu!

English: Those who make an image, all of them are useless, And their precious things shall not profit; They are their own witnesses; They neither see nor know, that they may be ashamed.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơm rup yang jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei dôm tơmam lu sư hưch wă ưh kơ yua kiơ. Lu bơngai pơm kơdranh kơ lu rup yang noh ưh kơ gơh 'bôh păng ưh kơ băt, gô pơm kơ lu sư mơlâu đĕch.

English: Who would form a god or mold an image That profits him nothing?
Bahnar: Bu traih, man rup yang dah hling rup yang tơmam noh ưh kơ đei yua kiơ kơ sư ôh.

English: Surely all his companions would be ashamed; And the workmen, they are mere men. Let them all be gathered together, Let them stand up; Yet they shall fear, They shall be ashamed together.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kơkuh kơ rup Yang gô mơlâu, lu bơngai thơ̆ pơm lu sư jơ̆ kon bơngai hmă đĕch. Lê̆ đĭ-đăng lu sư akŭm băl. Iung bĕ; lu sư gô hli tơrơ păng mơlâu.

English: The blacksmith with the tongs works one in the coals, Fashions it with hammers, And works it with the strength of his arms. Even so, he is hungry, and his strength fails; He drinks no water and is faint.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơjơ̆m iŏk bơsei 'buh lăm ngar ŭnh, iŏk mut teh hơjơ̆m pơm sư, yua ti pran kơtang sư hơjơ̆m tơtang pơm rup, sư gô pơngot păng jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ đei, sư ưh kơ nhă đak pă kĕ dang wă lôch.

English: The craftsman stretches out his rule, He marks one out with chalk; He fashions it with a plane, He marks it out with the compass, And makes it like the figure of a man, According to the beauty of a man, that it may remain in the house.
Bahnar: Bơngai thơ̆ 'long iŏk tơlei sư dăng pơtŏ, iŏk chŭr sư rek rup hơbŏ traih hơmet hăm săng pơiel, pơtŏ hăm 'long thưk đei mum pơm rup hơbŏ, sư pơm rup bơngai rup hơbŏ thoi bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Na tah lê̆ tơ lăm hnam yang sư.

English: He cuts down cedars for himself, And takes the cypress and the oak; He secures it for himself among the trees of the forest. He plants a pine, and the rain nourishes it.
Bahnar: Sư kăl 'long Hơngo. Dah iŏk 'long hơngo hla top păng 'long kôih. Lê̆ sư chăt hơdai lu 'long lăm bri, sư pơtăm 'long hơngo, đak 'mi jruh pơm kơ 'long wơ̆ tih.

English: Then it shall be for a man to burn, For he will take some of it and warm himself; Yes, he kindles it and bakes bread; Indeed he makes a god and worships it; He makes it a carved image, and falls down to it.
Bahnar: 'Long noh đe yua pơm 'long ŭnh tơkuh; iŏk tŏ sĕt pơm ŭnh wă nhur păng kư̆m yua wă tơkuh ŭnh pơm 'bĕng. Đe kư̆m yua iŏk 'long noh pơm rup yang na kơkuh kơ sư, Traih pơm minh pôm rup, na bon kơkuh kơ sư.

English: He burns half of it in the fire; With this half he eats meat; He roasts a roast, and is satisfied. He even warms himself and says, “Ah! I am warm, I have seen the fire.”
Bahnar: Minh puăt sư iŏk tơkuh lăm ŭnh, na lăm minh puăt 'long ŭnh noh sư 'buh 'nhĕm, păng sa phĭ hrăp. Sư nhur ŭnh noh mơ̆n păng khan: Hah ha! Inh nhur âu mơn tơtŏ dêh

English: And the rest of it he makes into a god, His carved image. He falls down before it and worships it, Prays to it and says, “Deliver me, for you are my god!”
Bahnar: 'Long mă oei rơkah sư iŏk pơm rup yang, rup mă pơm kơdih na drap kŭp kơ̆l 'bơ̆t anăp rup noh na sư kơkuh, krao khan apinh rup yang sư pơm noh khan: “Apinh dŏng pơklaih inh yua kơ ih jơ̆ yang inh!”

English: They do not know nor understand; For He has shut their eyes, so that they cannot see, And their hearts, so that they cannot understand.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh ưh kơ băt păng ưh kơ tơchĕng lăng yua kơ măt lu sư tep na ưh kơ 'bôh, jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư kư̆m chĭt lê̆ na lu sư ưh kơ hlôh.

English: And no one considers in his heart, Nor is there knowledge nor understanding to say, “I have burned half of it in the fire, Yes, I have also baked bread on its coals; I have roasted meat and eaten it; And shall I make the rest of it an abomination? Shall I fall down before a block of wood?”
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh chă tơchĕng. Ưh kơ đei bu hlôh băt, wă pơma khan: “Inh tơkuh iŏk minh puăt bơih pơm 'long ŭnh inh 'buh 'bĕng kơpal ngar ŭnh, 'buh 'nhĕm păng inh sa bơih. Oei rơkah pă minh puăt inh hăm yua pơm tơmam krưp đe areh ưh? Inh hăm năm bon kơkuh kơ minh jăl 'long ưh?”

English: He feeds on ashes; A deceived heart has turned him aside; And he cannot deliver his soul, Nor say, “Is there not a lie in my right hand?”
Bahnar: Bơngai sa 'mui tơnuh; jơhngơ̆m đon ưh kơ ngeh ba sư jrok trong; sư ưh kơ gơh pơklaih bơhngol sư kơdih, Păng kư̆m ưh kơ băt tơmam lăm ti 'ma sư noh jơ̆ tơmam hơlĕnh đĕch?

English: “Remember these, O Jacob, And Israel, for you are My servant; I have formed you, you are My servant; O Israel, you will not be forgotten by Me!
Bahnar: “Ơ Jakôp, 'blŏk bĕ lu tơdrong 'nâu yua kơ iĕm jơ̆ đam Inh. Ơ Isơrael Inh bơih pơjing iĕm, iĕm đam Inh Ơ Isơrael Inh ưh kơ hiơt kơ iĕm ôh.

English: I have blotted out, like a thick cloud, your transgressions, And like a cloud, your sins. Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”
Bahnar: Inh sŭt lê̆ bơih tơdrong lu iĕm pơm yoch nhen thoi sŭt lê̆ hơmơ̆l, tơdrong yoch lu iĕm nhen thoi tŭk. Wơ̆t brŏk bĕ tơ Inh, yua kơ Inh huai iŏk lu iĕm bơih.”

English: Sing, O heavens, for the LORD has done it! Shout, you lower parts of the earth; Break forth into singing, you mountains, O forest, and every tree in it! For the LORD has redeemed Jacob, And glorified Himself in Israel.
Bahnar: Ơ lu plĕnh, hơri chơt hiôk bĕ! Yua kơ Kră Yang pơm bơih tơdrong âu, Ơ teh đak ôr jreo bĕ, Ơ lu kông, ơ lu bri hăm lu 'long lăm noh hơri ôr bĕ! Yua kơ Kră Yang huai iŏk bơih Jakôp păng gô đei ư-ang lăm Isơrael.

English: Thus says the LORD, your Redeemer, And He who formed you from the womb: “I am the LORD, who makes all things, Who stretches out the heavens all alone, Who spreads abroad the earth by Myself
Bahnar: Kră Yang, đei khan thoi âu: “Inh huai iŏk lu iĕm Inh pơjing lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm klak. Inh bơih Kră Yang, Inh bơih Tơ'ngla pơm pơjing tôm tơmam. Minh 'nu Inh đĕch bơlang lu plĕnh, lơ̆k teh âu, ưh kơ đei bu 'nguaih kơ Inh.

English: Who frustrates the signs of the babblers, And drives diviners mad; Who turns wise men backward, And makes their knowledge foolishness
Bahnar: Inh pơm pơglăi lê̆ tơdra lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol hơlĕnh, pơm kơ lu pơjâu jing kơwao; pơm kơ lu bơngai hlôh jing kơtul pơm tơplơ̆ tơdrong hlôh băt sư jing kơtul kơwao dơ̆ng.

English: Who confirms the word of His servant, And performs the counsel of His messengers; Who says to Jerusalem, ‘You shall be inhabited,’ To the cities of Judah, ‘You shall be built,’ And I will raise up her waste places
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơsĭt nơ̆r lu đĭch đam sư pơma, păng pơsĭt trŏ hloi dôm nơ̆r lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư; pơma gah pơlei Jêrusalem khan: “Gô đei bơngai oei lăm noh” păng pơma gah lu pơlei Juđa khan: “Gô pơjing ming,” Inh gô tơiung ming dơ̆ng lu anih đĭ juơ.

English: Who says to the deep, ‘Be dry! And I will dry up your rivers’
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ sơlŭng jrŭ ‘hrơ̆ hrĕng bĕ, Inh gô pơm kơ lu krong hrơ̆ kro.’

English: Who says of Cyrus, ‘He is My shepherd, And he shall perform all My pleasure, Saying to Jerusalem, “You shall be built,” And to the temple, “Your foundation shall be laid.” ’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ pơtao Sirus: ‘Sư bơngai wei triu Inh, sư gô pơm keh tơdrong inh wă, kư̆m pơma dơ̆ng gah pơlei Jêrusalem khan: “Gô pơjing ming sư dơ̆ng, păng pơma gah hnam akŭm khan: “Jrăng hơnă gô pơdơ̆ng ming.”

English: “Thus says the LORD to His anointed, To Cyrus, whose right hand I have held— To subdue nations before him And loose the armor of kings, To open before him the double doors, So that the gates will not be shut
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Sirus bơngai Sư rơih tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu. Inh rôp ti 'ma sư bơih wă pơm kơ lu dêh char chu kơ sư, na Inh iŏk lê̆ tơmam tơblah lu pơtao, wă pơih 'măng Jang pơlei, 'bơ̆t anăp sư, na đe ưh kơ gơh tang dơ̆ng!

English: ‘I will go before you And make the crooked places straight; I will break in pieces the gates of bronze And cut the bars of iron.
Bahnar: Inh gô năm adrol kơ ih, Inh gô pơm kơ lu kông groi dơnă, teh pơchah lê̆ lu 'măng Jang kong, gơ̆ lê̆ chơkăl bơsei.

English: I will give you the treasures of darkness And hidden riches of secret places, That you may know that I, the LORD, Who call you by your name, Am the God of Israel.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ ih tơmam gĭt tah ôn lăm anih măng mu, Ăn kơ ih mŭk tơmam gĭt lăm anih hlơp, wă kơ ih băt kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael. Tơ'ngla krao ih hăm anăn ih.

English: For Jacob My servant’s sake, And Israel My elect, I have even called you by your name; I have named you, though you have not known Me.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Jakôp jơ̆ đĭch đam Inh păng Isơrael lu bơngai mă inh rơih iŏk. Na Inh krao ih hăm anăn ih păng ăn anăn ih đe gô pơyom, mă khan ih ưh kơ băt kơ Inh ră.

English: I am the LORD, and there is no other; There is no God besides Me. I will gird you, though you have not known Me
Bahnar: Inh bơih Kră Yang, ưh kơ đei yang nai dơ̆ng ôh, 'nguaih kơ Inh ưh kơ đei Yang nai dơ̆ng. Mă đơ̆ng ih ưh kơ băt kơ inh, Inh gô ăn kơ ih pran kơtang.

English: That they may know from the rising of the sun to its setting That there is none besides Me. I am the LORD, and there is no other
Bahnar: Wă kơ đĭ lu bơngai dơ̆ng anih măt 'năr lĕch. Truh tơ anih măt 'năr mơ̆t, wă kơ lu sư băt ưh kơ đei Yang nai ôh 'nguaih kơ Inh. Inh bơih Kră Yang, ưh kơ đei yang nai dơ̆ng ôh.

English: I form the light and create darkness, I make peace and create calamity; I, the LORD, do all these things.’
Bahnar: Inh bơih Tơ'ngla pơm đei tơdrong hơdah păng pơjing tơdrong măng mu, pơm đei tơdrong hiôk-hian păng kư̆m ăn đei tơdrong pơrăm, Inh bơih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơm dôm tơdrong noh.

English: “Rain down, you heavens, from above, And let the skies pour down righteousness; Let the earth open, let them bring forth salvation, And let righteousness spring up together. I, the LORD, have created it.
Bahnar: Ơ lu plĕnh tơ kơpal ti, ăn bĕ hơmơ̆l tuh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt thoi 'mi. Ơ teh pơih bĕ mă să, wă kơ găr tơdrong dŏng pơklaih, păng găr tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt chăt bluh tơmơ̆ng! Inh bơih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing tơdrong noh.

English: “Woe to him who strives with his Maker! Let the potsherd strive with the potsherds of the earth! Shall the clay say to him who forms it, ‘What are you making?’ Or shall your handiwork say, ‘He has no hands’?
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu bơngai pơjah pơjăng hăm Tơ'ngla pơjing sư! Minh pôm bô̆i hơdai hăm bô̆i nai 'bơ̆t teh! Teh lơ̆n hăm gơh pơma kơ bơngai man sư khan: Ih pơm kiơ noh? Dah mă tơmam pơma kơ bơngai pơm sư khan: Sư ưh kơ đei đon wă chĕp.

English: Woe to him who says to his father, ‘What are you begetting?’ Or to the woman, ‘What have you brought forth?’ ”
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu bơngai bu pơma kơ 'bă sư khan: ‘Ih pơjing kơ bu?’ Dah mă pơma kơ mĕ sư khan: ‘Ih jĭ anăp tơpŭ kơ kiơ?’

English: Thus says the LORD, The Holy One of Israel, and his Maker: “Ask Me of things to come concerning My sons; And concerning the work of My hands, you command Me.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng rơgoh đe Isơrael Tơ'ngla Pơjing khan thoi âu: “Yua kơ lu iĕm jet Inh, gah tơdrong gô truh kơ kon pơlei Inh, gah tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti Inh.

English: I have made the earth, And created man on it. I—My hands—stretched out the heavens, And all their host I have commanded.
Bahnar: Inh bơih Tơ'ngla pơjing teh đak păng pơjing kon bơngai oei kơpal teh. Đơ̆ng ti Inh kơdih pơm, bơlang lu plĕnh păng pơjing lu sơnglŏng.

English: I have raised him up in righteousness, And I will direct all his ways; He shall build My city And let My exiles go free, Not for price nor reward,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơiung sirus pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Inh, păng gô pơm ăn kơ trong sư tơpăt, sư gô pơm ming pơlei tih Inh păng tơlĕch lu kon pơlei Inh đơ̆ng đe puh ba pơm bơnă ưh kơ kăl kơ huai iŏk hăm tơmam apah ôh.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “The labor of Egypt and merchandise of Cush And of the Sabeans, men of stature, Shall come over to you, and they shall be yours; They shall walk behind you, They shall come over in chains; And they shall bow down to you. They will make supplication to you, saying, ‘Surely God is in you, And there is no other; There is no other God.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Lu iĕm gô iŏk đĭ Tơmam teh đak Êyiptơ, mŭk tơmam teh đak Kus păng bơngai Sabê, lu bơngai tih kơjung, lu sư gô năm tơ iĕm păng kiơ̆ gah lu iĕm. Lu sư gô yak kiơ̆ rŏng lu iĕm, lu sư gô năm tơ iĕm hăm glang oei chô̆ lu sư truh bon kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm, lu sư adrĭ apinh khan: ‘Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai lu iĕm, ưh kơ đei yang nai ôh, ưh kơ đei Yang nai dơ̆ng.’ ”

English: Truly You are God, who hide Yourself, O God of Israel, the Savior!
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôn akâu Ih, Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Ih, jơ̆ Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih đe Isơrael.

English: They shall be ashamed And also disgraced, all of them; They shall go in confusion together, Who are makers of idols.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơm man rup yang lu sư gô mơlâu păng rŭng răng, lu sư mơlâu dêh kơdâu weh đĭ.

English: But Israel shall be saved by the LORD With an everlasting salvation; You shall not be ashamed or disgraced Forever and ever.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai Isơrael, Kră Yang gô dŏng pơklaih. Hăm tơdrong dŏng pơklaih ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch. Lu iĕm huay pă mơlâu dah rŭng răng dơ̆ng bơih truh tơ đĭ chăl khŏm khŏm.

English: For thus says the LORD, Who created the heavens, Who is God, Who formed the earth and made it, Who has established it, Who did not create it in vain, Who formed it to be inhabited: “I am the LORD, and there is no other.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: Inh bơih Tơ'ngla pơjing lu plĕnh, Sư bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư pơjing plei teh. Sư pơjing plei teh ưh kơ lê̆ hoh bơbông đĕch ôh, sư pơjing wă kơ đei kon pơlei oei, Kră Yang pơma thoi âu: Inh bơih Kră Yang, ưh kơ đei yang nai ôh.

English: I have not spoken in secret, In a dark place of the earth; I did not say to the seed of Jacob, ‘Seek Me in vain’; I, the LORD, speak righteousness, I declare things that are right.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei pơma hăm lu iĕm lăm tơdrong hlơp ôh păng kư̆m ưh kơ pơma đơ̆ng lăm char măng mu, Inh ưh tam đei pơma kơ adrĕch adrung Jakôp khan: ‘Lu iĕm chă Inh tơdrong ưh kơ đei Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang pơma tơpăt, roi tơdrong trŏ sĭt.’

English: “Assemble yourselves and come; Draw near together, You who have escaped from the nations. They have no knowledge, Who carry the wood of their carved image, And pray to a god that cannot save.
Bahnar: Ơ lu kon pơlei klaih đơ̆ng anat anot đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ dêh char. Năm tơ âu akŭm băl bĕ, đĭ-đăng wang năm jê̆. Lu bơngai tung rup yang pơm păng 'long. Lu sư ưh kơ hlôh krao khan kơ yang mă ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih lu sư.

English: Tell and bring forth your case; Yes, let them take counsel together. Who has declared this from ancient time? Who has told it from that time? Have not I, the LORD? And there is no other God besides Me, A just God and a Savior; There is none besides Me.
Bahnar: Lê̆ lu sư năm pơđâu băl Ră roi bĕ, pơdah bĕ khan bĕ. Đơ̆ng chăl adrol sơ̆ bu ră roi pơdah tơdrong âu? Bu pơdah tơdrong âu đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆? Hăm trŏ kơ Inh Kră Yang ưh? 'Nguaih kơ Inh ưh kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei nai ôh! Ưh kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt nai păng ưh kơ đei Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih nai yua kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ đei yang nai dơ̆ng.

English: “Look to Me, and be saved, All you ends of the earth! For I am God, and there is no other.
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei jơ̆p anih tôch kơ teh. Wih brŏk bĕ tơ Inh na lu iĕm gơh klaih! Yua kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ưh kơ đei yang nai ôh.

English: I have sworn by Myself; The word has gone out of My mouth in righteousness, And shall not return, That to Me every knee shall bow, Every tongue shall take an oath.
Bahnar: Kơdih kâu Inh pơkă bơih: Lăm nơ̆r tơpăt sĭt, nơ̆r lĕch bơih đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh. Nơ̆r pơma noh ưh kơ gơh wih pơdrâu dơ̆ng: Đĭ-đăng kŭl-tăng gô sơtơ̆p 'bơ̆t anăp inh, rim 'bơ̆r gô pơkă 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: He shall say, ‘Surely in the LORD I have righteousness and strength. To Him men shall come, And all shall be ashamed Who are incensed against Him.
Bahnar: Đe gô pơma pơđâu gah Inh khan: Lăm Kră Yang đĕch bơ̆n đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng pran kơtang. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai hil kơ sư gô năm tơ sư na mơlâu.

English: In the LORD all the descendants of Israel Shall be justified, and shall glory.’ ”
Bahnar: Lăm Kră Yang đĭ-đăng kon sâu Isơrael gô đei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Bel bows down, Nebo stoops; Their idols were on the beasts and on the cattle. Your carriages were heavily loaded, A burden to the weary beast.
Bahnar: Yang Bel kŭp kơ̆l, yang Nêbô drap, rup yang noh lu sư chơ kơpal rŏng lu sem brem, sem dơrong. Lu rup yang mă lu iĕm juăt kơ tung trăp dêh, pơm kơ lu sem brem chơ sư trăp pă kĕ.

English: They stoop, they bow down together; They could not deliver the burden, But have themselves gone into captivity.
Bahnar: Lu rup yang noh kŭp kơ̆l, wang drap hơdai ưh kơ gơh pơklaih tơdrong lu sư đơ̆ng pŭ trăp. Păng kơdih lu sư đe rôp pơm bơnă.

English: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch adrung Jakôp mơ̆ng Inh bĕ păng đĭ-đăng lu iĕm mă oei oei lăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael, Inh bơih pŭ pôk lu iĕm đơ̆ng năr 'nao tơpŭ kơ iĕm, kơ'mĭn lu iĕm đơ̆ng lăm klak mĕ iĕm.

English: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you.
Bahnar: Dĭng truh kơ iĕm kră krŭng Inh kư̆m oei Kră Yang lei-lăi. Truh tơ iĕm sŏk ko go kơdŭ Inh kư̆m oei pôk kơ'mĭn lu iĕm Inh pơjing bơih lu iĕm, na gô pŭ pôk lu iĕm, Inh gô pôk kơ'mĭn păng pơklaih lu iĕm.

English: “To whom will you liken Me, and make Me equal And compare Me, that we should be alike?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơting Inh hăm bu? Păng lăng Inh hơtŏ kơ bu? Lu iĕm wă pơtŏ pơting Inh hăm bu? Wă kơ 'bôh bơ̆n lei-lăi?

English: They lavish gold out of the bag, And weigh silver on the scales; They hire a goldsmith, and he makes it a god; They prostrate themselves, yes, they worship.
Bahnar: Lu sư iŏk maih đơ̆ng lăm kơdŭng păng iŏk hu kŏng hăm 'long kŏng, lu sư mưng apah bơngai tuh hling maih pơm rup yang, đơ̆ng noh drap kơkuh.

English: They bear it on the shoulder, they carry it And set it in its place, and it stands; From its place it shall not move. Though one cries out to it, yet it cannot answer Nor save him out of his trouble.
Bahnar: Lu sư tôi rup yang noh tơ hơngiĕng tung ba pơdơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anih sư, na yang noh dơ̆ng minh 'bôt 'bơ̆t doh, ưh kơ gơh weh tơ anih tơ nai. Tơdah đei bu krao khan: Yang noh ưh kơ gơh tơl tơwih păng ưh kơ gơh dŏng lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong anat anot.

English: “Remember this, and show yourselves men; Recall to mind, O you transgressors.
Bahnar: 'Blŏk hơdơ̆r bĕ dôm tơdrong âu, tơchĕng mă hơlen bĕ! Ơ lu bơngai kơchu lu iĕm athei tơchĕng 'blŏk bĕ tơdrong noh lăm kơ̆l.

English: Remember the former things of old, For I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is none like Me
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r bĕ chăl adrol sơ̆, yua kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei yang nai ôh; Inh jơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei bu dang Inh.

English: Declaring the end from the beginning, And from ancient times things that are not yet done, Saying, ‘My counsel shall stand, And I will do all My pleasure,’
Bahnar: Inh roi bơih tơdrong năr tuch-luch đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆. Inh roi tơbăt bơih đơ̆ng chăl adrol sơ̆ dôm tơdrong mă ưh tam đei truh. Inh pơma khan: Tơdrong Inh, kơnhăm wă gô dơ̆ng kơjăp, Inh gô pơm dôm tơdrong mă Inh lăp đon.

English: Calling a bird of prey from the east, The man who executes My counsel, from a far country. Indeed I have spoken it; I will also bring it to pass. I have purposed it; I will also do it.
Bahnar: Inh gô krao sem klang đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch; păng krao bơngai đơ̆ng dêh ataih pơm tơdrong inh wă. Tơdrong Inh pơma bơih, Inh gô pơm keh, dôm tơdrong Inh pơkă bơih, Inh gô pơm.

English: “Listen to Me, you stubborn-hearted, Who are far from righteousness
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai jơhngơ̆m arăng. Lu bơngai kơ chu mơ̆ng bĕ Inh pơma.

English: I bring My righteousness near, it shall not be far off; My salvation shall not linger. And I will place salvation in Zion, For Israel My glory.
Bahnar: Inh ba tơdrong dŏng pơklaih truh jê̆, Sư ưh kơ ataih ôh, ưh kơ hiơ̆ ôh, Inh gô dŏng pơklaih pơlei Siôn, Ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael ư-ang kơ Inh bơngai.

English: “Come down and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon; Sit on the ground without a throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans! For you shall no more be called Tender and delicate.
Bahnar: Ơ kon adruh hơlai Babilôn, jur hơ-oei tơ 'mui teh bĕ! Ơ kon adruh bơngai Kalđê, jur hơ-oei tơ teh bĕ iĕm ưh kơ đei tang-dŏ pơtao bơih! Đơ̆ng dang ei đe ưh pă krao lu iĕm bơngai 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ rŏ liĕm dơ̆ng bơih.

English: Take the millstones and grind meal. Remove your veil, Take off the skirt, Uncover the thigh, Pass through the rivers.
Bahnar: Iŏk bĕ tơpăl peh pơm tơpŭng bơlah; plôh lê̆ bĕ che gom muh măt ih, plôh lê̆ ao tai 'nguaih, mă klơ̆p blu na tŏk găn đak krong.

English: Your nakedness shall be uncovered, Yes, your shame will be seen; I will take vengeance, And I will not arbitrate with a man.”
Bahnar: Akâu hoh ih gô pơdah tơ 'nguaih Tơdrong mơlâu ih gô 'bôh! Inh gô pơm 'mong plơ̆, ưh kơ đei lon minh 'nu bu ôh.

English: As for our Redeemer, the LORD of hosts is His name, The Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu bơ̆n, anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: “Sit in silence, and go into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans; For you shall no longer be called The Lady of Kingdoms.
Bahnar: Ơ kon adruh bơngai Kalđê, hơ-oei hreh bĕ, năm bĕ lăm anih măng mu! Yua kơ đơ̆ng dang ei đe ưh pă krao ih drŏ-kăn pơtao kơ teh đak dơ̆ng bơih.

English: I was angry with My people; I have profaned My inheritance, And given them into your hand. You showed them no mercy; On the elderly you laid your yoke very heavily.
Bahnar: Inh hil mĭl kơ kon pơlei Inh, Inh pơm kơ mŭk tơmam Inh jing 'mê̆-'mach, Inh pơjao đĭ lu sư lăm tơpang ti ih. Mă-lei ih ưh kơ đei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu sư; Ih tơ'băk bơih 'long ăt trăp kơpal bơngai kră pă kĕ.

English: And you said, ‘I shall be a lady forever,’ So that you did not take these things to heart, Nor remember the latter end of them.
Bahnar: Ih khan bơih: Inh gô jing pơtao drŏ-kăn ling-lang. Ih ưh kơ đei tơchĕng ih pơm kiơ dang ei păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơchĕng tơdrong gô truh dơning dơmônh.

English: “Therefore hear this now, you who are given to pleasures, Who dwell securely, Who say in your heart, ‘I am, and there is no one else besides me; I shall not sit as a widow, Nor shall I know the loss of children’
Bahnar: “Thoi noh, ơ lu bơngai 'maih hiôk đĕch. Tơchĕng khan ưh pă đei tơdrong anat kiơ đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp, mơ̆ng bĕ âu: Ih khan lăm jơhngơ̆m. ‘Inh âu, adrĕch yŏng mơng ưh pă đei bơngai bu dang inh, inh gô ưh kơ đei layơ sơ'ngon thoi yă adro kư̆m ưh kơ đei nhơ̆m hmoi thoi bơngai hiong kon hơ'lơ̆p.’

English: But these two things shall come to you In a moment, in one day: The loss of children, and widowhood. They shall come upon you in their fullness Because of the multitude of your sorceries, For the great abundance of your enchantments.
Bahnar: Kŭm lăm minh năr. Ih gô đei 'bar tơdrong âu truh kơ ih. Tơdrong hiong kon hơ'lơ̆p păng jing yă adro. Gô truh tôm tơdrong 'noh. Mă khan ih pơjâu pơm lơ tơdrong tơwir dah đei hĭ nơ̆r yang mơsêh pơma hơlĕnh!

English: “For you have trusted in your wickedness; You have said, ‘No one sees me’; Your wisdom and your knowledge have warped you; And you have said in your heart, ‘I am, and there is no one else besides me.’
Bahnar: Ih gơnang tơdrong ih pơm kơnê̆ ih Ih khan: ‘Ưh kơ đei bu 'bôh inh.’ Tơdrong gơh hơgei hlôh wao ih gô pơm kơ ih wơ̆l jrok. Ih pơma lăm jơhngơ̆m: ‘Inh âu, 'nguaih kơ inh ưh kơ đei bơngai bu.’

English: Therefore evil shall come upon you; You shall not know from where it arises. And trouble shall fall upon you; You will not be able to put it off. And desolation shall come upon you suddenly, Which you shall not know.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong gô truh tơ ih. Mă ih ưh kơ gơh kơ weh. Tơdrong pơmat-tat gô truh tơ ih mă ih ưh kơ gơh puh tơ nai. Tơdrong pơrăm blư truh ưh kơ tam băt. Mă ih ưh kơ băt adrol ôh.

English: “Stand now with your enchantments And the multitude of your sorceries, In which you have labored from your youth— Perhaps you will be able to profit, Perhaps you will prevail.
Bahnar: Pơm dơ̆ng bĕ, pơm dôm tơdrong tơwir pơm pơjâu mơsêh hơlĕnh, mă ih nŏng kơ adrin pơhrăm đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p nge! Rŏ lăng gô pơyua kơ ih; rŏ lăng đơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh na ih gô tơhli đe?

English: You are wearied in the multitude of your counsels; Let now the astrologers, the stargazers, And the monthly prognosticators Stand up and save you From what shall come upon you.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m ih gleh glăn yua kơ đơ̆ng iĕm chă pơđâu tơ'bôh lơ tơdrong. Iung bĕ ơ lu bơngai mă băt hlôh gah plĕnh, lăng sơnglŏng, lăng khei tơ'bang blŭng-a, na tơng khan lê̆ adrol. Lê̆ lu sư pơklaih ih đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong gô truh kơ ih 'noh.

English: Behold, they shall be as stubble, The fire shall burn them; They shall not deliver themselves From the power of the flame; It shall not be a coal to be warmed by, Nor a fire to sit before!
Bahnar: To lu sư gô nhen thoi hơnong 'ba; ŭnh sa pơđĭ; lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơklaih kơdih lu sư đơ̆ng pla ŭnh. Ŭnh noh ưh kơ đei ngar wă nhur tơnŏ ôh, ưh pă đei tơnuh ŭnh wă ngôi nhur.

English: Thus shall they be to you With whom you have labored, Your merchants from your youth; They shall wander each one to his quarter. No one shall save you.
Bahnar: Đĭ dôm lu bơngai jang gleh hrat hơdai ih jing thoi noh: Dôm lu bơngai mơdro mơchan hăm ih đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p. Rim 'nu jrok kiơ̆ trong kơdih, ưh kơ đei bu dŏng pơklaih ih!

English: “Hear this, O house of Jacob, Who are called by the name of Israel, And have come forth from the wellsprings of Judah; Who swear by the name of the LORD, And make mention of the God of Israel, But not in truth or in righteousness
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r 'nâu ơ adrĕch Jakôp mă đe krao anăn Isơrael, lĕch đơ̆ng tơm 'bok Juđa, lu bơngai pơkă hăm anăn Kră Yang, krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael. Mă-lei lăm jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ đei tơpăt păng ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơpă.

English: For they call themselves after the holy city, And lean on the God of Israel; The LORD of hosts is His name
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan lu iĕm kơdih kon pơlei đơ̆ng pơlei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, păng gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: “I have declared the former things from the beginning; They went forth from My mouth, and I caused them to hear it. Suddenly I did them, and they came to pass.
Bahnar: Inh khan lê̆ đơ̆ng sơ̆ bơih gah dôm tơdrong blŭng-a, dôm tơdrong noh lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh, Păng Inh wă kơ lu iĕm băt. Na Inh pơm hloi păng dôm tơdrong noh truh hloi.

English: Because I knew that you were obstinate, And your neck was an iron sinew, And your brow bronze
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh băt lu iĕm arăng kơ̆l, hơko iĕm huan thoi bơsei, klĕng iĕm thoi kong

English: Even from the beginning I have declared it to you; Before it came to pass I proclaimed it to you, Lest you should say, ‘My idol has done them, And my carved image and my molded image Have commanded them.’
Bahnar: Na Inh pơma dôm tơdrong 'noh kơ lu iĕm đơ̆ng sơ̆, bơtho lu iĕm dôm tơdrong 'noh adrol kơ sư tam mă truh, kơnh hli kơ iĕm khan: 'Noh jĭ rup yang đơ̆ng inh pơm, rup yang inh traih, rup yang inh tuh hling đơ̆ng inh athei đei dôm tơdrong 'noh.

English: “You have heard; See all this. And will you not declare it? I have made you hear new things from this time, Even hidden things, and you did not know them.
Bahnar: Ih kơtơ̆ng bơih, ih lăng lăng bĕ dôm tơdrong 'nâu lei lu iĕm ưh kơ sơng iŏk hă? Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp, Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm băt dôm tơdrong 'nao, dôm tơdrong hrĕp mă iĕm tam mă băt

English: They are created now and not from the beginning; And before this day you have not heard them, Lest you should say, ‘Of course I knew them.’
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong 'noh đe 'nao pơjing, đơ̆ng sơ̆ ưh tam mă đei ôh: Adrol kơ năr 'nâu, iĕm tam kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu, kơnh hli kơ iĕm khan: ‘Inh băt bơih tơdrong 'noh!’

English: Surely you did not hear, Surely you did not know; Surely from long ago your ear was not opened. For I knew that you would deal very treacherously, And were called a transgressor from the womb.
Bahnar: Iĕm tam mă kơtơ̆ng, tam mă băt. Đơ̆ng sơ̆ đon iĕm tam mă pơih; yua kơ Inh băt kơ iĕm hơlĕnh ling-lang, đơ̆ng năr mĕ iĕm tơpŭ kơ iĕm krao iĕm bơngai blơ̆ blĕch.

English: “For My name’s sake I will defer My anger, And for My praise I will restrain it from you, So that I do not cut you off.
Bahnar: Yua kơ anăn Inh kơdih, na Inh ĕnh tơdrong blĕk Inh; yua kơ tơdrong ư-ang Inh kơdih, na pơgơ̆t tơdrong Inh huay kơ pơlôch pơrăm iĕm.

English: Behold, I have refined you, but not as silver; I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh hling iĕm rơgoh bơih, mă-lei ưh kơ trŏ thoi hling hu; Inh pơlong lăng iĕm lăm ŭnh tơdrong pơmat-tat.

English: For My own sake, for My own sake, I will do it; For how should My name be profaned? And I will not give My glory to another.
Bahnar: Noh yua kơ Inh, yua kơ kơdih Inh na Inh pơm tơdrong 'nâu, yua kơ kiơ Inh lê̆ anăn Inh đe pơjăm pơjuă ngôi? Inh gô ưh kơ ăn tơdrong ư-ang Inh kơ bu nai ôh.

English: “Listen to Me, O Jacob, And Israel, My called: I am He, I am the First, I am also the Last.
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch Jakôp, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Inh, ơ Isơrael kon pơlei mă Inh đei rơih. Inh bơih Tơ'ngla 'noh; Inh jơ̆ blŭng-a ala chă păng kư̆m tuch-luch ning-mônh.

English: Indeed My hand has laid the foundation of the earth, And My right hand has stretched out the heavens; When I call to them, They stand up together.
Bahnar: Ti inh pơjing bơih hơnă teh Ti gah 'ma Inh đei bơlang bơih plĕnh; Inh krao plĕnh teh lu sư iung hơdai hloi.

English: “All of you, assemble yourselves, and hear! Who among them has declared these things? The LORD loves him; He shall do His pleasure on Babylon, And His arm shall be against the Chaldeans.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei akŭm hơdai đĭ-đăng păng athei mơ̆ng: Lăm lu Yang, Yang kiơ roi tơbăt bơih dôm tơdrong 'nâu? Bơngai mă Kră Yang rơih, gô pơm pơkeh tơdrong đêl pơkă blah Babilôn păng yua ti sư gô blah bơngai Kalđê.

English: I, even I, have spoken; Yes, I have called him, I have brought him, and his way will prosper.
Bahnar: Inh, Inh đei pơma bơih, tơpă Inh đei krao iŏk sư, Inh gô ba sư. Sư gô kĕ jei hiôk lăm trong sư jang.

English: “Come near to Me, hear this: I have not spoken in secret from the beginning; From the time that it was, I was there. And now the Lord GOD and His Spirit Have sent Me.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei năm jê̆ Inh păng athei mơ̆ng tơdrong 'nâu: Đơ̆ng blŭng-a Inh ưh tam mă đei pơma ôn. Kơplah đei tơdrong 'noh, Inh oei tơ noh bơih, Dang ei Kră Yang wơh inh năm. Hăm yang bơhngol Sư.

English: Thus says the LORD, your Redeemer, The Holy One of Israel: “I am the LORD your God, Who teaches you to profit, Who leads you by the way you should go.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih iĕm Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael khan: “Inh bơih Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm, Tơ'ngla bơtho iĕm mă đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng kơ iĕm păng dui ba iĕm lăm trong iĕm gô năm.

English: Oh, that you had heeded My commandments! Then your peace would have been like a river, And your righteousness like the waves of the sea.
Bahnar: Ôi! Rŏ kơ iĕm mơ̆ng bơih tơdrong juăt Inh tơtă, Lei tơdrong hiôk-hian iĕm thoi đak krong. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt iĕm thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă.

English: Your descendants also would have been like the sand, And the offspring of your body like the grains of sand; His name would not have been cut off Nor destroyed from before Me.”
Bahnar: Kon sâu iĕm thoi pơlao chuơh adrĕch adrung iĕm thoi găr chuơh, anăn lu sư ưh kơ đei sut ưh kơ lôch hiong đơ̆ng anăp Inh.

English: Go forth from Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans! With a voice of singing, Declare, proclaim this, Utter it to the end of the earth; Say, “The LORD has redeemed His servant Jacob!”
Bahnar: Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng Babilôn! Kơdâu weh bĕ đơ̆ng bơngai Kalđê! Athei jreo ôr hiôk chơt na khan roi tơbăt bĕ tơdrong 'nâu. Ră roi dĭng jơ̆p truh tôch kơ lăm teh đak! Athei khan: “Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih adrĕch Jakôp bơih, đĭch đam Sư.”

English: And they did not thirst When He led them through the deserts; He caused the waters to flow from the rock for them; He also split the rock, and the waters gushed out.
Bahnar: Kơplah Kră Yang chông ba lu sư năm lăm char glă, lu sư ưh kơ đei ol kơ đak, Kră Yang ăn đak lĕch đơ̆ng tơmo. Kră Yang blah tơmo. Na đak lĕch ro.

English: “There is no peace,” says the LORD, “for the wicked.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh kơ đei layơ hiôk rơnŭk.”

English: “Listen, O coastlands, to Me, And take heed, you peoples from afar! The LORD has called Me from the womb; From the matrix of My mother He has made mention of My name.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai oei lăm bŏl đak dơsĭ mơ̆ng Inh bĕ! Ơ lu kon pơlei oei ataih mơ̆ng bĕ, Kră Yang krao iŏk inh đơ̆ng lăm klak mĕ inh. Anăn ăn kơ inh đơ̆ng inh oei lăm klak mĕ inh.

English: And He has made My mouth like a sharp sword; In the shadow of His hand He has hidden Me, And made Me a polished shaft; In His quiver He has hidden Me.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm kơ 'bơ̆r inh thoi lĕ kơ đao han; klơ̆p ôn inh hăm yơ̆p kơkŏng ti sư pơm kơ inh thoi 'brơ̆m hră suĕng. Păng ôn lê̆ inh lăm jŏ 'brơ̆m hră Sư.

English: “And He said to me, ‘You are My servant, O Israel, In whom I will be glorified.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Ih đam Inh. Ơ Isơrael Inh gô đei ư-ang đơ̆ng ih.

English: Then I said, ‘I have labored in vain, I have spent my strength for nothing and in vain; Yet surely my just reward is with the LORD, And my work with my God.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh khan: “Inh jang gleh lap hŭt đĕch. Inh huach jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ yua păng tơdrong kơ đei. Mă-lei tơpă tơdrong tơpăt inh tơ lăm Kră Yang, tơdrong apah bơnê inh tơ lăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh.”

English: “And now the LORD says, Who formed Me from the womb to be His Servant, To bring Jacob back to Him, So that Israel is gathered to Him (For I shall be glorious in the eyes of the LORD, And My God shall be My strength)
Bahnar: Dang ei, Kră Yang khan: Sư Tơ'ngla pơjing inh đơ̆ng lăm klak mĕ inh, ăn kơ inh jing đĭch đam Sư wă kơ inh chông ba adrĕch Jakôp wih tơ Kră Yang, păng akŭm Isơrael brŏk tơ Kră Yang; yua kơ inh đei pơyom 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ inh đei jơhngơ̆m pran.

English: Indeed He says, ‘It is too small a thing that You should be My Servant To raise up the tribes of Jacob, And to restore the preserved ones of Israel; I will also give You as a light to the Gentiles, That You should be My salvation to the ends of the earth.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m đei khan: “Ih đĭch đam Inh. Wă krao dơ̆ng lu adrĕch Jakôp păng wă ba lu bơngai Isơrael mă oei arih brŏk dơ̆ng, mă tơdrong jang âu iĕ đĕch inh gô ăn kơ ih tơdrong jang tih ba tơdrong hơdah pơchrang ăn kơ lu dêh char tơmoi. Ba tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Inh truh tơ tôch jơ̆p-jang teh đak.

English: Thus says the LORD, The Redeemer of Israel, their Holy One, To Him whom man despises, To Him whom the nation abhors, To the Servant of rulers: “Kings shall see and arise, Princes also shall worship, Because of the LORD who is faithful, The Holy One of Israel; And He has chosen You.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih, Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael khan kơ bơngai mă kon bơngai pơjăm mă teh đak areh, hăm bơngai pơm đĭch kơ lu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r thoi âu: Lu pơtao gô 'bôh ih na iung; lu kon pơtao gô hơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh. Yua kơ Kră Yang jơ̆ Tơ'ngla tơpăt, Tơ'ngla Rơgoh 'Lơ̆ng Isơrael, jơ̆ Tơ'ngla rơih iŏk ih.

English: Thus says the LORD: “In an acceptable time I have heard You, And in the day of salvation I have helped You; I will preserve You and give You As a covenant to the people, To restore the earth, To cause them to inherit the desolate heritages
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Lăm năr trŏ lăp Inh gô tơl tơwih nơ̆r ih krao khan: Lăm năr dŏng pơklaih Inh gô tơgŭm ih. Inh gô wei-lăng ih, pơjao kơ ih pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao hăm kon pơlei wă tơiung dơ̆ng dêh char, păng klah asong tơmam lăm bri kơdrơ̆ng.

English: That You may say to the prisoners, ‘Go forth,’ To those who are in darkness, ‘Show yourselves.’ “They shall feed along the roads, And their pastures shall be on all desolate heights.
Bahnar: Wă khan kơ lu bơngai bơnă: ‘Lĕch bĕ,’ păng khan kơ bơngai oei lăm măng mu: ‘Pơdah bĕ akâu iĕm!’ Lu sư gô sŏng sa rok trong păng lu sư gô đei tơmăn 'nhĕt tơ kơpal kông groi mơ-mlưch.

English: They shall neither hunger nor thirst, Neither heat nor sun shall strike them; For He who has mercy on them will lead them, Even by the springs of water He will guide them.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô ưh kơ đei pơngot, ưh kơ đei ol kơ đak, hơyuh tŏ dah măt 'năr ưh kơ đei pơm kơ lu sư tŏ. Yua kơ Tơ'ngla 'mêm mơnat lu sư, gô chông anhăk ba lu sư năm truh tơ jê̆ cheng đak glung.

English: I will make each of My mountains a road, And My highways shall be elevated.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm ăn kơ kông Inh jing trong tơhnă, păng dôm trong tih Inh gô 'bŭ hơmet ming.

English: Surely these shall come from afar; Look! Those from the north and the west, And these from the land of Sinim.”
Bahnar: Lăng to lu sư gô truh đơ̆ng ataih; mơ'nah gô truh đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m, lu mơ'nah gô truh đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t păng lu bơngai nai dơ̆ng đơ̆ng dêh char Sinim.a

English: Sing, O heavens! Be joyful, O earth! And break out in singing, O mountains! For the LORD has comforted His people, And will have mercy on His afflicted.
Bahnar: Ơ plĕnh, hơri bĕ! Ơ teh, hiôk chơt bĕ! Ơ lu kông pơret nơ̆r hơri bĕ! Yua kơ Kră Yang đei pơlung bơih kon pơlei Sư păng mơnat kơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat.

English: But Zion said, “The LORD has forsaken me, And my Lord has forgotten me.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Siôn đei pơma khan: “Kră Yang achăng hŭt inh bơih; Kră Yang hiơt kơ inh bơih.”

English: “Can a woman forget her nursing child, And not have compassion on the son of her womb? Surely they may forget, Yet I will not forget you.
Bahnar: Mĕ hăm gơh hiơt kơ kon sư mă oei mŏm. Dah ưh kơ mơnat kơ kon kơdih pơjing hă? Mă khan bơngai âu gơh hiơt, Inh ưh kơ hiơt kơ ih ôh.

English: See, I have inscribed you on the palms of My hands; Your walls are continually before Me.
Bahnar: 'Nâu inh đei chhơ̆ bơih lu iĕm lăm tơpang ti Inh; lu dur pơlei iĕm ling-lang oei 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: Your sons shall make haste; Your destroyers and those who laid you waste Shall go away from you.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei iĕm truh tĕnh lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơlôch lu iĕm gô weh đơ̆ng iĕm.

English: Lift up your eyes, look around and see; All these gather together and come to you. As I live,” says the LORD, “You shall surely clothe yourselves with them all as an ornament, And bind them on you as a bride does.
Bahnar: Athei bơyar măt iĕm lăng jum dăr: Đĭ-đăng lu kon iĕm gô akŭm băl wă brŏk tơ iĕm! Kră Yang khan: Tơpă thoi Inh Tơ'ngla arih ling-lang ih lăng lu sư thoi lĕ tơmam đe pơguăng, thoi tơlei tơ̆n bơngai drŏ-kăn wă iŏk klo.

English: “For your waste and desolate places, And the land of your destruction, Will even now be too small for the inhabitants; And those who swallowed you up will be far away.
Bahnar: Tơpă, sơ̆ lu anih pơchah pơchek, jing bri juơ, dêh char lu iĕm pơchah răm bơih. Na dang ei kon pơlei oei gô jing hrăt-hrot tơpă. Lu bơngai ayăt lu iĕm gô oei ataih kơ iĕm.

English: The children you will have, After you have lost the others, Will say again in your ears, ‘The place is too small for me; Give me a place where I may dwell.’
Bahnar: Lu kon hơ'lơ̆p tơpŭ lăm kơplah chăl pơmat-tat, gô pơma lăm đon ih khan: Bri teh âu hrăt-hrot dêh kơ bơ̆n: Rĭ asong kơ nhôn wă oei mă să bĕ.

English: Then you will say in your heart, ‘Who has begotten these for me, Since I have lost my children and am desolate, A captive, and wandering to and fro? And who has brought these up? There I was, left alone; But these, where were they?’ ”
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh ih gô pơma lăm jơhngơ̆m khan: Bu pơjing bơih kơ inh lu kon hơ'lơ̆p 'nâu? Inh hiong đĭ-đăng bơih kon hơ'lơ̆p; kơplah inh thông hoang weh jăk păng tơklah tơklang? Na lei bơngai bu gô wei rong lu kon hơ'lơ̆p 'nâu? 'Nâu inh gô oei uăi minh 'nu, adro po, pơsĕl pơsŏ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p 'nâu lu sư truh đơ̆ng yơ?”

English: Thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, I will lift My hand in an oath to the nations, And set up My standard for the peoples; They shall bring your sons in their arms, And your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “'Nâu, Inh gô yơ̆r ti Inh tơ kơpal lu teh đak, hơtŏk hla-kơ Inh tơ lăm kon pơlei. Na lu sư gô pôk lu kon drŏ-nglo 'bơ̆t kơtơh, koi lu kon drŏ-kăn tơ kơpal hơngiĕng na yak năm.

English: Kings shall be your foster fathers, And their queens your nursing mothers; They shall bow down to you with their faces to the earth, And lick up the dust of your feet. Then you will know that I am the LORD, For they shall not be ashamed who wait for Me.”
Bahnar: Lu pơtao gô pơm 'bă wei rong iĕm, lu akăn pơtao gô pơm bơngai wei rong tơmŏm iĕm. Lu sư gô kŭp drap tơ teh chu kơ iĕm; liah 'mui teh tơ jơ̆ng iĕm; kơplah noh iĕm gô băt kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang, păng lu bơngai gơnang kơ Inh gô ưh kơ đei mơlâu.”

English: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, Or the captives of the righteous be delivered?
Bahnar: Hăm gơh plah tơgar iŏk mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng lu bơngai pran kơtang dah gơh pơdrâu iŏk dơ̆ng? Dah dŏng pơklaih bơnă, đơ̆ng lu bơngai nuih kơtang?

English: But thus says the LORD: “Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, And the prey of the terrible be delivered; For I will contend with him who contends with you, And I will save your children.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Tơpă, lu bơngai bơnă gô tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng lu bơngai pran kơtang. Păng gô pơdrâu iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng bơngai nuih, Inh gô tơblah hăm lu bơngai blah lu iĕm, păng Inh bơih gô pơklaih kon hơ'lơ̆p iĕm.

English: I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh, And they shall be drunk with their own blood as with sweet wine. All flesh shall know That I, the LORD, am your Savior, And your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep iĕm lu sư gô pơlôch dih băl, lu sư jing suai yua kơ đơ̆ng hil blĕk, thoi lĕ suai sik; Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô băt kơ Inh, Kră Yang Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih iĕm, Tơ'ngla huai iŏk iĕm păng Tơ'ngla mơsêh adrĕch Jakôp.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Where is the certificate of your mother’s divorce, Whom I have put away? Or which of My creditors is it to whom I have sold you? For your iniquities you have sold yourselves, And for your transgressions your mother has been put away.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Hla bơar achăng mĕ lu iĕm tơ yơ bơih? Bơngai mă Inh hrĕch achăng bơih. Dah bu mă tơ'ngla Inh hre. Mă đêl inh tĕch lu iĕm ăn kơ tơ'ngla noh? Inh tĕch iĕm yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch iĕm kơdih: Hrĕch achăng lê̆ mĕ lu iĕm yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm pơm.

English: Why, when I came, was there no man? Why, when I called, was there none to answer? Is My hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem? Or have I no power to deliver? Indeed with My rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness; Their fish stink because there is no water, And die of thirst.
Bahnar: Lơliơ mưh Inh truh ưh kơ đei 'bôh bơngai bu? Mưh Inh krao ưh kơ đei bơngai bu tơl? Ti Inh kơđeh hă na ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih? Dah Inh ưh kơ đei jơhngơ̆m pran wă dŏng pơklaih iĕm hă? 'Nâu wă Inh chrih na đak dơsĭ hrơ̆ hloi. Inh ăn kơ đak krong jing char glă; ka tơ ala đak krong gô lôch đĭ jing 'bâu ôm yua ưh kơ đei đak.

English: I clothe the heavens with blackness, And I make sackcloth their covering.”
Bahnar: Inh pơhrŭk ăn kơ plĕnh hăm tơdrong măng mu, păng klơ̆p gom lê̆ sư hăm minh blah 'bi.”

English: “The Lord GOD has given Me The tongue of the learned, That I should know how to speak A word in season to him who is weary. He awakens Me morning by morning, He awakens My ear To hear as the learned.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ inh hơpiĕt lu bơngai gơh bơtho tơ'bôh wă kơ inh băt yua nơ̆r pơma tơiung lu bơngai rơdu tơrăn. Kră Yang râu inh rim pơgê đơ̆ng hrôih tơ'blŏk ăn kơ đon inh wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư bơtho nhen thoi bơngai đei hŏk pơhrăm.

English: The Lord GOD has opened My ear; And I was not rebellious, Nor did I turn away.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh pơih đon inh, inh ưh pă kơchu, kư̆m ưh kơ đei kơdŭn.

English: I gave My back to those who struck Me, And My cheeks to those who plucked out the beard; I did not hide My face from shame and spitting.
Bahnar: Inh ăn bơih kơ đe teh rŏng inh, păng ăn tơ'bŏk inh kơ đe buch sŏk kang inh. Lu bơngai pơ'brơh kơ inh gơsoh đak hai, inh ưh kơ đei ôn muh măt ôh.

English: “For the Lord GOD will help Me; Therefore I will not be disgraced; Therefore I have set My face like a flint, And I know that I will not be ashamed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh tơgŭm inh, inh ưh kơ mơlâu ôh. Na inh pơm kơ măt inh lăng tơ anăp, inh băt kơ inh gô ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ mơlâu.

English: He is near who justifies Me; Who will contend with Me? Let us stand together. Who is My adversary? Let him come near Me.
Bahnar: Tơ'ngla mă jô̆ inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt oei jê̆; bơngai bu pơ̆n ayăt hăm inh Bĕ bơ̆n iung dơ̆ng hơdai hăm inh. Bu wă jâu inh Athei năm jê̆ inh bĕ!

English: Surely the Lord GOD will help Me; Who is he who will condemn Me? Indeed they will all grow old like a garment; The moth will eat them up.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh năm tơgŭm inh. Bơngai bu jâu inh khan yoch? Lăng to đĭ-đăng lu sư gô so thoi ao, mă mua reh hiah.

English: “Who among you fears the LORD? Who obeys the voice of His Servant? Who walks in darkness And has no light? Let him trust in the name of the LORD And rely upon his God.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lăm lu iĕm băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang, păng chu kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r đĭch đam Sư Mă năm lăm măng mu păng ưh kơ đei hơdah. Gơnang bĕ kơ Anăn Kră Yang păng gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư kơdih.

English: Look, all you who kindle a fire, Who encircle yourselves with sparks: Walk in the light of your fire and in the sparks you have kindled— This you shall have from My hand: You shall lie down in torment.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, đĭ-đăng lu iĕm bơngai tơkuh ŭnh păng tơ̆k ŭnh hơchô̆ hơpaih. Năm rok bĕ gah hơdah ŭnh hơchô̆ hơpaih mă iĕm tơ̆k, Tơdrong 'nâu lu iĕm gô pŭ iŏk đơ̆ng ti Inh, lu iĕm gô 'bĭch lăm tơdrong pơmat-tat!

English: “Listen to Me, you who follow after righteousness, You who seek the LORD: Look to the rock from which you were hewn, And to the hole of the pit from which you were dug.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu bơngai chă Kră Yang, mơ̆ng Inh bĕ! Lăng bĕ kơ tơmo mă đơ̆ng blah iŏk lu iĕm bơih păng sơlŭng tơmo mă đơ̆ng sir hơtŏk lu iĕm!

English: Look to Abraham your father, And to Sarah who bore you; For I called him alone, And blessed him and increased him.”
Bahnar: Athei tơchĕng bĕ kơ Abraham 'bă iĕm, hăm Sara, bơngai pơjing lu iĕm; kơplah Inh krao sư, sư lăp minh 'nu; Inh tuh ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ sư na jing đei bơngai lơlap lơlang.

English: For the LORD will comfort Zion, He will comfort all her waste places; He will make her wilderness like Eden, And her desert like the garden of the LORD; Joy and gladness will be found in it, Thanksgiving and the voice of melody.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô pơlung pơlei Siôn; Kră Yang gô ăn kơ rim anih sư đĭ bri juơ. Kră Yang gô pơm kơ teh sư lê̆ bri jing thoi pơgar Êđen. Char glă jing thoi pơgar Kră Yang; Tơ anih noh gô 'bôh đei tơdrong hiôk chơt, 'nă hal, nơ̆r bơnê păng nơ̆r hơri.

English: “Listen to Me, My people; And give ear to Me, O My nation: For law will proceed from Me, And I will make My justice rest As a light of the peoples.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei Inh, mơ̆ng bĕ Inh ơ teh đak Inh; pơgling đon iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ Inh. Gô đei tơdrong juăt lĕch đơ̆ng Inh, păng tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng Inh jing hơdah pơchrang ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei.

English: My righteousness is near, My salvation has gone forth, And My arms will judge the peoples; The coastlands will wait upon Me, And on My arm they will trust.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Inh wă jê̆ truh; tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Inh truh bơih. Tơpang ti Inh gô wei pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng kon pơlei. Lu bơngai oei lăm bŏl dơsĭ chang gô Inh păng lu sư hơmĕng gơnang kơ tơpang ti Inh.
