English: Lift up your eyes to the heavens, And look on the earth beneath. For the heavens will vanish away like smoke, The earth will grow old like a garment, And those who dwell in it will die in like manner; But My salvation will be forever, And My righteousness will not be abolished.
Bahnar: Ngơk lăng bĕ tơ kơpal plĕnh păng kŭp lăng bĕ tơ ala teh; lu plĕnh đông hiong thoi 'nhui ŭnh, teh gô so hiah nhen thoi ao, lu kon pơlei oei arih kơpal teh gô lôch thoi roi, mă-lei tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Inh oei ling-lang. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Inh ưh kơ đei layơ hiong tôch ôh.

English: “Listen to Me, you who know righteousness, You people in whose heart is My law: Do not fear the reproach of men, Nor be afraid of their insults.
Bahnar: Ơ kon pơlei băt tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Đei răk tơdrong juăt Inh lăm jơhngơ̆m, mơ̆ng bĕ Inh! 'Nĕ hli kơ đe pơjăm, 'nĕ hli kơ lu sư pơma kơnê̆ chrih pơjăm iĕm.

English: For the moth will eat them up like a garment, And the worm will eat them like wool; But My righteousness will be forever, And My salvation from generation to generation.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ mua gô reh kăp sa lu sư nhen reh ao, păng mua gô sa sư thoi sa brai sŏk triu. Mă-lei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Inh gô oei oei ling-lang, tơdrong dŏng pơklaih inh oei truh ning-mônh.

English: Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the LORD! Awake as in the ancient days, In the generations of old. Are You not the arm that cut Rahab apart, And wounded the serpent?
Bahnar: Ơ ti Kră Yang hơđơ̆r bĕ hơđơ̆r bĕ! Pơpôi jơhngơ̆m pran. Iung bĕ thoi sơ̆. Thoi jơhngơ̆m blŭng-a sơ̆! Hăm trŏ kơ Ih Tơ'ngla wă koh hơjăl Ahap, păng 'bet bơih kon sem brem tih noh dah kiơ?

English: Are You not the One who dried up the sea, The waters of the great deep; That made the depths of the sea a road For the redeemed to cross over?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ Ih Tơ'ngla mă pơm kơ đak dơsĭ, păng đak sơlŭng jrŭ tih hrơ̆, pơm ăn kơ đak dơsĭ jrŭ jing trong, wă ăn kơ kon pơlei mă Ih dŏng pơklaih năm rok trong noh?

English: So the ransomed of the LORD shall return, And come to Zion with singing, With everlasting joy on their heads. They shall obtain joy and gladness; Sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei mă Kră Yang huai iŏk bơih gô brŏk, Năm mơ̆t tơ Siôn hăm tơdrong hơri chơt hiôk. Tơdrong hơri chơt hiôk ling-lang gô oei lăm kơ̆l lu sư. Lu sư gô đei tơdrong chơt hiôk, 'nă hal, tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon chhŭr nuih gô hiong đĭ.

English: “I, even I, am He who comforts you. Who are you that you should be afraid Of a man who will die, And of the son of a man who will be made like grass?
Bahnar: Inh bơih, inh jơ̆ Tơ'ngla pơlung lu iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli kơ kon bơngai juăt kơ lôch? Ngăl hli kơ kon bơngai tơdrong arih nhen thoi 'nhĕt.

English: And you forget the LORD your Maker, Who stretched out the heavens And laid the foundations of the earth; You have feared continually every day Because of the fury of the oppressor, When he has prepared to destroy. And where is the fury of the oppressor?
Bahnar: Iĕm hiơt bơih kơ Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơjing lu iĕm, Sư bơih bơyar lu tăl plĕnh. Pơjing hơnă teh. Mă-lei rim năr iĕm hrăn hli tơtey ling-lang. Kơ lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep kơplah sư hil wă pơlôch iĕm? Mă-lei dang ei tơdrong lu bơngai hil blĕk pơjuă noh tơ yơ?

English: The captive exile hastens, that he may be loosed, That he should not die in the pit, And that his bread should not fail.
Bahnar: Bơngai bơnă đe gô tơlĕch, gô ưh kơ đei lôch lăm hnam phak, păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei kơ'bah tơmam sa.

English: But I am the LORD your God, Who divided the sea whose waves roared— The LORD of hosts is His name.
Bahnar: Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm Tơ'ngla pơm ăn đak dơsĭ poh-yă păng poh-yă re jơwa. Kră Yang Tih Hloh jơ̆ anăn Sư

English: And I have put My words in your mouth; I have covered you with the shadow of My hand, That I may plant the heavens, Lay the foundations of the earth, And say to Zion, ‘You are My people.’ ”
Bahnar: Inh dan bơih nơ̆r pơma Inh lăm 'bơ̆r iĕm, ôn iĕm lăm yơ̆p tơpang ti Inh. Inh bơlang lu tăl plĕnh păng pơjing plei teh, păng pơma hăm Siôn khan: Iĕm jơ̆ kon pơlei Inh!”

English: Awake, awake! Stand up, O Jerusalem, You who have drunk at the hand of the LORD The cup of His fury; You have drunk the dregs of the cup of trembling, And drained it out.
Bahnar: Hơđơ̆r bĕ, hơđơ̆r bĕ! Ơ Jêrusalem iung dơ̆ng bĕ! Iĕm bơngai huch kơchŏk tơdrong hil mĭl đơ̆ng Kră Yang. Ih huch dĭng mah hrơ̆ đơ̆ng kơchŏk. Kơchŏk mă pơm kơ iĕm pơ̆k iung.

English: There is no one to guide her Among all the sons she has brought forth; Nor is there any who takes her by the hand Among all the sons she has brought up.
Bahnar: Lăm đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo mă Jêrusalem pơjing, ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu mă gơh wei sư. Lăm đĭ-đăng lu kon drŏ-nglo mă Jêrusalem wei rong, ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu mă rôp ti dui sư.

English: These two things have come to you; Who will be sorry for you?— Desolation and destruction, famine and sword— By whom will I comfort you?
Bahnar: 'Bar tơdrong gleh 'nâu truh bơih kơ ih. Bu gô nhơ̆m hmoi kơ ih tơdrong pơrăm, pơngot rơwĕt păng đao gưm truh kơ ih, Bơngai bu gô pơlung ih.

English: Your sons have fainted, They lie at the head of all the streets, Like an antelope in a net; They are full of the fury of the LORD, The rebuke of your God.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei ih lôch hơngơ̆t bơih, lu sư 'bĭch tơ rim mum trong pơlei. Nhen thoi kon juei hrơ̆p lăm hơnhuăl. Nhen thoi 'bĕnh hăm tơdrong Kră Yang hil mĭl păng tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei chrih.

English: Therefore please hear this, you afflicted, And drunk but not with wine.
Bahnar: Na, dang ei, mơ̆ng bĕ tơdrong 'nâu ơ lu bơngai pơmat-tat, lu bơngai suai mă-lei ưh kơ đei yua đơ̆ng tơdrô.

English: Thus says your Lord, The LORD and your God, Who pleads the cause of His people: “See, I have taken out of your hand The cup of trembling, The dregs of the cup of My fury; You shall no longer drink it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă dŏng kon pơlei Sư khan: “'Nâu Inh gô iŏk pơdrâu kơchŏk 'noh đơ̆ng lăm ti iĕm kơchŏk mă pơm kơ iĕm pơ̆k iung. Iĕm gô ưh pă đei huch dơ̆ng ôh kơchŏk mă Inh hil mĭl.

English: But I will put it into the hand of those who afflict you, Who have said to you, ‘Lie down, that we may walk over you.’ And you have laid your body like the ground, And as the street, for those who walk over.”
Bahnar: Inh gô dan kơchŏk noh tơ lăm ti lu bơngai pơjuă pơđep iĕm, lu bơngai mă khan kơ iĕm: Kŭp drap bĕ kơ nhôn wă kơ nhôn rok juă kơpal. Kơdŭ rŏng iĕm pơm thoi teh, thoi trong ăn kơ đe rok juă.

English: Awake, awake! Put on your strength, O Zion; Put on your beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city! For the uncircumcised and the unclean Shall no longer come to you.
Bahnar: Ơ pơlei Siôn, iung hơđơ̆r bĕ, iung hơđơ̆r bĕ, pơpôi jơhngơ̆m pran ih bĕ! Ơ pơlei Jêrusalem, jơ̆ pơlei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, athei iŏk hrŭk ao 'lơ̆ng ih! Lu bơngai ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar, bơngai yoch kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach gô ưh pă mơ̆t tơ lăm ih dơ̆ng bơih.

English: Shake yourself from the dust, arise; Sit down, O Jerusalem! Loose yourself from the bonds of your neck, O captive daughter of Zion!
Bahnar: Ơ pơlei Jêrusalem, iung tơtuh 'bruih 'brăm đơ̆ng ih bĕ, păng iung pơgơ̆r; ơ kon adruh Siôn, bơngai bơnă, plôh yaih bĕ tơlei đe chô̆ đơ̆ng hơko iĕm.

English: For thus says the LORD: “You have sold yourselves for nothing, And you shall be redeemed without money.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu; lu iĕm tĕch bơih mă-lei ưh kơ đei jên; na kư̆m gô huai iŏk iĕm dơ̆ng ưh kơ đei hăm jên kăk ôh.

English: For thus says the Lord GOD: “My people went down at first Into Egypt to dwell there; Then the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Sơ̆ kon pơlei Inh jur tơ Êyiptơ oei tơ noh; đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh bơngai Asiri pơjuă pơđep ngôi lu sư tơdrong kơ đei.”

English: Now therefore, what have I here,” says the LORD, “That My people are taken away for nothing? Those who rule over them Make them wail,” says the LORD, “And My name is blasphemed continually every day.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh wă pơm kiơ âu? Kon pơlei Inh đe rôp anhăk tơdrong kơđei,” Kră Yang khan: “Lu bơngai pơgơ̆r sư ôr pơklai, pơma kơnê̆ kơ anăn Inh ling-lang prăt năr.

English: Therefore My people shall know My name; Therefore they shall know in that day That I am He who speaks: ‘Behold, it is I.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na kon pơlei Inh gô băt kơ anăn Inh; tơpă lăm năr 'noh lu sư gô băt Inh âu bơih jơ̆ Tơ'ngla khan: 'Nâu, Inh âu.”

English: How beautiful upon the mountains Are the feet of him who brings good news, Who proclaims peace, Who brings glad tidings of good things, Who proclaims salvation, Who says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
Bahnar: Đêl jơ̆ng lu bơngai ba tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng tơ kơpal kông 'lơ̆ng pă băt dang yơ. Lu bơngai roi tơdrong hiôk-hian, tơbăt tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng. Tơbăt tơdrong dŏng pơklaih khan kơ Siôn: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm oei pơgơ̆r.”

English: Your watchmen shall lift up their voices, With their voices they shall sing together; For they shall see eye to eye When the LORD brings back Zion.
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r lu bơngai gak! Lu sư hơri hiôk chơt hơdai; yua kơ măt lu sư 'bôh kơplah Kră Yang chông ba bơnă wih brŏk tơ Siôn.

English: Break forth into joy, sing together, You waste places of Jerusalem! For the LORD has comforted His people, He has redeemed Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Ơ lu anih bri juơ pơlei Jêrusalem, iung hơri hiôk chơt hơdai bĕ, yua kơ Kră Yang pơlung kon pơlei Sư, huai iŏk dơ̆ng bơih Jêrusalem.

English: The LORD has made bare His holy arm In the eyes of all the nations; And all the ends of the earth shall see The salvation of our God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn bơih tơdrong jang ti rơgoh Sư 'bơ̆t anăp măt rim kơ teh đak; đĭ-đăng teh đak gô 'bôh tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n!

English: Depart! Depart! Go out from there, Touch no unclean thing; Go out from the midst of her, Be clean, You who bear the vessels of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm weh bĕ, weh bĕ, weh lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng anih noh. 'Nĕ hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam 'mê̆-'mach. Lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng noh pơm akâu kơdih mă rơgoh. Ơ lu bơngai chĕp tơmam Kră Yang.

English: For you shall not go out with haste, Nor go by flight; For the LORD will go before you, And the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm weh lĕch ưh kơ mah hăt hot, kư̆m ưh kơ mah kơdâu klĕnh; Kră Yang gô năm adrol kơ lu iĕm păng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael năm đơ̆ng rŏng wei-lăng iĕm.

English: Behold, My Servant shall deal prudently; He shall be exalted and extolled and be very high.
Bahnar: Âu, đĭch đam Inh gô pơm hăm tơdrong gơh hơgei; đe gô pơư, tơiung pơyom, đe gô pôk hơtŏk.

English: Just as many were astonished at you, So His visage was marred more than any man, And His form more than the sons of men
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai lăng tơ akâu jăn Sư hlĭch krưp ưh pă hơbŏ kơ kon bơngai, lăng akâu sư ưh pă nhen kơ kon drŏ-nglo kon bơngai.

English: So shall He sprinkle many nations. Kings shall shut their mouths at Him; For what had not been told them they shall see, And what they had not heard they shall consider.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Sư gô pơm kơ lơ teh đak lăng hlĭch. Lu pơtao gô pơŏm 'bơ̆r yua kơ Sư; yua kơ lu sư 'bôh tơdrong ưh tam đei bơngai bu roi ăn kơ lu sư. Păng lu sư gô hlôh băt tơdrong lu sư tam mă kơtơ̆ng.

English: Who has believed our report? And to whom has the arm of the LORD been revealed?
Bahnar: Bơngai bu lui tơdrong lu nhôn roi tơbăt bơih, păng ti Kră Yang đei pơdah ăn kơ bu bơih?

English: For He shall grow up before Him as a tender plant, And as a root out of dry ground. He has no form or comeliness; And when we see Him, There is no beauty that we should desire Him.
Bahnar: Sư wơ̆ kơjung 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang thoi lĕ minh pôm 'long 'lơ̆p chăt bluh đơ̆ng rơh lăm teh hrĕng kro. Sư ưh kơ đei 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ rŏ; wă kơ lu bơ̆n lăng tơ sư, sư ưh kơ đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng gah 'nguaih wă kơ lu bơ̆n lăp.

English: He is despised and rejected by men, A Man of sorrows and acquainted with grief. And we hid, as it were, our faces from Him; He was despised, and we did not esteem Him.
Bahnar: Sư bơngai đe areh păng đe kuă kơ sư. Sư ling-lang pŭ iŏk tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon pơmat-tat jĭ jơhngơ̆m. Thoi bơngai mă đe ôn muh măt ưh kơ sư. Đe areh kơ sư; lu bơ̆n lăng sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei rơ-a kiơ.

English: Surely He has borne our griefs And carried our sorrows; Yet we esteemed Him stricken, Smitten by God, and afflicted.
Bahnar: Sĭt tơpă, sư bơih pŭ tơdrong jĭ jăn kơ lu bơ̆n, sư pŭ hơnong iŏk tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon lu bơ̆n, mă lu bơ̆n lăng ngeh khan đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei teh pơjĭ, păng pơmat Sư.

English: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; The chastisement for our peace was upon Him, And by His stripes we are healed.
Bahnar: Đe 'bet sư rơka yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu bơ̆n. Yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ lu bơ̆n na đe pơjĭ sư. Đơ̆ng sư chu đe phak na lu bơ̆n đei hiôk-hian. Sư chu pŭ rơka wă kơ bơ̆n gơh klaih hiôk.

English: All we like sheep have gone astray; We have turned, every one, to his own way; And the LORD has laid on Him the iniquity of us all.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n thoi triu jrok trong. Rim 'nu kiơ̆ trong kơdih: Lei na Kră Yang iŏk đĭ tơdrong yoch lu bơ̆n tơpŭ ăn kơ sư.

English: He was oppressed and He was afflicted, Yet He opened not His mouth; He was led as a lamb to the slaughter, And as a sheep before its shearers is silent, So He opened not His mouth.
Bahnar: Sư đe teh pơjuă păng pơmat, mă-lei ưh kơ đei pơma minh nơ̆r, nhen thoi triu đe dui wă pơm 'nhĕm, nhen thoi triu kơmlo dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai yuă sŏk sư ưh kơ đei tơlĕch minh nơ̆r.

English: He was taken from prison and from judgment, And who will declare His generation? For He was cut off from the land of the living; For the transgressions of My people He was stricken.
Bahnar: Đe rôp sek tơlang sư ưh kơ trŏ na ba hloi sư na pơlôch; lăm jơhnơr hơdai hăm sư. Hăm đei bu băt tơchĕng khan sư lôch; yua kơ tơdrong yoch kon pơlei Inh, mă trŏ kơ sek tơlang păng pơlôch.

English: And they made His grave with the wicked— But with the rich at His death, Because He had done no violence, Nor was any deceit in His mouth.
Bahnar: Đe 'măn bơih bơsat sư hơdai hăm lu bơngai kơnê̆. Mă khan sư ưh kơ đei layơ pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ păng 'bơ̆r sư ưh kơ đei hơlĕnh. Mă-lei kơplah sư lôch, đe 'bŭ sư hơdai hăm bơngai mơdrŏng

English: Yet it pleased the LORD to bruise Him; He has put Him to grief. When You make His soul an offering for sin, He shall see His seed, He shall prolong His days, And the pleasure of the LORD shall prosper in His hand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang lăp đon ăn kơ sư đe teh pơjuă păng pơjĭ. Đang kơ sư pơyơ̆r akâu jăn sư pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk đơ̆ng yoch. Sư gô 'bôh adrĕch adrung sư; lu năr sư gô rai sot kơjung, păng jơhngơ̆m đon Kră Yang wă na gơh jing đơ̆ng Sư.

English: He shall see the labor of His soul, and be satisfied. By His knowledge My righteous Servant shall justify many, For He shall bear their iniquities.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ bơhngol sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat. Sư anih 'bôh hơdah. Đơ̆ng tơdrong sư hlôh băt sư gô hiôk. Đĭch đam Inh 'lơ̆ng tơpăt noh, Sư ăn đei lơ bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đơ̆ng sư pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: Therefore I will divide Him a portion with the great, And He shall divide the spoil with the strong, Because He poured out His soul unto death, And He was numbered with the transgressors, And He bore the sin of many, And made intercession for the transgressors.
Bahnar: Lei na Inh gô jô̆ sư hơtŏ hăm bơngai yŏng tih. Păng Kră Yang gô jô̆ sư lei-lăi hăm lu bơngai nuih pran, yua kơ sư tuh jao tơdrong arih sư kơdih truh kơ lôch, đe jô̆ lăm khŭl bơngai kơnê̆; mă tơpă sư pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch kơ lơ bơngai păng krao khan ăn kơ lu bơngai yoch.

English: “Sing, O barren, You who have not borne! Break forth into singing, and cry aloud, You who have not labored with child! For more are the children of the desolate Than the children of the married woman,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai drŏ-kăn hơwŏng, bơngai ưh kơ đei hơiơch hơri bĕ. Ơ bơngai tam mă jĭ rơneh, hơri jreo hiôk chơt bĕ, yua kơ kon hơ'lơ̆p bơngai drŏ-kăn tŭk gô đei lơ hloh kơ kon hơ'lơ̆p bơngai drŏ-kăn mă đei klo, Kră Yang khan thoi 'noh.

English: “Enlarge the place of your tent, And let them stretch out the curtains of your dwellings; Do not spare; Lengthen your cords, And strengthen your stakes.
Bahnar: Pơih mă să bĕ hnam khăn ih. Pơih lang mă să bĕ anih ih oei; 'nĕ kơ rôp pơjăng; dăng tơlei mă kơjung rơdăng, pơ̆ng 'long hơdrơ̆ng mă kơjăp!

English: For you shall expand to the right and to the left, And your descendants will inherit the nations, And make the desolate cities inhabited.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm gô rai lơ năm tơ gah 'ma păng gah 'ngiĕo; adrĕch adrung iĕm gô đei iŏk lu teh đak, păng gô oei tơ lu pơlei mă đĭ lê̆ bri juơ boih.

English: “Do not fear, for you will not be ashamed; Neither be disgraced, for you will not be put to shame; For you will forget the shame of your youth, And will not remember the reproach of your widowhood anymore.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hli; yua kơ iĕm gô ưh kơ đei mơlâu ôh. 'Nĕ kơ bơngơ̆t; yua kơ đe ưh pă pơm kơ iĕm mơlâu dơ̆ng bơih. Ih gô hiơt tơdrong mơlâu kơplah iĕm oei mơlôh sơ̆, păng ưh pă 'blŏk dơ̆ng tơdrong mơlâu kơplah iĕm adro.

English: For your Maker is your husband, The LORD of hosts is His name; And your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel; He is called the God of the whole earth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Tơ'ngla pơjing iĕm noh klo iĕm. Anăn Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Tơ'ngla huai iŏk iĕm noh mă Tơ'ngla Rơgoh Isơrael; Sư noh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ đĭ plĕnh teh.

English: For the LORD has called you Like a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, Like a youthful wife when you were refused,” Says your God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang krao iŏk iĕm thoi drŏ-kăn klo achăng lê̆ păng ơh sơ'ngon lăm jơhngơ̆m, nhen thoi akăn iŏk oei kơplah oei mơlôh, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm khan thoi noh.

English: “For a mere moment I have forsaken you, But with great mercies I will gather you.
Bahnar: Inh achăng hŭt iĕm lăp minh kơchon; mă-lei hăm tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tih Inh gô sơng iŏk iĕm brŏk.

English: With a little wrath I hid My face from you for a moment; But with everlasting kindness I will have mercy on you,” Says the LORD, your Redeemer.
Bahnar: Lăm jơhngơ̆m Inh oei hil mĭl dêh. Inh ôn muh măt Inh ưh kơ đei lăng iĕm minh rơwưh minh bruh minh 'biơ̆. Mă-lei yua kơ jơhngơ̆m đon 'mêm mơnat tih ling-lang. Inh gô mơnat kơ iĕm.” Kră Yang, Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih iĕm khan thoi noh.

English: “For this is like the waters of Noah to Me; For as I have sworn That the waters of Noah would no longer cover the earth, So have I sworn That I would not be angry with you, nor rebuke you.
Bahnar: Inh lăng tơdrong noh thoi đak lơ̆p jơhnơr Nôê sơ̆. Thoi Inh pơkă khan đak ưh kơ đei layơ wă lơ̆p pơđĭ kơpal teh đơ̆ng; na Inh kư̆m pơkă khan Inh ưh pă hil kơ iĕm dơ̆ng bơih păng kư̆m ưh kơ wă chrih phak iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: For the mountains shall depart And the hills be removed, But My kindness shall not depart from you, Nor shall My covenant of peace be removed,” Says the LORD, who has mercy on you.
Bahnar: Mă đơ̆ng kông hiŏng tơ nai, mă đơ̆ng groi rĭ tơplih, mă-lei jơhngơ̆m đon Inh 'mêm mơnat hăm iĕm ưh kơ đei tơplih. Nơ̆r pơgơ̆p hiôk-hian Inh ưh kơ đei tơplih Kră Yang, jơ̆ Tơ'ngla 'mêm mơnat kơ iĕm pơma thoi noh.

English: “O you afflicted one, Tossed with tempest, and not comforted, Behold, I will lay your stones with colorful gems, And lay your foundations with sapphires.
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai oei pơmat-tat, đơ̆ng kial hơbŭt huơ̆r ưh kơ đei bu pơlung. 'Nâu Inh gô man ih hăm tơmo gĭt, lơ̆k hơnă ih păng tơmo gĭt Saphir.

English: I will make your pinnacles of rubies, Your gates of crystal, And all your walls of precious stones.
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk tơmo gôh gĭt pơm hnam thôt, iŏk tơmo gĭt rang pơm rim 'măng jang ih păng đĭ-đăng dur ih tă pơm păng tơmo gĭt ngăl.

English: All your children shall be taught by the LORD, And great shall be the peace of your children.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon ih gô đei Kră Yang bơtho tơ'bôh, păng tơdrong hiôk-hian kon hơ'lơ̆p ih gô tih tơpă.

English: In righteousness you shall be established; You shall be far from oppression, for you shall not fear; And from terror, for it shall not come near you.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hơnơ̆ng gô pơm kơ ih kơjăp Tơdrong đe pơjuă pơđep gô weh ataih đơ̆ng ih yua kơ ưh kơ đei hli tơdrong kiơ ôh. Ih gô klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong hli tơrơ, yua kơ tơdrong noh ưh kơ đei layơ truh jê̆ ih.

English: Indeed they shall surely assemble, but not because of Me. Whoever assembles against you shall fall for your sake.
Bahnar: Tơdah đe chă đon wă pơrăm ih, noh ưh kơ trŏ đơ̆ng Inh. Bơngai bu chă đon wă pơrăm ih sư gô pơ̆k huŏng yua kơ đơ̆ng ih.

English: “Behold, I have created the blacksmith Who blows the coals in the fire, Who brings forth an instrument for his work; And I have created the spoiler to destroy.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh bơih pơjing bơngai hơjơ̆m dơhlu ŭnh soh ngar păng hơjơ̆m tơmam tơblah wă yua; păng kư̆m đơ̆ng Inh bơih pơjing lu bơngai chă pơrăm. Wă chă pơm tơdrong pơrăm.

English: No weapon formed against you shall prosper, And every tongue which rises against you in judgment You shall condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the LORD, And their righteousness is from Me,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă dôm tơmam tơblah sư pơm wă pơrăm Ih gô ưh kơ kĕ păng dôm nơ̆r lu bơngai pơma jâu ih gô glăi đĭ. Noh bơih tơdrong Inh ăn kơ lu đĭch đam Kră Yang, păng tơdrong lăng pơsĭt đơ̆ng Inh ăn, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Ho! Everyone who thirsts, Come to the waters; And you who have no money, Come, buy and eat. Yes, come, buy wine and milk Without money and without price.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai mă rơhing kơ đak, năm bĕ tơ đak! Păng bơngai bu ưh kơ đei jên, năm bĕ răt na sa, năm bĕ răt tơdrô păng đak toh mă ưh kơ kăl hăm jên, ưh kơ đei huach kơ răt.

English: Why do you spend money for what is not bread, And your wages for what does not satisfy? Listen carefully to Me, and eat what is good, And let your soul delight itself in abundance.
Bahnar: Liơ lu iĕm pơhuach jên wă răt tơmam mă ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơmam sŏng sa ôh. Ăn jơhngơ̆m gleh lap tơplih iŏk tơmam ưh kơ phĭ? Adrin mơ̆ng bĕ Inh athei sa tơmam mă 'lơ̆ng. Na jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm hiôk kơ tơmam sa bek 'lơ̆ng.

English: Incline your ear, and come to Me. Hear, and your soul shall live; And I will make an everlasting covenant with you— The sure mercies of David.
Bahnar: Athei pơgling đon păng năm bĕ tơ Inh, mơ̆ng Inh na bơhngol lu iĕm gơh arih. Inh gô pơm tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu iĕm ling-lang, wă khan tơdrong 'mêm mơnat tơpă Inh pơkă hăm Đawit.

English: Indeed I have given him as a witness to the people, A leader and commander for the people.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Inh ăn kơ sư jing bơngai pơm kơdranh ăn kơ lơ bơngai, pơm yŏng păng pơm bơngai wei-lăng lơ kon pơlei.

English: Surely you shall call a nation you do not know, And nations who do not know you shall run to you, Because of the LORD your God, And the Holy One of Israel; For He has glorified you.”
Bahnar: Na iĕm gô krao pơtơm teh đak mă iĕm ưh tam mă băt. Teh đak ưh tam mă băt kơ iĕm gô kơdâu năm tơ iĕm. Yua kơ đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm păng Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael, jơ̆ Tơ'ngla pôk ư-ang kơ iĕm.”

English: Seek the LORD while He may be found, Call upon Him while He is near.
Bahnar: Chă bĕ Kră Yang kơplah bơ̆n oei gơh tơ'bơ̆p; krao khan bĕ kơplah Sư oei jê̆!

English: Let the wicked forsake his way, And the unrighteous man his thoughts; Let him return to the LORD, And He will have mercy on him; And to our God, For He will abundantly pardon.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơnê̆ athei hŭt lê̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ sư kơdih; bơngai pơm kơnê̆ athei hŭt lê̆ dôm đon tơchĕng kơnê̆. Wih brŏk bĕ tơ Kră Yang, na Sư 'mêm mơnat, năm bĕ tơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n yua kơ Sư ling-lang ưh kơ đei jô̆ yo tơdrong yoch bơ̆n.

English: “For My thoughts are not your thoughts, Nor are your ways My ways,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Đon tơchĕng Inh phara kơ đon tơchĕng lu iĕm, trong lu iĕm phara kơ trong Inh.”

English: “For as the heavens are higher than the earth, So are My ways higher than your ways, And My thoughts than your thoughts.
Bahnar: Plĕnh kơjung hloh kơ teh dang yơ, na trong Inh kơjung hloh kơ trong lu iĕm păng. Đon tơchĕng Inh kơjung hloh kơ đon tơchĕng lu iĕm kư̆m dang noh.

English: “For as the rain comes down, and the snow from heaven, And do not return there, But water the earth, And make it bring forth and bud, That it may give seed to the sower And bread to the eater
Bahnar: Nhen đak 'mi păng prĕl jur đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh, păng ưh kơ đei wih hơlơ̆k dơ̆ng, mă-lei pơm kơ teh hơyuh pơm kơ teh đei mơ̆r păng 'ba hơbo bluh chăt tơmơ̆ng đei găr adrĕch ăn kơ bơngai rei, đei tơmam sa ăn kơ bơngai sa

English: So shall My word be that goes forth from My mouth; It shall not return to Me void, But it shall accomplish what I please, And it shall prosper in the thing for which I sent it.
Bahnar: Na kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh, nơ̆r Inh pơma, lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r inh bơih, ưh kơ đei tôch đĕch ôh; sĭt gô pơm tơdrong Inh wă. Păng pơkeh tơdrong jang Inh wơh sư.

English: “For you shall go out with joy, And be led out with peace; The mountains and the hills Shall break forth into singing before you, And all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
Bahnar: Bĕ lu iĕm gô lĕch năm hiôk chơt păng ba lăm tơdrong hiôk-hian. Kông kơjung păng groi kơđeh gô đei nơ̆r hơri 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm. Rim kơ 'long tơ bri brah gô tơtap ti.

English: Instead of the thorn shall come up the cypress tree, And instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree; And it shall be to the LORD for a name, For an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.”
Bahnar: 'Long hơngo gô chăt iung tơplih ăn kơ 'long jơla păng 'long gơsing gô tih kơjung tơplih ăn kơ 'long jơ'bôt jơla; noh tơdrong wă ăn kơ bơ̆n 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ anăn Kră Yang, minh tơdrong tơdra tơbăt ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch ôh.”

English: Thus says the LORD: “Keep justice, and do righteousness, For My salvation is about to come, And My righteousness to be revealed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Athei wei bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Păng pơm bĕ tơdrong trŏ 'lơ̆ng; yua kơ tơdrong dŏng pơklaih Inh wă jê̆ truh păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Inh wă jê̆ pơdah bơih.

English: Blessed is the man who does this, And the son of man who lays hold on it; Who keeps from defiling the Sabbath, And keeps his hand from doing any evil.”
Bahnar: Pŭn dêh kơ bơngai bu pơm tơdrong noh! Păng pŭn dêh kơ kon sâu đe bu wei kơjăp tơdrong trŏ; wă khan wei răk ưh kơ pơm glăi năr pơdơh Sa'bat păng wei ti ưh kơ pơm minh tơdrong kơnê̆ ayơ.”

English: Do not let the son of the foreigner Who has joined himself to the LORD Speak, saying, “The LORD has utterly separated me from His people”; Nor let the eunuch say, “Here I am, a dry tree.”
Bahnar: Bơngai tơmoi pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang bơih 'nĕ kơ pơma khan: “Kră Yang sĭt gô lăng inh pha kơ kon pơlei Sư.” 'Nĕ ăn bơngai krĕo kư̆m pơma khan: “Inh jơ̆ tơnơm 'long kro.”

English: For thus says the LORD: “To the eunuchs who keep My Sabbaths, And choose what pleases Me, And hold fast My covenant
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Lu bơngai krĕo wei năr pơdơh Sa'bat Inh. Rơih iŏk dôm tơdrong Inh lăp đon, chĕp kơjăp nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh

English: Even to them I will give in My house And within My walls a place and a name Better than that of sons and daughters; I will give them an everlasting name That shall not be cut off.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư hơdai tơ lăm hnam Inh wă khan lăm dur Inh. Minh anih 'blŏk hơdơ̆r păng minh anăn gĭt hloh kơ kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn; Inh gô ăn dơ̆ng kơ lu sư minh anăn mă oei oei ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.

English: “Also the sons of the foreigner Who join themselves to the LORD, to serve Him, And to love the name of the LORD, to be His servants— Everyone who keeps from defiling the Sabbath, And holds fast My covenant
Bahnar: Dôm Lu bơngai tơmoi mă đei pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang bơih, wă chu kiơ̆ kơ Sư 'mêm kơ anăn Kră Yang păng wă pơm đĭch đam Sư; lu bơngai noh wei răk năr pơdơh Sa'bat huay kơ pơm glăi, păng chĕp kơjăp nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh.

English: Even them I will bring to My holy mountain, And make them joyful in My house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices Will be accepted on My altar; For My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations.”
Bahnar: Na Inh gô anhăk lu sư tŏk tơ kơpal kông rơgoh Inh ngăl, Ăn kơ lu sư hiôk chơt lăm hnam Inh krao khan. Tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi nai lu sư pơyơ̆r, tơ kơpal chơnang soi Inh gô sơng iŏk; yua kơ hnam Inh gô krao hnam krao khan ăn kơ đĭ-đăng adrĕch adrung kon pơlei.

English: The Lord GOD, who gathers the outcasts of Israel, says, “Yet I will gather to him Others besides those who are gathered to him.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Tơ'ngla krao akŭm kon pơlei Isơrael đơ̆ng tơklah tơklang khan thoi âu: Kon pơlei mă lu sư akŭm bơih, Inh gô wă krao akŭm dơ̆ng lu kon pơlei nai brŏk hăm sư.

English: All you beasts of the field, come to devour, All you beasts in the forest.
Bahnar: Ơ khŭl sem dơrong tơ anih tơmăn glă, Khŭl lu sem bri, đĭ-đăng năm sa bĕ.

English: His watchmen are blind, They are all ignorant; They are all dumb dogs, They cannot bark; Sleeping, lying down, loving to slumber.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael gak tă kơ măt tol, ưh kơ băt tơdrong kiơ. Đĭ-đăng lu sư thoi kŏ kơmlo, ưh kơ băt kơ kuăl, 'maih 'bĭch ling-lang păng tep blêk apo kư̆ kă đĕch

English: Yes, they are greedy dogs Which never have enough. And they are shepherds Who cannot understand; They all look to their own way, Every one for his own gain, From his own territory.
Bahnar: Lu sư jơ̆ kŏ sa dư, ưh kơ băt phĭ. Noh bơih lu bơngai wei triu ưh kơ hlôh wao: Chă wơ̆t kiơ̆ trong kơdih lu sư; rim 'nu lu sư chă tơdrong pơyua kơdih, đơ̆ng blŭng truh tơ tôch.

English: “Come,” one says, “I will bring wine, And we will fill ourselves with intoxicating drink; Tomorrow will be as today, And much more abundant.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Năm bĕ, inh gô iŏk tơdrô, bĕ bơ̆n et tơdrô kơtang mơ̆ng kơ wă; Năr dơning kư̆m gô lei-lăi thoi năr 'nâu, et sa rai tih hloh dơ̆ng.

English: The righteous perishes, And no man takes it to heart; Merciful men are taken away, While no one considers That the righteous is taken away from evil.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt lôch đĭ. Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu 'blŏk hơdơ̆r. Bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m đon 'mêm mơnat đĭ hiong. Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu băt tơchĕng khan. Bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Kră Yang iŏk sư wă kơ sư huay kơ 'bơm tơdrong truh răm.

English: He shall enter into peace; They shall rest in their beds, Each one walking in his uprightness.
Bahnar: Sư mơ̆t lăm tơdrong hiôk-hian. Lu bơngai arih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, gô lôch pơdơh tơ anih sư kơdih.

English: “But come here, You sons of the sorceress, You offspring of the adulterer and the harlot!
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm ơ lu kon drŏ-nglo yă pơjâu, adrĕch adrung lu bơngai ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă păng drŏ-kăn đi, năm jê̆ tơ âu bĕ.

English: Whom do you ridicule? Against whom do you make a wide mouth And stick out the tongue? Are you not children of transgression, Offspring of falsehood
Bahnar: Lu iĕm hiĕk che bơle kơ bơngai bu? Lu iĕm ha 'bơ̆r să. Liĕl hơpiĕt iĕm pơpơm kơnê̆ pơjăm bu? Lu iĕm ưh kơ băt iĕm kon sâu bơngai kơnê̆ pơma hơlĕnh hă?

English: Inflaming yourselves with gods under every green tree, Slaying the children in the valleys, Under the clefts of the rocks?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm tơhưch băl 'bơ̆t tơm 'long kôih. Ala kơ yơ̆p hơmŭl 'long hơdrih; pơlôch kon sâu pơm tơmam soi tơ lăm thŭng thong, tơ lăm trôm tơmo tih.

English: Among the smooth stones of the stream Is your portion; They, they, are your lot! Even to them you have poured a drink offering, You have offered a grain offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
Bahnar: Lu tơmo iel rang tơ lăm thŭng noh jing rup Yang iĕm. Tơ lu tơmo noh lu iĕm tuh đak rơmă păng pơyơ̆r tơmam huch, păng phe 'ba pơm tơmam soi kơ lu tơmo 'noh. Liơ mă inh gơh ngach ưh kơ blĕk kơ tơdrong 'noh?

English: “On a lofty and high mountain You have set your bed; Even there you went up To offer sacrifice.
Bahnar: Tơ kơpal kông kơjung lu iĕm dan giơng tep, păng tŏk tơ noh wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi.

English: Also behind the doors and their posts You have set up your remembrance; For you have uncovered yourself to those other than Me, And have gone up to them; You have enlarged your bed And made a covenant with them; You have loved their bed, Where you saw their nudity.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm dan tơmam wă kơ 'blŏk gah rŏng kơ 'măng păng gah rŏng kơ lu jrăng 'măng. Lu iĕm achăng lê̆ Inh păng pơih pơdah bơih, giơng lu iĕm pơm kư̆ kă. Tŏk tơ kơpal giơng pơm kơ giơng iĕm rai să. Lu iĕm pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư, iĕm lăng 'mêm kơ giơng, păng hưch kơ tơdrong lu sư jơ̆ng jôch.

English: You went to the king with ointment, And increased your perfumes; You sent your messengers far off, And even descended to Sheol.
Bahnar: Iĕm chĕp ba đak rơmă ôliwơ pơgang 'bâu phu pơyơ̆r ăn kơ yang Molek păng wơh lu bơngai jang năm tơ dêh ataih; jur truh tơ pơlei bơngai lôch!

English: You are wearied in the length of your way; Yet you did not say, ‘There is no hope.’ You have found the life of your hand; Therefore you were not grieved.
Bahnar: Iĕm gleh lap bơih yua kơ trong ataih; mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ đei khan, noh jơ̆ tơdrong kơ đei. Lu iĕm chă 'bôh bơih jơhngơ̆m pran kơ iĕm kơdih, na iĕm ưh kơ đei rơdu tơrăn.

English: “And of whom have you been afraid, or feared, That you have lied And not remembered Me, Nor taken it to your heart? Is it not because I have held My peace from of old That you do not fear Me?
Bahnar: Gơneh gơnơm kơ bu iĕm hli yom kơ bu, na iĕm mah pơma hơlĕnh kơ Inh. Ưh pă 'blŏk kơ Inh. Ưh pă 'măn Inh lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm, hăm trŏ yua kơ Inh oei ngăn đunh dêh, na iĕm ưh kơ hli kơ Inh?

English: I will declare your righteousness And your works, For they will not profit you.
Bahnar: Inh gô tơ'bôh pơdah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng iĕm tơdrong iĕm jang. Păng tơdrong noh tă ưh kơ đei yua kơ iĕm ngăl.

English: When you cry out, Let your collection of idols deliver you. But the wind will carry them all away, A breath will take them. But he who puts his trust in Me shall possess the land, And shall inherit My holy mountain.”
Bahnar: Mưh iĕm krao ôr wă kơ dŏng, gô lê̆ kơ lu rup yang 'noh dŏng pơklaih iĕm. Lăp minh hơyuh kial gô dơhlu pơđông lu rup yang iĕm 'noh. Lăm minh 'măng hơyuh kial tơthu đĕch gô hiong đĭ-đăng, mă-lei bơngai bu kơ'nơp lăm Inh, gô đei yua teh 'nâu păng đei iŏk kông rơgoh Inh.

English: And one shall say, “Heap it up! Heap it up! Prepare the way, Take the stumbling block out of the way of My people.”
Bahnar: Sư gô khan: “Man bĕ, pơdơ̆ng bĕ, hơmet bĕ trong! Bơ'nguơih bĕ lu tơdrong găn kon pơlei Inh.”

English: For thus says the High and Lofty One Who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy: “I dwell in the high and holy place, With him who has a contrite and humble spirit, To revive the spirit of the humble, And to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Tơ'ngla Tih Hloh kơ đĭ-đăng, Tơ'ngla oei đei ling-lang. Anăn Sư Kră Yang 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh, đei khan thoi âu: “Inh oei tơ anih kơpal hloh păng 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh. Mă-lei kư̆m oei hơdai hăm bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m sơ'ngon tơbral tơdrong yoch, wă tơiung ming jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai băt tơjur akâu, wă pơlung jơhngơ̆m lu bơngai băt sơ'ngon kơdih yoch.

English: For I will not contend forever, Nor will I always be angry; For the spirit would fail before Me, And the souls which I have made.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ wă jô̆ yoch ling-lang ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ hil mĭl ling-lang mơ̆n, hli kơ kơnh gô rơdu bơhngol păng kial dui jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai mă Inh đei pơjing bơih kư̆m hiong

English: For the iniquity of his covetousness I was angry and struck him; I hid and was angry, And he went on backsliding in the way of his heart.
Bahnar: Yua kơ yoch lu sư hưch ham chă lơi kơdih, na Inh hil mĭl păng teh sư. Lăm kơplah Inh blĕk, Inh ôn bơih muh măt Inh hil, mă-lei lu sư oei wih kiơ̆ trong lăm jơhngơ̆m sư kơdih.

English: I have seen his ways, and will heal him; I will also lead him, And restore comforts to him And to his mourners.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh trong lu sư, mă-lei Inh gô pơklaih gô dui ba hăm nơ̆r pơlung

English: “I create the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace to him who is far off and to him who is near,” Says the LORD, “And I will heal him.”
Bahnar: wă khan: Ăn nơ̆r hơri bơnê tơ 'bơ̆r lu bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi lăm lu bơngai Isơrael. Kră Yang khan: Hiôk-hian, hiôk-hian bĕ kơ bơngai oei ataih păng lu bơngai oei jê̆, Inh gô pơklaih lu sư.

English: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, When it cannot rest, Whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai kơnê̆ nhen thoi đak dơsĭ poh-yă ưh kơ gơh pơdơh hreh, đak dơsĭ tơdrŏ, teh trôk đông tŏk.

English: “There is no peace,” Says my God, “for the wicked.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh khan: “Lu bơngai kơnê̆ ưh kơ đei hiôk-hian.”

English: “Cry aloud, spare not; Lift up your voice like a trumpet; Tell My people their transgression, And the house of Jacob their sins.
Bahnar: “Krao ôr mă re bĕ 'nĕ kơ ĕnh, ôr jreo mă re thoi keng, roi tơbăt bĕ kơ kon pơlei Inh tơdrong lu sư pơm plơ̆. Păng pơm plơ̆ kơ hnam Jakôp tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: Yet they seek Me daily, And delight to know My ways, As a nation that did righteousness, And did not forsake the ordinance of their God. They ask of Me the ordinances of justice; They take delight in approaching God.
Bahnar: Rim năr lu sư chơchă Inh; păng chơt hiôk băt kơ trong Inh. Thoi kon pơlei pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, păng ưh kơ đei layơ hiơt kơ khôi juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư kơdih, lu sư krao apinh Inh sek tơlang ăn tơpăt jơhngơ̆m lu sư hiôk năm jê̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: ‘Why have we fasted,’ they say, ‘and You have not seen? Why have we afflicted our souls, and You take no notice?’ “In fact, in the day of your fast you find pleasure, And exploit all your laborers.
Bahnar: Lu sư Jet: “Yua kơ kiơ lu nhôn ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa mă-lei Ih ưh kơ 'bôh? Lu nhôn tơjur akâu mă-lei Ih ưh kơ băt?” 'Nâu, lăm năr lu iĕm ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa, lu iĕm ling-lang chă tơdrong lu iĕm wă kơdih. Sa pơgâm lu bơngai jang kơ iĕm.

English: Indeed you fast for strife and debate, And to strike with the fist of wickedness. You will not fast as you do this day, To make your voice heard on high.
Bahnar: Tơpă lu iĕm ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa wă chă tơdrong pơjah tơhil băl, tơrôp ti pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ tơ'bet băl; Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa thoi dang ei, wă kơ nơ̆r lu iĕm ôr gô kơtơ̆ng tơ plĕnh.

English: Is it a fast that I have chosen, A day for a man to afflict his soul? Is it to bow down his head like a bulrush, And to spread out sackcloth and ashes? Would you call this a fast, And an acceptable day to the LORD?
Bahnar: Noh hăm trŏ tơdrong ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa mă Inh lăp đon? Iĕm iŏk jơhngơ̆m đon ala kơdih. Kŭp kơ̆l thoi 'long gơlăr. 'Bĭch kơpal 'bi păng tơnuh. 'Noh hăm trŏ kơ tơdrong noh iĕm khan ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa? Minh năr pơm kơ Kră Yang hiôk jơhngơ̆m ah?

English: “Is this not the fast that I have chosen: To loose the bonds of wickedness, To undo the heavy burdens, To let the oppressed go free, And that you break every yoke?
Bahnar: Noh hăm trŏ ưh kơ trŏ ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa mă Inh lăp đon hrĕch lê̆ tơlei glang tơdrong kơnê̆, plôh lê̆ đêl đe chô̆ đơ̆ng 'long ăt. Tơlĕch achăng lu bơngai đe pơjuă pơđep gơh hơgei, gơ̆ lê̆ rim 'long ăt dah kiơ?

English: Is it not to share your bread with the hungry, And that you bring to your house the poor who are cast out; When you see the naked, that you cover him, And not hide yourself from your own flesh?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ ih athei asong tơmam sa kơ lu bơngai pơngot rơwĕt, chông ba lu bơngai dơnuh hin ưh kơ đei hnam wih tơ lăm hnam iĕm kơdih, lăp iĕm 'bôh bơngai akâu hoh athei pơhrŭk ăn, păng 'nĕ kơ weh muh măt ưh kơ lăng lu 'nhŏng oh minh sĕch akar lu iĕm kơdih, dah kiơ?

English: Then your light shall break forth like the morning, Your healing shall spring forth speedily, And your righteousness shall go before you; The glory of the LORD shall be your rear guard.
Bahnar: Na tơdrong ih pơm gô rang hơdah thoi pơgê hrôih; rơka ih gơh klaih 'bônh. Tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ih gô năm adrol kơ ih tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang gô wei-lăng đơ̆ng rŏng ih.

English: Then you shall call, and the LORD will answer; You shall cry, and He will say, ‘Here I am.’ “If you take away the yoke from your midst, The pointing of the finger, and speaking wickedness
Bahnar: Kơplah noh ih krao apinh Kră Yang gô tơl tơwih; ih krao Sư dŏng tơgŭm Sư khan: Đei Inh tơ âu! “Dah ih hŭt lê̆ tơdrong pơjuă pơđep păng ưh kơ đei dơhlâu ti pơma kư̆ kă.

English: If you extend your soul to the hungry And satisfy the afflicted soul, Then your light shall dawn in the darkness, And your darkness shall be as the noonday.
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm đĭ jơhngơ̆m rong lu bơngai pơmat-tat păng asong ăn sa phĭ kơ lu bơngai pơngot, lei tơdrong hơdah ih gô pơchrang lăm măng mu, kơplah noh măng ih thoi lĕ kơ 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: The LORD will guide you continually, And satisfy your soul in drought, And strengthen your bones; You shall be like a watered garden, And like a spring of water, whose waters do not fail.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ling-lang gô chông ba ih ăn kơ ih tôm mah lăm anih teh hrĕng kro, pơm ăn kơ akâu jăn ih pran jăng. Ih thoi lĕ pơgar đe ruh đak ling-lang, thoi tu đak glung ưh kơ đei layơ hrơ̆.

English: Those from among you Shall build the old waste places; You shall raise up the foundations of many generations; And you shall be called the Repairer of the Breach, The Restorer of Streets to Dwell In.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch adrung ih gô tơiung hơmet dơ̆ng anih sơ̆ đĭ pơchah tơphĕ. Iĕm gô hơmet dơ̆ng lu hơnă so đơ̆ng lơ kơ jơhnơr adrol sơ̆. Đe gô jô̆ pôk iĕm bơngai hơmet ming dur pơlei mă đĭ păk pơchah hơmet ming trong pơlei ăn kơ lu kon pơlei oei.

English: “If you turn away your foot from the Sabbath, From doing your pleasure on My holy day, And call the Sabbath a delight, The holy day of the LORD honorable, And shall honor Him, not doing your own ways, Nor finding your own pleasure, Nor speaking your own words
Bahnar: “Tơdah iĕm wei răk huay kơ pơm yoch lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat. Ưh kơ pơm dôm tơdrong iĕm 'maih wă lăm năr rơgoh Inh. Tơdah iĕm lăng năr pơdơh Sa'bat jơ̆ năr hiôk chơt, lăng năr rơgoh Kră Yang jơ̆ trŏ kơ pơyom; tơdah iĕm pơyom gĭt năr noh ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ̆ trong iĕm kơdih, ưh pă pơm kiơ̆ đon iĕm kơdih 'maih wă păng ưh pă pơma nơ̆r mơ̆ng kơ wăn.

English: Then you shall delight yourself in the LORD; And I will cause you to ride on the high hills of the earth, And feed you with the heritage of Jacob your father. The mouth of the LORD has spoken.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh iĕm gô đei chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang, păng Inh gô ăn kơ iĕm tŏk hao lu anih kơjung hloh kơpal teh đak. Inh gô 'me rong iĕm hăm mŭk tơmam Jakôp 'bok iĕm.” 'Bơ̆r Kră Yang pơma thoi noh.

English: Behold, the LORD’s hand is not shortened, That it cannot save; Nor His ear heavy, That it cannot hear.
Bahnar: Tơpă ti Kră Yang ưh kơ sĭ kơđeh ôh na mă ưh kơ gơh pơklaih; đon Sư kư̆m ưh kơ sĭ kơ klĭk ôh mă ưh kơ gơh kơtơ̆ng.

English: But your iniquities have separated you from your God; And your sins have hidden His face from you, So that He will not hear.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'noh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu iĕm, pơm pơklah iĕm hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; păng tơdrong yoch lu iĕm na Kră Yang ôn muh măt sư đơ̆ng lu iĕm, dĭng mah Sư ưh pă mơ̆ng lu iĕm.

English: For your hands are defiled with blood, And your fingers with iniquity; Your lips have spoken lies, Your tongue has muttered perversity.
Bahnar: Ti lu iĕm 'mê̆-'mach đơ̆ng pham bơngai iĕm pơlôch. Hơnglâu iĕm 'mê̆-'mach đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch kơnê̆. 'Bơ̆r lu iĕm đĭ pơma hơlĕnh. Hơpiĕt lu iĕm pơma jŏk tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: No one calls for justice, Nor does any plead for truth. They trust in empty words and speak lies; They conceive evil and bring forth iniquity.
Bahnar: Chă tơkêng băl ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt. Pơjah băl kư̆m ưh kơ đei kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng Đĭ-đăng tă kơ gơnang kơ tơdrong hiong răm, pơma hơlĕnh pơdăr, lu sư tơchĕng kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ păng pơm tơdrong răm.

English: They hatch vipers’ eggs and weave the spider’s web; He who eats of their eggs dies, And from that which is crushed a viper breaks out.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơ'nơ̆m kơtăp 'bih, tanh hăm wai dŭng; bơngai bu sa lu kơtăp 'noh gô lôch. Tơdah kơtăp noh pơchah sư gô cheh jing 'bih đei bih hơkăm.

English: Their webs will not become garments, Nor will they cover themselves with their works; Their works are works of iniquity, And the act of violence is in their hands.
Bahnar: Wai dŭng ưh kơ gơh yua pơm ao, lu sư ưh kơ gơh hrŭk hăm tơmam wai dŭng. Tơdrong jang lu sư jơ̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ tơpă, ti lu sư pơm tơdrong tơblah tơblŭng.

English: Their feet run to evil, And they make haste to shed innocent blood; Their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; Wasting and destruction are in their paths.
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng lu sư kơdâu năm wă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, hăt hot pơlôch bơngai ưh kơ đei tơdrong yoch; đon lu sư tơchĕng jơ̆ hơlĕnh pơdăr, lu sư ba tơdrong pơrăm păng pơchah pơchek đĭ rok trong gơlong lu sư yak.

English: The way of peace they have not known, And there is no justice in their ways; They have made themselves crooked paths; Whoever takes that way shall not know peace.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ băt trong hiôk-hian, lăm trong lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei trong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng, lu sư pơm kơdih lu trong đŏng đĕo, bơngai bu năm lăm trong 'noh sư ưh kơ băt tơdrong hiôk-hian!

English: Therefore justice is far from us, Nor does righteousness overtake us; We look for light, but there is darkness! For brightness, but we walk in blackness!
Bahnar: Lei na tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng ataih kơ lu bơ̆n, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ truh jê̆ lu bơ̆n. Lu bơ̆n chang tơdrong hơdah mă-lei 'nâu tă tơ tơdrong măng mu, lu bơ̆n chang tơdrong hơdah hơdong mă-lei yak năm lăm tơdrong măng mu.

English: We grope for the wall like the blind, And we grope as if we had no eyes; We stumble at noonday as at twilight; We are as dead men in desolate places.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n chă pơpel hơbơ̆ rok kiơ̆ tơnăr thoi bơngai măt tol; chă hơbơ̆ thoi bơngai ưh kơ đei măt; kơplah 'năr dơ̆ng bơ̆n nơnăm pơ̆k iung thoi yak lăm măng mu; lăm lu bơngai pran kơtang mă bơ̆n thoi bơngai lôch.

English: We all growl like bears, And moan sadly like doves; We look for justice, but there is none; For salvation, but it is far from us.
Bahnar: Lu bơ̆n ling-lang grĕnh ôr thoi chơgơu, păng tơngưih thoi sem kơtơp; lu bơ̆n chang hơmĕng tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng mă-lei ưh kơ đei, chang tơdrong dŏng pơklaih mă-lei sư rai ataih đơ̆ng bơ̆n!

English: For our transgressions are multiplied before You, And our sins testify against us; For our transgressions are with us, And as for our iniquities, we know them
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch lu nhôn pơm rai lơ 'bơ̆t anăp Ih. Tơdrong yoch lu nhôn roi pơdah, ayăt hăm lu nhôn. Tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu nhôn oei oei hăm lu nhôn, păng lu nhôn băt tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu nhôn.

English: In transgressing and lying against the LORD, And departing from our God, Speaking oppression and revolt, Conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn yoch bơih, blah plơ̆ Kră Yang, păng tơwih rŏng ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn. Lu nhôn pơma tơdrong kơnê̆ blơ̆ blĕch păng blah. Tơchĕng lĕch nơ̆r pơma hơlĕnh đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: Justice is turned back, And righteousness stands afar off; For truth is fallen in the street, And equity cannot enter.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpăt rai kơdŭn, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng tơ ataih. Tơdrong trŏ pơ̆k bơih 'bơ̆t trong tih pơlei păng tơdrong pơm tơpăt ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t.

English: So truth fails, And he who departs from evil makes himself a prey. Then the LORD saw it, and it displeased Him That there was no justice.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơpăt ưh pă đei bơih, lu bơngai weh đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ đe rôp tơgar iŏk. Kră Yang 'bôh na sư ơh sơ'ngon yua kơ ưh kơ đei tơdrong tơpăt hơnơ̆ng

English: He saw that there was no man, And wondered that there was no intercessor; Therefore His own arm brought salvation for Him; And His own righteousness, it sustained Him.
Bahnar: Sư 'bôh ưh pă đei bu tơgŭm păng Sư lăng hlĭch ưh pă đei bu krao, chă tơgŭm băl Na Kră Yang yua hloi ti Sư kơdih dŏng pơklaih; păng iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư kơdih na tơiung tơgŭm.

English: For He put on righteousness as a breastplate, And a helmet of salvation on His head; He put on the garments of vengeance for clothing, And was clad with zeal as a cloak.
Bahnar: Kră Yang iŏk tơdrong tơpăt hrŭk thoi ao mam păng iŏk tơdrong dŏng pơklaih, yơ̆l thoi môk kơlăm Sư iŏk tơdrong pơm 'mong pơm thoi hơbĕn ao hrŭk, sư iŏk đĭ jơhngơ̆m tơnăp wăn tăp tơ akâu pơm thoi hơbĕn ao.

English: According to their deeds, accordingly He will repay, Fury to His adversaries, Recompense to His enemies; The coastlands He will fully repay.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm tơwih kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang lu sư pơm. Kră Yang hil mĭl kơ lu bơngai blah Sư, pơm 'mong kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ Sư. Sư gô pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai oei tơ bŏl đak dơsĭ.

English: So shall they fear The name of the LORD from the west, And His glory from the rising of the sun; When the enemy comes in like a flood, The Spirit of the LORD will lift up a standard against him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng gah bơmơ̆t đe gô hli yom kơ anăn Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng gah măt 'năr lĕch gô hli pơyom kơ tơdrong ư-ang Sư; yua kơ Sư gô truh thoi đak krong ro jăng hơyuh kial dui jơhngơ̆m đơ̆ng Kră Yang puh pơđông lê̆.

English: “The Redeemer will come to Zion, And to those who turn from transgression in Jacob,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih gô truh tơ Siôn; năm tơ lu bơngai lăm adrĕch adrung Jakôp, mă achăng hŭt tơdrong yoch.” Kră Yang pơma thoi noh.

English: “As for Me,” says the LORD, “this is My covenant with them: My Spirit who is upon you, and My words which I have put in your mouth, shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your descendants, nor from the mouth of your descendants’ descendants,” says the LORD, “from this time and forevermore.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Gah Inh 'nâu, noh boih tơdrong Inh pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư. Yang bơhngol Inh oei tơ lăm iĕm păng lu nơ̆r Inh tah bơih lăm 'bơ̆r iĕm, gô ưh kơ weh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r iĕm păng 'bơ̆r adrĕch adrung kon sâu iĕm đơ̆ng dang ei ling-lang truh kơ ning-mônh,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Arise, shine; For your light has come! And the glory of the LORD is risen upon you.
Bahnar: Iung bĕ pơchrang bĕ! Yua kơ tơdrong hơdah ih truh bơih, păng tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang pơchrang kơpal ih.

English: For behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, And deep darkness the people; But the LORD will arise over you, And His glory will be seen upon you.
Bahnar: Măng mu gô gom jơ̆p kơ teh đak păng măng klăm gô klơ̆p lu kon pơlei. Mă-lei Kră Yang gô pơchrang tơ kơpal ih păng tơdrong ư-ang Sư gô tơ'bôh tơ kơpal ih.

English: The Gentiles shall come to your light, And kings to the brightness of your rising.
Bahnar: Lu teh đak gô năm tơ tơdrong hơdah ih păng lu pơtao gô tơkan tơ tơdrong 'brưch hơdah ih.

English: “Lift up your eyes all around, and see: They all gather together, they come to you; Your sons shall come from afar, And your daughters shall be nursed at your side.
Bahnar: Ngơk bĕ muh măt ih păng lăng. Đĭ-đăng lu sư akŭm băl wă năm tơkan tơ ih. Lu kon drŏ-nglo ih gô tơkan đơ̆ng ataih; lu kon drŏ-kăn ih đe gô kơ'mĭn glơng tơ ti.

English: Then you shall see and become radiant, And your heart shall swell with joy; Because the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, The wealth of the Gentiles shall come to you.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh kơnh ih gô 'bôh đei tơdrong hơdah hơdong, jơhngơ̆m ih gô mơn hiôk chơt; đĭ-đăng tơmam đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ gô tuh tơ ih, tơdrong mơdrŏng rim kơ teh đak gô truh tơ ih.

English: The multitude of camels shall cover your land, The dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; All those from Sheba shall come; They shall bring gold and incense, And they shall proclaim the praises of the LORD.
Bahnar: Khŭl aseh lăk-đa gô 'bĕnh-'bang kơ dêh char ih, kon aseh lăk-đa đơ̆ng dêh char Mađian păng Êpha. Lu bơngai mơdro đơ̆ng Sêba truh, chĕp ba maih păng tơmam 'bâu phu păng hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.

English: All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, The rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; They shall ascend with acceptance on My altar, And I will glorify the house of My glory.
Bahnar: Khŭl sem dơrong đơ̆ng dêh char kêdar gô akŭm tơ ih lu triu tơno dêh char Nêbaôt gô yua pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r, Inh gô iŏk tơdrong đe pơyơ̆r lu sư tơ kơpal chơnang soi Inh. Na Inh gô pơm kơ hnam ư-ang Inh rai ư-ang hloh.

English: “Who are these who fly like a cloud, And like doves to their roosts?
Bahnar: Lu đe bu âu, păr thoi hơmơ̆l, thoi sem kơtơp păr wih tơ tơpu sư kơdih?

English: Surely the coastlands shall wait for Me; And the ships of Tarshish will come first, To bring your sons from afar, Their silver and their gold with them, To the name of the LORD your God, And to the Holy One of Israel, Because He has glorified you.
Bahnar: Tơpă lu bŏl đak dơsĭ răp gô Inh ngơ-ngei, lu duk Tarêsi adrol hloh gô năm ba lu kon drŏ-nglo ih wih đơ̆ng ataih, hơdai hăm hu maih lu sư, wă kơkuh kơ anăn Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei ih Tơ'ngla 'lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael, yua kơ sư pơm bơih kơ ih đei tơdrong ư-ang.

English: “The sons of foreigners shall build up your walls, And their kings shall minister to you; For in My wrath I struck you, But in My favor I have had mercy on you.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơmoi gô man pơdơ̆ng ming dur ih păng pơtao lu sư gô bơ̆jang kơ ih kơplah Inh hil mĭl đei teh tôn mă-lei 'bơ̆t Inh mơnat, Inh pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ ih dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore your gates shall be open continually; They shall not be shut day or night, That men may bring to you the wealth of the Gentiles, And their kings in procession.
Bahnar: Măng jang ih gô pơih ling-lang, măng năr ưh kơ đei layơ tang, wă kơ đe chĕp mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng rim kơ teh đak truh ăn kơ ih, na lu pơtao gô năm chĕp ba tơmam gĭt ăn kơ ih

English: For the nation and kingdom which will not serve you shall perish, And those nations shall be utterly ruined.
Bahnar: kon pơlei păng teh đak ayơ ưh kơ chu yom kơ ih, lei gô pơlôch pơrăm, lu teh đak kon pơlei noh gô pơrăm pơchah pơchek đĭ.

English: “The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, The cypress, the pine, and the box tree together, To beautify the place of My sanctuary; And I will make the place of My feet glorious.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ư-ang dêh char Liban gô truh tơ ih. 'Long hơngo 'long krăk, hơngo hla iĕ hai, wă hơmet ming anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh. Inh gô pơm kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh ư-ang.

English: Also the sons of those who afflicted you Shall come bowing to you, And all those who despised you shall fall prostrate at the soles of your feet; And they shall call you The City of the LORD, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo lu bơngai pơgŏ pơđep ih gô kŭp kơ̆l năm kơkuh kơ ih, păng rim 'nu lu bơngai mă pơjăm pơjuă ih gô drap 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ ih. Lu sư gô krao kơ ih pơlei Kră Yang pơlei Siôn Tơ'ngla 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Isơrael.

English: “Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, So that no one went through you, I will make you an eternal excellence, A joy of many generations.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ đe hiơt đe areh kơ ih, păng ưh kơ đei bu năm rok lăm ih. 'Nâu Inh gô pơm ăn kơ ih jing rŏ ling-lang, jing tơdrong chơt hiôk kơ lơ bơngai ling-lang hlŏng hloi.

English: You shall drink the milk of the Gentiles, And milk the breast of kings; You shall know that I, the LORD, am your Savior And your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
Bahnar: Ih gô mŏm đak toh lu dêh char păng lu pơtao thoi mĕ gô tơmŏm 'me rong Ih. Ih gô băt kơ Inh bơih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih ih Tơ'ngla huai iŏk ih păng Tơ'ngla mơsêh pran kơtang adrĕch Jakôp.

English: “Instead of bronze I will bring gold, Instead of iron I will bring silver, Instead of wood, bronze, And instead of stones, iron. I will also make your officers peace, And your magistrates righteousness.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn maih tơplih kơ kong, ăn hu gô tơplih kơ bơsei, ăn kong tơplih ăn kơ ih 'long, ăn bơsei tơplih ăn kơ ih tơmo. Inh gô ăn tơdrong hiôk-hian pơm yŏng wei-lăng ih păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r ih.

English: Violence shall no longer be heard in your land, Neither wasting nor destruction within your borders; But you shall call your walls Salvation, And your gates Praise.
Bahnar: Lăm dêh char ih gô ưh pă kơtơ̆ng bơih gah tơdrong pơm kơnê̆, mă lăm hơdral teh đak ih kư̆m ưh pă đei pơchah răm dơ̆ng bơih; mă-lei ih gô krao dur ih kơdih noh tơdrong “Dŏng pơklaih” 'măng jang ih kơdih noh tơdrong “Bơnê ư-ang.

English: “The sun shall no longer be your light by day, Nor for brightness shall the moon give light to you; But the LORD will be to you an everlasting light, And your God your glory.
Bahnar: Măt 'năr ưh pă pơchrang hơdah kơ ih kiơ̆ kơ'năr. Tơdrong hơdah rang khei kư̆m ưh pă pơchrang kơ ih kiơ̆ kơmăng. Mă-lei Kră Yang jơ̆ tơdrong hơdah kơ ih ling-lang hlŏng hloi. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih noh tơdrong ư-ang ih.

English: Your sun shall no longer go down, Nor shall your moon withdraw itself; For the LORD will be your everlasting light, And the days of your mourning shall be ended.
Bahnar: Măt 'năr ih ưh pă mơ̆t dơ̆ng bơih, măt khei ih kư̆m ưh pă weh hiong, yua kơ Kră Yang bơih tơdrong hơdah ling-lang ăn kơ ih. “Dôm lu năr ih nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon gô tôch đĭ.

English: Also your people shall all be righteous; They shall inherit the land forever, The branch of My planting, The work of My hands, That I may be glorified.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei ih gô jing 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; lu sư gô đei dêh char 'nâu ling-lang; Lu sư bơih bluh tơmơ̆ng đơ̆ng Inh pơtăm, đơ̆ng ti Inh pơm wă kơ Inh đei ư-ang.

English: A little one shall become a thousand, And a small one a strong nation. I, the LORD, will hasten it in its time.”
Bahnar: Bơngai tŏ sĕt hloh gô jing rơbâu hơngan. Bu iĕ hloh gô jing minh khŭl kon pơlei pran kơtang Inh bơih Kră Yang gô pơm pơkeh tơdrong 'noh trŏ kơ khei 'năr.”

English: “The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon Me, Because the LORD has anointed Me To preach good tidings to the poor; He has sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, To proclaim liberty to the captives, And the opening of the prison to those who are bound
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang oei hơdai Inh. Kră Yang rơih inh. Wă năm bơtho ăn tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin, păng pơlung lu bơngai ơh sơ'ngon Sư wơh inh roi tơdrong Sư wă tơlĕch lu bơngai đe phak, kơ roi tơbăt ăn kơ lu bơngai bơnă gơh hơgei, tơbăt tơlĕch lu bơngai đe chĭt phak đơ̆ng hnam bơnă.

English: To proclaim the acceptable year of the LORD, And the day of vengeance of our God; To comfort all who mourn
Bahnar: Wă roi tơbăt sơnăm Kră Yang mơnat, păng năr Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n pơm tơwih; wă pơlung đĭ-đăng lu bơngai ơh sơ'ngon.

English: To console those who mourn in Zion, To give them beauty for ashes, The oil of joy for mourning, The garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; That they may be called trees of righteousness, The planting of the LORD, that He may be glorified.”
Bahnar: Wă ăn kơ lu bơngai ơh sơ'ngon oei tơ pơlei Siôn hơgăl pơkao tơplih kơ tơnuh tuh ăn đak 'bâu phu hiôk chơt tơplih kơ ơh sơ'ngon, pơhrŭk ăn ao bơnê ư-ang tơplih kơ jơhngơ̆m ơh klai. Đe gô krao sư tơm 'long kôih tơdrong tơpăt, 'long mă Kră Yang đei pơtăm bơih. Wă tơ'bôh tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang.

English: And they shall rebuild the old ruins, They shall raise up the former desolations, And they shall repair the ruined cities, The desolations of many generations.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô pơdơ̆ng ming đêl lu anih pơchah răm sơ̆. Tơiung dơ̆ng lu anih đĭ juơ so sơ̆. Lu sư gô hơmet tơiung lu pơlei mă pơchah răm, lu anih mă đĭ jing bri juơ đunh jơhnơr bơih.

English: Strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, And the sons of the foreigner Shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơmoi oei tơ noh wă wei rong khŭl triu lu iĕm, lu bơngai tơmoi gô choh mir chŭn păng pơtăm hơmu ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: But you shall be named the priests of the LORD, They shall call you the servants of our God. You shall eat the riches of the Gentiles, And in their glory you shall boast.
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm đe gô krao iĕm 'bok soi Kră Yang, đe gô krao iĕm đĭch đam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n; lu iĕm gô sa tơmam đơ̆ng lu dêh char păng tơdrong hiôk rơnŭk đơ̆ng lu sư.

English: Instead of your shame you shall have double honor, And instead of confusion they shall rejoice in their portion. Therefore in their land they shall possess double; Everlasting joy shall be theirs.
Bahnar: Tơplih đơ̆ng mơlâu. Kon pơlei Inh gô đei iŏk tơmam hloh 'bar wơ̆t tơplih đơ̆ng đe pơjăm. Lu sư gô chơt hiôk đơ̆ng tơmam đe asong bơih, na lu sư gô đei iŏk mŭk tơmam 'bar wơ̆t lơ hloh lăm dêh char lu sư păng đei tơdrong hiôk chơt ling-lang.

English: “For I, the LORD, love justice; I hate robbery for burnt offering; I will direct their work in truth, And will make with them an everlasting covenant.
Bahnar: Inh bơih Kră Yang Inh lăp kơ tơdrong tơpăt, areh kơ tơdrong tơtông klĕ păng tơdrong pơm ưh kơ tơpăt, kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m tơpăt Inh. Inh gô apah lu sư, păng pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu sư ling-lang.

English: Their descendants shall be known among the Gentiles, And their offspring among the people. All who see them shall acknowledge them, That they are the posterity whom the LORD has blessed.”
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung lu sư đe gô ư-hơ-nhang ang-hơ-nhăk lăm rim kơ teh đak. Anăn kon sâu lu sư đe gô ang lăm lu kon pơlei, bơngai bu 'bôh gô băt kơ lu sư jơ̆ minh adrĕch adrung đơ̆ng Kră Yang tuh ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: I will greatly rejoice in the LORD, My soul shall be joyful in my God; For He has clothed me with the garments of salvation, He has covered me with the robe of righteousness, As a bridegroom decks himself with ornaments, And as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.
Bahnar: Inh gô hiôk chơt dêh lăm Kră Yang. Jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk 'nă hal lăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh yua kơ sư pơhrŭk ăn kơ inh ao dŏng pơklaih; tơsu ăn kơ inh ao tai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt nhen thoi lĕ tơdăm iŏk akăn yơ̆l môk wăn kơ̆l sư nhen thoi adruh iŏk klo pơguăng akâu sư hăm tơmam kăp jên.

English: For as the earth brings forth its bud, As the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth, So the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
Bahnar: Nhen thoi teh pơm ăn kơ 'long bluh tơmơ̆ng thoi pơgar rei adrĕch bluh chăt thoi yơ. Na Kră Yang kư̆m pơm ăn kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, păng tơdrong bơnê ư-ang bluh chăt 'bơ̆t anăp rim kơ adrĕch kon bơngai thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: For Zion’s sake I will not hold My peace, And for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, Until her righteousness goes forth as brightness, And her salvation as a lamp that burns.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Siôn na inh ưh kơ đei ngăn hreh ôh, yua kơ Jêrusalem na Inh ưh kơ đei pơdơh hiôk ôh. Dĭng truh tơ layơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt sư pơchrang thoi hơdah 'mơ̆i păng tơdrong dŏng pơklaih sư khơ̆ng thoi lĕ pla ŭnh hơchô̆ hơpaih.

English: The Gentiles shall see your righteousness, And all kings your glory. You shall be called by a new name, Which the mouth of the LORD will name.
Bahnar: Lu teh đak gô 'bôh tơdrong 'lơ̆ng ih. Lu pơtao gô 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang ih. Đe gô krao ih anăn 'nao đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Kră Yang krao ăn.

English: You shall also be a crown of glory In the hand of the LORD, And a royal diadem In the hand of your God.
Bahnar: Ih jing môk pơtao 'lơ̆ng rŏ lăm tơpang ti Kră Yang, pơm môk pơtao lăm tơpang ti Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih.

English: You shall no longer be termed Forsaken, Nor shall your land any more be termed Desolate; But you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; For the LORD delights in you, And your land shall be married.
Bahnar: Đe ưh pă krao ih Kră Yang hŭt lê̆ dơ̆ng bơih dah ưh pă krao ih teh lê̆ bri juơ dơ̆ng bơih. Mă-lei đe gô krao ih Inh chơt hiôk hăm ih păng krao teh đak ih đei pơkong thoi ŭnh om bơih. Yua kơ Kră Yang chơt hiôk ih păng teh ih gô đei klo.

English: For as a young man marries a virgin, So shall your sons marry you; And as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, So shall your God rejoice over you.
Bahnar: Thoi bơngai tơdăm oei kơ bơngai adruh 'nao iung, kư̆m thoi lu kon drŏ-nglo ih gô oei hăm ih; thoi bơngai 'nao iŏk akăn gô hiôk chơt yua kơ akăn sư 'nao iŏk. Na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih kư̆m hiôk chơt yua kơ ih.

English: I have set watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem; They shall never hold their peace day or night. You who make mention of the LORD, do not keep silent
Bahnar: Ơ pơlei Jêrusalem, Inh 'măn bơih bơngai gak tơ kơpal dur ih, kơ năr kơmăng lu sư ưh kơ đei oei hreh, ơ lu iĕm bơngai mă tơ'blŏk kơ Kră Yang, 'nĕ ăn kơ Sư pơdơh.

English: And give Him no rest till He establishes And till He makes Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
Bahnar: Kŭm 'nĕ ăn kơ Kră Yang pơdơh dĭng truh tơ Sư pơjing tơiung dơ̆ng pơlei Jêrusalem, păng pơm kơ sư đei đe ư-ang jơ̆p kơ teh đak.

English: The LORD has sworn by His right hand And by the arm of His strength: “Surely I will no longer give your grain As food for your enemies; And the sons of the foreigner shall not drink your new wine, For which you have labored.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei yơ̆r ti gah 'ma Sư păng kơkŏng ti mơsêh Sư pơkăm khan: “Inh ưh pă đei ăn bơih 'ba mi ih kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ ih sŏng sa dơ̆ng, lu bơngai tơmoi gô ưh pă et sik hơmu 'nao ih. Sik mă đơ̆ng ih jang gleh hrat.

English: But those who have gathered it shall eat it, And praise the LORD; Those who have brought it together shall drink it in My holy courts.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai yuă kĕch 'ba mi bơih lu sư gô đei sŏng sa 'ba mi noh, păng hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, păng lu bơngai phĕ plei hơmu gô huch sik hơmu sư tơ lăm cham hnam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh.”

English: Go through, Go through the gates! Prepare the way for the people; Build up, Build up the highway! Take out the stones, Lift up a banner for the peoples!
Bahnar: Lĕch năm bĕ, rok trong 'măng dur hơmet bĕ trong ăn kơ kon pơlei Man hơmet bĕ, man ming bĕ trong tih. Bơ'nguơih bĕ tơdrong găn pơdơ̆ng bĕ hla-kơ ăn kơ lu kon pơlei Inh.

English: Indeed the LORD has proclaimed To the end of the world: “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Surely your salvation is coming; Behold, His reward is with Him, And His work before Him.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nâu, Kră Yang roi tơbăt bơih. Truh tơ jơ̆p-jang lăm teh đak. “Roi tơbăt bĕ kơ kon adruh pơlei Siôn. “Âu Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih ih truh bơih. To lu bơngai mă Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih gô năm hơdai Sư.”

English: And they shall call them The Holy People, The Redeemed of the LORD; And you shall be called Sought Out, A City Not Forsaken.
Bahnar: Đe gô krao lu sư Kon Pơlei Rơgoh. Kon pơlei mă Kră Yang huai iŏk; gah ih đe gô krao kơ ih pơlei tih đe chơchă, pơlei mă ưh pă hŭt lê̆ juơ dơ̆ng.

English: Who is this who comes from Edom, With dyed garments from Bozrah, This One who is glorious in His apparel, Traveling in the greatness of His strength?— “I who speak in righteousness, mighty to save.”
Bahnar: Bu Tơ'ngla mă truh đơ̆ng char Eđôm. Đơ̆ng pơlei Bôsra? Na hrŭk hơbĕn ao gôh rang hơdah, yak năm hăm tơdrong pran kơtang. Noh Inh bơih Tơ'ngla pơma nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Tơ'ngla mơsêh mơyang tih-tin wă dŏng pơklaih.”

English: Why is Your apparel red, And Your garments like one who treads in the winepress?
Bahnar: Yua kơ kiơ ao Ih tong đak 'brê? Ao tai Ih 'brê thoi bơngai pơjuă đak hơmu?

English: “I have trodden the winepress alone, And from the peoples no one was with Me. For I have trodden them in My anger, And trampled them in My fury; Their blood is sprinkled upon My garments, And I have stained all My robes.
Bahnar: “Minh 'nu Inh đĕch pơjuă păng hmĕt đak hơmu, ưh kơ đei bu mă đơ̆ng kon pơlei oei hăm Inh. Lăm tơdrong hil Inh pơjuă lu sư, lăm tơdrong Inh mĭl Inh pơjuă bơhlơ̆r lu sư. Pham lu sư tơprah 'bơm ao Inh, ao tai Inh pham klep jơ̆p-jang.

English: For the day of vengeance is in My heart, And the year of My redeemed has come.
Bahnar: Lăm jơhngơ̆m Inh pơkă bơih kơ năr wă pơm 'mong, păng sơnăm mă Inh dŏng pơklaih truh bơih.

English: I looked, but there was no one to help, And I wondered That there was no one to uphold; Therefore My own arm brought salvation for Me; And My own fury, it sustained Me.
Bahnar: Inh chă lăng mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu tơgŭm. Inh lăng hlĭch yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu dŏng. Na Inh yua kơkŏng ti Inh wă dŏng jei gah Inh. Păng tơdrong Inh hil mĭl dŏng tơgŭm Inh.

English: I have trodden down the peoples in My anger, Made them drunk in My fury, And brought down their strength to the earth.”
Bahnar: Inh pơjuă gơhlơ̆r bơih lu kon pơlei lăm tơdrong hil mĭl. Inh ăn kơ lu sư suai hăm tơdrong Inh hil mĭl, păng pơlôch bơih pham lu sư lĕch tơ kơpal teh.

English: I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the LORD And the praises of the LORD, According to all that the LORD has bestowed on us, And the great goodness toward the house of Israel, Which He has bestowed on them according to His mercies, According to the multitude of His lovingkindnesses.
Bahnar: Inh gô roi tơ'blŏk tơdrong Kră Yang 'mêm mơnat, păng hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang kơ dôm lu tơdrong mă Kră Yang pơm bơih kơ lu bơ̆n păng tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tih Sư ăn kơ adrĕch Isơrael, dôm lu tơdrong mă Sư đei ăn kơ bơ̆n, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Sư 'mêm Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih lu sư bơih.

English: For He said, “Surely they are My people, Children who will not lie.” So He became their Savior.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei khan: “Tơpă lu sư jơ̆ kon pơlei Inh lu kon mă ưh kơ đei pơma hơlĕnh ôh.” Păng Kră Yang boih Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu sư.

English: In all their affliction He was afflicted, And the Angel of His Presence saved them; In His love and in His pity He redeemed them; And He bore them and carried them All the days of old.
Bahnar: Lăm lu sư đei tơdrong pơmat-tat, Kră Yang kư̆m wang pơmat-tat, păng linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư dŏng pơklaih lu sư boih. Đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m mơnat păng 'mêm kơeng na huai iŏk lu sư. Kră Yang pôk kơ'mĭn lu sư ling-lang rim năr đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: But they rebelled and grieved His Holy Spirit; So He turned Himself against them as an enemy, And He fought against them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư oei ayăt plơ̆, păng pơm ăn kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Kră Yang sơ'ngon. Na Kră Yang jing ayăt hăm lu sư; Kră Yang kơdih tơblah hăm lu sư.

English: Then he remembered the days of old, Moses and his people, saying: “Where is He who brought them up out of the sea With the shepherd of His flock? Where is He who put His Holy Spirit within them
Bahnar: Na kon pơlei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r dơ̆ng kơ đơ̆ng sơ̆, 'blŏk kơ Môis păng kon pơlei Kră Yang na jet: Tơ'ngla mă hơtŏk lu sư păng bơngai wei khŭl sem dơrong Kră Yang, hlôi đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ tơ yơ bơih? Tơ'ngla ăn Yang Bơhngol Sư oei hơdai hăm kon pơlei tơ yơ bơih?

English: Who led them by the right hand of Moses, With His glorious arm, Dividing the water before them To make for Himself an everlasting name
Bahnar: Tơ'ngla mă pơm kơ kơkŏng ti ư-ang pran kơtang Kră Yang năm gah ti 'ma Môis. Mă pơm kơ đak dơsĭ tơklah 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư? Wă kơ anăn Kră Yang oei đei ling-lang ưh kơ đei tôch.

English: Who led them through the deep, As a horse in the wilderness, That they might not stumble?”
Bahnar: Mă Tơ'ngla dui ba lu sư tŏk hlôi đơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng jrŭ? Nhen thoi aseh kơdâu tơ char glă, ưh kơ đei pơ̆k.

English: As a beast goes down into the valley, And the Spirit of the LORD causes him to rest, So You lead Your people, To make Yourself a glorious name.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn bơih kơ lu sư pơdơh. Nhen thoi khŭl sem dơrong jur tơ anih thŭng Kră Yang dui ba kon pơlei Sư kư̆m thoi noh. Wă pơm kơ anăn Sư ư-ang.

English: Look down from heaven, And see from Your habitation, holy and glorious. Where are Your zeal and Your strength, The yearning of Your heart and Your mercies toward me? Are they restrained?
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti nger tơ ala. Lăng bĕ đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng ư-ang Ih oei! Jơhngơ̆m hưch hanh pran kơtang Ih tơ yơ? Jơhngơ̆m 'maih wă păng tơdrong 'mêm mơnat Kră Yang ưh pă đei dơ̆ng bơih hăm lu nhôn.

English: Doubtless You are our Father, Though Abraham was ignorant of us, And Israel does not acknowledge us. You, O LORD, are our Father; Our Redeemer from Everlasting is Your name.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih bơih 'Bă lu nhôn mă khan Abraham ưh kơ băt kơ lu nhôn Isơrael kư̆m ưh kơ jô̆ lu nhôn; Ơ Kră Yang Ih jơ̆ 'Bă lu nhôn. Anăn Ih jơ̆ Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn ling-lang đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: O LORD, why have You made us stray from Your ways, And hardened our heart from Your fear? Return for Your servants’ sake, The tribes of Your inheritance.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang liơ Ih pơm ăn kơ lu nhôn tơklah jrok ataih kơ trong gơlong Ih? Liơ Ih pơm ăn lăm jơhngơ̆m lu nhôn arăng ưh kơ hli kơ Ih? Apinh Ih wih hơlơ̆k bĕ yua kơ lu đĭch đam Ih, păng yua kơ lu adrĕch adrung jing mŭk tơmam Ih.

English: Your holy people have possessed it but a little while; Our adversaries have trodden down Your sanctuary.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang 'nao đei anih 'nâu ưh tăm mă đunh; mă-lei bơngai ayăt kơ nhôn pơjuă lê̆ bơih anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih.

English: We have become like those of old, over whom You never ruled, Those who were never called by Your name.
Bahnar: Đunh bơih, lu nhôn nhen thoi minh khŭl kon pơlei, mă Kră Yang ưh tam mă pơgơ̆r păng đe ưh tam mă krao hăm anăn Ih.

English: Oh, that You would rend the heavens! That You would come down! That the mountains might shake at Your presence
Bahnar: Ơ! Kuă kơ kiơ Kră Yang hek plĕnh na jur tơ teh, wă pơm kơ kông pơpơ̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: As fire burns brushwood, As fire causes water to boil— To make Your name known to Your adversaries, That the nations may tremble at Your presence!
Bahnar: Nhen ŭnh sa 'long ŭnh kro, nhen ŭnh pơm kơ đak blôk, wă kơ lu bơngai ayăt băt kơ anăn Ih. Đĭ kơ teh đak tơtey 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: When You did awesome things for which we did not look, You came down, The mountains shook at Your presence.
Bahnar: Kơplah Ih pơm lu tơdrong trŏ kơ hli krưp mă lu nhôn ưh kơ đei tơchĕng 'bơm. Na Ih jur păng lu kông tơdrŏ pơpơ̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: For since the beginning of the world Men have not heard nor perceived by the ear, Nor has the eye seen any God besides You, Who acts for the one who waits for Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ đe ưh tam mă băt, đon ưh tam mă kơtơ̆ng, măt ưh tam mă 'bôh Kră Yang nai 'nguaih kơ Sư. Tơ'ngla mă đei pơm ăn bơih kơ lu bơngai mă chang gô Sư noh.

English: You meet him who rejoices and does righteousness, Who remembers You in Your ways. You are indeed angry, for we have sinned— In these ways we continue; And we need to be saved.
Bahnar: Ih sơng iŏk lu bơngai jơhngơ̆m hiôk pơm tơdrong tơpăt, păng lu bơngai 'blŏk kơ Ih năm kiơ̆ trong Ih. Ih hil bơih yua kơ lu nhôn pơm yoch. Đunh bơih lu nhôn oei lăm yoch noh, na wă gơh klaih liơ?

English: But we are all like an unclean thing, And all our righteousnesses are like filthy rags; We all fade as a leaf, And our iniquities, like the wind, Have taken us away.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn đĭ-đăng jing nhen thoi bơngai 'mê̆-'mach bơih, dôm tơdrong tơpăt lu nhôn, nhen thoi ao mơgrĭ. Lu nhôn đĭ-đăng tă kơ nhen hla jô, păng tơdrong kơnê̆ lu nhôn nhen thoi kial pơđông đĭ lu nhôn.

English: And there is no one who calls on Your name, Who stirs himself up to take hold of You; For You have hidden Your face from us, And have consumed us because of our iniquities.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu krao chă anăn Ih, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu 'blŏk wă rôp kơjăp kiơ̆ Ih, yua kơ Ih ôn bơih muh măt Ih kơ lu nhôn, lê̆ lu nhôn răm lăm tơdrong yoch lu nhôn kơdih.

English: But now, O LORD, You are our Father; We are the clay, and You our potter; And all we are the work of Your hand.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, mă khan thoi noh, Ih oei 'Bă lu nhôn, lu nhôn jơ̆ teh lơ̆n, Ih jơ̆ thơ̆ man lu nhôn; đĭ-đăng lu nhôn jơ̆ tơdrong jang đơ̆ng ti Ih.

English: Do not be furious, O LORD, Nor remember iniquity forever; Indeed, please look—we all are Your people!
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih 'nĕ kơ hil dêh hnang 'nĕ pă 'blŏk tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu nhôn ling-lang! 'Nâu apinh Ih lăng lu nhôn thoi kon pơlei Ih ngăl!

English: Your holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
Bahnar: Lu pơlei rơgoh Kră Yang đĭ jing char glă; Siôn đĭ jing char glă, Jêrusalem đĭ jing bri juơ.

English: Our holy and beautiful temple, Where our fathers praised You, Is burned up with fire; And all our pleasant things are laid waste.
Bahnar: Hnam Akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lu nhôn ư-ang, anih mă 'bok lu nhôn hơri bơnê ư-ang kơ Ih, ŭnh sa đĭ bơih. Đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam kiơ mă lu nhôn gĭt răm đĭ bơih.

English: Will You restrain Yourself because of these things, O LORD? Will You hold Your peace, and afflict us very severely?
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang đei tơdrong truh thoi âu, Ih oei gơh lê̆ hă? Ih oei hreh đĕch, pơm kơ lu nhôn pơmat-tat dêh hă?

English: “I was sought by those who did not ask for Me; I was found by those who did not seek Me. I said, ‘Here I am, here I am,’ To a nation that was not called by My name.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă ưh kơlah krao apinh Inh, na Inh pơdah akâu kơ lu sư bơih. Lu bơngai mă ưh kơlah chơchă Inh na tơ'bơ̆p Inh bơih. Inh khan hăm minh adrĕch adrung kon pơlei nai ưh kơ đei krao chă anăn Inh: “Inh tơ âu, Inh tơ âu!”

English: I have stretched out My hands all day long to a rebellious people, Who walk in a way that is not good, According to their own thoughts
Bahnar: Inh yơ̆r ti Inh prăt năr tơ gah minh adrĕch kon pơlei mă arăng kơ̆l. Lu bơngai mă năm lăm trong ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, kiơ̆ kơ đon kơdih tơchĕng.

English: A people who provoke Me to anger continually to My face; Who sacrifice in gardens, And burn incense on altars of brick
Bahnar: Minh adrĕch kon pơlei ling-lang tơblĕk Inh 'Bơ̆t anăp Inh soi sơmah kơ rup yang lăm pơgar, soh 'long 'bâu phu ăn kơ yang tơ kơpal chơnang găch.

English: Who sit among the graves, And spend the night in the tombs; Who eat swine’s flesh, And the broth of abominable things is in their vessels
Bahnar: Lu sư ngôi tơ lăm bơsat; oei kơmăng tơ lăm anih hrĕp, sa 'nhĕm nhŭng păng mong đak 'nhĕm ưh kơ rơgoh lăm gŏ lu sư.

English: Who say, ‘Keep to yourself, Do not come near me, For I am holier than you!’ These are smoke in My nostrils, A fire that burns all the day.
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Dơ̆ng mă ataih, 'nĕ năm jê̆ inh, yua kơ inh rơgoh hloh kơ lu iĕm.” Lu bơngai 'nâu thoi 'nhui lĕch đơ̆ng lăm trôm muh Inh, thoi ŭnh sa prăt năr.

English: “Behold, it is written before Me: I will not keep silence, but will repay— Even repay into their bosom
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong mă đei chih bơih 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, Inh gô ưh pă đei lê̆ bơih, mă-lei gô pơm tơwih trŏ, Inh gô pơm tơwih kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong yoch lăm jơhngơ̆m sư.

English: Your iniquities and the iniquities of your fathers together,” Says the LORD, “Who have burned incense on the mountains And blasphemed Me on the hills; Therefore I will measure their former work into their bosom.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ lu sư hăm tơdrong kơnê̆ yă 'bok lu sư.” Kră Yang khan: “Yua kơ lu sư soh bơih 'long 'bâu phu kơpal lu kông, păng pơma kơnê̆, blei hiap Inh kơpal lu groi na Inh gô phak jô̆ akŭm đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch đêl lu sư pơm bơih đơ̆ng adrol sơ̆.

English: Thus says the LORD: “As the new wine is found in the cluster, And one says, ‘Do not destroy it, For a blessing is in it,’ So will I do for My servants’ sake, That I may not destroy them all.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Thoi đe oei 'bôh đak hơmu lăm hơie hơmu Na khan: ‘'Nĕ kơ pơrăm lê̆, yua kơ lăm plei noh oei đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng.’ Inh kư̆m gô pơm thoi noh kơ lu đĭch đam Inh, Inh ưh kơ pơrăm đĭ-đăng lu sư ôh.

English: I will bring forth descendants from Jacob, And from Judah an heir of My mountains; My elect shall inherit it, And My servants shall dwell there.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn đei kon sâu lĕch đơ̆ng Jakôp, păng minh 'nu đơ̆ng Juđa gơh đei iŏk lu kông Inh; Lu bơngai mă Inh rơih iŏk gô đei dêh char noh, lu đĭch đam Inh gô oei tơ noh.

English: Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, And the Valley of Achor a place for herds to lie down, For My people who have sought Me.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh, lu bơngai mă krao chă Inh gô đei tơmăn glă Sarôn pơm anih tơmăn 'nhĕt wei rong triu păng thŭng Akô pơm tơmăn 'nhĕt ăn kơ rơmo bun pơdơh.

English: “But you are those who forsake the LORD, Who forget My holy mountain, Who prepare a table for Gad, And who furnish a drink offering for Meni.
