Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm, achăng hŭt lê̆ Kră Yang bơih. Hiơt kơ kông rơgoh Inh, Lu iĕm bơngai mă hơmet gơ'bang et sa ăn kơ yang Gata păng hling 'bĕnh kơ pơnhan sik hơmu ăn bơih kơ yang Mêni.b

English: Therefore I will number you for the sword, And you shall all bow down to the slaughter; Because, when I called, you did not answer; When I spoke, you did not hear, But did evil before My eyes, And chose that in which I do not delight.”
Bahnar: Na Inh hơgăt ăn kơ lu iĕm lôch kơ đao gưm, păng đĭ-đăng lu iĕm gô kŭp kơ̆l ăn kơ đe pơlôch; Yua kơ Inh krao bơih lu iĕm ưh kơ tơl; Inh đei khan lu iĕm ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng, lu iĕm đei pơm bơih tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, păng rơih iŏk tơdrong Inh ưh kơ lăp đon.”

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, My servants shall eat, But you shall be hungry; Behold, My servants shall drink, But you shall be thirsty; Behold, My servants shall rejoice, But you shall be ashamed
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “'Nâu, lu đĭch đam Inh gô đei sa, Mă-lei lu iĕm gô pơngot; 'Nâu đĭch đam Inh gô nhă, mă-lei lu iĕm oei rơhing kơ đak; 'Nâu đĭch đam Inh gô đei tơdrong hiôk chơt, mă-lei lu iĕm gô mơlâu ơh sơ'ngon

English: Behold, My servants shall sing for joy of heart, But you shall cry for sorrow of heart, And wail for grief of spirit.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu đĭch đam Inh gô hơri ư-ang yua kơ jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk, Mă-lei lu iĕm gô nhơ̆m ôr yua kơ jĭ jơhngơ̆m. Lu iĕm gô nhơ̆m ôr yua kơ jơhngơ̆m pơmat-tat.

English: You shall leave your name as a curse to My chosen; For the Lord GOD will slay you, And call His servants by another name
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă Inh rơih iŏk gô yua anăn iĕm wă hiap pơtê̆ kơ đe. Kră Yang gô pơlôch iĕm; Mă-lei Kră Yang gô iŏk anăn plơ̆ng krao tơplih ăn kơ lu đĭch đam Sư.

English: So that he who blesses himself in the earth Shall bless himself in the God of truth; And he who swears in the earth Shall swear by the God of truth; Because the former troubles are forgotten, And because they are hidden from My eyes.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, bơngai bu oei lăm dêh char wă sơkat tơdrong pŭn hiôk sư gô krao apinh tơdrong pŭn hiôk hăm anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt; Bơngai bu oei tơ kơpal teh wă pơkă pơkăm, athei pao anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt na pơkă pơkăm; Yua kơ lu tơdrong pơmat-tat adrol sơ̆ hiơt đĭ bơih, măt Inh ưh pă tăng bơih.

English: “For behold, I create new heavens and a new earth; And the former shall not be remembered or come to mind.
Bahnar: Âu Inh gô pơjing plĕnh 'nao teh 'nao; Dôm tơdrong adrol sơ̆ ưh pă đei 'blŏk dơ̆ng bơih, kư̆m ưh pă đei bu tơchĕng dơ̆ng bơih lăm kơ̆l 'ngok.

English: But be glad and rejoice forever in what I create; For behold, I create Jerusalem as a rejoicing, And her people a joy.
Bahnar: Mă-lei athei 'nă hal păng chơt hiôk ling-lang khŏm khŏm lăm tôm tơdrong kiơ Inh đei pơjing. Tơpă Inh đei pơjing pơlei Jêrusalem thoi tơm tơdrong hiôk chơt păng pơjing kon pơlei lăm pơlei noh thoi minh tơdrong hiôk chơt.

English: I will rejoice in Jerusalem, And joy in My people; The voice of weeping shall no longer be heard in her, Nor the voice of crying.
Bahnar: Inh gô hiôk chơt yua kơ Jêrusalem, Inh gô 'nă hal kơ kon pơlei Inh; Tơ anih noh ưh pă đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r nhơ̆m ôr pơret dơ̆ng bơih.

English: “No more shall an infant from there live but a few days, Nor an old man who has not fulfilled his days; For the child shall die one hundred years old, But the sinner being one hundred years old shall be accursed.
Bahnar: Tơ noh ưh pă đei bơngai hơ'lơ̆p nge lôch hrôih, kư̆m ưh kơ đei bơngai kră ayơ mă ưh kơ arih sot tôm kơ sơnăm Yua kơ lôch kơplah minh-hrĕng sơnăm noh wă khan lôch oei mơlôh păng bơngai arih đei lăp minh-hrĕng sơnăm noh lăng thoi đei hiap pơtê̆.

English: They shall build houses and inhabit them; They shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Inh gô man hnam păng oei lăm noh; pơtăm pơgar hơmu păng gô sa plei.

English: They shall not build and another inhabit; They shall not plant and another eat; For as the days of a tree, so shall be the days of My people, And My elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ đei man hnam ăn kơ lu bơngai nai oei thoi sơ̆; ưh kơ đei pơtăm hơmu ăn kơ bơngai nai sa thoi sơ̆; sơnăm kon pơlei Inh arih gô nhen thoi dôm sơnăm 'long arih, lu bơngai mă Inh rơih iŏk gô đei yua đơ̆ng tơdrong jang lu sư kơdih.

English: They shall not labor in vain, Nor bring forth children for trouble; For they shall be the descendants of the blessed of the LORD, And their offspring with them.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô Jang ưh kơ đei gleh hrat kư̆ kă kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơpŭ kon hơ'lơ̆p, wă lê̆ kơ tơdrong truh pơrăm yua kơ adrĕch adrung đei Kră Yang tuh tơdrong pŭn hiôk hơdai hăm kon sâu lu sư.

English: “It shall come to pass That before they call, I will answer; And while they are still speaking, I will hear.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ lu sư krao apinh; Inh gô tơl tơwih nơ̆r lu sư To lu sư oei pơma, Inh kơtơ̆ng bơih.

English: The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, The lion shall eat straw like the ox, And dust shall be the serpent’s food. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all My holy mountain,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kŏ-so hăm triu kon gô sa hơdai, dăm-brang sa hơnong 'ba thoi rơmo, 'bih gô sa 'mui teh. Gô ưh pă đei bu wă pơm kơnê̆, dah wă pơrăm lăm jơ̆p-jang kông rơgoh Inh,” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “Heaven is My throne, And earth is My footstool. Where is the house that you will build Me? And where is the place of My rest?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Plĕnh noh Tang-dŏ pơtao Inh, teh noh hơnă jơ̆ng Inh juă. Lu iĕm gô man ăn kơ Inh hnam tơ yơ? Anih ayơ pơm anih Inh pơdơh?

English: For all those things My hand has made, And all those things exist,” Says the LORD. “But on this one will I look: On him who is poor and of a contrite spirit, And who trembles at My word.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam 'nâu tă kơ đơ̆ng ti Inh pơm ngăl, thoi noh đĭ-đăng tơmam gơh đei.” Kră Yang khan thoi noh. “'Nâu đei bơngai mă Inh lăng gĭt: Bơngai iơ̆m dim, đei jơhngơ̆m băt tơbral, păng hli tơtey kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r inh pơma.

English: “He who kills a bull is as if he slays a man; He who sacrifices a lamb, as if he breaks a dog’s neck; He who offers a grain offering, as if he offers swine’s blood; He who burns incense, as if he blesses an idol. Just as they have chosen their own ways, And their soul delights in their abominations
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai bu pơlôch minh pôm kon rơmo soi sơmah, kư̆m thoi pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai; bu soi sơmah hăm minh pôm kon triu kư̆m thoi gơ̆ hơko minh pôm kŏ bu pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba kư̆m thoi pơyơ̆r pham nhŭng; bu soh tơmam 'bâu phu kư̆m thoi kơkuh kơ rup yang. Lu bơngai noh rơih bơih trong lu sư kơdih, jơhngơ̆m lu sư 'maih wă pơm tơdrong jang krưp kơnê̆

English: So will I choose their delusions, And bring their fears on them; Because, when I called, no one answered, When I spoke they did not hear; But they did evil before My eyes, And chose that in which I do not delight.”
Bahnar: Na Inh kư̆m gô rơih iŏk tơdrong pơmat ăn kơ lu sư, na tuh ăn tơdrong mă lu sư hli. Yua kơ mưh Inh krao ưh kơ đei bu tơl, Inh pơma lu sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, Lu sư pơm bơih tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, păng rơih tơdrong mă Inh ưh kơ lăp đon.”

English: Hear the word of the LORD, You who tremble at His word: “Your brethren who hated you, Who cast you out for My name’s sake, said, ‘Let the LORD be glorified, That we may see your joy.’ But they shall be ashamed.”
Bahnar: Ơ lu iĕm bơngai mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma mă hli tơtey, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang. “'Nhŏng oh lu iĕm bơngai mă hil areh kơ lu iĕm, hŭt lê̆ lu iĕm yua anăn Inh păng khan: ‘Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang đei ư-ang, wă kơ lu nhôn 'bôh tơdrong hiôk chơt lu iĕm.’ Mă-lei lu sư bơih gô mơlâu.

English: The sound of noise from the city! A voice from the temple! The voice of the LORD, Who fully repays His enemies!
Bahnar: Đei re jơwa lăm pơlei tih; đei re jơwa đơ̆ng hnam akŭm noh re jơwa nơ̆r Kră Yang pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ Sư.

English: “Before she was in labor, she gave birth; Before her pain came, She delivered a male child.
Bahnar: Adrol kơ jĭ anăp sư tơpŭ bơih; adrol kơ jĭ anăp truh, sư tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo bơih.

English: Who has heard such a thing? Who has seen such things? Shall the earth be made to give birth in one day? Or shall a nation be born at once? For as soon as Zion was in labor, She gave birth to her children.
Bahnar: Hăm tam đei bu kơtơ̆ng minh tơdrong thoi noh? Hăm đei bu 'bôh bơih tơdrong thoi noh? Hăm đei dêh char ayơ tơpŭ pơjing lăm minh năr? Dah hăm đei teh đak ayơ tơpŭ pơjing băl lăm minh wơ̆t hơdai? Mă-lei Siôn 'nao wă jĭ anăp tơpŭ pơjing hloi kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p bơih.”

English: Shall I bring to the time of birth, and not cause delivery?” says the LORD. “Shall I who cause delivery shut up the womb?” says your God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh bơih Tơ'ngla ăn jơ 'năr tơpŭ kon na khan ưh kơ ăn tơpŭ hă? Inh bơih ăn đei anăp na ưh kơ ăn hơiơch hă?” Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi noh.

English: “Rejoice with Jerusalem, And be glad with her, all you who love her; Rejoice for joy with her, all you who mourn for her
Bahnar: “Hiôk chơt bĕ hơdai hăm pơlei Jêrusalem ơ lu bơngai mă 'mêm kơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Hiôk chơt bĕ yua kơ sư, ơ lu bơngai mă nhơ̆m hmoi kơ Jêrusalem, athei đĭ jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk 'nă hal hơdai hăm sư.

English: That you may feed and be satisfied With the consolation of her bosom, That you may drink deeply and be delighted With the abundance of her glory.”
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu iĕm gô chơt hiôk lăm tơdrong ư-ang Sư thoi kon hơ'lơ̆p phĭ hrăp rơkah rơkai đơ̆ng mŏm toh mĕ sư.”

English: For thus says the LORD: “Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, And the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream. Then you shall feed; On her sides shall you be carried, And be dandled on her knees.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “'Nâu, Inh gô ba ăn tơdrong hiôk-hian ro thoi đak krong, ba tơmam gĭt lu teh đak thoi đak glung 'bĕnh blai; lu iĕm gô mŏm păng pôk kơ'mĭn tơ kơtơh, păng tơoei hơ-on kơpal kŭl-tăng.

English: As one whom his mother comforts, So I will comfort you; And you shall be comforted in Jerusalem.”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơlung lu iĕm thoi noh. Nhen thoi mĕ pơlung kon, lu iĕm gô đei tơdrong pơlung tơ lăm Jêrusalem.

English: When you see this, your heart shall rejoice, And your bones shall flourish like grass; The hand of the LORD shall be known to His servants, And His indignation to His enemies.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô 'bôh dôm tơdrong noh, na lăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk-hian, kơting lu iĕm gô bluh thoi 'nhĕt. Đe gô băt ti Kră Yang gô tơgŭm lu đĭch đam Sư, mă-lei tơdrong Sư hil mĭl gô phak lu bơngai ayăt kơ Sư.

English: For behold, the LORD will come with fire And with His chariots, like a whirlwind, To render His anger with fury, And His rebuke with flames of fire.
Bahnar: Lăng to, Kră Yang gô truh hăm ŭnh păng gre aseh Sư nhen thoi kial hơbŭt, wă pơm tơwih tơdrong ơh blĕk Sư hăm tơdrong hil mĭl, păng tơdrong Sư chrih nhen thoi pla ŭnh khơ̆ng.

English: For by fire and by His sword The LORD will judge all flesh; And the slain of the LORD shall be many.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô iŏk ŭnh păng đao gưm wă phak lu bơngai pơm yoch. Đei lơ bơngai Kră Yang pơlôch.

English: “Those who sanctify themselves and purify themselves, To go to the gardens After an idol in the midst, Eating swine’s flesh and the abomination and the mouse, Shall be consumed together,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: “Lu bơngai mă hơmet akâu sư kơdih, wă năm mơ̆t tơ lu pơgar, kiơ̆ minh 'nu bơngai dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk noh, sa 'nhĕm nhŭng, 'nhĕm kơne, lu tơmam sa kơnê̆ krưp.” Kră Yang khan: “Lu sư gô tơ'bơ̆p tơdrong tôch hiong răm pơđĭ.

English: “For I know their works and their thoughts. It shall be that I will gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come and see My glory.
Bahnar: Gah Inh, Inh băt tơdrong jang păng đon lu sư tơchĕng, Inh gô năm wă krao đĭ-đăng lu dêh char păng rim nơ̆r pơma: Lu sư gô truh păng 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang Inh.

English: I will set a sign among them; and those among them who escape I will send to the nations: to Tarshish and Pul and Lud, who draw the bow, and Tubal and Javan, to the coastlands afar off who have not heard My fame nor seen My glory. And they shall declare My glory among the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Inh gô dan minh tơdrong tơdra tơ lăm lu sư; lu bơngai mă lăm lu sư oei arih đơ̆ng tơdrong truh pơmat na inh gô wơh lu sư năm truh tơ jơ̆p-jang teh đak, wă khan truh tơ Tarsis, lu bơngai Phun, Lut, lu kon pơlei gơh hơgei kơ prah hră, lu bơngai Tubal păng Jawan, truh tơ lăm lu bŏl đak dơsĭ ataih, lu anih ưh tam mă kơtơ̆ng anăn Inh păng ưh tam mă 'bôh tơdrong ư-ang Inh, lu sư gô bơtho tơdrong ư-ang Inh tơ jơ̆p kơ teh đak.”

English: Then they shall bring all your brethren for an offering to the LORD out of all nations, on horses and in chariots and in litters, on mules and on camels, to My holy mountain Jerusalem,” says the LORD, “as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lu sư gô chông ba đĭ-đăng 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char thoi tơmam pơyơ̆r soi sơmah kơ Kră Yang ba lu sư hăm aseh, gre aseh, gre tŭn hơnhŭn hơbang, aseh iĕ, aseh lăk-đa truh tơ kông rơgoh Inh tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.” Lu sư chông ba lu sư hăm gre tŭn, gre aseh, aseh, aseh iĕ lăk-đa: ‘Kŭm thoi kon pơlei Isơrael chĕp tơmam soi phe 'ba lăm ge mong tơmam rơgoh lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang.

English: And I will also take some of them for priests and Levites,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Inh gô rơih iŏk mơ'nah đơ̆ng lăm lu sư pơm 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi.”

English: “For as the new heavens and the new earth Which I will make shall remain before Me,” says the LORD, “So shall your descendants and your name remain.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Nhen thoi plĕnh 'nao teh 'nao mă inh pơjing gô oei kơjăp ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Inh thoi noh mơ̆n lu kon sâu iĕm păng anăn lu iĕm kư̆m oei kơjăp.

English: And it shall come to pass That from one New Moon to another, And from one Sabbath to another, All flesh shall come to worship before Me,” says the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô năm kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Inh. Đơ̆ng Khei 'Nao Tơ'bang 'nâu truh tơ khei tơ'bang to, đơ̆ng năr Sa'bat 'nâu truh tơ năr Sa'bat nai.

English: “And they shall go forth and look Upon the corpses of the men Who have transgressed against Me. For their worm does not die, And their fire is not quenched. They shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.”
Bahnar: Wă lu sư lĕch năm 'bôh akâu lu bơngai mă ayăt hăm Inh lôch; yua kơ hrai sa lu sư ưh kơ đei layơ lôch, ŭnh sa lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei layơ păt, lu sư gô jing tơdrong krưp kơnê̆ pơm ăn kơ rim kon bơngai.”
